But the medium blithely overlooks stressing the points of a good number of its messages in favor of a succession of kaleidoscopic glimpses of youth's apathy or revolt against the Establishment. Like its pertinent four letter words and nudes, "Dynamite Chicken" may be fun and games on occasion but it's hardly a shocking revelation these days.Since it was aimed at the college circuits, where it has been shown for some time, "Dynamite Chicken" briefly employs the talents of practically everyone adored by the campus crowd, from Joan Baez to Andy Warhol, in skits, songs and on its sound track. And Mr. Pintoff, who's kidded our foibles in cartoons (the Oscar-winning "The Critic") on TV and on film, has been aided by a legion of filmmakers and entertainers in fashioning this "contemporary probe of the mores and manners of the revolutionary era and a lot of other things."But "Dynamite Chicken" often appears to be a lot of other things. The Ace Trucking Company, for example, projects authentic comedy in their version of filming a TV commercial. A nude unsuccessfully reading for the role of "Cinderella" is funny, not obscene, as is an imitation of Lyndon B. Johnson.The varied views of Black Panthers, hard hats versus intellectuals on the American Flag, Women's Lib, Malcolm X and Vietnam are offered straight and/or with tongue in cheek but only with spasmodic impact. There is little doubt that a torrid, strip-teasing "nun" is sophomoric stuff compared with the satiric thrust of Ron Carey's swinging "priest" miming to the beat of Lionel Goldbart's "God Loves Rock and Roll" or Joan Baez's tender rendition of "Carry It On."In short, while no one is chicken here, "Dynamite Chicken" is rarely dynamite.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mujib the Symbo of Bengalis'
description: Let the army come and take me to prison, Sheik Mujibur Rahman said last year. Guns will never silence the voice of the people of Bengal.

title: L.I.'s Quiet New Professional John Van Nostrand Klein
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Jan.  Nearly two years ago, John V. N. Klein, at that time the presiding officer of the Suffolk County Legislature, and H. Lee Dennison, then the County Executive, were seated in Mr. Dennison's offices during a pay dispute with the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, watching police officers plaster the county center with placards. Dennison was officially a deputy sheriff, Mr. Klein recalled today as he paused from a rigorous schedule, moments after being sworn in as Suffolk's second County Executive and the first Republican to hold that office. And he turned to me and said, I'm going to arrest the next cop who puts up one of those things for defacing government property. I managed to dissuade himthank God.

title: Kubrick Tells What Makes Clockwork Orange Tick
description: LONDON, Jan. 3Stanley Kubrick grew up on the Grand Concourse and 196th Street in the Bronx, attending Taft High School with some infrequency but eagerly showing up at the Loew's Paradise and R.K.O. Fordham twice a week to view the double features.

title: Petitions Raise Hartke Hopes
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Jan. (AP)Senator Flartke said he had been skeptical of his chances in the primary when he came to New Hampshire last week but that he and aides and students had gathered 3,197 signatures on petitions, more than three times the number needed to enter his name.

title: InventorytoSales Ratio Off Sharply in November
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 Manufacturers inventories were almost unchanged in November, continuing a sluggishness that lasted through most of 1971, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: U.S. Party Lands Late in Peking; Attends Dinner in Hall of People
description: PEKING, Jan. 3  A White House advance party flew into the Chinese capital in a blowing snowstorm today, checked into the most modern hotel in the city, and then drove to the Great Hall of the People for dinner, possibly with Premier Chou Enlai.

title: Felino Neri of Philippines, Negotiated Reparations
description: MANILA, Jan. 3 (AP)Felino Neri, former Foreign Secretary and Ambassador to Japan, died yesterday in a Manila hospital following a heart seizure. He was 63 years old.

title: Coach Nixon Sends In a Play to the Miami Dolphins
description: MIAMI, Jan. 3President Nixon gave Don Shula, coach of the Miami Dolphins, a suggestion today for the American Football Conference champions game plan in the Super Bowl with the Dallas Cowboys at New Orleans on Jan. 16.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE AS TRADING EBBS
Mistakes in Welfare Payments Said to Cost HalfBillion Yearly
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3  A Federal welfare official, urging support for the Administration's welfare reform proposal, said today that mistakes in the administration of state and local programs could be costing more than $500million a year.

title: FUNERAL IS HELD FOR L. I. POLICEMAN
description: SEAFORD, L. I., Jan. 3 More than 2,000 policemen from the New York metropolitan area and from as far away as Buffalo attended a funeral service here today for Richard B. Rose, the first Nassau County policeman to be killed in the line of duty in 10 years.

title: Foe Again Shells Laotian Base;
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 3 (Reuters)The large Americansupported guerrilla base at Long Tieng came under renewed shelling from North Vietnamese forces today, and a Government spokesman here said it was in danger of being overrun.

title: MONTICELLO TV BANNED BY COURT
description: Television viewers were shut out from watching Monticello Raceway events last night following a State Court of Appeals order prohibiting telecasts of harness races while Roosevelt RaCeway is open.

title: Gray Line and Fifth Avenue in Accord
description: Trustees of Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., and the Gray, Line Corporation yesterday announced that they had executed a formal written agree ment implementing a plan for the settlement of claims be tween the two companies and the elimination of ownership of each other's stock.

title: PAUL W. JONES JR., FOREIGN POLICY AIDE
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Jan. 3Paul W. Jones Jr., executive secretary of the State Department's planning and coordination staff, died of cancer Saturday in Arlington Hospital. He was 49 years old and lived in Falls Church.

title: The Peterson Report
description: The report of Peter G. Peterson, President Nixon's assistant for international economic affairs, represents a significant shift toward a more outwardlooking and expansionist trade policy. Taking heart from the realignment of currencies, he calls on the United States to compete harder in world markets and to encourage the building of a competitive world trading system with the confidence that comes from having a sense of our future.

title: Vermont Schools to Merge
description: NORTHFIELD, Vt., Jan. 3 (UPI)Norwich University, the nation's oldest private military, school, and Vermont College, a private women's school in Montpelier, about 12 miles away, announced plans today for an immediate merger. Norwich, which has 900 cadets, will operate the separate residential campuses with men assigned to Northfield and women to Montpelier, but will have men and women taking some courses at either campus. There are 350 women at Vermont College.

title: MRS. H. A. W. MYRIN
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 3 (AP) Mrs. Mabel Pew Myrin, daughter of Joseph N. Pew, founder of the Sun Oil Cormpany, died today in Lankenau Hospital. She was 82 and lived in Kimberton.

title: Columnist Says Nixon Pressed Policy Against India
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3President Nixon was furious with his subordinates during the recent IndiaPakistan war for not taking a stronger stand against India, the syndicated columnist Jack Anderson reported today.

title: Klein, Sworn in Suffolk, Calls for Major Changes
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Jan. 3John V. N. Klein, a Republican, was sworn in today as Suffolk County's second County Executive and in his inaugural address proposed major departures from programs long advocated by his Democratic predecessor, H. Lee Dennison.

title: Nixon Arrives on Coast For a WeekLong Stay
description: EL TORO, Calif., Jan. 3 (AP) President Nixon arrived at the Marine Corps Air Station here tonight for a week stay at the Western White House in San. Clemente, where he will meet with Prime Minister Eisaku Sato Of Japan.

title: Yonkers School Problems Are Legacy
description: CONKERS, Jan. 3  School problems, have become an unhappy tradition in this city, Which marked the first school day of the new year With a teachers strike.

title: SESSION IN ALBANY FAILS FOR 6TH DAY  TO ACT ON TAXES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 3The Legislature tried again today to act on a compromise tax package of about $413million as part of governor Rockefeller's plan to meet a budget deficit of $1.5billion over, the next 15 months.

title: Hanna Mining and Basic Set Joint Exploration Program
description: CLEVELAND, Tan. 3 (AP)Basic, Inc., and the Hanna Mining Company announced today an agreement on a joint exploration program aimed primarily at finding additional mineral .deposits in Maine.

title: John Jay Police College Stirred By Charge It Harbors Gamblers
description: The John Jay College of Criminal Justice, which has 2,800 New York City policemen enrolled as students, has been embroiled in a lawandorder Issue of its own: gambling in the student lounge.

title: Miners Kin Ask $2.5Million
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 3 (UPI)A $2.5million damage suit was filed today by survivors of 10 miners killed in an explosion at the Finley Coal Company mine near Hyden, Ky., on Dec. 30, 1970. Named as defendants were the Underwriters Safety and Claims Inc., of Louisville; the Employer's Reinsurance Corporation of Kansas City, Mo., and the General Reinsurance Corporation of New York.

title: Now She's Designing for GrownUps
description: She is pretty; homely girls don't model for Balmain or Balenciaga. She is talented; she had to be to have her sculpture and handweaving exhibited at the Museum of Modern Art and the Philadelphia Art Alliance. She is domestic; witness a handsome husband and two children, a girl, 16, and a boy, 11. And in 69, Saks Fifth Avenue gave her its Creator/ Award, citing her as one of the country's 12 best designers. Taking all this into consideration, it isn't surprising that shortly thereafter Gloria Sachs went into business on her own. I had designed junior clothes and preteen clothes and I decided It was time to let the clothes grow up with me, Mrs. Sachs said recently in her pale green and pink salon. A model in her student days In Paris, studying under Leger, now she designs clothes for women sizes 6 to 16 that show the same meticulous attention to detail that characterized her earlier designs.

title: New Nader Project Seeks Exceptional Performances
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, is organizing a search for models of exceptional performance it government, business, labor and citizenship.

title: Romans, in NoFare Test, Leave Driving to Busmen
description: ROME, Jan. 3Romans are rediscovering the bus as means of getting around.

title: U.S. Price Panel Weighs 35c Fare for City Transit
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority, which has the responsibility for setting bus and subway fares, has already applied to the Federal Price Commission for permission to increase the fares to 35 cents from the current 30, it was learned yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Notes on People
description: Donna Rachele, as most Italians still call the widow of Benito Mussolini, has filed a claim against the state for an increase of her Government pension from $243 to $364 a month.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Yonkers Teachers'
description: YONKERS, Jan. 3A teachera strike that both the union and the school administration agreed was 90 per cent effective crippled the state's fourth largest school system today.

title: Executive Changes
description: John K. Lundberg has been elected president and chief executive officer of the American Savings Bank. He succeeds John H. Hammett, who has been elected chairman of the board.

title: New Surrogate Pledges to End Patronage System
description: Family Court Judge Millard L. Midonick took office yesterday as surrogate of New York County with a promise to replace patronage with merit in handling Manhattan's vast estate business and to urge changes in state laws for the protection of orphans and widows.

title: A.E.C, TO IMPROVE APLANT'S SAFETY
description: DENVER, Jan. 3The Atomic Energy Commission is spending betwen $100million and $200million to improve its controversial atomic weapons plant near here.

title: Britain Agrees to Pull Out Training Mission in Libya
description: LONDON, Tuesday, Jan. (Reuters)Britain has agreed to a Libyan request to withdraw her naval training mission from Libya, probably by the middle of this month, the Defense Ministry said today.

title: Three Lakers Elected To West AllStar Team
description: Jerry West, Gail Goodrich and Wilt Chamberlain of the Los Angeles Lakers were named yesterday to the West team for the National Basketball Association's 22d annual AllStar Game.

title: Admission to Guggenheim Raised From 50 Cents to $1
description: The Guggenheim Museum has increased its general admission charge from 50 cents to $1. The increase, announced by Peter LawsonJohnston, president of the Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation, is the first since the building on Fifth Avenue and 89th Street opened in 1959.

title: White House Newsmen's Group Affirms Backgrounder Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (AP) In an implied rebuke to The Washington Post, the White House Correspondents Association called upon its members today to abide by the rules of anonymous briefings.

title: Rules Split Accountants
description: Once upon a time, the chief financial officer of a certain large corporation was seeking to hire a new firm of accountants. He called in three leading practitioners of that arcane art, and of each one he asked the same question: What is two plus two? The first two firms, cautious and conservative as befitting their craft, naturally enough answered four. But the third, wellversed in the techniques of creative modern accounting, came back with a query of its own: What did you have in mind?

title: FLORENCE JACQUES, NATURE WRITER, 81
description: Mrs. Florence Page Jacques, author of books on nature and travel and of verse, died Saturday in North Oaks, Minn., at the age of 81.

title: Lester Patrick, 31, Is Chosen General Manager of Miami Six
Books of The Times
description: DR. BRODIE'S REPORT. By Jorge Luis Borges. Translated by Norman Thomas diGlovannl in collaboration with the author. 128 pages. Dutton, $5.95.

title: Barrow Wins Rugby Match
description: BARROW, England, Jan. a (Reuters)Barrow beat Keighley, 137, tonight in a Rugby League match.

title: Leftist Parties in Finland Gain in General Election
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Jan. 3 (UPI)Leftist parties showed gains today in first returns from Finland's twoday general election.

title: COURT ASKED TO BAR ARMY DOSSIER SUIT
description: WASHINGTON; Jan, 3The Justice Department asked .:the Supreme Court today to .throw out a! suit by political radicals and antiwar groups who are seeking to curb surveillance by the Army of civilian political activitieS.

title: HARRIS POLL FINDS LINDSAY STATIONARY
description: Last August, when Mayor Lindsay announced that he was switching from the Republican party to the Democratic, he was the choice of 9 per cent of rank and file Democrats to be their party's nominee for President this November.

title: CITY DROPS PLAN TO BUILD IN PARK
description: In the face of growing opposition to encroachments on parks, the city has abandoned plans to build a center in Central Park for the Fire Department's new $15million communications system.

title: U.S. Military in Vietnam Down to Total of 157,000
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 3 (Reuters)United States troop strength in South Vietham has dropped to 157,000, a decrease of 386,400 from the peak of April, 1969, the United States command announced today.

title: Snow Strands a Woman With Her Dead Husband
description: GORMAN, Calif., Jan. 3 (AP)Stanley Culver, a 53yearold retired mechanic Who had heart trouble, emphysema and asthma, died last Wednesday in his snowbound trailer in the Tehachapi Mountains north of Los Angeles When his emergency supply of oxygen ran out.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Baltimore fans will bristle in indignation at the thought but it has to seem to most neutral observers that professional football is better off with the Miami Dolphins the Super Bowl rather than the Baltimore Colts. This reaction is not because of the fact that the Colts and Dallas Cowboys played so dull and dreary a game in last year's Super Bowl that they hardly earned an encore.

title: C.&O.B.&O. at 20Year Low As 71 Net Hits $3.25 a Share
STEEL PRODUCTION UP BY 2.9% IN WEEK
Man Found Hanged in Park
description: The body of a man About 25 or 30 years old was found by a passerby hanging from a tree in Prospect Park, Brooklyn, near the old Swan Lake, yesterday afternoon, the police said. The man, an apparent suicide, could not immediately be identified, they said.

title: Miss Macchi, France, Wins World Cup Giant Slalom
Humphrey Chooses Site
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 3 (AP)Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, will formally announce his bid for the PreSidency next Monday in Philadelphia.

title: Architecture in 71: Lively Confusion
description: The state of the art of architecture in 1971, the first year of the trilliondollar building decade, was one of lively confusion.

title: Aerospace Cut Favored
description: WASHINGTON; Jan. 3 (Ap) Virgil Day, a business member of the Pay Board, said today that the board would cut down somewhat a 12 per cent pay rise for aerospace workers, then begin living by its 5.5 per cent guideline.

title: Passengers Flew on Radioactive Plane
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Jan. 3 (AP)A Delta Air Lines plane contaminated by leakage of radioactive material ,made nine passenger flights into 11 American cities over the weekend, health and airline officials said today.

title: PERU ANNOUNCES CABINET SHUFFLE
description: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 3 (AP)Three changes in President Juan Velasco Alvarado's 14man military Cabinet became official today with the swearing of an army general and two admirals. The moves were seen as the first step toward preparing a successor to President Velasco.

title: ISRAELI AIDE DENIES BARTERING ON JETS
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 3 (AP)Israel Galili, one of Premier Golda Meir's closest confidants, said today that Israel would receive American F4 Phantom jet fighterbombers without having made any political concessions. Interviewed on the state radio, he said that no concessions had been asked of Israel.

title: Tax Booklet to Be Sold
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (AP)  The Postal Service said today that the booklet Your Federal Income Tax would go on sale for 75 cents at first and second class post offices this month. It includes a sample Form 1040 with explanations for filling in each line.

title: Vietnam Land Reform Advances, but Slowly
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 3The Government's landreform program, considered the most vital part of its effort to win the support of landless peasants, is proceeding despite corruption, resistance from many owners and even some hesitation among those wile are supposed to get free land.

title: State FireInsurance Pool Said to Try to Hide Profit
description: New York State's huge fireinsurance poolknown as the New York FAIR planwas changed yesterday with attempting to hide the fact that it was making a profit.

title: Julia Kelety, 85, Actress In Lehar Operettas, Dies
description: Julia Kelety, an actress who in 1905 created the role of Sonya in Franz Lehar's The Merry Widow in her native Budapest, died Saturday in her home here. She was 85 years old and the widow of E. Dean Fuller, a lawyer.

title: RIZZO TAKES POST IN PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 3 (UPI) Frank L. Rizzo, a former police commissioner, was sworn in today as Mayor of Philadelphia. He called for a return to the oldfashioned quest of jobs, not relief, confidence, not fear, a clean city and honesty in government.

title: LONDON FARE RISE IRES COMMUTERS
description: LONDON, Jan. 3A fare increase on London's subways and buses today brought protests from angry commuters, some of whom had to pay 100 perU cent more to get to. work.

title: EDWARD ORTION, 80, A DENTAL SURGEON
description: Dr. Edward J. Ortion, a dental surgeon who served with the French and American Armies in World War I and was long active in FrancoAmerican societies, died Friday night in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 12 East 97th Street.

title: U.S. and Japan Sign Agreement On Textiles Reached Last Year
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (UPI) The United States and Japan signed a threeyear agreement today under which Japan agreed to limit exports of wool and manmade fiber textiles to the American market. The pact makes formal the accord reached last Oct. 15.

title: Bridge: A Tournament Chairman Is Also a Tourney Winner
description: Virtue is seldom its own reward in bridge tournaments: Those who carry out the planning and organizing are, other things being equal, less likely to win trophies than those who have nothing to think about except the bidding and play.

title: S. &
description: The election of four vice presidents was announced yesterday by the Sperry and Hutchinson Company. They are: George H. Doner, Robert V. Dunn, Roland A. Early and Charles F. Edwall. The company, formed in 1896 as the originator of S.&.H. green stamps, recently has been diversifying into interior furnishings and business and consumer services.

title: India Reacts Cautiously
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 8The Government of Indiawhich has been saying for over nine months that the release of Sheik Mujibur Ralunan was a crucial first step toward peace In the subcontinentreacted with studied caution tonight to the announcement by the new Pakistani Government that the Bengali leader would be freed unconditionally.

title: Louis A. Reilly Dies at 79; ExPostmaster of Newark
description: SPRING LAKE HEIGHTS, N. J., Jan. 3  Louis A. Reilly, Postmaster of Newark from 1943 until his retirement in 1962, died in Jersey Shore Medical Center Saturday. He was 79 years old and lived here.

title: SUGAR FUTURES UP TO A 7YEAR HIGH
description: Trading of nearby world sugar No. 11 futures contracts on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange yesterday opened at gains of up to 50 points, or  cent a pound, the daily trading limit.

title: Disabled Soviet Ship Arrives After a Mysterious Collision
description: A 130foot Soviet fishing trawler arrived in New York Harbor yesterday, disabled by a mysterious 11foot gash in her starboard side. As of last night, the Coast Guard still had not learned any details of the mishap that had caused the damage.

title: Waldheim Meets Bash, Presents Medal to Thant
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 3On his first working day as Secretary General of the United Nations, Kurt Waldheim today met his senior staff, received the chief delegates of the United States and Cyprus and presented a gold medal to U Thant.

title: LESTER GREENBERG, PEDIATRICIAN, DEAD
description: Dr. Lester J. Greenberg, director emeritus of pediatrics at St. Joseph's Hospital, Fair Rockaway, Queens, died there Wednesday. He was 62 years old and had offices in Lawrece, L. I., and Far Rockaway, where he lived.

title: The Presidency Under Glass: I
description: Americans are not very happy today about their Presidency. The Indochina war has precipitated accumulating doubts and discontents about the way that institution has come to operate. The result is repentance on the part of some of us who in the past were uncritical supporters of a strong Presidency and a sharp reexamination of the Presidential role by Congress, the press and the academy.

title: FUND BEGUN TO AID POLICE PROGRAMS
description: A private foundation has been formed to raise money for the Police Department to finance experimental and other programs to Improve law enforcement.

title: Pro Bowlers Open U.S. Play Here
Brydges's Mother Dies
description: BETHESDA, Md., Jan. 3 (UPI)  Mrs. Margaret McInerney Brydges, the mother of Earl W. Brydges, majority leader of the New York State Senate, died today at the age of 90. She was the widow of William H. Brydges. She is survived by six children, a sister and many grandchildren and greatgrandchildren.

title: Frazier Reaches Fight Site
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 3 (AP) Joe Frazier, the heavyweight boxing champion, arrived here today to prepare for the defense of his title against Terry Daniels of Dallas on Jan. 15. Daniels arrived from Dallas yesterday.

title: KENNECOTT SEEKS PAYMENT BY CHILE
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation formally called on the Chilean Government yesterday. to honor its unconditional guarantee to pay the first installment of $5.8million of a total of $92.9million in notes held by Kennecott in the expropriated El Teniente copper mine.

title: Nixon and Hart he Entered in Primaries
description: CONCORD, N. Y., Jan. 3President Nixon's campaign organization submitted candidacy papers today to the New Hempshire Secretary of State to place Mr. Nixon's name on the state's Presidential primary ballot.

title: U.S. COURT REVISES LINES IN ALABAMA
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Jan. 3 A threeJudge Federal Court ordered a drastic reapportionment of the Alabama Legislature today in a decision that held that county lines must be gnored as political boundaries if this is necessary to gain equal representation for all districts.

title: 62 Are Hurt in Belfast as a Beer Truck Is Blown Up
description: BELFAST, Northern Irelaid, Jan. 3 (AP)Terrorists blew up a beer truck in the heart of Belfast today and 62 persons were injured by flying glass.

title: Roger Davis Will Replace Peter Duel in TV Series
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 3 (UPI) Roger Davis has been signed to replace Peter Duel in the costarring title role with Ben Murphy in the remainder of the segments of the television series Alias Smith and Jones.

title: . . . Beyond Politics..,
description: Every incumbent knows that the best political strategy Is to appear to be above and beyond politics. This approach appeals to the many voters who have an ambivalent attitude toward political leadership, recognizing that it is essential in a selfgoverning society and yet wishing that it were not necessary.

title: SUBURBAN STORES SHOW BEST GAINS
description: Christmas business in local department stores was stronger in suburban areas than in New York City, a survey by The Times disclosed yesterday.

title: Jersey Standard Reaches Oil Contract With Algeria
description: The Standard Oil Company (New Jersey) has signed $400million agreement with Algeria for crude oil deliveries starting in 1972, the giant oil company confirmed yesterday.

title: PATENT LICENSES MAY BE LIMITED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3  A century ago, just before Christmas in 1871, Mark Twain was granted a patent for an Improvement in Adjustable and Detachable Straps for Gar ments. If he wanted to he WRS free to license different clothiers to install his waistbands in :their particular sales areas, or to use them in specified kinds of trousers.

title: Hostages in Hanoi . . .
description: President Nixon either signaled a significant shift his Vietnam policy or he misled the American people when he told a TV interviewer night before last that a complete cessation of American military involvement in Indochina depends on one circumstance; i.e., the prisonerofwar situation.

title: Harry E. Sprogell, 60, Dies; A Civil Liberties Lawyer
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 3Harry E. Sprogell, a partner in the law firm of Saul, Ewing, Remick & Saul, who had been active in civil liberties cases, died Saturday after an illness of several months. He was 60 years old and lived in North Wales, Pa.

title: Dallas Reporter Slain
description: DALLAS, Jan. 3 (AP) The body of Hoyt B. Spurlock, 28 years old, a reporter for The Dallas Times Hemld, was found yesterday outside his apartment. The police said he had been shot to death.

title: Bengalis Celebrate News About Mujib
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Jan. 3Crowds of jubilant Bengalis, pinging, shouting and firing their rifles, marched the streets of Dacca tonight to celebrate the news that Sheik Mujibur Rahman would be released.

title: 3 CITY FIREMEN SUE TO HALT UNION VOTE
description: Three members of the Uniformed Firefighters Association filed suit yesterday in Manhattan Supreme Court to prevent the tallying of ballots cast by firemen on the .proposed new contract with the city.

title: Market Place: Thefts Hidden By Some Firms
description: It's no secret that organized crime zeroed in on Wall Street during its infamous paperwork crisis, but it may strain the belief of some investors to learn that in some cases the Street itself tried to cover up the theft of securities.

title: TV: Conversation With President Avoids Routine
description: For one live unrehearsed and unedited hour on Sunday evening, Dan Rather, the C.B.S. White House correspondent, had A Conversation With President Nixon. What, precisely, is a conversation? It is a questionandanswer session and its success depends on who is asking which questions. Mr. Rather managed to produce a quite successful conversation.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. TO TEST EVERY PRICE RISE FOR ITS LEGALITY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3The A.F.L.C.I.O. disclosed today that it would report every retail price increase to the Internal Revenue Service as a possible violation of the Price Commission's regulations.

title: Court of Appeals Hears Case Against Closing Persico Trial
description: ALBANY, Jan. 43The debate over the recent closed trial of Carmine J. Persico reached the state's highest court today, with five New York City reporters asking the Court of Appeals to rule that State Supreme Court Justice George Postel had erred in barring the public and the from the proceedings.

title: J.D.L. Forms Group to Fight Lindsay's Presidential Bid
description: Rabbi Meir Kahane, leader of the Jewish Defense League, announced yesterday the formation of a Jewish political action committee to work to defeat Mayor John V. Lindsay in his campaign for the Presidency.

title: Atlantic Richfield le Struck
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 3 (UPI) Some 6,000 of the  Atlantic Independent Union members went on strike today at Atlantic Richfield Company facilities here and along the East Coast.

title: Rowles, Miss Teague Win Slalom Races at Stowe
description: STOWE, Vt., Jan. 3Don Rowles of Mount Hood, Ore., and Cecelia Teague of Waits field, Vt., were the winners today in the preCanAm slalom races at Little Spruce Peak.

title: Charles E. Wilson of G.E. Dies; Mobilized Industry in 2 Wars
description: Charles E. Wilson, former president of the General Electric Company who served as the Government's industrial mobilizer in World War If and ,the Korean conflict, died yesterday in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville, N. Y., after a month's illness. He was 85 years old and lived at 7 Hampton Road, Scarsdale.

title: Postel Voids Convictions Against Persico Witness
description: Supreme Court Justice George Postel honored an ear lier promise yesterday and dis missed the two convictions for loansharking and possession of stolen furs pending against Syl via Winograd, a former codefendant of Carmine J. Persico.

title: Chaps Top Pacers,102101, Making Up 15Point Deficit
SAMUEL S. KAUFMAN
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Jan. 3Samuel S. Kaufman, retired founder and chief executive of Oliver and Kaufman, textile converters in New York City, died at Stamford Hospital yesterday. He was 84 years old and lived at 312 Scofieldtown Road.

title: Tax Policy Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (AP) Fredric W. Hickman, a Chicago tax lawyer, was named today as the Treasury Department's Deputy Assistant Secretary for Tax Policy. He succeeds John S. Nolan.

title: Vietnamese ExEnvoy Tells of Meeting Ellsberg
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Jan. 3 Vu Van Thai, the former South Vietnamese diplomat who was named as a coconspirator with Dr. Daniel Ellsberg in connection with the Pentagon papers last week, said today that he and Dr. Ellsberg had been friends for a long time and had met in the context of his activities concerning Vietnam.

title: EARNINGS INCREASE FOR SECURITY BANK
description: The Security National Bank, Huntington, L. I., announced yesterday that net operating earnings (before profits or losses on security transactions) in all 1971 were $11.5million, or $3.76 a share, up 13 per cent from the yearearlier $10.2million, or $3.33 a share. Net income last year was $11.9million, or $3.88 a share, also up 13 per cent from 1970's $10.6million, or $3.44 a share.

title: Lindsay Groups List Receipts of $94,981 For Political Work
description: The five borough John V. Lindsay Asiociations reported receipts totaling $84,981.24 during 1971 In political Committee statements received in the mail by the Beard of Elections here yesterday. The reports ,tallied $37,616.35 as bal. ances left at the year's end:

title: HANOI SAYS P.O.W.'S GO WHEN U.S. TALKS TALKS
description: PARIS, Jan. 3 (AP)North Vietnam asserted today that the only way President Nixon could free United States prisoners of war and get out of the swamp in Vietnam, was to abandon hopes of military victory and negotiate seriously at the Paris conference on Vietnam.

title: Hartke to Run in Indiana
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 3 (UPI) Senator Hartke said today that he would enter the Presidential preference primary May 2 in Indiana. He made the announcement after flying here from New Hampshire.

title: Governor Designates 5 Judges As Appellate Associate Justices
description: ALBANY, Jan. 34 Rockefeller announced 'today that': he . had designated five judges as associate justices the Appellate Division. The Goventer also said he had redesgnated four. judges as assoelate justices of the division, whichis the second highest apCourt in the state system.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dorothy Bildersee Dead at 86; Headed Principals Association
description: Dorothy Bildersee, former president of the New York Principals Association, died of a heart aliment Sunday at the Hilaire Farm Nursing Home in Huntington, L. I. Her age

title: Cowboys Fear Warfield And With Good Reason
description: DALLAS, Jan. 3  Torn Landry, the Dallas coach, characterized the Miami Dolphins. the Cowboys opponent in the Sup9 Bowl, as a mystery team today. He made one exception: Paul Warfield.

title: Public Seeks Voice in Hospital Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 The administration of local hospitals, an area normally left to doctors and bankers, is coming under public scrutiny as alarm over soaring health costs spreads.

title: 2 Senators Demand Change in Rules to Benefit FoodStamp Recipients in Populous States
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3Twol Senators who favor more liberal food distribution benefits assailed the Department of Agriculture today for its refusal to abandon new food stamp regulations that would increase benefits in the South and West at the expense of New York and other industrial states.

title: On the Town Ends Run
description: On the Town, the Betty Comden, Adolph Green and Leonard Bernstein musical based on an idea by Jerome Robbins, ended its run at the Imperial Theater Saturday after haying registered 73 performances.

title: HANS OPPENHEIMER, BIOCHEMIST, IS DEAD
description: Dr. Hans Oppenheimer, a biochemist who headed the physical chemistry department of the Institute for Muscle Disease, died of cancer Sunday in New York Hospital. He was 56 years old and lived at 10 Wildwood Road, Westchester, N. Y.

title: RULING DELIGHTS SCHUTZ WORKERS
description: William Brehm reported for work as usual yesterday In the brew house of the Schlitz Brewing Company plant in Brooklyn. But his smile was brighter than usual because for a whileMr. Brehm had reason to think them might not be a job for him yesterday.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: HELP RETAILERS SELL YOUR PRODUCTS with selfliquidating merch. display by Krebs (designers/mfrs.) 2473690. Advt.

title: BHUTTO DECLARES HE WILL RELEASE BENGALIS LEADER
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 3Pakistan's President, Zulfikar Ali Bhutto; told a crowd in Karachi today that he intended to release the detained Bengali leader Sheik Mujibur Rahman unconditionally.

title: U.S. WON'T RULE OUT NEW RAIDS ON NORTH
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 3 (UPI) The Pentagon, holding open the possibility of renewed bombing of North Vietnam, said today that United States planes had failed to hit all of their planned targets in the fiveday series of air strikes on the North last week.

title: DAYTON BUSING PLAN ISSUED, THEN HALTED
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Jan. 3The Dayton school superintendent announced plans today to carry 40 per cent of the city's 55,000 students by bus to different chools next September But hours later a new conservativedominated school board told him to stop planning and withdraw his actions.

title: Deputy Mayor
description: The office of Deputy Mayor for Administration has been a paper tiger of New York City's government recent years, more important on the printed flow charts that sketch governmental offices and their powers than in the workaday pull and tug of municipal operations.

title: KRAWITZ WILL LEAVE MET, ROBINSON STAYS
description: One of the Metropolitan Opera's four assistant managers disclosed yesterday that he would remain with the company under the Goeran Gentele regime beginning next season, and another said he would be leaving. Francis Robinson, who is in charge of press and public relations, will stay on; Herman Krawitz, whose duties include backstage operations, will leave at the end of his current contract in July.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
CAHILL PROPOSES PRISON REFORMS
description: TRENTON, Jan. 3A series of penal reforms involving parole, living conditions, health and education for New Jersey's prisons was proposed here today by Gov. William T. Cahill.

title: Argentine Heat Toll Is 100
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 3 (Reuters)About 100 people have died during a heat wave in which temperatures have neared 100 during the last 10 days.

title: Tribute Is Paid to Harlan By Court of Appeals Here
description: The United States Circuit Court of Appeals here, which covers New York, Connecticut and Vermont, paid informal tribute yesterday to John M. Harlan, retired Associate Justice of the Supreme Court, who died last Wednesday.

title: McGovern Chargs Deceit By President on P.O.W.'s
Corn Farmers Face Big Changes in 1972
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Jan. 3The country's corn farmers in 1972 face sharp contrasts with the situation of a year ago.

title: . . . Mr. Mitchell for Manager
description: President Nixon told the national television audience that one of the hard decisions facing him is whether to retain John Mitchell as his Attorney General or appoint him as manager of the Presidential campaign. The reason why the decision is so hard, Mr. Nixon said, is that Mr. Mitchell is the best man, best qualified to be Attorney General and also best qualified to run the campaign.

title: White Inaugurated
description: BOSTON, Jan. 3 (UPI)Mayor Kevin H. White, saying Boston was not a dying city but a dynamic one, called today for a coalition of private and public interests to insure that the renaissance of the cities would start in Boston.

title: Sugarman Plans Drive to Cut Welfare Backlog
description: A drive to clear up a paperwork backlog in processing welfare cases, aiming to save the city $2million a month by earlier closings alone, was announced yesterday by Human Resources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman.

title: SAM SOBEL
description: Sam Sobel, a realty executive and investor and president of the American Jewish Museum of Art and Culture, 110 East 42d Street, which he founded in 1967, died Sunday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 90 Riverside Drive.

title: 300 Americans May Be Touring China at Same Time as Nixon
Muskie Home for Crucial Speech
description: KENNEBUNK BEACH, Me., Jan 3The crusted snow had been cleared from the flagstone walk leading up a slight rise to the summer cottage owned by Senator Edmund S. Muskie. There was a brisk wind blowing off the Atlantic, three blocks away, and no heat inside the twostory, yellow shingled home. But Senator Muskie had chosen to be among his fellow natives of Maine today when he taped an eightminute declaration as a candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination, to be telecast nationally tomorrow night. So there was a good deal of effort undertaken to make the summer home look as it might if the Senator were Jiving there instead. of at the Shawinut Inn in nearby Kennebunkport.

title: Record Total Of Whites Has Left State
L.S.U.Defeated, 8073
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Jan. 31 (AP)Louisiana State, broke in its new $11.5million Assembly Center tonight, but Vanderbilt's Commodores played intire like they: owned the place as they rolled to an 8073 Southeastern Conference victory.

title: Threat of Starfish to Coral Ends
description: COCONUTISLAND BLAND, Hawaii Three years ago Hawaii was caught up in an ecological crisis'. Aspecies of starfish with an exploding population supposedly threatened to consume the live coral reefs surrounding the Hawaiian wailan islands.

title: Advertising:
description: Obviously:pleased with Its success With the acquired. Field end : Stream magazine; the Columbia .Broadcasting System has gone . out and purchased (for, cash) two more spacial Intereat magazinesRoad and Track form Bond Publishing and Cycle. World from Parkhurst Publishing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: VOLKSW AGEN CLOSES SIX UNITS FOR WEEK
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Ian. 3 (UPI)  Volkswagen, West Germany's biggest industrial enterp,rise, today closed down six domestic, factories for one Week because of low orders, a spokesman said.

title: Lower East Side Remodeling Turns a Mess Into Townhouse
description: When Stanley and Ellen Poler decided to exchange their $39amonth apartment on East 74th Street for a ratridden house on the Lower East Side, their families were shocked, their friends appalled.

title: L.I. Sewers Called Vital To Protect Water Supply
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Jan, 3 The future of the water supply of Long Island depends on its sewers, according to the United States Environmental Protection Agency, which issued a detailed report and then Invited objections at an allday hearing here today.

title: ROSEWALL TAKES AUSTRALIAN TITLE
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 3 (UPI)Ken Rosewall won the Australian open tennis championship today, but Evonne Goolagong, the aborigine girl who won at Wimbledon, failed in a bid to annex her national crown.

title: IN THE NATION
description: The remarkable series of documentary excerpts now being published by the columnist Jack Anderson is a public service of the first order. Since the authenticity of these documents has not been denied by an obviously discomfited White House, they provide a valuable glimpse into the making of policyin this case, a policy that to many Americans seems disastrous.

title: CRITICS DEPLORE THEATER OF FACT
description: The socalled Theater of Fact, by virtue of the writer's biases, is an impossibility to achieve as well as a disservice to the general public when it mixes facts with fiction.

title: STOCKS OFF A BIT IN LIGHT TRADING
MARQUETTE TAKES 9TH IN ROW, 7260
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 3 (AP)Slowstarting Marquette, down nine points in the first half surged back behind big Jim Chones and Sophomore Marcus Washington tonight for a 7260 basketball victory over its archrival Wisconsin.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: ADVTJANUARY 11, 1972, is the date te wait for Million Dollar Inventory Manufacturers Site at Barco Bus Equipment Corp.

title: Soviet MachineTool Order Is Won by British Company
description: LONDON, Jan. 3 (UPI)The Soviet Union has placed an order worth more than $1.53million for numerically controlled machine tools in Britain, Vero N. C. Development, Ltd., of Southampton said today.

title: MACKEIL TO PUSH GUNMEN'S TRIALS
description: ueens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell said yesterday his office would no longer make deals for lesser pleds with any person charged with using a loaded gun during the corn.. mission of a crime.

title: Easy Football Tickets: Buy This Corporation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) Washington Redskins fans who want to buy season tickets can get them by purchasing a corporation.

title: TV: Murrow Retrospective Running on Channel 13
description: Channel 13/WNET's contribution to imaginative television programing this week .dMonday through Fridayis titled A Murrow Retrospective. The publicTV station is presenting several documentaries that the late Ed ward R. Murrow worked on es'distinguished reporter and rieWs analyst for the Colum.bia Broadcasting System.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: BOWLING. GREEN, Ohio, Jan. 4 (AP)Niagara jumped to an early lead and downed Bowling Green, 8874, tonight for its ninth straight victory.

title: Royal Typewriter to Move Its Production to Britain
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 4 (AP)The Royal Typewriter Company announced today it will move all its typewriter production overseas a step expected to affect 1,500 workers.

title: AntiInflation Plan Backed
description: SAN MATEO, Calif., Jan. 4 (UPI)The National Federation of Independent Business said today that 91 per cent of members polled support the Government's plan to combat inflation by restraining wages and prices. But members were divided on the guidelines employed.

title: Krupp Confirms That Chief Will Step Down at Yearend
description: ESSEN, West Germany, Jan. 4 (Reuters) Guenter Vogelsang, who led Fried, Krupp, G.m.b.H., the West German industrial giant, back to financial health, will resign as chairman of the executive board at the end of 1972, the company confirmed today.

title: Amtrak Stops Run Between Cleveland, Chicago and Buffalo
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 4 (AP) Amtrak, the National Railroad Passenger Corporation, said today that it was immediately discontinuing service between Buffalo, Cleveland and Chicago.

title: 25 on Jetliner Hurt As Plane Is Tossed By Air Turbulence
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 4 (AP)Twentyfive persons were injured when a National Airlines 747 with 334 persons ,aboard ran into severe air turbulence today on a flight here from Miami. All but five were later released from hospitals to which they were taken.

title: Woman Gets College Post
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 4 (AP)Jane Earley, a member of the University of Cincinnati board of trustees for 31 years, was elected chairman of the body today. Dr. Warren Bennis, the university president, said that he knew of no other major coeducational college with a woman chairman of the board.

title: EXCHANGE TO TEST SPECIALIST ROLE
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that it had established a new system to measure the performance of specialists, the men at the center of the auction market whose role is to maintain fair and orderly trading in the stocks assigned to them.

title: Otis, Patek of Royals Cited
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 4 (UPI)Amos Otis, a center fielder, and Fred Patek, a shortstop the basestealing duo that sparked Kansas City to its best season, were named cowinners, today of the Royals first playeroftheyear award.

title: DEMOCRATS ACCUSE F.C.C. OF FAVORITISM
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) The Democratic party ac)used the Federal Communications Commission today of constantly favoring the White House over the Democrats like Pavlov's dog salivated whenever his master rang the bell.

title: Suits Filed on Grasshoppers
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Jan (UPI)  Ranchers have filed $200,000 in claims against Nevada because of damage to their crops by grasshoppers. Seven ranchers in Humboldt County said, the state Department of Agiculture had been negligent in not controlling the pests. The biggest claim, was for 00,157.

title: Victory Eludes Shapiro In Shift to Sulky Sport
description: WESTBURY, L.I, Jan. 4The walls of the tack room in the stable of the fouracre Shapirb home in Brookville are covered with all the blue ribbons Neal has accumulated in the 12 years it has taken him to become one of the most successful riders of show jumpers in the world.

title: LOSS IN NOVEMBER IS CUT BY PENNSY
description: The Penn Central Transportation Company lost $28,908,382 in November and had deficit of $248,923,387 in the first 11 months of 1971, the trustees of the bankrupt carrier reported yesterday.

title: British Schools Said to Ignore Violence
description: LONDON, Jan, 4 British schools, once a symbol of stern discipline, have been accused by a teachers union, of ignoring the problem of classroom violence. Another teachers union denies that there has been evidence of a marked increase in complaints.

title: I.D.S. Urges S.E.C. to End Setting Stock Commissions
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Investors Diversified Services, Inc., told the Securities and Exchange Commission today. that if the commission insisted on continuing to set the price of the sales commissions on stock transactions it could hurt its own ability to regulate the securities business.

title: Nobel Laureate Wins Soviet Science Award
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Jan. 4 (UPI)Dr. Hannes Alfven, a (13yearold Swedish physicist and Nobel laureate, was notified today that he had been granted the highest award of the Soviet Academy of Sciences in 1971 for outstanding achievements in plasma physics and astrophysics.

title: '72 Newport Jazz Festival Is Moving to New York
description: The Newport Jazz Festival, the first musical event of its kind in the United States, will move to New York City for the summer of 1972.

title: Cattle Hermone Reiulation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI)  Cattle and sheep going to market after Saturday must comply with a new regulation aimed at keeping hormone residues out of the nation's meat supply. The Agriculture Department said today that the regulation required producers who used the growthpromoting hormone diethylstilbestrol to withdraw it from cattle and sheep feed seven days before slaughter.

title: Derelict Stricken on Bus Found With $130,000 Hoard in Clothes
description: An elderly man with all the appearances of a derelict who suffered a heart attack on a city bus yesterday afternoon had his pockets stuffed with more than $130,000 in cash, checks and bankbooks.

title: The High and Mighty World of Yolen
description: MANCHESTER, Vt., Jan. 4To shallow thinkers, the dateline on this piece probably suggests fractured fibulae and hot buttered rum, but the fact is, Vermont is not celebrated for skiing alone. The vagaries of wind current and updraft caused by the mountainous terrain create conditions that make for some of the world's most exciting kite flying. Will Yolen demonstrated this a decade ago Adamant, Vt., where he established a record that still stands, but may not survive another fortnight. Yolen is a crafty sportsman whose competitive guile compensates for his modest physical attainments. Not much larger than a growler of beer, he stands tall in international kiteflying society, where he has recognized himself as world champion ever since he tricked the Maharajah of Bliaratpur into diving his kite into a rain, forest during a flyoff in Central India.

title: City's Worst Traffic Bottleneck Is Opened a Little
description: The unclogging of the Bruckner Interchange in the Bronx, widely regarded as the city's worst bottleneck, began yesterday as traffic moved for the first time on two of its new viaducts.

title: Doctors Confused by Requirement on Postiog of Fees
description: There is growing confusion among health professionals over the Price Commission's ruling that requires doctors to post fees and over the precise way they may increase charges by, a maximum of 2.5 per cent.

title: Court Orders Teachers To End Yonkers Strike
description: YONKERS, Jan. 4State Supreme Court Justice George Beisheim Jr. granted an injunction today against the teachers strike here, which has all but closed down this city's 43school system.

title: Colonels Nudge Rockets
description: DENVER, Jan. 4 (UPI)The Kentucky Colonels escaped lastsecond effort to tie the game tonight and slipped past the Denver Rockets, 106103. Art Becker's 3point try dropped off the rim at the whistle. Cincy Powell provided the winning margin with a short jumper and Artis Gilmore padded the lead on a stuffer with. only, 11 seconds left.

title: School Strike in Yonkers
description: The crippling strike in Yonkers public schools is classic example of the harm done when a nostrike law in the public service fails to provide for final arbitration of deadlocked disputes.

title: Report Says 10 Churches Abet Immoral Acts of Arms Industry
LIBRARY TO REOPEN ITS SCIENCE DIVISION
description: The New York Public Library announced yesterday that public service in its Science and Technology Division would be resumed Jan. 17 at 10 A.M.

title: B.B.C. to Present Program
description: LONDON, Jan. 4 (Reuters)The British Broadcasting Corporation tonight disregarded an almost unprecedented Government rebuke and said it Would not abandon plans to present a twoandahalfhour television program tomorrow on ways to solve the Northern Ireland crisis.

title: McCloskey Would Welcome Brooke as a Running Mate
description: FRANKLIN, N. H., Jan. 4 (AP)  Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr., Republican of California, said today that he would welcome Senator Edward W. Brooke, Republican of Massachusetts, who is a Negro, as his running mate on a Presidential ticket.

title: 7th Duke of Wellington Dead; Art Connoisseur and Diplomat
description: LONDON, Jan. 4The Duke of Wellington, greatgrandson of the victor of the Battle of Waterloo, died today at his country home near Reading, in Berkshire. He was 86 years old.

title: R. A. BROWN JR., CANADIAN OIL MAN
description: TORONTO (Canadian Press) Jan. 4Robert A. Brown Jr., who made a fortune and a reputation as one of the top Canadian oil wildcatters, died here today. He was 57 years old. Mr. Brown was in Toronto on business. He suffered a heart attack and died in a hospital.

title: Nader Is Dropped as a Member Of Auto Safety Advisory Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 Ralph Nadar, the consumer advocate and auto safety expert, has been dropped from membership on the Transportation Department's Motor Vehicle Safety Advisory Council.

title: Jackson Assails Move
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Jan. (UPI)  Senator Jackson dismissed Mr. Wallace's Presidential plans today as utter nonsense and said that Democrats needed a progressive conservative ticket to lure Floridians away from President Nixon.

title: Muskie Formally in Race; Pledges a New Beginning
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4  Senator Edmund S. Muskie formally announced tonight his candidacy for the Democratic Presidential nomination and pledged to lead the nation in a new beginning. The Senator from Maine declared, in a national telecast, that politicians generally and President Nixon particularly had failed to provide America's citizens with the fulfillment of her promise.

title: Court Stays Cutoff in Medicaid Facing Upstate Nursing Homes
description: A temporary stay to avert a threatened cutoff in Medicaid reimbursement to nursing homes upstate was granted here yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals, while the state asked that the stay be expanded to cover also state government homes that include one on Staten Island.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 4 (AP) Evonne Goolagong of Australia and Virginia Wade of Britain had walkovers into the third round of the New South Wales open tennis championships today, as their, opponents withdrew because of injuries.

title: Donald R. Hamilton, Physicist; Led Princeton Graduate School
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 4 Dr. Donald Ross Hamilton, professor of physics and former dean of the Graduate School of Princeton University, died this morning in Princeton Hospital after a long illness. He was 57 years old and lived at 53 McCosh Circle.

title: Solzhenitsyn to Get Nobel in Private in Moscow
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 4 (Reuters)The Swedish Academy said today that it would pre sent the gold medal and diploma for the 1970 Nobel Prize in literature to Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn at a private ceremony in Moscow in the spring The decision, announced by the academy secretary, Dr. Karl. Ragnar Gierow, ends a dispute over whether the insignia should be handed over at an official ceremony in the Swedish Embassy in Moscow or privately.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Soviet Jews to Israel
description: A miniflood of Soviet Jews streamed into Israel the last few weeks and months of 1971. During all of last year about 13,000 of these immigrants arrived, a record number that has stimulated great hopes for continued immigration this year. Most of the recent arrivals are Georgian Jews, but many are also from Moscow and other large Soviet cities as well as from the Baltic states. The number of such immigrants is less than 1 per cent of all Soviet Jews, but its absolute magnitude is great enough to suggest a drastic Kremlin policy change on Jewish emigration.

title: A Coast Guard Unit Cancels 95 Playboy Subscriptions
description: NORFOLK, Va., Jan. 4 (AP) The commander of the Fifth Coast Guard District, charging that recent issues of Playboy magazine had gone beyond the bounds of what many consider proper, has canceled all Government  purchased subscriptions to the magazine at district units, the Norfolk VirginiaPilot reported yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A. &
description: The Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company, the nation's largest food chain, operated in the red in its latest fiscal quarter, for the first time in more than three decades.

title: Nader Cites Pressures by I.T.T.
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 4Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, said yesterday that a former Connecticut insurance commissioner told him in early 1970 that the International Telephone and Telegraph Company had exerted political and economic pressures here to insure that its acquisition of the Hartford Fire Insurance Company, a $1.5billion deal, would be approved.

title: U.S.Korea Textile Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) The United States and South Korea signed a fiveyear agreement today limiting Korean textile reports to the United States market. It followed by one day a similar agreement with Japan.

title: Peronist Office Bombed
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 4 (AP) Two bombs seriously damaged the headquarters today of the women's,branch of Peronist movement where Isabel Martinez de Peron, wife of the former President, Juan D. Peron, has an office. No casualties were reported, the police said. Mrs: Peron arrived last month from Spain to try to Unify the Peronist movement.

title: Rip in Soviet Vessel Explained as RussianCaused
description: The mystery of how the Soviet trawler s'Andreyev incurred a 4by10foot gash in her hull off New Jersey appeared cleared up yesterday when her captain told the Coast Guard that the vessel had collided with another Russian ship.

title: Hobson's Tax Choice
description: New York's current state budget approaches $8 billion. Revenues have fallen so far short of expenditures that a gap of about $1 billion, more than onetenth the total, opened up in the current fiscal year ending March 31. Projections for the fifteenmonth period that includes the next fiscal year have placed the gap at $1.5 billion. Confronted with this fiscal crisis, Governor Rockefeller made the only responsible choice open to him and proposed some spending economies and some new taxes.

title: McGovern Flag Flies In Wrong Place Here
description: Senator George McGovern's major Presidential campaign headquarters in this area opened at 605 Fifth Avenue Monday, and by yesterdaY, about a dozen fulltime work. ers had moved into the sixthfloor office.

title: TOKEN UNCHANGED
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority voted last night to increase the city's subway and bus fares from 30 to 35 cents as of 12:01 A.M. today.

title: Boeing Co. Lodges a Claim Against United Aircraft
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 4 (Reuters)The Boeing Company has lodged a claim with the United Aircraft Corporation for about $94million for alleged early deficiencies in the engine that powers the Boeing 747 jumbo jet.

title: Iowans Flock to a Ball for New Mayor, 19
description: AYRSHIRE, Iowa, Jan. 4 It isn't every day that Ayrshire inaugurates the youngest mayor in the United States, so it was only fitting that the school gym was packed with more people than Ayrshire's population of 273 last night for the inaugural ball of 19yearold Jody Smith.

title: Londonderry Shops Blown Up; Warned, All in Them Escape
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Jan. 4 (Reuters)Two shops were blown up in the center of Londonderry today after staff and customers had been given three minutes to get out.

title: SUNS HALT BULLS AS HAWKINS STARS
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 4 (AP)Connle o Hawkins, who earlier was V inolved in a freeforall with Chicago's Bob Love, scored points in the final minute and cobtributed a key interception to lead the Phoenix Suns to i I .108 victory over the Bulls tonight in a National Basketball Association game.

title: U.S. to End the Arming Of Ambulance Copters
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 4 (UPI)American military spokesmen said today that the 10yearold practice of arming ambulance helicopters was due to be ended by the middle of this month.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Lindsay Committee Formed
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 4 (AP) A John V. Lindsay for President Committee was formed yesterday. The key officers include Justice of the Peace Renz Jennings; Ted Mote, head of the Arizona chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union Jerry Pollock, a Democratic candidate for Congress in 1970, and Sherry Finkbine, a television actress.

title: COMMUTERS BEAR A HEAVY BURDEN
description: Albany's new tax and toll package is like a cat o nine tails laid on the twitching backs of many daily. commuters to Manhattan.

title: Reynolds Metals Expands Recycled Aluminum Line
description: RICHMOND, Va., Jan. 4 (AP) The Reynolds Metals Company announced today its expansion of its line of recycled aluminum products to include recycled alloy ingot for sale to the casting industry.

title: ROOKIE LAURELS TO BROCKINGTON
description: John Brockington of the Green Bay Packers, who shattered the National Football League rushing record for firstyear running backs by grinding out 1,105 yards, was named yesterday the N.F.L. offensive rookie of the year by The Associated Press.

title: Washington Post Is Given Secret Pagers by Anderson the full texts of three Wet documents describing meetings of the National Security Council's Special Action Group.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Washington Post reported on the front page of its Wednesday editions that Jack Anderson, a syndicated columnist, had turned over to the paper the full texts of three Wet documents describing meetings of the National Security Council's Special Action Group.

title: Rangers Keep Cool Heads In Spite of Rough Drill
description: Perhaps working on the theory of better late than never, the Rangers did some hitting yesterday, and came close to fighting several times. The popping, however, was against themselves.

title: Stage: Rockumentary About Manson
description: The key, to 22 years, Robert Sickinger's play about Charfes Manson that opened last night at Stage 73, is in the title. The 22 years refer to the time that Manson is reported to have spent in prison,..from 12 to 34, before he became a selfproclaimed messiah and convicted murderer.

title: McGovern Files in New Hampshire and Foresees a Tough Fight
description: CONCORD, N.H., Jan. 4 Senator George McGovern formally entered the March 7 Democratic Presidential primary here today, avoiding any predictions except to say that it would be a very, very tough fight.

title: Newsmen Asked to List Candidates for Primary
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Jan. 4 (AP)Secretary of State Richard Stone asked the Capitol's two dozen news men today to submit lists of candidate whose names 'should be on the March 14 Presidential primary ballot.

title: PANEL EYES FUTURE OF SERIOUS MUSIC
description: Whoever was listening yesterday morning to the panel on Who's Listening to Serious Music and Why Not? got an earful, not much music but plenty serious.

title: 3 ROB NASSAU BANK AND GET $180,500
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Jan. 4Three armed men, two of them wearing ski masks and the other a. black wig, held up nine employes of the Franklin National Bank branch here this morning and escaped with $180,500 in cash.

title: Triborough Increases Listed by Facilities
description: Following is a list of the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority facilities and the increases in tolls, which go into effect at 11:59 P.M. today:

title: DR. BORIS EMMET, LED SNELLENBURG'S
description: Dr. Boris Emmet, onetime chairman of the board of Snellenberg's, a ,Philadelphia department store, and former national retail merchandise manager for Sears, Roebuck & Co., died Monday at his home at 300 East 57th Street. He was 86 years old.

title: Isotope Airliner Is Cleaned And Put Back Into Service
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 4 (AP)An airliner that carried a leaky shipment of radioactive medical isotopes from New York to Houston has been decontaminated and placed back into service, Delta Air Lines said today.

title: 5 PARLEYS SLATED ON URBAN DECAY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4In a step that may presage a major new Administration. strategy, George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, announced today that he would soon convene meetings In five cities seeking metropolitan areawide solutions to the problems of spreading innercity decay and abandonment.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 4 (AP)Dave Simmons of New Zealand, defeated topseeded Bill Brown of Omaha, 36, 63, 16, 64, 75, in the singles final of the South Island and Nelson provincial tennis tournament today.

title: Mrs. Sheila Jackson Dorsey Married to John M. Bates Jr.
description: Mrs. Sheila Jackson Dorsey of New York was married in St. James Episcopal Church yesterday to John Montague Bates Jr., who iswith the San Francisco office of du Pont Glore Forgan, investment bankers. The ceremony, performed by the Rev. Almus Thorp, was followed by a reception at the Knickerbocker Club.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Suit in Alabama Asks Black Police Be Hired
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Jan. The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People asked a Federal Court here today to direct the Alabama Department of Public Safety to hire only Negroes as state troopers until the black ratio on the force reached the state's ratio of blacks.

title: Miss Macchi Gains 2d Slalom Victory
description: OBERSTAUFEN, Germany, Jan. 4Before the Alpine skiing race, Francoise Macchi of France said: I am going to attack. I am going to win.

title: ELLSBERG ENTERS NOT GUILTY PLEA
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 4 (AP) Daniel Ellsberg pleaded not guilty today to new Federal charges stemming from the Pen tagon Papers case.

title: Retired FactorUnit Head Of Chase Takes New Post
description: Emanuel P. Lewis, who retired Monday from the Chase Manhattan Bank, where he was president of the factor committee, has been elected managing director of the Slavenburg Corporation of New York, a subsidiary of N. V. Slavenburg's Bank, Rotterdam, the Netherlands.

title: After Hats, Adolfo's Favorite Is Clingy, Knitted Clothes
description: It seemed as if half the women at Adolf's spring and summer show at the St. RegisSheraton Hotel yesterday were wearing sleeveless sweaters, usually his. So it was no great surprise that every other outfit on the runway involved a sleeveless pullover, usually knitted.

title: Illinois to Honor NoFault
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 4 (AP)State Supreme Court Justice Thomas C. Kluczynski has ruled that insurance companies must honor nofault insurance claims pending a decision by the full court on the constitutionality of the state's nofault law.

title: PRIME RATE CUT TO SIXYEAR LOW
description: The prime rate tumbled to 5 per cent yesterday, the lowest level for this key minimum charge on business loans since late 1965 and early 1966.

title: Delta Airlines
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 4 (UPI)Delta Airlines reported today record operating revenues in calendar, 1971.

title: HOVDE TO RESIGN WIDER OFFICE
description: Dr. Carl F. Hovde will resign at the end of the year as dean of Columbia College, the university's undergraduate school for men.

title: Survivor of Crash Found in Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 4 (AP) A 17yearold girl, one of 92 persons aboard an airliner that crashed Dec. 24, has been. found alive in a jungle in eastern Peru where she had wandered among swamps, rivers and tropical forest.

title: Market Warning Sent Place: On Stock Tips
description: In closed board rooms, private dining rooms and sedate executive suites around Wall Street, financial analysts meet corporate managements to gather the information that influences investment decisions.

title: Mrs. Nixon, Ending Visit, Sees Liberian Tribal Dance
description: MONROVIA, Liberia, Jan. 4 (AP)Mrs. Richard M. Nixon, wearing native dress with bouffant head scarf, tapped her foot to tribal drums today as she watched dancing girls with painted bodies and bare breasts.

title: Evanston to Sell Liquor
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Jan. 4 (AP) The City Council of Evanston, home of the Woman's Christian Temperance Union headquarters, voted yesterday, 11 to 6, to permit the sale of liquor by the drink in clubs; hotels and restaurants.

title: Bridge: Boxer and Card Players Must Learn When to Duck
description: One of the hardest lessons for the average player to learn is the right moment to take an ace when defending against a Suit contract A small minority duck too often, and find that a vital trick has disappeared for ever. The majority acts on the principle that a trick in the bag is worth two in the hand, and is often wrong.

title: U.S. Tax Withholding Rates to Increase Jan. 16
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) In spite of the tax relief voted b3 Congress last month, millions of Americans will find their takehome pay reduced after Jan 16 by a larger withholding of income taxes from paychecks.

title: Buying Time for What?
description: The White House has wasted no time in shattering the illusion created by President Nixon in his television interview earlier this week when he indicated that the fate of American prisoners of war is the one circumstance standing in the way of total withdrawal from Indochina.

title: The Army: A Soldier's Assessment
description: WASHINGTONA great deal has been written about the Army lately, good and bad. As its Chief of Staff, welcome this opportunity to tell you where the Army is and where it is headed.

title: Don't Call Them Rev. and Mrs. Church's Pastor, Too
description: SCRANTON, PaThere are two pastors at the 600member Trinity Congregational Church here. They take turns preaching on alternate Sundays, share the neighbpring rectory and receive equal salary checks and pension payments. They also think alike on most subjects, although their approach is often quite different.

title: Rights Offering Is Planned By Commonwealth Edison
description: The Commonwealth Edison Company announced plans yesterday to raise about $200million with a rights offering of common stock and warrants. The giant Chicagobased utility said the financing had been authorized by directors and would be registered shortly, assuming favorable market conditions.

title: 42d Street Crowd Helps Robber Flee
description: A bank robber made off with $15 yesterday afternoon and fled through Times Square pursued by two bank employes who shouted Robbery! Robbery!

title: ExBowler of the Year Has Found His Grip
description: Now that Billy Hardwick, the former twotime bowler of the year, has taken a new grip on his game, he is looking forward to making another comeback.

title: Warriors in Romp
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 4 (UPI) The, Golden State ,Warriors coasted to a 11286 victory over the Buffalo Braves tonight. The ;winners 4)rokeopen the game by Outscoring Buffalo, 274, in the final 8:23 of the first period. The Braves did not hit a field goal in that span.

title: VANDALIZED BUSES BRING AN INQUIRY
description: NEWARK, Jan. 4Detectives and the Fire Department's arson squad are investigating the destruction of two buses owned by the Newark Boys Choir School, the fifth act of vandalism involving the school since it moved into an uppermiddleclass section of the North Ward two years ago.

title: PRINCETON DEFEATS MICHIGAN BY 9182
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 4The backcourt combination of Brian Taylor and Ted Manakas combined for 41 points tonight to pace Princeton to a 9182 victory over Michigan at Jadwin Gym.

title: Lesson of Yonkers
description: Strikes by teachers have become so much a part of the national school scene  there were more than 400 in the last three yearsthat they now seldom excite interest outside the Community directly affected.

title: Fox and Edlefsen Score In South African Tennis
description: CAPETOWN, South Africa, Jan. 4 (AP)Three United States players gained berths in the third round of the Sugar tennis tournament today, but two others were eliminated.

title: Arctic Gas Estimate Given
description: The Dome Petroleum Company, in a letter to the Canadian national Energy Boards, estimated that more than 15 trillion cubic feet of natural gas had been discovered in the Canadian Arctic. The company said it believes there are no technologial reasons why this gas won't be on stream within the next few years.

title: PROS WALLOPED BY STARS, 11489
description: MEMPHIS, Jana 4 (AP)The Utah Stars completely dominated a rather, disorganized Memphis Pros team, 11489, tonight in an American Basketball Association game.

title: COMPROMISE PLAN
description: ALBANY, Jan. 4  After a week of wooing, waiting and searching for votes, the Republicancontrolled Legislature today passed a $407million package of tax increases with needed help from the Democratic minorities in both houses.

title: WAGE BOARD FAILS TO BREAK IMPASSE ON AEROSPACE PAY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Pay Board failed again today to act on contract settlements in the aerospace industry after a day of maneuvering in caucuses.

title: Bolivia Said to Deport 9
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Jan. 4 (Reuters)  Nine political prisoners have been deported by the rightwing Government of Col. Hugo Banzer, Government sources said today.

title: Chileans Find Compromise in University Dispute
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 4A political conflict of national importance in the University of Chile found a compromise solution today that was hailed as a victory by the antiMarxist academic forces.

title: Enemy Troops, Aided by MIG's, Destroy a Key Bridge in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 4 (UPI)  A Defense Ministry spokesman reported today that enemy troops, supported by two North Vietnamese MIG aircraft, had destroyed a bridge on the only road between Vientiane and the royal capital, Luang Prabang.

title: Pakistani Officer Defects
description: NEW DELHI, Wednesday, Jan. 5 (AP)A Pakistani Army officer killed a Pakistani major, the only other occupant of a two  seater reconnaissance plane, and flew the plane to India, news reports here said today.

title: Support for Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) The Proprietary Association, representing 87 manufacturers who account for more than 90 per cent of overthecounter drug volume said it generally approved of the plan.

title: Notes on People
description: Gen. Robert E. Cushman Jr., selected last month by President Nixon to be the 25th commandant of the Marine Corps, has listed his two biggest problems attracting qualified recruits and insuring fair treatment for blacks.

title: Maravich Sparks Hawks
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 4 (AP)  Pete Maravich scored straight points in the last two ,minutes tonight, boosting the !.Atlanta Hawks to a 10391 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: Dissident Union Men Picket T.W.U. Office
description: A group of angry transit workers demonstrated outside the headquarters of the Transport. .Workers Union at 1980 Broadway yesterday against a tentative contract announced last Saturday.

title: Carson Given 18 Months in Bribe Case
description: Robert T. Carson was sentenced yesterday to 18 months in prison for taking part in a bribery conspiracy to kill stockfraud indictments when he was the administrative aide to Senator Hiram L. Fong, Republican of Hawaii.

title: U.S. Copter Fires on Allies
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Jan. 5 (AP)American helicopters supporting South Vietnamese troops in the Mekong Delta accidentally fired on Government forces, killing one soldier and wounding seven, the United States command disclosed today.

title: Harlan's Funeral Attended By ExColleagues on Court
description: WESTON, Conn., Jan. 4 (AP) The ashes of former Supreme Court Justice John Marshall Harlan were buried in a rustic churchyard here today after a private funeral attended by Chief Justice Warren Burger, and his colleagues on the High Court.

title: Cougars Beat Condors
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan.. 4 (AP)Larry Miller scored 35 points to lead the Carolina Cougars to a 130116 victory over the Pittsburgh Condors tonight. It was the Condors 10th loss in the last 11 games.

title: Album to Aid Bengalis Stirs a Marketing Row
description: The George HarrisonRavi ShankarBob Dylan Bangladesh record album, released two weeks ago after months of disputes, has created what the music industry calls bad vibes among some record stores and their customers.

title: PEKING EMPHASIZES ARMYSTATE UNITY
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, Jan. 5 (UPI)  The Chinese Communist party and the State Council have issued a joint call for :meter efforts to strengthen the unity between the army and the Government, the Chinese press agency, Hsinhua, reported today.

title: MRS. LELAND M'PHAIL JR.
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 4 Mrs. Jane Hamilton MacPhail, the wife of Leland S. (Lee) MacPhail Jr., executive vice president and general manager of the New York Yankees, died in White Plains Hospital last night, appareptly of a heart attack. She was 55 years old and lived at 224 Old Colony Road, Hartsdale.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE NAIVE AND SENTIMENTAL LOVER. By John Is Carre, 455 pages. Knopf. $7,95.

title: Nixon Tells Workers of New Ship Pact
