description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 4  In his first public appearance of the new year, President Nixon announced today .a. major shipbuilding contra'ct before some 200 happy. shipyard workers here. ,In the process,, he gave, vivid .demonstration of how ordinary Presidential business can be made to coincide with political.purpose.

title: Antifreeze Agent in Fish Blood Studied for Use With Humans
description: McMURDO STATION, Antarctica, Jan. 4 (AP)Dr. Arthur L. DeVries would like to catch a codfish in the cold waters of the North Atlantic Ocean and give it a blood transfusion.

title: Tanker Contract in Maine
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) The Navy has awarded an $80,155,000 contract to the Bath Iron Works in Bath, Me., for the construction of five tankers. Senator Margaret Chase Smith reported today that more than one million man hours would be required In the assembly of each 25,000ton vessel.

title: BERRIGAN PLOT TRIAL DELAYED FOR A WEEK
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 4 (UPI)A Federal district judge today postponed for one week the trial of eight ,persons charged with plotting to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, the Presidential adviser.

title: Physics Journal Decries Role of Scientist in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 4 (AP) A physios journal has complained that no top Nixon Administration official is qualified to function in top GovernMent circles a spokesman for the stientific community.

title: Police Find a Clue in Robbery at Pierre Hotel
description: As life regained its gracious rhythm at the Pierre Hotel yesterday, the police reported finding what may be a key clue to tracing the bandits who stole more than $1million worth of guests jewelry and cash on Sunday.

title: $24,034 Added ta Fund for the Neediest
description: I did delay but I didn't forget, wrote Ann, Durell of Manhattan. Her note to the New York. Times Neediest Cages. Fund aecompanied a cheek for $150one of 709 contributions totaling $24,034. 06 that the fund recorded yes.

title: NADER CRITICIZES MUSKIE TAX ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Ralph Nader charged today that Senator Edmund S. Muskie had failed to follow through on the promise he made more than year ago to conduct a public Investigation of the property tax and its abuses.

title: Fulbright Lays U.S. Failures To a Blind AntiCommunism
description: Senator J. W. Fulbright, in an article published yesterday, ,traced the failures of United States foreign policy since World War II to blind adherence to the anatiCommunist Truman Doctrine.

title: Cities Levy Extra Taxe For Subsidizipg Transit
description: Cities across the nation are turning increasingly to special property, sales and gasoline taxes to subsidize soaring deficits on their mass transit systems.

title: Peace Corps, Short of Funds, Plans to Halve Force of 8,000
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) The Peace Corps, short of funds, began shaping plans today to reduce its 8,000member volunteer force by half and to cancel programs in as many as 15 countries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: '71 Auto Output of G.M., Ford and Chrysler Up by 2 Million Over 70
description: DETROIT, Jan. 4 (UPI) Passengercar production by the Big Three auto makers increased by 2,253,540 units in 1971 to 8,723,126, compared with the 1970 total of 6,469,586, figures released today showed.

title: Murphy Leads Rockets
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 4 (AP) Calvin Murphy came off the bench to record a careerhigh 12 assists and score 28 points tonight in leading the Houston Rockets to a 119110 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: Advertising:
description: In the publishing world there are a couple of 18yearolds that have gotten just too big for the varsity. We're going to have to move them up to the pros.

title: CLOSE BOWIE TRACK, MARYLAND IS URGED
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 4 (AP)The Maryland Racing Commission recommended today that Bowie Race Course be closed and its 60 days of racing transferred to Pimlico and Laurel.

title: CATHOLIC AGENCY MAPS A NEW ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4In a major shift of policy, leaders of the National Conference of Catholic Charities said today that the organization planned to supplement its traditional social services with a new focus on political activism.

title: Advertising:
description: Doyle Dane Bernbach has just gotten some business it can really sink its teeth into: the Ponderosa Steak Houses. The billings are put at more than $2million and the agency officially starts in the spring.

title: SCRIBNER CHOOSES 2 TO END BOARD RIFT
description: Dr. Harvey. Scribner, the City Schools Chancellor, last night stepped into the controversy involving Community School Board 1 on the Lower East Side by appointing two temporary board members.

title: Mujib Release May Come on Weekend
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Jan. 4 (AP)A Government spokesman said today that President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto was unlikely to release the detained East Bengali leader, Sheik Mujibur Rahman, before the weekend.

title: Bhutto Offers Friendship
description: KARACHI, Jan. 4 (Reuters)President Bhutto has offered peace and friendship to India and said he would go to New Delhi to talk with Premier Indira Gandhi tomorrow if India responded.

title: Bucks Trounce Knicks, 121100, to Split Series
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 4  The first half was similar, but the second half was not as the Milwaukee Bucks beat the Knicks, 121100, at the Arena tonight, just 24 hours after the dramatic 10199 Knick victory in New York.

title: Wallace's Move: A Threat to Muskie, Possible End to Jackson
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 4Gov. George C. Wallace's decision to enter several, Democratic primeries poses problems for. the Democratic frontrunner, Senator Edmund S. Muskle of Maine, at the moment when he has finally made his candidacy official. For about a month, it seemed to most students of Democratic politics that Mr. Muskie would probably all but clinch the nomination if he won the first four primariesin New Hampshire on March 7, Florida on March 14, Illinois on March 21 and Wisconsin on April 4. The greatest threat, it has been thought, would come in the Florida voting.

title: 5 Lindsay Associations Aided By a Variety of Contributors
description: City officials, state legisla1 tors, trade unions, business concerns and a host of ordinary citizens contributed close to $200,000 to the John V. Lindsay Associations in the city from 1969 to 1971.

title: A Voice for Women in Law
description: The number of women law students has tripled over the last five years, and, as a consequence, there is a new emphasis on building a national organization for women in the legal profession.

title: Nixon Shows He Is an Old Hand at TV Techniques
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 4 The main item of conversation among the men who occupy the: White House and those who cover it is not President Nixon's forthcoming meeting here with. Japanese Prime Minister Sato, (summits are getting to be a bit old hat these days) but his interview, on the Columbia Broadcasting System Sunday night.

title: Ralph B. von Guerard, 53, Registrar at N.Y.U., Is Dead
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Jan. 4Ralph B. von Guerard, registrar of New York University, died in New York Hospital yesterday after heart surgery some days ago. He was 53 years old and lived at 12 Parkview Circle North.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Dec. 28:

title: Bombs in Parcels Arriving in Israel; Policeman Injured
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 4 (Reuters)A police bombdisposal expert was seriously injured here yesterday as parcels containing bombs, apparently sent by Arab .guerrillas, continued to arrive in Israel from Europe, mainly Austria.

title: U.S. Judge Bars a Rent Rise in Jersey
description: NEWARK, Jan. 4  A restraining order barring a landlord from raising his rents in violation of wage and price controls and from evicting a tenant who refused to pay the higher rent was signed here today.

title: U.S. Says It Has Open Mind On Chinese in Arms Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (Reuters)The State Department said today that the United States had an open mind on Chinese participation in the Geneva disarmament conference.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4One of the misfortunes of those telephone calls from President Nixon to the football Coaches is that we are told only part of what the President said and are left to imagine the rest of the conversation.

title: Shayne Loses His Suit For Hockey in Coliseum
description: Neil Shayne lost his suit yesterday to compel Nassau County to give his World Hockey Association franchise playing dates in the new Nassau Coliseum.

title: Black Ground Backs Forest Hills Housing Opposition
description: A black selfhelp organization strongly supported yesterday those who oppose the controversial low income housing project being built In Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Apollo 16 Astronaut III
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 4 (Reuters)Lieut. Col, Charles M. Duke Jr. of the Air Force, the lunar module pilot for Apollo 16, was taken to Patrick Air Force Base Hospital this afternoon suffering from bacterial pneumonia. Donald K. Slayton, chief of flight crew training, said that the illness was not expected to have any effect on training for the mission, to be launched March 17.

title: 4 DISTRICT HEADS NAMED BY MAYOR
description: The four men who will begin to function this month as district managers in a test by the city of government decentralization were named yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: 76ers Hold Off Pistons
description: DETROIT, Jan. 4 (AP)Billy Cunningham scored 17 of his .39 points in the final period ,tonight as the Phidelphia 76ers .held off the Detroit Pistons for a 131127 victory.

title: MRS. PAULINE WHITE, FORT LEE TEACHER
description: Mrs. Pauline Hansen White, a teacher and the wife of the Rev. Dr. Paul C. White, secretary from 1934 to 1968 of what is now the Metropolitan New York Synod of the United, Lutheran Church, died Monday at their home, 708 West 192d Street. She was 65 years Old.

title: Frans Masereel, Artist, Is Dead
description: PARIS, Jan. 31Frans Masereel, the Belgian artist who became one of the most forceful and best known exponents of German expressionism, died last night at Avignon in southern France at the age of 83.

title: Yablonski Case Plea Filed
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., Jan. 4 (AP)Attorneys for Paul Gilly, one of five persons charged in the slayings of Joseph A. Yablonski of the United.Mine Workers of America and his wife and daughter in 1969, filed a petition todayto move their client's trial out of Washington County,, where they argued he could not receive a fair trial. His trial is scheduled to begin Jan. 17.

title: F.D.A. TO REVIEW ALL DRUGS SOLD OVER THE COUNTER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Food and Drug Administration announced today the beginning of the first overall review ever attempted of the safety and efficacy of the more than 100,000 nonprescription drugs on the market.

title: College Basketball Tickets On Sale Today at Garden
description: Tickets for the 10 remaining regularseason college basketball doubleheaders that will be played at Madison Square Garden this season will go on sale today at the Garden box office at 10 o'clock. (Tickets can also be obtained at all Ticketron outlets.)

title: AMEX AND 0TC REGISTER GAINS
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market finished higher yesterday after an afternoon rally erased Most of the earlier fosses. Brokers attributed most of the market's strength to a new round of primerate reductions by some banks from 51/4 to 5 per cent.

title: INDIANA UPSET BY NO. ILLINOIS
description: DE KALB,, Ill., Jan. 4 (AP)Northern Illinois, led by Jim Bradley and Billy Harris, upset highranked Indiana, 8571, tonight despite 30 points by Hoosier Jobie Wright.

title: Painting Adorns Building Frame
description: Nassos Daphnis stepped back from his painting, cocked his head to one side and groped for words to distinguish what be had attempted from other artistic endeavors.

title: DAVIDSON TOPPLES ST. JOHN'S, 88 TO 84
description: Davidson College turned back St. John's 8884, at the Redmen's Jamaica, Queens, campus last night, halting a late rally with cool ball control and accurate foul shooting.

title: Advertising:
description: Reflecting a fact of the last decade, LaRoche, McCaffrey & McCall has officially changed its name to McCaffrey & McCall. Chester J. LaRoche, who founded the C. J. LaRoche agency in 1946, retired from the business at the end of 1967, having turned over the direction of the agency five years before to a couple of young cats from Young & Rubicam, James J. McCaffrey, now chairman, and David B. McCall, president.

title: SUGAR FUTURES UP ON SOVIET BUYING
description: Purchases by the Soviet Union in the world sugar market are helping to push sugar futures prices to their highest levels in seven years, a DowJones News Service dispatch from London said yesterday. New York sugar brokers agreed. London, like New York, is a major sugar trading center.

title: Cadmium Price Raised
description: The American Smelting and Refining Company and the St. Joe Minerals Company announced yesterday that they were raising the price of cad. iniuni by 25 cents a pound, to $1.75 a pound, effective immediately. This followed a similar move by Amax Lead and Zinc, Inc., a subsidiary of American Metal Climax, Inc., and was matched in Canada by Cominco, Ltd., the Hudson Bay Mining and Smelting Company and Noranda Mines, Ltd.

title: Floridians Triumph
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 4 (AP) Mack Calvin struck for a season high 38 points tonight to lead the Floridians over the Virginia Squires, 124113. The Squires rookie star, Julius Erving, scored 36 points.

title: The New Big 5
description: Shortly before the turn of the year, William L. Safire, Special Assistant to President Nixon, told a New York Law Journal Forum that the first of the great changes he foresaw for 1972 would be a growing awareness of the economic root of international power. Our eyes will become accustomed to the new Big Five in world affairsthe United States, the Soviet Union, the Common Market, mainland China land Japan. What do these portentous words mean? Are they simply inflated rhetoric or do they signify a coming development in United States foreign economic policy whose importance has not yet been appreciated?

title: Soviet Ends Construction of World's First Large Commercial Fast Breeder Nuclear Reactor
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 4The Soviet Union. announced today a major advance in its nuclear en, ergy program with the end of construction of the world's first large commercial fast breeder reactor.

title: Visit Reported Canceled
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan. 4 (Reuters)Reliable sources said today that unrest caused by reports of mass deportation of Iranians from Iraq had caused Premier Amir Abbas Hoveida to cancel. a scheduled visit to the United States.

title: DR. GEORGE BEAL, CHEMIST 84, DIES
description: COCOA, Fla., Jan. 4  Dr. George Denton Beal, who repred in 1958 as a director of research at Mellon Institute in PittSburgh, died yesterday of heart attack at his home here. He had lived in Cocoa since hiS retirement. His age was 84.

title: World Bank Notes Top Bond Activity
description: The bond markets, despite the beginning of a new round of primerate reductions, failed to move much yesterday. Corporate and taxexempt bonds dipped and recovered, and Government bonds recovered from their Monday slide.

title: The Presidency Under Glass: II
description: The Indochina war has set in motion a wholesome and belated critique of the American Presidency. A direct product of this war is the proposed War Powers Act of 1971, a bill designed to restrain the power of Presidents to carry the nation into undeclared hostilities. The bill's two particular architects are Senators Javits and Stennis. These two able men are not usually encountered as brothers in arms; and the collaboration of this odd couple suggests the range and weight of senatorial opinion behind the measure. The Senate Foreign Relations Committee, after intensive hearings, has endorsed the bill. So, indeed, has The New York Times.

title: Donohue Mounts Threat TO McLaren Monopoly
description: The Mark DonohuePorsche entry into the, 1972 CanadianAmerican Challenge Cup is Shaping up as the best break the CanAm has had in years. Today at Road Atlanta, Donohue will resume his testing program to evaluate refinements suggested by two previous sessions there and in Germany. The earlier tests have convinced Donohue and his car owner, Roger Penske, that they have a good chance of upsetting Team McLaren, which has won the CanAm title the last five seasons. Moreover, Penske Racing is about to sign up a sponsor, L & M cigarettes, a development that should improve the already solid financial base Penske has with Porsche/ Audi.

title: ADMIRAL AVGHERIS, GREEK DEFENSE HEAD
description: ATHENS, Jan. 4 (AP)Adm, Spyridon Avgheris, former chief of Greece's National Defense Staff, died yesterday night while under treatment for a heart attack in the Athens Navy Hospital. He was 63 years old.

title: '72 Tax Estimates
description: ALBANY, Jan. 4Following are estimates supplied by the State Division of the Budget on the amount of income tax increase to be paid this year by a typical family of four.

title: WIDOW, 69, IS SLAIN IN QUEENS PROJECT
description: A 69yearold widow was found strangled and stabbed yesterday morning in the bedroom of her apartment in lowincome project in the Hammels section of the Rockaways, Queens.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISThe only two capitals with significant diplomatic leverage on Hanoi's policy are Moscow and Peking. For a long time U.S. diplomacy sought to prevail upon Russia to bring its influence to bear in order to produce what Washington would term an acceptable Indochina settlement. Having failed, American hopes now turn to China.

title: Gino's to Close 21 Units
description: KING OF PRUSSIA, Pa., Jan. 4 (UPII)Gino's, Inc., announced today that, it would close 14 restaurants in the Los Angeles area and seven in southern Connecticut. The company added that these restaurants had been losing a total of about $2million a year. Louis C. Fischer, president, said a reserve would be set up to cover closing costs.

title: Harry Brockman, Cantor At Flatbush Synagogue
description: Harry Brockman, cantor for the last 28 years at Congregation Shaare Torah of Flatbush, Albemarle Road and East 21st Street, Brooklyn, died Monday night while taking part in an installation ceremony at the temple. He was 67 years old.

title: Executive Changes
description: J. Perry Rudick has been named a senior vice president of Smith, Barney & Cd.,Inc., international investment bankers. He will continue as the director responsible for,the corporate finance department.

title: Figures on Ashland Offer
description: Ashland Oil Canada, Ltd., announced yesterday that more than twothirds of the outstanding shares of the Empire State Oil Company had been tendered. under Ashland Oil Canada's cash purchase offer of $24 a share that expired yesterday.

title: Tension Is Mounting on the YemenSouthern Yemen Border, but a FullScale Conflict Is Not Expected
description: SANA, Yemen, Jan 4 (Reuters)  Tension on the remote mountainous border between the two Yemens has been mounting though the Soviet Union furnishes military assistance and advisers to both sides.

title: British Say Malta Has Barred U.S. Sixth Fleet
description: LONDON, Jan. 4 (UPI) Prime Minister Dom Mintoff of Malta has barred use of facilities on Malta by the United States Sixth Fleet in the Mediterranean, the British Defense Ministry said today.

title: Criticism by wing of I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 4 (Reuters)The Official wing of the Irish Republican Army today condemned the violence pursued by the organization's militant Provisional wing. The Official wing said that violence could only delay. prospects of Irish unity and asserted that British troops were actually trying to provoke it.

title: Mills Passing Up Common Market Trip
description: PARIS, Jan. 4  Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, has bowed out of a trip to Paris and Brussels the committee is making over the next week to try to improve American relations with the European Common Market.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: N. C. A. A. SpeciaL Session Sought on Financial Woes
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Jan. 4 The National Collegiate Athletic Association will not attempt to solve the serious financial problems of intercollegiate sports during its 66th annual convention this week.

title: Hong Kong Flu Is Suspected in Jersey
description: The Hong Kong flu, which hit Connecticut last month and which has appeared in a number of states throughout the country, now seems to be spreading throughout New JerSey, according to Dr. Ronold Altman, the state epidemiologist.

title: G.M. to Close Tooling Plant Because of Style Cutback
description: DETROIT, Jan. 4The General Motors Corporation said it would close a tooling plant here by March 31, idling 1,000 hourly and salaried workers. And the Ford Motor Company this week laid off 50, or about 5 per cen of the employes at its design center.

title: No Decision on Relief
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) A State Department spokesman said today that no decision had been reached on providing additional United States assistance to refugees in India and the newly declared nation of Bangladesh.

title: Man in the News
description: When William R. Tolbert Jr. was inaugurated Monday as President of Liberia, he wore a blue cottbn shirt and trousers, unconventional attire for such ceremonies anywhere, but pointedly so in a country long preoccupied with the intricacies of protocol and formal dress. Mrs. Richard M. Nixon, who headed the official United States delegation to the inauguration of Liberia's 19th President, sat beside the new President at the inaugural banquet.

title: Taft Quits Ohio Race; Asks Solid Nixon Slate
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. (AP)  Senator Robert Taft Jr., Republican of Ohio, said today he was withdrawing as a favorite son candidate for President. He hopes for a unified delegation pledged to President Nixon, he said.

title: November's Advance Was $1.26BillionPersonal Loans a Big Factor
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Consumer installment credit rose by a record $1,266,000,000 in November, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: PATMAN CHALLENGES PEAT MARWICK ROLE
description: Accounting practices followed by auditors for the Great Southwest Corporation were challenged yesterday by Representative Wright Patman, the Texas Democrat who is chairman of the House Banking Committee.

title: NO PULLOUT DATE OFFERED BY U.S.
2 Negroes Indicted For Holding Whites In Peohage on Farm
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) Two Florida Negro men have been indicted in Columbia, S.C., On Federal charges of holding ,least nine white farm workers in peonage and involuntary servitude, Attorney General John N. Mitchell announced today.

title: Paris Talks to Be Resumed
description: PARIS, Jan. 4 (UPI)The United States and South Vietnam agreed today to resume the Vietnam peace talks on Thursday after four weeks, of postponements by both sides.

title: Patent Commissioner Selected by President
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 4 (AP) President Nixon has selectd Robert Gottschalk to be Commissioner of Patents, the Western White House said today. He has been first assistant commissioner since February, 1970.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 4Yale's five starters scored in double figures tonight as the Elis defeated a touring Australian national team, 10390.

title: U.S. Backs Plan for Meadows
description: TRENTON, Jan. 4State officials said today that the Federal Government had agreed to guarantee up to $50million in initial financing for the construction of a community in the Hackensack Meadows in northern New Jersey.

title: POLICE ARE ASKING FOR $680MILIAN
description: The Police Department yesterday requested a $680.7million expense budget for 1972473 or $28.7million more than its current budgetto provide for about 1,000 more policemen to bring the department's patrol force to its maximum allotted strength of 25,000.

title: Illegal Collecting Laid To 2 Sanitationmen
description: Two city sanitationmen who interspersed commercial refuse collections for a fee with their regular rounds of pickups in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn were suspended yesterday:

title: 1,575 Unemployed in City Get Public Service Jobs
description: The city administration reported yesterday that it had recruited unemployed people to fill all 1,575 publicservice jobs allotted it under the Federal Emergency Employment Act, and had 1,200 applicants so far for 938 other jobs under a special allotment for areas of severe unemployment.

title: Secrets of Nutcracker Stage Magic
description: One of the mysteries of The Nutcracker is why anyone would want to give a child a nutcracker as a Christmas present in the first place. The ballet never explains this. But in George Balanchine's production for the New York City Ballet, currently approaching its 680th performance at the State Theater, more immediate mysteries do have their solutions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: OTB AND YONKERS TRADE CHARGES IN LATEST BATTLE
description: Locking wheels like a couple of Roman chariots, the Offtrack Betting Corporation and Yonkers Raceway careened through a new flurry of accusations yesterday.

title: Humphrey Bound for Florida
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Jan. 4 (AP)  Senator Humphrey will fly to Florida for a fiveday campaign swing next Monday after announcing his Presidential candidacy in Philadelphia, his state campaign publicist announced today.

title: CREDIT MEN SEE BUSINESS UPTURN
description: Encouraging prospects for significant upturn in business in 1972 are being forecast by a majority of New York's commercial credit and financial executives, who expect marked improvement in sales and profits. They also foresee a holding trend in business bankruptcies and hope for debt collections.

title: APOLLO 16 FLIGHT MY BE DELAYED
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 3 (UPI)  A technical problem has turned up in the Apollo 16 moonship, and there is

title: Harrislntertype Contract
description: The HarrisIntertype Corporation said yesterday it has received a $25.5million Navy contract for Versatile Avionic Shop Test systems to test electronic equipment on carrier aircraft.

title: Advertising
description: There were strong indications yesterday that Richard S. Lessler, chairman of the board of Grey Advertising since 1968, may soon be joining McCannErickson.

title: Article 1 No Title
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. (AP)  Evonne Goolagong of Australia and Virgina Wade of Britain easily reached the quarterfinals of the New South Wales open tennis championships today. Australia and Virgina Wade of Britain easily reached the quarterfinals of the New South Wales open tennis championships today.

title: Texts of Secret Documents on TopLevel U.S. Discussions of IndianPakistani War
F.D.A. ASKS CURBS ON SOAP CHEMICAL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The Food and Drug Administration proposed restrictions today on the use of hexachlorophene, an antibacterial chemical used in a wide variety of consumer products, ranging from soap to deodorant sprays.

title: Charles S. Mitchell Dead at 62; Led Cities Service Since 1968
description: Charles Scott Mitchell, chairman and chief executive officer of Cities Service Company since 1968, died yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital. The nature of his illness was not immediately determined. He was 62 years old and lived at 785 Fifth Avenue..

title: Florida Utility Plans Split
description: Directors of the Florida Power and Light Company proposed yesterday a 2forI commonstock split, subject to shareholder approval at the annual meeting May 13. At a special meeting yesterday, stockholders increased the number of authorized preferred shares to 5 million from 500,000.

title: Free Subways and Buses and All!
description: With the selffulfilling prophecy of an inevitable fare increase now a reality here in. New York City, our straphangers should be aware that other cities, in this country and abroad, are reducing, and in some cases, abolishing fares instead of raising them.

title: Firmness on Pay Control
description: By refusing clearance for proposed aerospace wage Increases more than double the basic antiinflation guidepost of 5.5 per cent, the public and industry members of the Pay Board have at last dared to defend its own standards against challenge by powerful unions.

title: Council Approves Ban on Rent Rises For 33,000 Elderly
description: A bill exempting 33,000 elderly tenants from paying the recent cityauthorized rent increases on controlled apartments was unanimously passed yesterday by the City Council.

title: Byrnes, Ranking Republican on Key Committee in House, Says He Won't Seek ReElection
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Representative John W. Byrnes of Wisconsin, the ranking Republican on the House Ways and Means Committee, announced today that he would not run for reelection.

title: Ghanaian Hails Mrs. Nixon as Symbol of Friendship
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Jan. 5Mrs. Richard M. Nixon came to this sultry West African republic today for the second stop in a handshaking tour that is showing increasing signs of being a big success.

title: WASTE IS CHARGED IN SCHOOL BOARD
description: A union official accused the Board of Education yesterday of wasting money by giving schooldesign contracts to private architects and engineers when the work could be handled by its own Bureau of Design.

title: DR. ZOLTAN DEAK, 66, HUNGARIAN WRITER
description: Dr. Zoltan Deak, a Hungarian newspaperman,. political writer and poet who was an outspoken foe of Nazis and Communists, died yesterday in Madison Avenue Hospital. He had suffered a cerebral hemorrhage on Sunday.

title: COURT ESTIMATES $1BILLION LOSS IN MEDICAID HERE
description: State Supreme Court Justice Jacob Grumet released a grand jury report yesterday that he said indicated that almost a billion dollars went down the drain in the city's administering of Medicaid.

title: Florida Power Signs Deal With Humble Oil for 5 Years
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Jan. 5 (UPI)  The Florida Power Corporation today signed a fiveyear contract with the Humble Oil Company of Houston to replace one that expires Dec. 31, 1972, under which Humble will supply Florida Power with 50 million gallons of oil.

title: Longshoremen's Officials Call Merger Talks Here Fruitful
description: Fruitful discussions toward achieving a merger of the Atlantic and Pacific Coast longshoremen's unions were held here yesterday by the top leaders of both groups.

title: RESCISSION IS SET
description: The United States Steel Corporation announced yesterday that competitive market conditions had forced it to roll back prices on a wide range of products, including some it had raised with Price Commission permission less than a month ago.

title: LASSITER OF PENNSY ARRESTED ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 5 (AP) Albert F. Lassiter, a retired Air Force brigadier general charged with two others with illegally diverting more than $21million from the Penn Central railroad, was arrested here today, the authorities said.

title: Researchers Will Live In an Underseas Home
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Three scientists will move into an undersea mobile home off the Florida Coast on Jan. 27 to begin a new research project of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

title: EDLEFSEN IS OUSTED FROM TENNIS EVENT
description: CAPETOWN, South Africa, Jan. 5 (AP)  Torn Edlefsen, American's 11th ranked player, was eliminated from the Sugar international tenni tournament today. Derek Schroeder of South Africa beat the Los Angeles star, 46, 62, 64, in the fourth round.

title: Study of Theater Urges Free Market for Tickets
description: A free market for the sale and distribution of theater tickets, with the laws of supply and demand dictating how high or low prices may go, is being urged by a citizens committee of 19 wellknown persons in and out of the theater.

title: Jackson, in Florida, Says He Is Opposed to Busing
description: PENSACOLA, Fla., Jan. 5 (UPI)  ,Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington, campaiging for the Democratic Presidential nomination, said today that he opposed massive busing of students but favored school desegregation and quality schools for all students.

title: British Army Is Toughening Its Tactics in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 5  British soldiers In Northern Ireland have been, given new authority to shoot to kill.

title: Test Drug Dissolves Gallstones
description: A team of researchers at the Mayo Clinic has reported feeding pills experimentally to four patients whose gallstones then dissolved totally or markedly without surgery.

title: Dismissal of Radical Professor Urged After Stanford Inquiry
President Orders the Development of a Space Shuttle
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. President Nixon ordered the Government today to proceed at once to develop a spaceship designed to shuttle easily from earth to earth orbit and back again.

title: 50 City Day Centers Fight Income Limit
description: Some 50 daycare centers in the city are refusing to comply with state incomeeligibility standards for families with children in such publicly assisted programs.

title: ES. ENVOY IN INDIA DISPUTED POLICIES BACKING PAKISTAN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Kenneth B. Keating, United States Ambassador to India, complained in a secret cablegram to Washington during the IndianPakistani war that the Nixon Administration's justification for its proPakistan policy detracted from American credibility and was inconsistent with his knowledge of events.

title: French Concorde Making Its First Visit to England
description: FAIRFORD, England, Jan. 5 (Reuters)The French prototype of the Concorde supersonic jetliner made its first visit to Britain today.

title: Bridge: TriState Regional Events Begin Jan. 13 at Grossinger's
description: Players in the New York area seeking their Life Master title will have their first chance this year to win red points at the TriState Regional Championships, which begin a week from today at Grossinger's.

title: Brand of Expos Signs
description: MONTREAL, Jan.(AP) 5 Ron Brand, an infielderoutfielder,signed his 1972 contract today with the montreal Expos

title: New Rochelle Police Bar Pay Award
description: NEW ROCHELLE, Jan. 5 Policemen here voted unanimously last night at a meeting of their union to reject a

title: Illinois Lets McCarthy Run Despite Refusal to Sign Oath
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Jan. 5Former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy of Minnesota can run in the Illinois Presidential primary March 21 despite his refusal to sign a loyalty oath, the slate electoral board ruled today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: DMZ Sites Bombed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 5 (Reuters) United States B52's bombed what were believed to be North Vietnamese troop concentrations and bunker complexes along the demilitarized zone today following reports of steppedup enemy activity in the area.

title: JAPAN IS PLANNING BIG RISE IN BUDGET
description: TOKYO, Jan. 5The Cabinet approved today a draft budget for the 1972 fiscal year calling for total outlays of $37.24billion. In terms of the yen, which was recently revalued, this is 21.8 per cent higher than the budget for the current fiscal year, which ends March 31.

title: Maurice Chevalier Buried After a Quiet Ceremony
description: PARIS, Jan. 5Maurice Chevalier was buried today as he wishedin a quiet, intimate ceremony in the suburban village of MarneslaCoquette where he had lived.

title: After Treading Lightly, Winter Marches In With Fury
description: New Yorkers sampled the furies of winter yesterday in the form of an inch of snow, subfreezing temperatures, gusty winds and slippery driving con. ditions.

title: GUN SITE IN NORTH ATTACKED BY JET
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 5An American jet escorting B52's on a raid over the.Ho Chi Minh supply trail in Laos darted over neighboring North Vietnam today for a protective reaction strike on an antiaircraft position, the United States command reported.

title: Samuel De Palma
description: Assistant Secretary of State for International Organization Affairs since 1969 .. career Foreign Service Officer since 1945, dealing primarily in field of international organizations... political officer at NATO and The Hague, 195861. with arms control and disarmament agency, 196669... born 83 years ago in Rochester N. Y.... holds degrees from University of Rochester and American University... Phi Beta Kappa... was parttime research assistant for Newsweek magazine, 194041 Air IntelBence specialist With Army Air Force during World War II.. generally regarded as effective amd mildmannered

title: C. W. POST WINS IN A.A.U. TRACK
description: It was easy, just a conditioner, said Mike Keogh of Manhattan College last night after handily winning the threemile run in 14 minutes 17 seconds in the Metropolitan Amatcur Athletic Union junior track and field championships at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: YONKERS STRIKERS TOLD TO RETURN
description: YONKERS, Jan. 5  The city began serving backtowork orders today on 53 leaders of the Yonkers Federation of Teachers who were ordered in an injunction issued yesterday to end their strike against the public schools here.

title: Tensions Rising Between French and Their Foreign Residents
description: PARIS, Jan. 5  The owner of a cafe in the Latin Quarter of Paris closed its doors this evening, apparently to avoid serving blacks.

title: WOODCOCK EDGE TOWARD MUSKlE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 Leonard Woodcock, president of the politically powerful United Automobile Workers, is moving steadily toward an endorsement of the Presidential candidacy of Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine.

title: Postal Service Counsel
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP)Louis A. Cox was named general counsel to the United States Postal Service today. Mr. Cox, who was also named secretary to the service's board of governors, replaces David A. Nelson, who has returned to private law practice.

title: Maurice Jacoutot Williams
description: Deputy Administrator for Agency for International Development since 1970... was international economist with State Department, 195051... held posts with Central Intelligence Agency, 195258... with aid agency since 1958, served mission in Iran and directed aid mission in Pakistan, 196567... born 51 years ago in New Brunswick, Canada, of United States citizens... attended Norhwestern University, University of Manchester, England, and received master's degree, University of Chicago ... served as Army captain in World War II... very observant but seldom vocally aggressive.

title: ... and on Prices
description: The good faith of labor's selfproclaimed effort to help enforce price controls would be vastly more convincing if labor had not so frequently tried in the last few weeks to take the spine out of wage controls.

title: Gas Plant to Be Built
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 5 (UPI)An affiliate of the Crown Central Petroleum Corporation plans to build a $200million plant here and sell its output of synthetic pipelinequality gas to an affiliate of the Columbia Gas System, Inc. When completed in about two years, the plant will employ more than 300 persons.

title: Eight Die in Hotel Fire
description: TOPPENISH, Wash., Jan. (AP)Firemen probed the interior of Washington Hotel here today following a fire that killed at least eight persons.

title: Article 3 No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) The House Banking Committee chairman, Wright Patman, Democrat of Texas, today praised the Philadelphia District Attorney for seeking prosecution in the collapse of the Penn Central Transportation Company, but he accused the Justice Department and Federal agencies of foot dragging and silence on the matter.

title: JUDGE EARL MAJOR
description: HILLISBORO, III., Jan. 5 (AP)Earl Major, a senior circuit Court of Appeals judge and a former Federal judge in the Southern District of Illinois, died yesterday of a heart attack. He would have been 85 years old today.

title: VERMONT EXPECTS VICTORY FOR G.O.P.
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Jan. 5An easy victory, has been predicted far Republican candidates in a special election to be held Friday, to fill Vermonts seats in the United States Senate and the House.

title: Franklin Simon Names 2
description: Gussie Shapiro and Stanley Fishman have been named vice presidents and senior mer:. chandise managers for Franklin Simon, the chain of fashion specialty stores owned by the City Stores Company. Both were formerly divisional merchandise managers with the Hecht Company, a Washington, D.C., store.

title: Amtrak Run Ends
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 5 (UPI)The last Amtrak passenger train left Cleveland today after picking up 13 passengers in the slush and snow at an unprotected crossing.

title: Governor Signs Bills on $407Million Fiscal Package for State
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5  Governor Rockefeller today signed a $4074nillion package of tax bills voted by the Legislature Yesterday. The package is aimed at easing a 15month budget deficit of $1.5billion as well as lightening the workload of the 1972 Legislature.

title: TWO SYMPHONIES STRIKE A BALANCE
description: Mozart and Bruckner could hardly on the surface appear more dissimilar, and yet a program made up of their symphonies can strike a perfect balance of grace and soberness, buoyancy and gravity. At Philharmonic Hall Tuesday night the Philadelphia Orchestra, led by Stanislaw Skrowaczewski, poised Mozart's lightly grand Symphony No. 29 in A (K.20I) against Bruckner's broad and radiant Symphony No. 9 in D minor, to impressive effect.

title: MISS ROCKWELL WINS SECOND SKIING TITLE
Investigation in Canada
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Jan. 5 (Canadian Press), The British Columbia Securities Commission has started preliminary inquiries into a private Ontario company, which traded Kaiser Resoucrces, Ltd., shares on behalf of some ex ecutives of the Kaiser group in the United States.

title: Soviet Author, III, Said to Be Mistreated in Prison
description: PARIS, Jan. 5Western sources have received a substantial account of Andrei Amalrik's battle to stay alive despite illness and what the dissident author's friends describe as mistreatment and neglect in Soviet prison camps.

title: Soviet Sextet at Garden Tonight
description: Tired and testy after a delayed bus ride from Philadelphia, the Soviet Union's hockey team spent only a few minutes in Madison Square Garden yesterday, then went to a hotel to rest for tonight's New York debut against the United States national team.

title: Miss Toussaint Sets Mark
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Jan. 5 (Canadian Press)Cheryl Toussaint of New York broke the world indoor record for the women's 600yard run tonight with a time of 1 minute 21.6 seconds in the first Knights of Columbus track and field meet. Miss Toussaint, 19 years old, held the previous mark of minute 22.2 seconds.

title: Fairleigh Downs L.I.U.
description: RUTHERFORD, N. J., Jan. 5 Fairleigh Dickinson outscored Long Island University, 104, in overtime to post a 7973 victory tonight. High scorer for Fairleigh was Lee Shulman with 21 points, while Fred Gibson and Walt Jones had 25 each I for L.I.U.

title: Notes on People
description: Just like any other tourist in Florida, Willy Brandt, :Chancellor of West Germany, .took in the sights of Disney ,World at Orlando. He and ,his 11yearold son, Matthias, were escorted through the amusement park by Mickey Mouse himself, who clutched Matthias's hand. The boy, here with his parents on vacation, following Mr. Brandt's meeting with President Nixon, showed he may have a future as a diplomat. He wore a Tshirt emblazoned USA.

title: Duryea Emerges Second Only to Governor by Independence and Aid to G.O.P.
description: Although he failed to prevent a glaring split in Republican Assembly ranks during the special session of the Legislature, Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea began the regular session yesterday as the major counterforce to Governor Rockefeller in state Republican ranks,

title: MURDER SUSPECT EA YES NO TRACE
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Jan. (AP)Stephen M. Bingham, the lawyer who is charged with murder in a bloody outbreak at San Quentin Prison last August, has vanished so completely that the District Attorney here says, There's a good possibility he's dead.

title: MUSKIE TROUBLED. BY ISSUES CRITICS
description: Senator Edmund S. Muskie, appealing here last night for funds for his campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination, raised about $80,000 of the $4million he said it would take in the first eight primary states alone.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Judge Acts to Stay Abortions in Municipal Hospitals
description: A temporary injunction to prevent abortions in the municipal hospitals here was issued yesterday by Justice Franics X. Smith in State Supreme Court in Queens.

title: New Beginning
description: Senator Edmund S. Muskie went home to Maine declare himself a candidate for the Presidency. The accent on downEast hominess was no doubt intended to underscore the simplicity, calm and quiet dignity which Senator Muskie has made the basis of his political appeal.

title: Wedding in Jersey For Mrs. Berkowitz
description: HACKENSACK, N. J. Jan. 5Mrs. Reine Berkowitz of North Caldwell and Sidney Silon, a widower, of Fort Lee were married here tonight by Judge Nathan S. Kirsch of the Municipal Court of Hackensack at his home.

title: Error by Atom Sub In New London Puts Coolant Into River
description: A nuclearpowered submarine, transferring water used as a coolant for its atomic reactor to a submarine tender moored lin the Thames River in New London, Conn., inadvertently discharged 500 gallons into the river on Dec. 29, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: Colgate Wins 5th Straight
description: STORRS, Conn., Jan. 5 (AP) Colgate University won its fifth straight game tonight, defeating Connecticut, 8680. Colgate's record is now 62.

title: HARVARD REBUFFS ATTACK ON A DEAN
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. Jan, 5The Harvard Corporation, Harvard's governing body, rebuffed today two senior professors and a former professor who had sought the ouster of Maurice D. Kilbridge as dean of the Graduate School of Design.

title: Soviet Dissident Convicted; Gets 7 Years and 5 in Exile
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 5  Vladimir K. Bukovsky, one of the most active members of the Soviet Union's small dissident movement, was convicted today of antiSoviet agitation and propagandizing. In a summary, oneday trial, he was sentenced to seven years deprivation of freedom, to be followed by five years exile.

title: LAKERS TRIUMPH OVER CAVALIERS FOR 32D IN ROW
Somogyi Sparks Rutgers
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., I Jan. 5 (AP)John Somogyi scored a season high total of 38 points tonight as he sparked Rutgers to a 9276 victory over Pittsburgh.Somogyi hit 12 of 19 shots from the field and converted 14 of 16 free throws as ,Rutgers beat Pitt for the seventh straight time.

title: Executive Changes
description: George W. Schmidt, formerly a vice president of the Singer Company, has been named president and chief executive officer of the Duplan Corporation, effective Feb. I. He will succeed T. Nash Broaddus, who will retire but continue as et director of the executive committee of the company, a leading textile manufacturer. Mr. Schmidt joined Singer in 1968 as vice president, marketing for the United States consumer products division. Later he was named president of the North American divisionU.S. charge of marketing and manufacturing in these countries. His most recent post was as group vice president in charge of Singer's North Atlantic consumer products group, which included responsibility for the manufacture and sale of Singer products sold at retail in the U.S., Canada and Europe.

title: Safety Agency Gets Report Of Power Brake Defects
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP)The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said today it had received reports on some automobile power brake defects and was investigating them. The agency said it had not determined whether the difficulties represent a safety hazard.

title: Mr. Bhutto's Generous Gesture
description: President Bhutto's promise to release unconditionally the Bengali leader Sheik Mujibur Rahman, for which he shrewdly elicited the support of a large Pakistani rally, is a wise and generous gesture. If promptly carried out it could clear the way for an urgently needed reconciliation on the bloodied and dangerously divided Indian subcontinent.

title: Bengali Economist Puts Cost Of War Recovery at $3Billion
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Jan. 5It will take at least $3billion and two years of painful work for the Bengalis to recover from the devastation caused in Bast Pakistan by their struggle for independence, an economist for the newly declared Bangladesh government estimated today.

title: From the Soup Through Dessert, Chestnuts in Every Course
description: You can never get tired of chestnuts, says Lilly Joss Reich, a tiny, woman who is an unabashed nut about nuts. Mrs. Reich, whose husband, Richard, is a playwright, not only follows the standard Viennese practice of using ground chestnuts and other nuts instead of flour in pastry, but she has developed an entire repertory of dishes based on chestnuts. It includes everything from soup to, well, nuts.

title: Sato Arrives in U.S. For Talks With Nixon
description: EL TORO AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Jan. 5 (Reuters)Premier Eisaku Sato of Japan,, arrived this morning at this air base in Southern California for two days of talks with President Nixon in the Western White House at San Clemente.

title: They Say His Apartment Is the Most Beautiful in Beverly Hills
description: LOS ANGELES  What some people here swear is the most beautiful apartment in Beverly Hills belongs to Gant Gaither, producer, artist and author. Be had lived in Mediterraneanstyle villa on a hill in the Sunset Plaza area of Los Angeles. But following the death of a friend, Bradley Little who had been editor of the magazine Architectural Digest and shared the villa with him, Mr. Gaither sold it and moved to the apartment.

title: 12 Die in South Korea Crash
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Jan. (UPI)A bus rolled off a moult; tain road 95 miles south. of here today, killing at least 12 persons and injuring 30, the police reported.

title: AirIndia Billboard Asks That Nixon Be Forgiven
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 5 (Reuters)AirIndia today put on display outside its offices here a large billboard asking God to forgive President Nixon for his policy toward: India and Pakistan in the last nine months because he did not know what he was doing.

title: Donald Gordon MacDonald
description: Assistant Administrator of Agency for International Development for Near East and South Asia since 1970.. career Foreign Service since 1952, serving aid missions in Turkey, Pakistan, Nigeria... directed aid mission in Saigon, 196670... handsome and usually deeply tanned ... very selfassured.. born 50 years ago in Chicago ... received degrees from Wesleyan and Princeton.. was instructor id Department of Politics at Princeton, 194749... served on Connecticut Commission of Government Organization, 1949 ... was lieutenant in Navy during World War II.. honorary member of Turkish Red Crescent Society.

title: JOHN M. ELLIOTT, 57, WROTE SAM'S SONG
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 5 (AP)John M. Elliott, composer of 1'It's So Nice to Have a Man Around the House, Sam's Song and other popular songs, died on Monday, apparently of a heart attack, at the University of California at Los Angeles Medical Center. He was 57 years old.

title: U.S. Seaman Hurt in Britain
description: FALMOUTH, England, Jan. 5 (AP)Rescuers struggled for an hour today to hoist an injured American seaman, Keven Peter Bowen, 23 years old, of Hillsdale, N.Y., to safety after he fell 50 feet down a cliff on the Cornwall coast in southwest England.

title: Beauty Salons Find Specialization Pays
description: Shampoo and set and out you go is no longer enough for most beauty salons. A few years back, they tried adding boutiques for clothes and accessories and weren't too successful. Now that they are feeling the pinch brought about by long hair and doityourself hairdos, they're searching for other areas to boost business. The logical move has been into specialized services, the sort of thing common to European salons.

title: New Clues Reported in Pierre Holdup
description: Deputy Police Commissioner Robert Daley said yesterday that the police had promising new leads in the Pierre Hotel robbery.

title: Advertising
description: Young & Rubicam, which got its first assignment from the American Home Products Boyle Midway division last summer, has just been given the SaniFlush business. Billings are estimated at $2.5milion.

title: Canada Expanded Foreign Reserves During December
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 5 (Reuters)Canada's foreignexchange reserves rose to more than $5.57billion at the end of December, an increase of nearly $297million in the month and $873million for all 1971, Canada's Finance Department reported today.

title: Market Place: Splinter Groups Stirring Debates
description: Debate is heating up on Wall Street over the frequent private meetings of small bands of security analysts trying to obtain corporate Information for investment decisions.

title: Officialdom in Action Anderson's Revelations Offer Glimpse Of How Leaders React Under Stress
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The country has now caught up with the movies and received some reallife Anderson tapes or at least minutes and they offer a fascinating glimpse of governmenta faithful account of how highranking officials talk to One another under stress But to be read fairly and profitably, these revelations also need more explanation and information, only some of which is available so far

title: Chess: Handing Fischer a Move Is Hardly a Prudent Idea
French Reseeves Climb
description: PARIS, Jan. 5 (Reuters)France's gold and currency reserves rose 1,975,000,000 francs in December to 39,334,000,000 francs, France's Finance Ministry said today.

title: JAPAN IS RELAXING CURRENCY CONTROLS
description: TOKYO, Jan. 5 (Reuters)Japan's Finance Ministry, said today it had eased some of the exchange controls imposed during the international currency crisis last year.

title: Article 2 No Title
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 5 (AP)Lee Warfield, a reserve guard, scored 24 points, 17 in the fourth period tonight, to help the Seattle SuperSonics defeat the Atlanta Hawks, 127116.

title: COURSE IN JERSEY BRANDED A FRAUD
description: NEWARK, Jan. 5  New Jersey's Consumer Affairs Director and Attorney General went to court today in an attempt to shut down operations of Glenn W. Turner's success motivation course, Dare to Be Great, throughout the state.

title: Unfairness on TV
description: As President Nixon predicted, his hourlong television interview last Sunday evening has evoked a request from the Democratic National Committee for equal time to reply. It is extraordinary that the Federal Communications Commission and the broadcasting industry continue to leave this elementary issue of fairness in the domain of controversy.

title: British Reserves Grew
description: LONDON, Jan. 5 (Reuters)An increase of $1billion in Britain's official reserves last month was announced by the Government yesterday.

title: DRUG IN TEST AIDS CARDIAC PATIENTS
description: Two separate British studies have indicated that clofibrate, a cholesterollowering drug, may prevent cardiac deaths and nonfatal heart attacks in patients suffering from angina pectoris.

title: Soviet Art in Capital for SixCity Tour
description: WASHINGTON  Packed in gray crates marked Nye Kantovat (loosely translated Do Not Tilt"), nearly 1,500 examples of Soviet arts and crafts have made their promised arrival at the Corcoran Gallery of Art for the first leg of a United States tour. The traveling show, opening here Jan. 12, comprises the largest group of ancient and contemporary art objects ever sent abroad by the Soviet Government.

title: Health Meeting in Boston
description: BOSTON, Jan.. 5 (UPI)The first of eight regional meetings of the President's Committee on Health Education will be hed tomorrow, with more than two dozen speakers on health problems and care. Subsequent meetings will be held Monday in Pittsburgh and Wednesday in St. Louis.

title: Keating Cable to Rogers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Following, in slightly paraphrased form, is the text of a secret cablegram from Kenneth B. Keating, United States Ambassador to India, William P. Rogers, the Secretary of State, on Dec. 8, 1971, made available to The New York Times by the columnist Jack Anderson:

title: Airline Captain TopFlight Dog Judge
description: When Joe Tacker isn't at the command of a DC9, flying passengers on the interisland run in Hawaii, he's at the controls in a dog.thow ring, ruling on ribbon winners.

title: Modern Muckraker Jack Northman Anderson
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Sunlight is the best disinfectant. From that premise, Jack Anderson operates as a muckraker to expose what he considers wrongdoing in and out of government, with emphasis on governmental secrets. He conducts his Washington MerryGoRound column with a sense of outrage he says, because public office is a public trust and sunlight on gov ernment blunders is the best way to inform the voters of what their elected officials may be up to.

title: SHIFTS EXPECTED AT LORD &
description: Lord & Taylor, a leading New Yorkbased department store chain, is expected to announce today a new organizational arrangement of top officers. As part of it, Melvin E. Dawley, chairman and chief executive officer, will take a new post with responsibilities that will no longer require him to be involved in daily operations.

title: CHILE COPPER HIT BY Ali OUTPUT LAG
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 5 Production failures in Chile's nationalized copper mines have contributed heavily to a partial suspension of foreign payments by the leftwing government of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: Phone Rate Cuts Unlikely For TransAtlantic Callers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (Reuters)Early cuts in transAtlantic telephone rates appear unlikely because of a decision of the Communications Satellite Corporation not to reduce satellite transmission fees.

title: JOSEPH C. KENNEDY OF BANKERS TRUST
description: MONTCLAIR. N. J., Jan. 5Joseph C. Kennedy, senior vice president in charge of the corporate finance department of the Bankers Trust Company, died last evening, apparently of a heart attack, while on his way home. He was 58 years old and lived at 73 Gates Avenue.

title: Mary Foshee Lide Is Married To Burk Murchison in Dallas
description: DALLAS, Jan, 5Miss Mary Foshee Lide was married here this afternoon to Burk Coleman Murchison, son of Clinton W. (Clint) Murchison Jr., chairman of the board of the Dallas Cowboys, the professional football team, and Mrs. Murchison of Dallas and New York.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Basketball produces its own peculiar kind of frenzy and it seems to reach a thunderous crescendo in the Madison Square Garden sound chamber when the New York Knickerbockers engage in one of their preposterous magic acts. These outrageous bits of flimflammery snatch away from the other team a victory that apparently was solidly assured and turn the arena into a madhouse. Knick fans go insane with joy and the enemy gets so crazed by anger as to almost need straightjackets to control the frustration. Such was the situation in the Garden a few nights ago when the Knicks capped a torturous uphill climb by tumbling over the top in the final three seconds to upset the Milwaukee Bucks, 101 to 99. The joint was jumping on a wave of hysteria that was reminiscent of the emotional outbursts accompanying the winning of the championship in the spring of 1970.

title: Natural History Museum Shifts Focus to Photos by TeenAgers
description: An exhibition that represents a drastic departure not only for the American Museum of Natural History but also for the young contributors to the display opened today.

title: THREE RETAIL CHAINS REPORT SALES GAINS
description: Three retail chains reported higher sales yesterday for December and cumulative 1971 periods, compared with the similar 1970 periods.

title: Havlicek Heads East's AllStars
description: John Havlicek of the Boston Celtics has gone from the best sixth man in pro basketball to the leading votegetter of the National Basketball Association's East AllStar team, which was named yesterday.

title: SHAYNE SUES GARDEN ON TICKET TIEINS
description: Neil Shayne, who has a $33million antitrust suit pending against the National Hockey League, filed another suit yesterday, charging Madison Square Garden, the Rangers and Knickerbockers with using illegal tiein policies that force ticketholders to buy seats for unwanted events.

title: Amending of Suit On I. T. T. Barred
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 5Efforts to overturn the State Insurance Commissioner's 1970 approval of the merger of the Hartford Fire Insurance Company into the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation bogged down today in a series of legal maneuvers in Superior Court here.

title: Christopher Van Hollen
description: Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern and South Asian Affairs since 1969.. career Foreign Service since 1951, serving posts in New Delhi, Calcutta, Katmandu. Karachi, Rawalpindi, and Ankara... State Department Country Director for India, Ceylon NepalMaldive Islands, 1968... born 49 years ago in Maryland... holds degrees from Haverford College and Johns Hopkins University... was Lieutenant (jg) in Navy, 194346... taught political science until joining state department... detailed to National War College, 1964 ... has a very outgoing personality... selfasserting but cautious in dealing with Congress.

title: Change in Strategy Reported
description: SAIGON, Thursday, Jan. 5 (AP)The South Vietnamese Government, in a major shift of Military strategy, is abandoning majors bases in Cambodia in favor of a powerful air mobile strike force, official sources said today,

title: U.S. and Russians Resume Talks in Vienna on Arms
description: VIENNA, Jan. 5The United States and the Soviet Union resumed their, negotiations on the limitation of. strategic siles here today after II recess for the Christmas and. New Year holidays.

title: U.S. Agreement With Bahrain To Set Up Navy Base Disclosed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5In a move to maintain an American Military presence in the Persian Gulf area, the United States has entered into an unpublicized agreement to establish a permanent naval station on the island of Bahrain.

title: IN THE NATION
description: It may be symbolic of trouble ahead that on the day Senator Edmund Muskie lanunched his longexpected Presidential candidacy in an expensive na tional telecast, Gov. George Wallace of Alabama got almost equal news coverage by casually letting The New York Times know that he would run in the Florida Democratic primary.

title: U.S. Steel Unit to Reopen
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5 (AP)The Gary, Ind., works of the U.S. Steel Corporation will resume operations of its No. 4 open hearth steelmaking shop Friday, the company announced today.

title: LAWMAKERS MEET IN BRIEF SESSION Apathy Marks Opening of TermGovernor Puts Off His Annual Message
description: The apathy and the lawmakers homeward Yearnings were th result. of two special sessions of the Legislature since midDecember. The first Was to redraw their district lines. The seCond ended yesterday with passage of a revised version of Governor. Rockefeller's emergency fiscal program,

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: UNIONS OUTVOTED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The Pay Board rejected today contract settlements that would nave provided a 12 per cent wage increase next year to more than 100,000 workers in the aerospace industry. It then recessed without voting on proposal for an alternate settlement.

title: Kissinger Parley Excerpts
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 5 Following are excerpts from a background briefing for news correspondents given on Dec 7 by Henry A. Kissinger President Nixon's adviser on national security. Senator Barry Goldwater of Arizona obtained the transcript front the White House and inserted it in The Congressional Record on Dec. 9. It constitutes a Nixon Administration summary of American policy at the time of themeetings discussed the documents made public toddy by the columnist Jack Anderson.

title: Anderson Ready for Battle With Government, but Appears Unlikely to Get One
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The columnist Jack Anderson said today that he was ready, if necessary, for a battle with the Government over his disclosure of secret IndiaPakistan papers, but he appeared unlikely to get it.

title: Dr. Shapiro Quitting to Protest Bullying Central School Board
description: Dr. Elliott S. Shapiro said yesterday that he would retire as superintendent of Community School District 2 this spring to protest against what he described as the City Board of Education's bullying policy and ruthless disregard for democratic procedures in personnel dealings.

title: Thoroughbred Racing To Honor Engelhard
description: The late Charles W. Engelhard, one of thoroughbred racing's biggest spenders during the nineteen sixties, will be honored posthumously here Jan. 26 at the sport's first Winner's Circle Dinner.

title: Poll of Vietnam Veterans Finds Doubt Over Readjustment Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Only slightly more than half of the veterans who have served in the armed forces since 1963 believe that the President and his Administration are doing all they can to help veteimns readjust to civilian life, according to the findings of a, special Harris Poll released here today.

title: Blast in Correction Office
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 5 (UPI)A bomb exploded this evening in a washroom of the regional office here of the State Correctional Services Department, the police said. No injuries were reported.

title: Rates Fall Abroad
description: Paris Jan. 5Lower interest rates, a strong dollar, demand for dollars securities, some outflow of dollars from foreign central banks (chiefty the Bank of Japan) and ever rising prices in the thin Continental markerts for gold.

title: Do Not Open Before 2014
description: The Republic will undoubtedly stand the suspense the courtordered postponement until 2014 of the publication of President Warren G. Harding's love letters to Mrs. Carrie Phillips. Most historians, though personally and professionally disappointed, will probably agree with the conclusion of one of their number that the matter will not be a shadow across the rest of my life.

title: Hanoi Ties P.O.W. Issue To End of Vietnamization
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 5 (AP) North Vietnam said today that the United States must abandon its policy of Vietnamizing. the the war to obtain the release of Americans held prisoner by Hanoi.

title: Dow Is Up by 12.20 As Volume Booms
Herman Fiedelbaum Dies at 82; Founder of Fields Hotel Chain
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Jan. 5 Herman Fiedelbaum, retired chairman of the Fields Hotel Corporation, one of the nation's largest hotel chains, died ap. parently of a heart attack last evening. He was 82 years old.

title: Retired Dr. Goldmark Sets Career as a Scientist Anew
description: Dr. Peter C. Goldmark, the man who at age 64 turned down $75,000 a year for 10 years with the CBS Laboratories division of the Columbia Broadcasting System, announced yesterday the start of a new career and a new com pany in conjunction with the Kinney Services, Inc.

title: CAROL ESBERG SHERMAN
description: Mrs. Carol Esberg Sherman, an advertising copywriter, died yesterday in Albert Einstein Hospital in the Bronx. She was 41 years old and lived at 90 Riverside Drive. Her husband, Saul, is a lawyer.

title: Black Correspondent Ousted By Newsweek Files Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) Samuel F. Yette, a Negro correspondent dismissed by Newsweek, today charged the magazine with racism and denial of free speech and press.

title: The Chicago Tribune Names Australian Managing Editor
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5 (Reuters)An Australian newspaperman will take over as managing editor of The Chicago Tribune next week, it was announced today.

title: Hightower Quits the Modem Museum
description: John B. Hightower, director of the Museum of Modern Art since May 1970, resigned yesterday.

title: Sugar Futures Price Advances After Reports of Quota Raise
1971 AUTO SALES ROSE TO RECORD
description: DETROIT, Jan. 5 (AP) Auto sales in the United States in 1971, given a late spur by the wageprice freeze and excisetax repeal, exceeded 10 million cars for the first time.

title: Michigan Court to Review Property Tax for Schools
description: LANSING, Mich., Jan. 5 (AP) The Michigan Supreme Court announced today that it had agreed to review the constitutionality of Michigan's property tax as a basic source of revenue for public schools support.

title: Man as Posterity's Keeper
description: CHICAGOMuch of the rebellion that has occurred in recent years has been attributed to disenchantment with the life that has been shaped by advanced technology, but the problems of our society cannot be solved by wearing of love beads and reversion to the simple life of the pioneer or of Rousseau's Noble Savage.

title: AIRLINER WRECKAGE IS SIGHTED IN PERU
description: LIMA, Peru, Jan. 5 (Reuters) The wreckage of an airliner missing since Dec. 24 with 92 persons aboard was found today in the north central Peruvian jungles. There was no sign of the additional survivors reported by a passenger who escaped.

title: Tickets in 50c Lottery Now on Sale in State
description: The new 50cent weekly New York State lottery tickets went on sale yesterday with hopes that the reduced rates would increase lottery sales. The top prize will be $50,000, but a total of 1,000 winners across the state will be selected in the weekly drawings.

title: Restless Japan: Role in Asia Still Uncertain
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 5When President Nixon meets with Premier Eisaku Sato of Japan here tomoriow. and Friday, he will be talking with the leader of a restless, anxious nation that appears close to being distraught.

title: OSCAR SUNDSTRAND, INVENTOR, DIES AT 82
description: HARTFORD, Conn., Jan. (AP)Oscar Sundstrand, a coinventor of the 10key adding machine and holder of more than 150 patents, died in Hartford Hospital yesterday at the age of 82.

title: Mayor Says City Is Better Able To Handle Snow Than in Past
description: Mayor Lindsay, with the snow swirling around him yesterday, inspected new sanitation equipment lined up in front of City Hall and said the city was in much better shape to handle snow than it had been in previous years.

title: Personal Finance: Yields on Savings
description: What's ahead for savers? Will interest rates on savings accounts move down generally?

title: ABORTION, IMPACT ASSAYED IN STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) Legalization of abortions in every state would have little initial impact on population growth but could curb the rising national rate of illegitimate births, says an unpublished study prepared for a Presidential panel.

title: B.B.C. Program Goes On
description: LONDON, Jan. 5The British Broadcasting Corporation went ahead tonight with a television program examining the Government's policy in Northern Ireland, despite protests from officials here and in Belfast.

title: FIREMEN RATIFY A 30MONTH PACT Pay Increase, Retroactive to Jan. 1, 1971, Approved
description: Members of the Uniformed Firefighters Association ratified a new 30month contract yesteray that provides for pay Increases totaling $2,150 during the life of the agreement.

title: Teacher Slain in Classroom After Quarrel With Husband
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) A 57yearold woman teacher was shot to death in front of her fifthgrade pupils today after a quarrel with her estranged husband.

title: Lincoln Center Officials Hail Community Festival
description: Lincoln Center's first Community Holiday Festival, which ended at Tully Hall last night with a Puerto Rican musical pageant entitled The Night Before Epiphany, has been accounted a success by Lincoln Center officials, and they are already considering the possibility of having more of them.

title: Bank Holding Unit Seeks SavingsLoan Association
description: In a move that will probably force the Federal Reserve to decide a controversial issue it has so far been able to avoid, West Coast bankholding company announced plans yesterday to acquire a savings and loan association.

title: QUEENS PROJECT PICKS UP SUPPORT
description: The city's controversial lowincome housing project under construction in Forest Hills was called a fait accompli yesterday by a new organization of residents from that middleclass Queens community.

title: U.S. Names a Replacement For Top Diplomat in Cairo
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The State Department announced ,today that Joseph N. Greene Jr., former minister in the United States Embassy in London, would soon replace Donald C. Bergus as the top American diplomat in Cairo.

title: Nixon Daughter on Trip
description: SUNNILAND, Fla., Jan. (AP) Mrs. David Eisenhower and Interior Secretary Rogers C. B. Morton sloughed through a halfmile of kneedeep water today as they inspected the Big Cypress Swamp, which president Nixon will ask Congress water reserve. Mrs. Eisenhower said that she had come along as an interested conservationist and as the representative of her father, Mr. Nixon.

title: Read this, please, but don't tell anyone what it says or who wrote it. If you must tell, attribute it to a former Government aide writing in a large metropolitan daily.
description: Following my address at. the University of Maine commencement ,last June, a student said to ine: Mr. Moyers, you've been in both journalism and Government; that makes every thing you say doubly hard to believe. The skepticism which she expressed toward two of our major institutions is widespread, one reason being, I am convinced, the indiscriminate use of backgrounders as the source of hard news , stories..

title: A Suhurbanite's Radio Station Tries a MiniMedia Approach
description: How small can a radio station be? Joseph Blanco thinks he has the answer to that question. He runs a fullblown radio station out of his garage that, on a good day, may have three radios on Ackertown Road in Monsey, N. Y., tuned to it.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SOVIET SHIP TOWED TO JERSEY DRYDOCK
description: The Soviet trawler s'Andreyev, holed in her starboard side in a collision with another Soviet trawler at sea last weekend, was towed from her Gravesend Bay anchorage yesterday to a Hoboken shipyard for repairs.

title: PLAN FOR STADIUM ADVANCES A STEP
description: The plan for the city to buy and renovate Yankee Stadium moved a step closer to realization yesterday as the City Planning Commission voted an urbanrenewal designation for the ball park and adjacent parking areas.

title: Bantom Leads St. Joseph's
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 5 (AP) Mike Bantom, a junior center, led a secondhalf surge that carried St. Joseph's to 7255 victory over La Salle tonight at the Palestra.

title: SIR GERALD KELLY OF ROYAL ACADEMY
description: LONDON, Jan. 5Sir Gerald Kelly, the portrait painter and former president of the Royal Academy, died at his home here last night. He was 92 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Opposition in Congress To Space Shuttle Likely
description: President Nixon's decision to support development of a space shuttle system is expected to ,stir some loud opposition in Congress  but probably not enough to sidetrack initial funding for the multibilliondollar project that is considered the key to the nation's future in space.

title: Dakota Governor Retiring
description: BISMARCK N. D., Jan. 5 (AP)William L. Guy, Governor of North Dakota, since 1961, announced today that he would not seek reelection. Mr. Guy, completing his 12th year in office, is the nation's senior Democratic Governor.

title: Ralston of Stanford Will Coach Broncos
description: John Ralston, the architect of Stanford's two successive Rose Bowl upsets, is the new coach of the Denver Broncos and the fourth college coach to graduate to the pro level in the last year.

title: Judge Acts on Cambridge
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. (AP)Superior Court Judge Frank W. Thomasello granted temporary restraining order today that put rent control back in effect in Cambridge. He said the order would be in effect until a hearing could be held, but he set no date. A vote by the City Council on Dec. 29 revoked rent controls.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Kaiser Officer Calls Purchases of Stock Proper and Normal
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 5 (UPI)A spokesman for Kaiser Resources, Ltd., conceded today that certain executives indirectly invested in a Canadian mining concern that was supposedly closed to United States investors.

title: Wisconsin Governor's Aide to Join Lindsay Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 The top aide to Gov. Patrick J. Lucey of Wisconsin is about to join Mayor Lindsay's campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: OTB MOVES FAST FOR ITS OWN GOOD
description: After playing Santa Claus with a $6,446.40 overpayment to four superfecta winners, the Offtrack Betting Corporation turned Scrooge yesterday by ordering its bank to stop the checks.

title: Books of The Times
description: GIRL, 20. By Kingsley Arnie. 253 pages. HerCourt Brace Joyanovich. $5.95.

title: Amex and Counter List Climb Strongly
Hearings on Insect Pests
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) The Agriculture Department will hold hearings next month on proposals to extend federal efforts to combat two majoi. insect pests, gypsy moths and Japanese beetles. The hearings will be held Feb. 8 in Baltimore and Feb. 15 in Memphis.

title: Clean Auto Engine by 75 Termed Possible by Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 A committee of the National Academy of Sciences has concluded that the rate of progress in developing a clean automobile engine makes it possible that the larger manufacturers can achieve the drastic reduction in pollution from their 1975 models that is required by the Clean Air Act of 1970.

title: LOSS OF KEY BASE IN LAOS IS FEARED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5United States officials said today that there was a better than 5050 chance that Communist forces would overrun the strategic Laotian base at Long Tieng in the next few weeks.

title: News of Skiing
