Victor, however, is having an affair with Jean, who is no older than his daughter, while his wife holds neighborhood action meetings on ecology and sleeps with the local novelist.Meanwhile (and "Glass Houses" is big on meanwhiles, through lots of crosscutting between simultaneous sex scenes), Victor's business partner, Ted, is having an affair with Kim, who is always thinking of Dad, which is why she arranges for herself and Ted to accidently meet Victor and Jean at a weekend encounter group.Only professional ethics prevent me from telling you what happens next, but I can report that the climax involves some quite fancy editing and juggling of realitythe sort of thing that no self-respecting porno fan would put up with for more thanwell  10 minutes. (Porno fans are the most hopeful people in the world.)"Glass Houses," however, is not pornography, and it's not really as stupid as it sounds. It is a fairly intelligent, perceptive look at a group of rather shabby people whose emotions are no deeper, nor more complex, than the movie that records them.Mr. Singer, who created something of a stir with his first film, "A Cold Wind in August," in 1961, has a certain talent for dealing seriously with characters who are not of the first interest (as he showed in the otherwise preposterous Lana Turner movie "Love Has Many Faces"). The surface reality of "Glass Houses"middle-class Los Angeles homes, with their dens and dishwashers, suburban motel rooms, air-conditioned officesgives the people a validity and interest that helps to neutralize, at least partially, the plain dumbness of their actions.The performers also are completely legitimate, especially Bernard Barrow as the father and Jennifer O'Neill ("Summer of 42," "Such Good Friends") as his lovely mistress, the sort of girl you might want to ask what she's doing in a place like this. Deirdre Lenihan plays the daughter with the kind of subtlety that I associate with movies on the order of "Plushette's Sweet Revenge."There are, further, hints of real intelligence in the script written by Mr. Singer and his wife, Judith Singer. I'm not referring to a parlor game that is introduced at one point, a sort of Monopoly spin-off in which, if I remember correctly, one player says to another: "You forgot my snipers across the street from your supermarket." That's funny in an easy, obvious way. But I think it takes real inspiration to have Miss O'Neill turn on her lover in high dudgeon, when he is embarrassed by her revealing the details of last night's sexual performances, and scream at him because of his uptightness: "That's how wars start!""Glass Houses" is not great, nor very good, but it has its wits about it. It opened yesterday at theaters around town on a double bill with "The Owl and the Pussycat."

title: HANRAHAN WINS TIME IN INDICTMENT FIGHT
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 7State's Attorney Edward V. Hanrahan won more time today in his effort to dismiss an indictment for conspiracy to obstruct justice that is pending against him.

title: Egyptian Aide Threatens Reprisal Against U.S. oil
description: CAIRO, Jan. 7Threats of Arab punitive action against United States oil companies and other, American economic and strategic interests have flared again In Egypt as a result of anger over Washington's reported decision to resume the sale of Phantom jet fighterbombers to Israel.

title: UNEMPLOYMENT UP IN MONTH TO 6,1%; JOBS ALSO CLIMB
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The nation's job situation remained essentially unchanged in December, with both employment and unemployment showing minor increases, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Timken Estimates Rise of 91c a Share in Its 71 Net
Shop Talk
description: Business wasn't too lively for David L. Pakter, a portrait painter in what he calls the Renaissance manner. A couple of years ago, while waiting for the current modernistic mishmash in art to pass, he began to think about going into design. I was looking for something innovative as well as utilitarian, he explained as he began plugging his works into electric outlets.

title: AIR FORCE SLASHING ITS STAFF IN EUROPE
description: LONDON, Jan. 7 (Reuters)The United States Air Force announced today that it was drastically reducing administrative staffs at three European bases in an effort to strengthen Its combat forces in Europe.

title: Express Trains Collide In Spain, Killing Two
description: VALLADOLID, Spain, Jan. 7 (Reuters)  Two express trains collided near here today, killing at least two persons, a railway company spokesman said tonight.

title: Members of Met Receive Silver Awards for Service
description: Silver tokens of appreciation for long service with the Metropolitan Opera were awarded yesterday to seven members of the company at a reception in the opera house.

title: Pompidou to Visit Britain
description: LONDON, Jan. 7 (Reuter)President Pompidou has accepted an invitation from Prime Minister Heath to pay an informal visit to Britain on the weekend of Feb. 1920 for talks, it was announced here today.

title: PRODUCTION OF CARS ROSE DURING WEEK
Nixon Affirms Candidacy; On New Hampshire Ballot
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 7President Nixon formally announced today that he would run for a second term to complete the work that we have begun.

title: RETAIL CHAINS LIFT SALES IN DECEMBER
description: Three more retail chains reported yesterday higher sales December and cumulative periods compared with 1970.

title: U. S. Move in Indian Ocean Is Linked to Commitments
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Pentagon officials stressed today that plans to send United States warships more frequently into the Indian Ocean were announced several years ago but that their implementation had been deferred because of the Vietnam war.

title: 4 Held in Robbery at the Pierre; $250,000 in Jewelry Recovered
description: Four men were arrested yesterday in connection with the robbery at the fashionable Pierre Hotel last Sunday of jewels and other valuables estimated to be worth $1million or more.

title: Miss Macchi Widens Cup Lead With Triumph in Giant Slalom
B. S. Pally, Comedian, 61, Dies; Was Big Jule in  Guys and Dolls
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 7 (AP) B. S. Pully, the nightclub comedian who created the role of Big Jule, the Chicago gangster, in the musical Guys and Dolls, died of a heart attack yesterday in Thomas Jefferson University Hospital here. He was 61 years old and had been staying at a Philadelphia hotel:

title: MRS. HAROLD KOENIG
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N. J., Jan. 7Mrs. Dorothy Friedman Koenig, a former vice president of the American Women's ORT, died Wednesday after a long illness. She was 43 years old, the wife of Harold Koenig, and lived at 79 Roberts Road.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As Chairman of the Commission on Independent Colleges and Universities of New York, I want to express appreciation for The Times reporting (Dec. 15) of the Plan of Action prepared for the Commission by the presidents of six of the state's largest universities, and also for your editorial (Dec. 21). I should like, however, to clarify certain key points in our plan.

title: Return of Bengali Refugees Is Gaining Momentum
description: CALCUTTA, India, Jan 7Fiftythousand gone? Excellent! Wonderful! Keep it up! shouted the refugee relief commissioner on the phone to one of his officers in charge of sprawling refugee camp on the border.

title: A Judge From Tennessee Is Chosen for Kerner Trial
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)  Chief Justice Warren E. Burger designated a Federal judge in Tennessee today to preside at the trial of Judge Otto Kerner of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on charges of taking bribes and committing other crimes when he was Governor of Illinois.

title: Powell and Rehnquist Take Seats on the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 Lewis F. Powell Jr. and William H. Rehnquist was sworn in today as Associate Justices of the Supreme Court, placing four appointees of President Nixon upon the nation's highest tribunal.

title: WILLIAM J. ADAMS
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Jan. 7William J. Adams, retired general purchasing director of the Western Electric Company, died yesterday. He was 65 years old and lived at 33 Old Pine Drive.

title: Chinese Nuclear Explosion Is Reported by the A.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI) China set off a nuclear test in the atmosphere today, the United States Atomic Energy Commission reported.

title: Union Leader Slain By Queens Gunman
description: The president of the parent union of about 20 locals was shot to death yesterday in a Queens parking lot near the State Supreme Court Building in Jamaica while scores of pedestrians and motorists were passing.

title: Services Here Mark Russian Orthodox Christmas
description: For more than three hours yesterday the Cathedral of the Holy Virgin Protection was fragrant with Incense and hundreds of flickering candles cast their reflections on holy icons as Russian Orthodox churchgoers solemnly celebrated the divine liturgy of Christmas Day.

title: Paying of Retroactive Raises Still Not Legal, Board Says
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)The Government said today that it was not yet legal to pay retroactive wage increases that Congress ordered paid more than three weeks ago.

title: Saigon Seizes 6 Papers
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan, 7 (Reuters)The police confiscated six of Saigon's Vietnameselanguage daily newspapers last night and the Information Ministry withdrew the license from a local news agency, the official Vietnamese news agency reported today.

title: This Antique Hitchcock Furniture Has Found a New HomeIn a Church
description: RIVERTON, Conn.  More than a century ago, Lambert Hitchcock went bankrupt producing stenciled furniture. But now it's such a success that a museum dedicated to the 19thcentury style will open here next summer.

title: LEWIS LANDES, 82, LAWYER, IS DEAD
description: LARCIEVIONT, N. Y., Jan. 7Lewis Landes, a retired Army colonel who had had a notable career in both world wars and as a New York and Washington lawyer, died yesterday in New Rochelle Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 1833 Palmer Avenue.

title: U.S. Rebukes India and Questions Her Neutral Role on Indochina Commission
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The State Department rebuked India today for having raised her relations with North Vietnam to the ambassadorial level and said the action cast doubt on New Delhi's neutral role on the International Control Commission in Southeast Asia.

title: Hicks Stops McNamee In 10th Round at Garden
description: Tommy Hicks, a 27yearold schoolteacher of retarded children in Ithaca, N. Y., knocked out Dennis McNamee of Pawtucket, R. I., in the 10th and final round of their lightheavyweight fight at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: LAYERS WIN BY 44, THEIR 33D IN ROW
El Hajj Malik to End Run
description: El Hajj Malik, the N. R. Davidson play, will end its Off Broadway run at the Martinique Theater after tomorrow night's performance, the 40th. The play was produced by the AfroAmerican Studio.

title: Mortar Fire Wounds 18 G.I.'s, At Base 20 Miles From Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Jan. 8 (AP)Twenty rounds of mortar fire struck United States fire support base only 20 miles northeast of Saigon last night in the heaviest shelling attack against an American force in six months.

title: Allende Swears In Censured Top Aide As Chief of Defense
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 7 (AP) President Salvador Allende Gossens today defied a congressional vote that suspended his close associate, Jose Toha Gonzalez, as Interior Minister by naming him Defense Minister instead.

title: Nixon and Sato Set Return of Okinawa To Japan May 15
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 7  President Nixon and Premier Eisaku Sato of Japan agreed today on a date for the reversion of Okinawa to Japan as their twoday meeting here closed.

title: Four States Install Hot Lines to Aid the Consumer
description: FRANKFORT, Ky.  When customers in nearby Lexington recently found fault with a carpet dealer, they did not call Ralph Nader or their lawyer, they called their own state government  on a tollfree consumer hot line.

title: Faulk Wins, Brown Bows
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 7 (AP)  Two American players gained the men's singles semifinals of the Auckland tennis championships today, but topseeded Bill Brown of Omaha lost his quarterfinal match.

title: VIVE MME. NIXON! ECHOES IN ABIDJAN
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Jan. 7This steamy West African country gave Mrs. Richard M. Nixon a rousing welcome today.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In the clatter of pins that is always there, as if were pipedin stereo music, Ernie Schlegel, who once bowled two perfect games in one day, walked quickly behind the polished lanes of the Madison Square Garden Bowling Center.

title: Antiques: A Milestone for a Magazine
description: The magazine Antiques is celebrating its 50th anniversary this year, and anyone involved in the field can tell you that is no mean achievement.

title: Avery's Mastery in Paintings on Paper
description: The Milton Avery exhibition that opened this week at the Grace Borgenicht GalJery, 1018 Madison Avenue at 79th Street, consists of some 30 paintings on paper oils, watercolors and monotypes. It is a remarkable show. For many of these works on paper have the strengththe absolute purity of form and expressionwe usually think of as the special quality of Avery's larger works on canvas. Avery often based his larger works on these smaller pictures first executed on paper, yet there is nothing tentative or unfinished about them. Each is a carefully conceived, wholly realized work of art in its own right.

title: Chicago's Blacks. Score Amid Lagging Economy
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 7A sign in the window of the blackowned Independence Bank in Chicago's largest black shopping district hailed the green power that could be had through savings.

title: Art: Bestiary Show Full of Delight
description: Bestiary, a new exhibition at Cordier & Ekstrom, 980 Madison Avenue at 76th Street, includes a Bambara fetish built of blood and mud, a glorious sixthcentury B.C. Etruscan sphinx, a Dubuffet cow, a Yorubawhat shall we call it, a Yoruba sculpture?that superimposes a human mask on a turtle shell, a Max Ernst fantasy, a Noguchi Strange Bird in green slate, a screaming tiger by Richard Lindner, a fat tiger by Morris Hirshfield, a set of four anonymous 17thcentury Italian paintings in which common animals in strange guises perform human feats, and enough other paintings and sculptures from ancient to immediately contemporary sources to acid up to 23, plus one natural object, a narwhal tusk, to remind of the unicorn.

title: Sought Own True Voice
description: Writing about two first books of poetry, John Berryman once remarked that the achievement of young poets, except for a major talent that announced itself unmistakably, is likely to depend on the vigor of the convention in which they were working.

title: On the Matter of Amnesty
description: WASHINGTONAt the present time, there are more than 500 draft resisters in Federal jails, about 3,900 draft resisters under indictment, and an estimated 70,000 young Americans living abroad to avoid the draft. Many of these men are victims of bad judgment and poor advice. Many have acted out of deep, personal convictions against the course which our country followed in the Vietnam conflict.

title: Text of Letter Describing Bank Bombs
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Jan. 7 (AP)Following is the text of a special delivery letter received yesterday from Chicago by The Berkeley Tribe, an underground newspaper. The text was supplied to The Associated Press by radio station KFPAFM in Berkeley. Dashes mean the numbers of the keys were not filled in by the letter writer:

title: Notes on People
description: Vice Adm. William P. Mack, commander of the United States Seventh Fleet in the Pacific since last June, will take over next summer as the 46th superintendent of the Naval Academy at Annapolis, his alma mater.

title: Soviet Official to Open Art Show in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The only woman in the Soviet hierarchy will come to the United States to open a Soviet exhibition of ancient and cantemporary art in Washington next Wednesday.

title: PENTAGON FACING CUTS IN STRENGTH
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The Pentagon said today that it must reduce its military manpower by 114,000 more servicemen and its civilian payroll by 41,000 more employes than it expected several months ago. This would bring the armed forces down to their lowest levels since before the beginning of the Korean War in 1950.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Having been associated with the Indian subcontinent for over forty years, and having spent most of November and early December in India, I venture a. comment on the recent conflict between India and Pakistan, and on the possibility of peaceful development in the future.

title: Congressmen in Europe, But Not Just to Listen
description: PARIS, Jan. 7It's sometimes pointed out in the corridors of Congress that the Ways and Means Committee once took a tripto Baltimore.

title: Article 1 No Title
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 7 (Reuters) At least 200 persons are feared believed to be dead as the result of a series of explosions yesterday at an ammunition dump left behind by the Pakistan army in the East Bengal town of Dinajpur, the Press Trust of India reported from Dacca.

title: 3 Die in Karachi Jail Riot
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Jan. 7 Three persons were killed when the police opened fire on rioting prisoners in Karachi's general jail today. Between 150 and 200 prisoners of the jail's population of more than 1,300 escaped in the confusion.

title: Apollo 16 Delayed to April 16 By Defect in Separating Device
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The National Aeronautics and Space Administration announced today a onemonth delay in the launching of the Apollo 16 manned flight to the moon.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A nursing home employes union reached agreement with the Guild of New York Nursing Homes on a new contract yesterday evening after a oneday walkout at three private nursing facilities with 600 patients.

title: PRIME RATE REDUCED BY BANK OF AMERICA
description: The Bank of America, exhibiting reluctance, cut its prime lending rate yesterday to 5 per cent from. 5 per cent, matching cuts made by most other major banks in the last week. It also decided not to trim rates paid on consumer savings.

title: Mothers Carry Women's Lib Message to Grade School
description: Women's lib has begun to show up in the elementary grades.

title: BULLETS TOP BULLS FOR FOURTH IN ROW
AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Jan. 7On B.B.C. television the other night, eight Irish politicians talked for three hours about the troubles in Northern Ireland. Each made his own case and then answered questions put by three British establishment figures. In this hardly dynamic format not a voice was raised in anger, not a fist brandished. It was all very earnest.

title: Police Remove Bombs From SafeDeposit Boxes in Three Banks Here
description: Alerted by letters from political radicals, the police moved early yesterday to defuse time bombs planted in safedeposit boxes at three Wall Street banks and six others in Chicago and San Francisco.

title: U.M.W. MUST PAY FUND $11.5MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7A Federal judge today ordered the National Bank of Washington, the United Mine Workers of America and two of its officers to pay $11.5million in damages to the union's pension fund for misusing miners money.

title: Soviet Jewish Family Welcomed by Mitchell
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)  Attorney General John N. Mitchell today welcomed the first Soviet Jews to be admitted to the United States under an expedited immigration policy. The newcomers are a factory worker and his family.

title: SICKIN TIES UP BROOKLYN BUSES; 1,000 STAY OUT
description: Bus service in much of Brooklyn was crippled yesterday by a wildcat strike of more than 1,000 transit workers who called in sick to protest terms of their new wage contract.

title: Albany to Extend School Board's Term
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7, New York City's interim Board of Education will probably have its life extended for another year by the current session of the Legislature, Senator Thomas Laverne, chairman, of the Senate Education Committee, said today.

title: GRAVEL LOSES BID TO LIMIT INQUIRY
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7An attempt by Senator Mike Gravel to limit the scope of a Federal grand jury investigation into the release and publication of the Pentagon papers was turned down today by the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit.

title: Mrs. Linda Childs Pearson Is Wed
description: Mrs. Linda Childs Pearson, daughter of Mrs. Starling Winston Childs Jr. of New York and Norfolk, Conn., and the late Mr. Childs, was married in Sydney, Australia, yesterday to Peter Brock Quinnell, son of Mr. and Mrs. A. H. Quinnell of Sydney. The Presbyterian ceremony in the H.M.A.S Watson Memorial Chapel was performed by the Rev. Malcolm A. Spence, an Australian Navy chaplain.

title: Executive Changes
description: Milton R. Stolll has been named by Dynamics Corporation of America as president of its Waring Products division, New Hartford, Conn.

title: Dynasciences Chairman And President Quits Post
description: The Dynasciences Corporation announced last night the resignation, effective Jan. 31, of William Duke as chairman and president. He was succeeded by Stanley K. Weissberg, a director, as president and chief executive officer. Harry S. Derbyshire; senior vice president of the Whittaker Corporation was named Dynasciences chairman.

title: Fillmore Society Lauds Whatsisname
description: Glasses aloft and tongue in cheek, the Millard Fill Birthday Party. Society disported itself yesterday at its seventhannual Dutch treat luncheon to salute the President with the leastest.

title: Dakar to Keep Lepers Out
description: DAKAR, Sengal, Jan. 8 (Agence FrancePresse)Lepers and beggars are to be cleared from Dakar streets so as not to shock tourists, Sengal's Information Minister, Ousmane Camara, has said. Speaking at a news conference this week, he reported that President Leopold Sedar Senghor had ordered that an efective solution to rid Dakar of the scourge should be found as soon as possible. Mr. Camara added that lepers would be made to stay in one of the country's many leper hospitals.

title: Airliner Crash in Mexico Kills 23
description: BACALAR, Mexico, Jan. 7 (UPI)All 23 persons aboard a Mexican DC6 airliner perished when it crashed in the the jungle of Yucatan peninsula about 10 miles northwest of here, police officials said today. Bacalar is in southeast Mexico.

title: STATE EXPLAINS AUTO TAX REFUND
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7 Norman F. Gallman, president of the State Tax Commission, today outlined the procedures whereby persons who purchased new automobiles since Aug. 16 or lightduty trucks since Sept. 23 could obtain refunds of the sales taxes collected on top of the Federal excise tax part of the price of the vehicles.

title: GOLF LEAD SHARED BY CURTIS SIFFORD
Hopes Rise for New BritainMalta Talks
description: LONDON, Jan. 7  There were strong signs here tonight that Britain was prepared to resume negotiations with Malta about her base on the Mediterranean island.

title: MACBETH IS VOTED BEST FILM BY BOARD
description: Roman Polanski's Macbeth has been chosen as the best motion picture of 1971 by the Committee on Exceptional Films of the National Board of Review of Motion Pictures, the public organization that inaugurated the practice 52 years ago of annually selecting the year's 10 best films.

title: Worldwide Increase In Smoking Found By Health Service
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI) People throughout the world smoked more last year, the United States Public Health Service said today.

title: SmallClaims Court Opens in Harlem
description: A new kind of Small Claims Court held Its first session yesterday.

title: Karsh's Camera Aims at Person Behind Face
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 7  Of all the performers Yousuf Karsh has photographed, the most natural was Joan Baez. Meeting him after an exhausting day of student upheaval at Stanford University, the folk singer requested and was granted time for a nap before having her picture taken by Karsh of Ottawa.

title: GOLD IN EUROPE TRADING AT PEAK
description: PARIS, Jan. 7Gold, traded like a commodity though still regarded as a store of value for the monetary system, is going through the roof in the European financial centers.

title: PRICE UNIT URGED TO BAR FARE RISE
description: Representative Ogden Reid, Republican of Westchester County, urged the Interstate Commerce Commission and the Federal Price Commission yesterday to reject a proposed 20 per cent acrosstheboard fare increase on the Penn Central's New Haven Division.

title: News Analysis
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Jan. 7 When former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy of Minnesota announced that he would not enter the Democratic Presidential primary here, where his candidacy four years ago altered the course of national politics, he said New Hampshire was different this year. He went on to explain that difference in terms of issues and personalities. But, it is becoming increasingly clear to those involved in the nation's first Presidential primary that there is another differencethere is a new New Hampshire this year.

title: MISS GOOLAGONG GAINS NET FINAL
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 7 (AP)Evonne Goolagong, the Wimbledon champion, defeated Pat Coleman, also of Australia, 7.5, 60, in a semifinal match tonight at the New South Wales tennis championships.

title: RHYTHM SUCCEEDS AT RAINBOW GRILL
description: The rhythm section that is now playing at the Rainbow Grill is one of the most fascin ating groups of its kind that can be heard anywhere. It is, for the most part, a Miles Davis, alumni association.

title: Teresa Stratas Withdraws From Melisande at Met
description: Teresa Stratas has withdrawn from the role of Melisande in the new production of Debussy's Pelleas et lalisande, which the Metropolitan Operal will present for the first time on Jan. 19. She will be replaced by Judith Blegen.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am repeatedly astounded by the superficial knowledge bordering on igporance of writers on farm subjects in the urban press, The Times not excepted. Why don't they tell it like it is?

title: Economic Suicide on the Docks
description: The new longshore wage agreement in New York and other North Atlantic ports represents a suicidal employer surrender to overwhelming union power.

title: SHAH OF IRAN IS DUE IN PAKISTAN TODAY
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 7The Government announced tonight that the Shah of Iran would arrive here tomorrow for a day of talks on the situation in the subcontinent.

title: Typhoon Hits Philippines
description: MANILA, Saturday, Jan. 8 (AP)  Typhoon Kit roared across the Central Philippines today, causing flash floods that washed away homes and disrupted communications. Red Cross officials said there were no immediate reports of deaths or injuries.

title: 33 Concerns Pledge 2% Price Rise Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Thirtythree of the nation's biggest corporations have promised the Price Commission that they will hold their average price increases to 2 per cent or less during the next 12 months, commission sources disclosed today.

title: BOBBINS TRIUMPHS IN PABST CUP SKI
A Second Textiles Accord Signed by U.S. and Korea
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) The State Department said today South Korea had signed an agreement with the United States, restricting cottontextile exports to this country until Sept. 30, 1975, and setting a 5 per cent annual growth rate.

title: 8 Children Sponsor Fair To Aid the Neediest Fund
2d Death in Buffalo Blast
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 7 (UPI)The explosion and fire at the Pillsbury Company flour mill on this city's waterfront Sunday claimed its second life today. Casimer Regdos, 50 years old, of Buffalo died at Buffalo General Hospital. Mr. Regdos was hospitalized since the explosion with secondand thirddegree burns over more than half of his body. His brother, John, 56, of suburban Elma, was killed in the explosion.

title: DR. EMMA P. CARR, 91, CHEMIST AT HOLYOKE
description: SOUTH HADLEY, Mass., Jan. 7 (AP)Dr. Emma Perry Carr, professor emeritus and head of the chemistry department at Mount Holyoke College from 1913 to 1946, died today in Evanston, Ill., where she had been living in retirement. She was 91 years old.

title: Russo Wed in Coast Church, Then Joins Ellsberg on Dais
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Jan. 7Anthony J. Russo Jr., who is under indictment with Dr. Daniel Ellsberg on charges of divulging the Pentagon Papers, was married here tonight under bizarre circumstances.

title: HARRISBURG 8 LOSE A WIRETAP APPEAL
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 7 (UPI)An appeals court dismissed yesterday legal proceedings against United States District Judge R. Dixon Herman, removing an obstacle to the trial of eight persons charged with a kidnapping conspiracy involving Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on national security matters.

title: Dr. Henry B. Parkes Dies at 67; Historian Led N.Y. U. Division
description: Dr. Henry Bamford Parkes, author, professor of history at New York University and chairman from 1944 to 1968 of its graduate division of American civilization, died yesterday of cancer at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 67 years old and lived at 210 East 15th Street.

title: GALLO NEPHEW HELD ON A DRUG CHARGE
description: A nephew of Joseph Gallo was charged yesterday with possession and distribution of a small quantity of cocaine to an undercover agent of the New York Joint Task Force.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE EAST INDIA COMPANY. By Brian Gardner. 319 pages. McCall. $8.95.

title: Test Pilot Dies in Plunge
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 7 (Reuters)A pilot testing an experimental aircraft that went out of control tried to parachute to safety yesterday but was hit and killed by his own plane as it plunged toward the sea. Coast Guard officials said that John Cook, 35 years old, president of the Cook Aircraft Corporation, bailed out of his aircraft at 3,000 feet and was struck by the wrng of the spinning craft.

title: SURVEY ASSESSES INVESTING TREND
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The impact of the severe tight money period of 196970 on business investment was remarkably small, a Government study concluded today.

title: ONE POLICY SLIP LEADS TO OTHERS
description: Everett Fredericks's officially registered Numbers Gambling Company, of 529 West 145th Street in Manhattan, may soon be out of business.

title: Investment in the Future
description: President Nixon has made a wise decision in authorizing the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to proceed with development of the space shuttle., We recognize that many will consider it another grave distoition of national priorities to divert scarce Federal funds to such a venture when so much remains undone meeting the needs of the cities, the environment and the poor. Yet we are convinced that the necessary money can easily be taken from the defense budget without blocking action on revenue sharing, welfare reform and other neglected social programs.

title: Author to Enter Primary
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 7 (AP) Bernard M. Bane of Cambridge announced today that he would be a Democratic candidate for the Presidential nomination in the state's primary. Mr. Bane, author of The Bane in Kennedy's Existence, said that he would run on platform of restoring authenticity to the United States Constitution.

title: Beatrice Sets Acquisition
description: Beatrice Foods Company said yesterday it had completed the acquisition of Peter Eckrich & Sons, Inc. The terms called for Beatrice Foods to issue about 1.9 million shares having market value in excess of $8million. The Eckrich will operate as a subsidiary of Beatrice.

title: Official of Common Cause Will Join Bar Association
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 7  Lowell R. Beck is resigning as executive director of Common Cause, a national citizens lobby, to become associate executive director of the American Bar Association, it was announced today.

title: MRS. NATHAN SCULMAN
description: Mrs. Beatrice Stern Schulman, a founder of Albert Einstein College of Medicine and an active supporter of many charities, died yesterday at Polyclinic Hospital after a brief illness. She was 75 years old and lived at 145 Central Park West.

title: Columbia Five Plus One Is Just About All That's Left
description: Columbia College's varsity basketball team had only six healthy players in uniformfive starters and a substitutewhen it opened its Ivy League season against Brown in Providence last night.

title: Nixon Aides Prepare the Way in China
description: PEKING, Jan. 7 Members of the White House advance party rehearsed procedure for President Nixon's arrival with their Chinese hosts at the air port here today. They then boarded a Sovietbuilt aircraft for the flight south to Shanghai, another stop on the President's itinerary.

title: SavingsBank Money Orders Are Free
description: The East New York Savings Bank has begun recently to offer and promote a new moneyorder service that provides its depositors with what amounts to a free checking account while they continue to earn 5 per cent interest on daytoday basis.

title: Double Fault at the U.N.
description: Secretary General Kurt Waldheim may have felt that courtesy toward his predecessor or solidarity among United Nations officialdom reqUired him to uphold the recent ouster of correspondents from Nationalist China. If so, this constitutes a deplorable victory of protocol over sound policy. It is a missed opportunity to correct a wrong and dangerous ruling.

title: SCRIBNER NAMES NEW RESEARCHER
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner removed the acting director of the school system's bureau of educational research yesterday, a day after the Chancellor criticized a bureau report as sloppy workmanship.

title: SOL D. LEVINE
description: Sol D. Levine, founder of the Sanco Equipment Company, Manhattan concern providing hotel and institutional supplies, died on Wednesday at St. Joseph's Hospital, Far Rockaway, Queens, after a long illness. Mr. Levine, who was 78, lived at 4 Iris Street, Cedarhurst, L. I.

title: Illinoisan, 32, Gets Heart In Transplant at Stanford
description: STANFORD, Calif., Jan. 7 (AP)  a 32yearold Illinois man received a new heart today in a transplant operation at the Stanford University Medical Center.

title: Doctor Called Prime Suspect in Death of Assistant
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office said yesterday that a grand jury investigation into the death of a 30yearold medical assistant, Gail Richards, involves... a homicide and that the prime suspect was Dr. Geoffrey Richstone, her employer and frequent companion.

title: Ogust Heads 365 Enthusiasts Sailing Today for Caribbean
Denmark Cuts Bank Rate
description: COPENHAGEN, Jan. 7 (Reuters)Denmark today reduced its bank rate by onehalf per centto 7 from 7 per centit was officially announced. The new rate will be effective from Monday, according to an announcement by the Central Bank.

title: ROBERT J. C. MOORE
description: Robert J. C. Moore, a retired New York lawyer who was past Grand Representative of the New York State Masonic Order, died Thursday in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 75 years old and also lived in Great Neck, L. I.

title: NEW DELHI. RAISES HANOI TIES LEVEL
description: NEW DELHI, Jan, 7India and North Vietnam upgraded their diplomatic missions from consular to ambassadorial level today, signaling a further deterioration in relations between the United States and India.

title: American in Soviet: Have a Soybean
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7Have a soybean, a United States Congressman said today, extending a glass of the roasted and flavored beans to Soviet officials as he made the rounds of Government offices to drum up trade.

title: GENERAL REPORTS CAMBODIAN MOVE
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, Jan. 7The commander of Saigon's forces in the Central Highlands disclosed today that about 1,800 of his troops landed in northeastern Cambodia this morning, In the fourth operation the South Vietnamese Army has conducted just across the border in the last two months.

title: CHADBOURN TO SELL A GERMAN INTEREST
description: Chadbourn, Inc., announced yesterday that it had reached an agreement with a group of European investors to buy its approximate 81 per cent interest in HudsonTextilwerke, G.m.b.H., Stuttgart, West Germany, for more than $13million in cash.

title: 89,000 U.S. BRIDGES FOUND DEFICIENT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) In the first step of a program to replace dangerous highway bridges, the Federal Government has found nearly onesixth of the nation's bridges critically deficient.

title: Opel Plant to Close for Week
description: RUSSELSHEIM, West Germany, Jan. 7 (UPI)A shortage of domestic orders is forcing Opel, the West German auto manufacturer owned by the General Motors Corporation, to shut down, one of its three factories for the week from Jan. 24 to 28, the company said today.

title: Equity to Stage Revue
description: One for the Money, a compilation of highlights from three Nancy HamiltonMorgan Lewis revues of the late 1930's and 1940's, will be presented by the Equity Library Theater next Thursday at its playhouse on 103d Street at Riverside Drive.

title: Support for Humphrey By R. W. APPLE Jr.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 With the first primary in New Hampshire two months away, the Democratic Presidential contenders continued their propaganda war today. The main weapon: Endorsements.

title: Earle Gregory, 74, Winner Of Medal of Honor, Dead
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Jan. (AF)Earle Gregory, who won the Medal of Honor in World War I for capturing 22 enemy soldiers, died yesterday in Veterans hospital here. He was 74 years old.

title: 20 Raised to Police Captain
description: Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy promoted 20 police lieutenants to the rank of captain yesterday in a brief ceremony at the Police Academy, 235 East 20th Street. The new captains passed competitive Civil Service examinations and won promotion by performing in a superior manner on the job, according to Mr. Murphy.

title: All 104 on Iberia Jet Die In Island Crash Off Spain
description: MADRID, Jan. 7An Iberia Airlines jet crashed into a hill on the Mediterranean island of Ibiza today, killing all 104 persons aboard.

title: L.I. Tax Collector Is Left Speechless, But Not Penniless;Sprcial to The New York Times
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., Jan. 7 Citing rising state, county, town and city taxes and the increase in tolls by the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority, Leslie Katz, a 28yearold, freelance commercial photographer today paid his halfyearly real estate, water and sewer tax bill at City Hall with 43,910 pennies.

title: Suicide Italian Style
description: If, as is frequently claimed in appeals for financial and other assistance, the beauty of Italy belongs to the world, then it may be time for those concerned in preserving it, both in Italy and abroad, to establish some supranational authority to prevent the sort of devastation being wreaked on this patrimony of ours by a threefold vandalism, sometimes interacting, sometimes conflicting: negligence, pollution and a bureaucratic selfobsession to which the Italian Fine Arts Authority itself is by no means immune.

title: EXAIDE OF J. D. L. ORDERED DEPORTED
description: Abraham Hershkovitz, a former office manager of the Jewish Defense League, pleaded guilty yesterday to conspiring to bomb the Soviet Union's trade agency here last April and was ordered deported to Israel.

title: Boston O.E.O. Dispute Ends
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7 (AP)Five neighborhood action agencies reopened today after they resolved a disagreement with the Federal Office of Economic Opportunity over accounting procedures.

title: States Aides Decry Food Stamp Shift
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 7In a unanimous report, representatives of 15 Governors and Mayor Lindsay urged today the immediate suspension of new Federal food stamp regulations that they said would seriously harm poor people and create intolerable administrative burdens for their states.

title: MRS. LOUIS DIAMOND
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Jan. 7Mrs. Rose Koonkes Diamond; a member of the advisory board of the Elizabeth Iron Works, Inc. died today in St. Elizabeth's Hospital after a long illness. She was 90 years old and lived at 742 Eaton Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The year ending 1971 marks the first time In this century that the United States imported more than it exported. This factor has contributed substantially to our balanceofpayments deficit and, in turn, has exacerbated the international monetary crisis.

title: 68'S BY MISS MILLER, MRS. HAGGE SET PACE
Florida Scenes by Heade, OnceForgotten, on View
description: Martin Johnson Heade, now recognized as one of the classic figures of 19thcentury American painting, was once a forgotten artist. Twentyfive years ago his name was a footnote in the standard texts and his paintings were lost or scattered. The recent revival of American 19thcentury art has restored his work to a position of some consequence. Some scholars even mention his name in the same breath with Ryder and Church.

title: General Sales Taxes Held Top State Revenue Raisers
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 7 (AP)Sales taxes continued to lead all other state taxes in raising revenue in 1971, Commerce Clearing House, an organization that reports on state legislatures, tax and business laws, said today.

title: Agriculture Urea Price To Be Raised by Olin Corp.
description: The agricultural division of the Olin Corporation said yesterday that it would increase the price of agricultural urea by $3 a ton on Jan. 17.

title: The Talk of Malta
description: VALLETTA, Malta, Jan. 7 Royal Navy helicoptets dangling heavy bundles have been busy over this island in the last few days. Royal Air Force transport planes have been sitting at Luqa Airport and hundreds of families of British military personnel have been packing amid arguments over what to sell off and what to leave behind. On the old battlements of Valletta small knots of Maltese have been standing day after day, staring glumly at the British cruiser Blake lying 200 feet below in the Grand Harbour.

title: Newark Policeman Slain
description: NEWARK, Saturday, Jan. (AP)A Newark patrolman, Morris Dublinsky, was shot and killed early today at the Ivy Hill Park Apartments, a police spokesman said. Police Inspector Charles Smith said the shooting occurred about 12:30 A.M. at the apartments, at 5 Manor Drive.

title: The Meaning of Malta
description: Malta's strategic importance in current world politics can be simply stated: its naval and air bases are valuable but not absolutely essential for Britain and NATO; but if those facilities were taken over by the Soviet Union, the balance of power in the Mediterranean would be drastically altered.

title: Wallace Sets Election Date
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.. Jan. 7 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace today set April 4 for a special election to fill the unexpired term of Representative George Andrews, Democrat of Alabama. who died Christmas Day. Mr. Wallace said that he hoped the State Democratic Executive Committee would nominate Mr. Andrews's widow for the post. Mrs. Andrews has said she would like to fill out the remaining year, but would not seek a full term.

title: Hewitt Reaches Final
description: CAPETOWN, South Africa, Jan. 7 (AP)Topseeded Bob Hewitt of South Africa and Francois Jauffret of France won semifinal matches today in the Sugar tennis tournament.

title: HENRY L. BUNIN
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 7Henry L. Bunin, president of the Lucinor Realty Corporation and the Bunwin Realty Corporation and an officer of several] other New York real estate concerns, died of a heart attack in St. Francis Hospital yesterday. He was in his late 70's and lived at 685 West End Avenue in New York.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 7For stereophonic addicts, who are all interested in the spatial aspects of music, the latest thing is quadrisonicsmeaning four loudspeakers arranged around the room. The difficulty has been in supplying the four distinct sounds. Now a bassoonist has invented a system that gets all four from the two tracks provided by today's equipment. Peter Scheiber of Peekskill, N. Y., a bachelor of arts in music from Oberlin College, was granted Patent 3,632,886 this week for what he calls the matrixing approach to quadrisonics. He has given an exclusive license to ElectroVoice, a subsidiary of Gulton Industries, Inc.

title: Avon Chief Executive Relinquishes Post
description: A sudden but obviously longplanned shift on the executive chessboard of Avon Products, Inc., was announced yesterday.

title: 993 TOP OFFICERS GOT DEFENSE JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) The military's close relationI ship with the defense industry is underscored in a new Pentagon survey identifying highranking officers who obtain top jobs with key defense contractors.

title: Flight Suspension Is Lifted On Navy's H46 Helicopters
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (Reuters)The Navy has cleared its fleet of 430 H46 helicopters for flight operations after they were grounded because of three fatal crashes.

title: Arab Communists Largest Parley Opens in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan, 7The largest Arab Communist gathering ever held opened here today in the tradition of of party congresses staged in Communist countries.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE ROSE FROM 71 LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage during the week ended Jan. I were above the volume in the corresponding 1970 week.

title: Idled Plants Mirror VW Woes
description: BONN, Jan. 7]Idle workers and stalled assembly lines at six major. Volkswagen plants mirrored the unresolved malaise of West Germany's automotive giant and largest exporter this week.

title: Swimming Course For the Handicapped
description: STONY BROOK, L. I.The State University is providing weekly swimming classes here for physically handicapped and mentally disturbed children.

title: He's Royal, $5.60, Captures Dash at Narragansett Park
description: PAWTUCKET, R. I., Jan. 8 (AP)He's Royal scored his fourth consecutive victory today, winning the $15,000 Stormy Weather Handicap before 12,596 fans at Narragansett Park.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  There has never been much doubt about the sympathies of the Nixon Administration as it watched Pakistan bloodily dismember herself and India Move in to help strip the corpse. The Administration was partial to Pakistan. The question, for a year, has been not whether Washington was evenhanded but whether it was levelheaded.

title: ValueAdded TaxWhat's the Value?
description: WASHINGTON  This could be the year that the valueadded tax comes to the United States  at least as a political issue.

title: Stand Tall
description: Mutual fund shareholders, often maligned and often neglected, can now stand tall. They are the most distinctive of investors. The New York Stock Exchange says so.

title: A Queens Neighborhood Assails Its Fire Protection as Inadequate
description: Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery is playing Russian roulette with the lives of the people in southeast Queens.

title: Point of View
description: WASHINGTON  When George Washington dispatched mounted Federal marshals in 1790 to take the first census, it was the only way to find out that there were  not counting untaxed Indians  3,929,214 Americans.

title: BENJAMIN SCHWARTZ
description: Benjamin Schwartz, who founded the Institute of Scrap Iron and Steel in 1928 and served as its director general for 10 years, died on Friday in Bellevue Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 287 Avenue C in Manhattan.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: The other day a young man who had just graduated from college told me that he wanted no part of American business. When I asked him why, his answer was that the corporate world drains all the humanity out of you.

title: Kristin C. Landsteiner Is Wed To Roger Theodore Servison
description: BARRINGTON, R. L, Jan. it  In St. John's Episcopal Church here this afternoon, Miss Kristin Carpenter Landstainer was married to Roger Theodore Servison by the Rev. W. Owings Stone.

title: Commodity Exchanges Expect Record Trading
description: Having closed 1971 with recordbreaking trading volume, the major commodity exchanges are looking forward to an even better year in 1972.

title: Edmonton Bids for Games
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 8 (AP)The City of Edmonton was selected today as Canada's nomination to hold the 1978 British Commonwealth Games.

title: Books for Handicapped
description: Direct library service to the handicapped has been initiated this month in Nassau County, where the county library system, in cooperation with various public and private agencies, is providing homebound or handicapped patrons with mail or delivery service of books and periodicals.

title: Religion
description: The church  Catholic and Protestant  has long wrestled with the problem of how to live with Caesar and Mammon. Last week there were two developments that indicated that the problem is far from a solution.

title: HOUSE EXPLODES, 26 HURT IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 8  A woman telephone caller lured British troops today to a boobytrapped house in East Belfast. An explosion while the soldiers were inside destroyed the house and showered rubble and masonry across the narrow slum street in an isolated Roman Catholic enclave.

title: Strike Decline in 1971 Laid To Freeze and Rate of Idle
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8. (UPI)  The Labor Department said Thursday that strike activity declined in 1971, mainly because of President Nixon's 90day wageprice freeze.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Hails the Release of Mujib
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 8  Prime Minister Indira Gandhi tonight called the release of Sheik Mujibur Rahman after more than nine months of detention in West Pakistan a triumph for the people of Bangladesh, India and world opinion.

title: U.S. CHURCHGOING 40% IN 71 IN POLL
description: Churchgoing in the United States in 1971 continued a 13year generally downward trend, with 40 per cent of adults of all faiths attending a place of worship in a typical week, the Gallup Poll reports.

title: R.E.I.T. Rating
description: Representatives of the real estate investment trust industry and security analysts who follow the field did some sparring last week on the subject of analizing trust shares.

title: Six Ski Schools In the Northeast A Rundown
description: DANBY, Vt.My wife, a nativeborn Vermonter who is past 50 and has never been on skis, is finally ready to give it a whirl this winter. She has been hearing about the Graduated Length Method, better known as GLM, and has almost convinced herself that she will be carving stylish turns in the Alps by spring. Her attitude comes as a revelation because although she has always had a home in Vermont and our place is ringed by seven ski areas, she has never, as I've said, slid down a slopenot with skis and poles, anyway.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Easier Antitrust Policy Seen
description: WASHINGTONThere are indications that the Nixon Administration is preparing to propose, as major components of its program to improve the competitive position of American business, at least two changes in antitrust policy to which advocates of strict antitrust enforcement would certainly object.

title: CHECK IS STARTED IN 8 BOMB CASES
description: Eight time bombs found in bank safedeposit boxes in New York, Chicago and San Francis co Friday, bank lease records and handwritten letters that alerted authorities were sent to Washington for analysis by the Federal Bureau of Investigation yesterday as a nationwide manhunt began for Christopher Charles Mohr.

title: Sensitive Music 2d in Tropical Race Before 12,357
description: MIAMI, Jan. 8As is so often the case in horse racing, them that has gets more.

title: Lynn Hunter Gamble Is a Bride
description: GREENVILLE, Del., Jan.  Miss Lynn Hunter Gamble, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Millard Gobert Gamble 3d of Wilmington, wat married here this afternoon to Richard Asbury Burke Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Burke of Newark.

title: BEAME SEEKS LAW ON SCHOOL PACTS
description: The campaign to publicize contracts with city consultants will be expanded to the city's schools, Controller Abraham D. Beame said yesterday.

title: Blind Brooklyn Lawyer Wins 10Year Fight for $197 Tax Refund After I.R.S. Tried to Collect 166,137
description: A blind 64yearold lawyer from Brooklyn has won an incometax refund of $197 at the end of a long legal battle that began with the Federal Government trying to collect $166,137 from him.burden of proving that their deposits did not represent unreported income.

title: Music: Jullliard Focus
description: The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Centernobody should be required to type this more than once, so let's refer to it as CMSLCoffered a program at Tully Hall on Friday night that was built around the Julliard String Quartet. Several regulars of CMSLC joined in, but this really was the Juilliard's evening. On the program were Haydn's G major Quartet (Op. 77, No. 1), Kuhlau's Plano Quartet in G minor, and Schoenberg's Verklarte Nacht in its original form as a string sextet.

title: Future Social Events
description: One Man in His Time

title: IRWIN, KANDI M'COY VICTORS IN SLALOMS
description: MANCHESTER, Vt., Jan. 8The first CanAm slalom of the season proved to be a winning one today at Big Bromley for 17 year old Dave Irwin of Thunder Bay, Ontario and 19yearold Kandi McCoy of Mamoth Mountain, Calif.

title: Art
description: DESPITE massive evidence to the contrary a vast and significant literature, in fact the notion persists that painters (and visual artists generally) are, when it comes to expressing their ideas and intentions in writing, a helpless, hopeless lot. Certain artists have abetted this notion by affecting a kind of inspired:,so they seem to thinkinarticulateness. Not so many years ago it was Considered the mark of a real heman painter in New York that he not be able to utter a single coherent sentence about what he was up to in his work. It was the era in which museum and university audiences learned to squirm patiently as artists of this persuasion made a (usually lengthy) public display of their inability to speak. (Oddly enough, remarkably few showed any inclination to decline these invitations to be inarticulate in public.) Then, toowhy deny it?some artists are just plain dumb. But there exists, all the same, a rich literature of artists writings, and it now looks as if the publishers are at last showing a real deter

title: Suffolk Copter Patrol Is Full of Surprises
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I. Whether it's a numbersrunning pigeon or keeping an eye peeled for poachers, policemen flying helicopter patrols of Long Island have learned to brace themselves for just about anything.

title: ALFRED GEHRI
description: MORGES, Switzerland, Jan. 8 (Reuters)  Alfred Gehri, French language playwright, died today. He was 76 years old.

title: 11 DOCTORS OUSTED BY MEDICAL GROUP
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 8  Eleven physicians have been suspended from membership in the Oregon Medical Association for failure to keep up with the association's educational requirements.

title: MEDICAID AUDITS CITED BY THE CITY
description: Health Department audits caused reductions in Medicaid bills and restitution of payments already made that amounted to $1.6million last year, Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, first deputy health commissioner, estimated yesterday.

title: There Are Still Some Hurdles for Chi
description: CLAREMONT, Calif.  In 1969, when she became the world's fastest woman runner, Chi Cheng lost only two races. In 1970, when she broke or equaled seven world records, she was unbeaten until injured in December. In 1971, after 12 races in April and May, she disappeared from track and field and hasn't raced since.

title: Bonuses Rise Through Loopholes
description: Some executive bonuses are moving up sharply this year despite detailed Pay Board regulations designed to limit such payments.

title: Bengalis Plan Nationalization
description: DACCA, Jan. 8 (Reuters)  the Bengali government will nationalize banking, insurance, foreign trade and basic industries, its acting president, Syed Nazrul Islam, announced in Dacca yesterday.

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Town Likely to Get V.A. Hospital Land
description: WASHINGTON  Barring an unforeseen hitch, the Town of Huntington stands to pick up more than 92 acres of prime wooded and rolling land in Northport, L. I., from the Federal Government for nothing.

title: Et Al.
description: Apparently there's a steady market for competently written narratives of U.S. battles. This one is about Andrew Jackson and the Battle of New Orleans, which followed the peace treaty with Britain but nonetheless eventually made Jackson President. It is detailed and graphic, good on drama, but weak on causation, background and results. For boys of all ages.

title: R.P.I. Tops Alfred, 8472
description: ALFRED, N. Y., Jan. 8 (AP)Holding the lead throughout, Rensselaer Polytechhic Institute easily defeated Alfred, 8472, in a conference basketball game today. Leading the scoring for was Steve Laskey, with 19 points.

title: AUSTERITY BUDGET IN ALGERIA PLEDGED
description: ALGIERS, Jan. 8  The Algerian Finance Minister, Ismail Mahroud, promised austerity and more austerity in the new budget here this week.

title: Ann L. Peters To Be a Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Lynn Peters Jr. of New York and Kingsport, Tenn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Lynn Peters, to David Gerald Gordon, son of Dr. and Mrs. Gerald Gordon of Grand Camano, British Virgin Islands,

title: Those Society Has Left Behind
description: IN a year of economic uncertainty and surprise, one grim tradition remained unbroken: when times are hard, they are hardest for the already underprivileged. This applied particularly to those Americans whose location or ethnic background qualified them be called minoritygroup members. From a survey several such groups of peopleAmerican Indians and Eskimos, SpanishAmericans, Chinese and Appalachian whitesit was apparent that the last hired were still likely to be the first fired.

title: Article 93412147 -- No Title
description: DEC. 18, 1892, was a historic date. That night, Tchaikovsky's ballet The Nutcracker had its premiere at the Maryinsky Theater in St. Petersburg. Everyone knows what happened to it and to the orchestral suite the composer adapted from it. Not everyone knows that it was Part of a double bill, shared by Tchaikovsky's last opera, Iolanthe (also known as Yolanta). At thetime, bath works were equally successful with the audience, equally unsuccessful with the critics. The ballet survived;of course; the opera did not.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR: Mr. Carter described how his car skidded to the right in Nova Scotia and how he turned in the direction of the skid by turning his steering wheel to the right. Unfortunately, most drivers, including the author, do not know the correct meaning of the term, turn in the direction of the skid, When his automobile was going off the road toward the right, he was skidding to the left, He should have turned his steering wheel to the left.

title: JAILER REPORTED TO HAVE HID MUJIB
description: LONDON, Jan. 8  The Sunday Times of London reported tonight that Gen. Agile Mohammad Yahya Khan, former President of Pakistan, had ordered the execution by hanging of Sheik Mujibur Rahman but that a jailer had thwarted the order by hiding the prisoner.

title: Another Honor for Allen
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 8 (UPI)  George Allen of the Washington Redskins will be honored as pro coach of the year at the Touchdown Club of Columbus annual all sports dinner Jan. 28.

title: Nassau's New Chief M.D. Finds Strong Pulse
description: MINEOLA, L. I.  Nassau County's pulse is strong, according to the new County Health Commissioner, but he warned that a freeze on state funds might force a reassessment of local activities.

title: EDWARD A. COHEN
description: Edward A. Cohen, who retired as operator of the shoe department of Bonwit Teller 20 years ago and earlier had been merchandising manager for shoes and leather goods at Saks Fifth Avenue, died Thursday in Miami Beach. His age was 82.

title: Retailers See Gains
description: Retailing, the one consistently shiny factor in an otherwise cloudy economy in 1971, has come into the new year with perhaps an even more attractive luster.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINCTON  Last Sunday, in a nationwide television interview, President Nixon gave the impression that he was willing to withdraw all troops and end all bombing and other American military activities in Indochina if North Vietnam would only agree to release American prisoners of war. In fact, Mr. Nixon seemed to be saying, this proposal had already been put to the North Vietnamese delegation in Paris, but Hanoi had totally rejectnd it.

title: Vlas N. Nichkov, Chairman Of Amtorg in U.S., Is Dead
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 8 (UPI)  Vlas N. Nichlov, chairman of Amtorg, the Soviet trade organization in the United States, died Thursday. He was 69 years old.

title: Almost everyone was very nice, and the President was very nice too
description: Sanford Fox is in charge of White House invitations, programs, menus and other formal papers. He also handles stationery. In this book it is revealed, presumably for the first time, that according to Mr. Fox, Mrs. Eisenhower preferred a creamwhite finish, Mrs. Kennedy a white kid finish, Mrs. Johnson a white kid finish. Mrs. Nixon is partial to a white kid finish in a real nice blue. The White House chef, Henry Haller, describes the first family's menus with the balance that is a Nixon hallmark: The general emphasis is on beef, although the President loves fish. Generally, every week for the family's menus we have, at some time or other, fish, beef, thicken and sometimes a casserole like lasagna. I am very impressed by the President's eating habits, says the chef.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON  The Anderson Papers on the U. S. Government's handling of the IndoPakistani war suggest that the Nixon Administration has learned very little from the damning disclosures of the Pentagon Papers on the Vietnam war.

title: Loguercio Wins With Red Shoes to Cap Liberty Bell Riding Triple
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 8The largest crowd of the current meeting  21,229  saw Mrs. Adele L. Rand's Red Shoes and Tony Loguercio dominate the thoroughbred racing program today at Liberty Bell Race Track.

title: Upstream to spawn among the beer cans
description: Fortune Dundy is a rare, stilting bird in mauve and ostrich feathers, fragile, zany, desperate. She is looking for some man, but she definitely resents question No. 72 on the DATEMATE application: Yes or No Previous Sexual Exp. Fortune, at 30, is a virgin. She knows she had better get rescued, and soon. The story of her quest for a rescuer in Los Angeles swinging singles club makes a delicious, painful book.

title: Lean Middle
description: There is plenty of money  around these days but those spending it have been rather erratic in using it for food and alcoholic beverages.

title: Home Court: Winning Edge
description: Basketball's homecourt advantage, an accepted feature of the game throughout its history, came into sharp focus for an unusually large audience last week when the New York Knicks and Milwaukee Bucks traded home victories on successive nights in televised games.

title: Enemy Drive Poses Major Threat in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 8  The latest Communist. offensive in Laos has confronted the United Statesbacked Government of Prince Souvanna Phouma with the most critical military situation it has faced in years.

title: Federation of Exchanges
description: LOS ANGELES  Richard W. Jones is an outspoken Westernborn and bred stockbroker who is intent on making the West equal to the East as a securities market. To accomplish this in the best interests of the investing public, he contends, the West must be granted more equality than the East during a transition period toward truly national securities exchange.

title: Books: Regulation Indicted
description: ENTERPRISE DENIED. By Albro Martin. 379 pages plus bibliography and index. Collumbia University Press.

title: Jones Last to Floridians
description: MIAMI, Jan. 8 (AP)  Larry Jones of the Floridians, the American Basketball Association's alltime leading scorer, will be lost to the team for the next. three or four weeks with a broken right hand, the Floridians said today. Jones suffered a broken bone above the index finger on his shooting hand in last night's loss to Utah.

title: The Poor Charge That Phase 1 and 2 Perpetuate the Status Quo and Social Injustice
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  Spokesmen for the nation's poor and underprivileged are oomplaining that President Nixon's wageprice stabilization program is servng merely to freeze the economic status quo and perpetuate social injustice In America.

title: Kennedy Center Spurs Arts
description: WASHINGTONOver and and over again last fall, classical music stations dinned the word into their listeners ears: The John F. Kennedy Center  the most exciting thing ever to happen in the performing arts in Washington.

title: Study Finds States Lag on School Aid To the Large Cities
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP)  The United States Office of Education said today that bigcity schools were being shortchanged in state funds.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: WHEN IT'S ICY

title: Blues Top Bruins, 53
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 8 (UPI) Garry Unger and Gary Sabourin scored two goals each tonight to pace the St. Louis Blues to a 53 triumph over the Boston Bruins.

title: Black Hawks Win, 40
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 8 (UPI)Pit Martin scored one goal and set up another and Gary Smith notched his fourth shutout this season as the Chicago Black Hawks defeated the Pittsburgh Penguins, 40, tonight.

title: Farm Front: Promise Of Action in Voting Year
description: WASHINGTON  Although a clear picture of the Administration's farm policy under the new Secretary of Agriculture is yet to emerge, 1972 holds promise of more action on the farm front, legislatively and politically.

title: Diary of a Mad Actor, 1972
description: WE all started out together, you know  me, Doc Simon, Mike Nichols, David Merrick, George Plimpton, Alan Arkin, Barbra Streisand, Godfrey Cambridge and, now, Sada Thompson. I was the serious one with the ready smile. Well, maybe not all together, not exactly, but more or less. Gene Hackman, too. And Mel Brooks, Jimmy Coco, Hal Prince, Mel Van Peebles, Cliff Gorman, Jean Stapleton.. are you with me so far? Betty Friedan, too, if you count her as... excuse me, the phone is ringing, I'll be right back. Wrong num(Continued on Page 9) ber. Where was I?

title: Mailbox:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Aerospace Industry Is Now Lean and Poised for Profit
description: LOS ANGELESThe trick in the aerospace industry, has long ceased to be how to take off, but how to land gracefully.

title: The World
description: Keith Bryan was a boy of 16 in Bristol when he joined the British Army's Gloucestershire Regiment. When the regiment was moved to Northern Ireland to try to keep the peace between militant Irish Catholics and their Protestant neighbors, Keith Bryan was in its ranks!

title: SPECIAL PROVISIONS
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The New Play
description: THERE'S ONE IN EVERY MARRIAGE, the Stratford National Theater of Canada's production of a comedy by Georges Feydeau, got 11 favorable reviews (Watt, News; Watts, Post; Gottfried, Women's Wear; Oppenheimer, Newsday; Raidy, Newhouse Newspapers; Glover, AP; Gayer, UPI; Harris, CBSTV; Rollin, NBCTV; Sanders, ABCTV; Bookspan, WPIXTV), and two mixed reviews (Barnes, Times; Klein, WNEWTV).

title: King Frederik Improving
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Jan, 8 (AP)  King Frederik of Denmark, who suffered a heart attack Monday, was reported regaining his strenght today. A hospital bulletin said that doctors believed he had overcome a bout with pneumonia that had complicated his rel.covery.

title: Civic Costs Raise TaxExempt Rates
description: In the old days before the Soaring Sixties convinced everyone that severe business recessions would no longer happen, there was some advantage to being a policeman or a garbageman. Public employes didn't make much money, but they didn't get laid off when times were tough.

title: Miss Mangano Is Wed
description: MANHASSET, L.I., Jan.  Miss Marianne Paula Mangano, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Mario A. Mangano, was married here this afternoon to Douglas L. Prisco, son of Dr. and Mrs. Frank J. Prisco of Great Neck. The Rev. Robert Brown performed the ceremony in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church.

title: THE BIG THREE
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Miss Davis Is Examined
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Jan. 8 (UPI)  Angela Davis, the black militant, was back in her jail cell today awaiting the results of medical tests taken yesterday because of her complaints that her health was deteriorating from long confinement. Her attorneys said Miss Davis did not expect to receive the results for a few days. She is awaiting trial on murder, kidnapping and conspiracy charges.

title: BARNET D. GOLDEN
description: Barnet D. Golden, a lawyer and the father of Elliott Golden, chief assistant district attorney of Kings County, died Friday in Brooklyn Jewish Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 420 Avenue F. Brooklyn.

title: Reinstatement of 10 Ends SitIn at Jamaica Hospital
description: A work stoppage at Jamaica Hospital in Queens ended last night after the hospital administration agreed to reinstate 10 perspns laid off Thursday.

title: Show Horses Will Get Physical Health Exams
description: DARIEN, Conn., Jan. 7The Connecticut Department of Agriculture will require that all horses entering the stakes for horse shows have health certificates signed by a qualified veterinarian, starting immediately.

title: FLAG ON A BAG
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Rojas to Receive Award At Kansas City Dinner
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Jan. 8 (AP)Cookie Rojas, a second baseman of the Kansas City Royals, who just a year ago faced an uncertain future, is to receive a special award for inspirational leadership on Jan. 23 at the Kansas City baseball awards dinner.

title: Church Again Protests Police Actin in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO Jan. 8  The Roman Catholic Church and the military Government in Brazil have come to another confrontation over repression by the political police and alleged intimidation of priests and prelates.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Space
description: A dream: A space vehicle that would shuttle from earth to orbit and back. It would take off like a rocket, orbit like a spacecraft and return to earth like a jet airplatie. It Would ainiplify. the construction and deployment of all kinds of satellites  military and civilian, communications and weather, moon ferries and planetary probes..

title: LeadBased Paint Banned In Federally Aided Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP)  The Department of Housing and Urban Development has banned the use of leadbased paint in all its assisted residences, effective Jan. 1.

title: Growth Per Se: A Spurned Goal
description: Fashions changein ideas as in apparel.

title: NASDAQ Changing Counter Trading
description: The overthecounter market, traditionally the trading arena for the stocks of relatively small and unseasoned companies, is in the throes of a transformation whose impact will be felt by the entire securities industry.

title: Pollution Fight Fogged by Costs
description: LOS ANGELESOne of the most fearless forecasts for 1972 is that a lot of time and breath will be expended by industrialists, politicians and the public debating the economics of environmental reform.

title: Security Force Strengthened
description: VALLETTA, Malta, Jan. 8 (Reuters)  Britain began evacuating servicemen's wives and children from Malta today but at the same time was reinforcing her military security strength in the face of possible hostility from island residents next week.

title: Sports of The Times
description: His jaw is Don Shula's dominant feature. It has the thrust of a goalline plunge, of a linebacker coming up to make a tackle.

title: Stephen Zeche, Lawyer, to Wed Myra L. Skluth
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan.  Dr. and Mrs. L. Herbert Skluth of Norwalk and Woodbury, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Myra Louise Skluth, to Stephen Zeche, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Zeche of New York. A March wedding is planned.

title: MissBonitaM.ShulockMarried To Robert Siverd, Law Student
description: JEANNETTE, Pa., Jan. 8  Miss Bonita Marie Shulock, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Shulock, was married here this morning to Robert Joseph Siverd, a secondyear law stude4 at Georgetown University. He is a son of Clifford D. Siverd, president and chief executive officer of the American Cyanamid Company, and Mrs. Siverd of Franklin Lakes, N..1.

title: 2 ECOLOGY GROUPS FACE FUND CRISES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  Two leading environmental groups  Friends of the Earth and Environmental Actionacknowledged today that they were facing serious financial crises.

title: COUGARS DEFEAT NETS, 118 TO 115
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Jan. 8 (AP)  Ted McClain and Joe Caldwell made two free throws each in the last 30 seconds tonight to give the Carolina Cougars a 118115 American Basketball Association victory over the New York Nets.

title: Still Upbeat at 88, Eubie Blake Won't Stay Retired From Ragtime
description: In 1945, Eubie Blake settled in Brooklyn and, a year later, he retired.

title: Bus and Subway Service Called Normal as Wildcat Strike Ends
description: The Transit Authonity reported yesterday that service had returned to normal on its buses and subways and that there was no resumption of Friday's wildcat strike by more than 1,000 of its workers.

title: Stocks Traded In YoYo Fashion
description: The stock market covered a lot of ground in 1971, ending. up slightly higher than where it started.

title: Alan Shusner to Wed Miss Merle Schwartz
description: ENCINO, Calif., Jan. 8  Mr. and Mrs. Martin M. Schwartz, formerly, of Woodmere, L. I., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Merle Hillary Schwartz, to Alan Z. Shusner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Israel Shusner of Shamokin, Pa. The wedding will take place on July 29 in WilkesBarre, Pa.

title: SHEIK MUJIB, FREE, ARRIVES IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, Jan. 8  Sheik Mujibur Rahman, free after nine months in a Pakistani prison, flew into London today.

title: Carvings Give Nefertiti Big Role
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 8  History has shortchanged Queen Nefertiti of ancient Egypt's Golden Age by stressing only her beauty, Ray Winfield Smith, an archeologist, believes.

title: Photography
description: MANY owners of model Super 8 Movie cameras may not realize that they can use the new high speed Ekta.chrome ASA 160 movie film in their cameras to take excellent indoor movies without need for floodlights. At least one company (Honeywell Photographic Products) has actually tested the new film in their latest model cameras, and has announced that results were very pleasing and attractive. Like most other Super 8's, thefr cameras are designed so that inserting the cartridge automatically sets the builtin exposure meter to match the film speed. However, only the newest models are keyed to match the new ASA 160but for those who own cameras with this feature already built in (consult the manual or ask your dealer if in doubt) there is no reason why they cannot use them to take indoor pictures without floodlights. The only time a problem may arise is a very bright sunlight, when a neutral density filter may

title: MINNESOTA TOPS INDIANA 52 TO 51
description: MIINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 8 (AP) Bob Nix sank two free throws with 17 seconds left tonight and then Jim Brewer blocked a shot to lift Minnesota to a 5251 victory over Indiana before the second largest crowd at Williams Areana19,121.

title: United States Power Squadrons Revises Its Curriculum
description: One of the world's largest volunteer teaching organizations the United States Power Squadrons, is changing its curriculum for 1972. The change will come in its traditional piloting courseto be called boatingand,will be tailored to the newest majority afloat, the outboardtrailer group.

title: Dance
description: CAN modemdance make it on Broadway? And if not, why not? And does It matter? Moderndance is very possibly the one indigenous art form to be found in the United States. It started from the inspiration of Isadore Duncan and progressed through the teaching and example of Ruth St. Denis and Ted Shawn. Moderndance is not especially modern nowadays, and it has earned the hyphen in its title through long and hard service.

title: Meredith Jean Forinash Engaged
description: YORK, Pa., Jan. 8.  Miss Meredith Jean Forinash and Henry Von Kohorn Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Von Kohorn of Greenwich, Conn., will be married next month.

title: 3 Airlines Act to Raise Fares to Puerto Rico
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP)  The three airlines serving the Caribbean from the United States Northeast propose to increase fares to Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands by about 9 per cent, effective Feb. 1.

title: BENEFIT WILL AID MASSAPEQUA YOUTH
description: Peter Blandford, who helped the Plainedge High School gymnastic team win the Division Nassau County championship, lies in Nassau County Medical Center at East Meadow, LI., with a broken neck. The 15yearold boy is paralyzed from the chest down. His condition is listed as fair.

title: Architecture
description: THIS is a saga of an Unbuilt house, and ale) a tale of the odds against you in New York. It is about the house on West 11th Streetthe one that was to be built on the site of No. 18, which achieved a kind of national fame when it was blown up by young revolutionaries almost two years ago.

title: Tuna Commission Countries Fail to Agree on 72 Quota
description: TOKYO, Jan. 8 (AP)  Six member nations of the InterAmerican Tropical Tuna Commission failed to reach agreement on the overall 1972 quota for yellowfin tuna fishing at twoday session this week, Japanese Foreign Ministry officials reported.

title: Miss Hannah Leibowitz Affianced
description: NORFOLK, Ya., Jan. 8  Miss HanTah Leibowitz and Capt. Timothy D. Lipman, U.S.A. Medical Corps, plan to be married on March 4. Mrs. Harry Leibowitz has announced her daughter's engagement to the son of Prof. and Mrs. Henry T. Lipman of New York.

title: LETTERS
