description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Western State Leads Skiing
description: CRESTED BUTTE, Colo., Jan. 8 (AP)Mike Lewis won the crosscountry event today to help Western State of Colorado to the early lead in the first Rocky Mountain Intercollegiate Ski Association meet of the season. Lewis toured the 15kilometer course in 45 minutes 30.4 seconds.

title: Coast Agency Rules Long Hair May Block Benefits to Jobless
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan, 8  The California Unemployment Insurance Appeals Board has ruled that jobless men with long hair are not eligible for unemployment compensation benefits in towns where most of the employers reject longhaired applicants.

title: $1Million Fire in Indiana
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Ind., Jan. (AP)  The Hilton Hotel here estimated that about $1million in damage was caused by a fire yesterday morning, which apparently started in the handstand of a 20th floor restaurant.

title: Liebrnans Have Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Burt Liebman of Forest Hills, Queens, on Dec. 21 in the Lenox Hill Hospital.

title: Reader's Report
description: Poor David Leslie, big chief of an international industrial octupus, is too much of a public figure to enjoy a discreet nervous breakdown. So he comes apart while visiting the Brussels branch of his firmwhere he insults V.LP.'s and makes headlines with what in humbler men might only invoke Blue Cross or two weeks sick leave.

title: U.S. Eases Its Screening For Vietnam Drug Use
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan, 8  The United States military's program for screening drug users will no longer require urinalysis for all personnel going on leave or for rest and recreation, the military command reported,

title: In Sydney, Everybody Gets Into Act for Race's Start
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N. Y. Jan. 8Guess I spun out, said Ridhard Nicolaysen, 22yearold Lawrence University. Ski Club member, after he fell on his second jump today and lost out in the 27th annual Torger Tokio Menforial ski jumping tournament.

title: Japan Sees Continuing Major Role for LongHaul Trains
description: TOKYO  Depite the increase in the nuMber of private automobiles in Japan in recent years, the Japanese do not foresee extinction for their longhaul passenger trains.

title: Blacks Meet Here to Plan Election Role
description: Determined to play a significant role in the 1972 election campaign, black elected and appointed officials from five states and Washington, D. C., met here yesterday to select delegates to a national black political convention.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: U.N. Group's Most Urgent Job Is Restoring Bengali Transport
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan, 8  "Operation Neutral is the shorthand designation given to the United Nations relief undertaking in East Pakistan.

title: Owen WingraveGhosts, Pacifism and Death
description: THE literary aspect.of Benjamin Britten's many operas and vocal works is generally of such high quality and moral interest, and it is so inextricably a part of these works that they become an important consideration in judging them. The composer's latest opera, Owen Wingrave, inspires the same response. Commissioned by the Television Service of the British Broadcasting Corporation and given its premiere last May 16, it has already been released as a recording on the London label (two disks, OSA1291) with the original

title: Et Al.
description: An intelligent choice of material makes this anthology of writings about arrest, trial and imprisonment stand out from similar collections. Here is Billie Holliday's candid and touching account of her fifties drug conviction; Lenny Bruce's comic obscenity trial; Edgar Smith's description of his 14 years in the death house (Prom which he was recently released under curious circumstances). Other experiences of the famous and the obscure.

title: OHIO STATE TOPS PURDUE, 78 TO 70
description: LAFAYETTE, Ind., Jan. 8 (UPI)  Allan Hornyak and Luke Witte took command in the closing two minutes tonight as Ohio State put down a Purdue rally and scored a 7870 victory in the Big Ten basketball opener for both.

title: Crosley Field to Crumble
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 8 (AP)Demolition of the Cincinnati Reds former home, Crosley Field, will begin April 1.

title: Japan
description: TOKYODuring the year 1971, the Japanese view about the United States economy underwent a considerable change. Overlapping of the following two factors made this change all the more conspicuous:

title: Toscanini or Boulez The Better Conductor?
description: MING MADERNA is an Italian, but he is not Afraid to assert (perhaps because he now lives In Germany) that Tos canini, fell short of godhood. Toscanini was a marvelous conductor, Maderna explaint with a generous wave of the hand, but he was only a cellist, you know. Maderna,, who makes his New York Philharmonic conducting debut on Thursday, believes composers usually make the best conductors because a composer must be steeped in musical culture, whereas the career, conductor may be no more than, well, a former cellist.

title: Miss Helen Grevey Bride of Lance Gad
description: PEEKSKILL, N. Y., Jan. 8  Miss Helen Alexandra Grevey, who expects to graduate in June from Cornell Law School, was married here this eve

title: Where Then, Is the Enemy?
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass.  The dwindling of terrestrial distances, and the millionfold increase in the speed of communication and data handling, have created a new unit which did not exist before: mankind. Though we do not get our paycheck from it, our fate is linked to it. This new unit, the most important of all, has no representative to take care of its interests, has no organization to defend it, though it is in the gravest danger. Thousands of bombs wait in silos to be fired, each of which can start the holocaust which can wipe us all out, and we do not know to whom the fingers belong on those thousand buttons each of which can invite doomsday; and the atomic Club still grows.

title: Recovery Seen In New England
description: New England has been feeling the business slump more than most regions of the United States and one of the reasons is that its mix of industries has been adversely affected over the last few years.

title: Education
description: Two years of economic gloom and scarcity of job opportunities have made the present crop of collegiate job seekers so grateful for small favors that even recruiters for the Central Intelligence Agency have recently been welcomed on some campuses. I3ut last week came the first authoritative hint of a turn for the better: A detailed study of business and industry employment trends concludes that men in the class of 72 will have an 11 per cent better chance of landing a job upon graduation than last year's class; for women, the chance will be 15 per cent better.

title: Jewish Group Buying Homes in Crown Heights to Stabilize the Community
description: In an effort to anchor their traditional community in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, Lubavitch Hasidic Jews are buying houses in their neighborhood with the aid of interestfree loans.

title: Psychologist Says Detainees in Ulster Undergo Torture
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 7  A social psychologist returned this week from an investigation in Northern Ireland with what she contends is evidence that psychological torture as well as physical abuse is being used in interrogation of Catholic prisoners held in interment camps.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Medicine
description: One out of every six practicing doctors in this country received his medical training abroad. It is a fact that troubles some observers of the American medical scene, and although their discontent rarely surfaces in this period of public emphasis on the shortage of doctors, it may soon do so.

title: ELLES M. DERBY
description: HOHOKUS, N. J., Jan. 8  E1les M. Derby, who retired as a third vice president of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company in 1968, died today in Valley Hospital, Ridgewood. He was 68 years old and lived at 110 Ackerman Avenue.

title: Oritz Stops Whittenburg
description: MIAMI, Jan. 8 (AP)The former world lightweight champion, Carlos Ortiz, knocked out Bill Whittenburg of Huntington, W. Va., with a right to the chin in the seventh round tonight,

title: THOMAS E. MADDAMS
description: BRIELLE, N. J., Jan. 8  Thomas E. Maddams, who retired in 1962 as vice president of the Glens Falls Group of Insurance Companies, died today in the Jersey Shore Medical Center, Neptune. He was 74 years old and lived in the Brandywine Apartments.

title: GRAND PRIX CRASH FATAL TO FALOON
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 8 (AP)  Bryan Faloon, a 27yearold New Zealand driver, died of injuries en route to the hospital today after an accident in the closing stages of the New Zealand Grand Prix. Frank Gardner of Australia won the 101mile race.

title: Mr. Nixon Announces
description: It was logical for President Nixon to announce his decision to seek a second term in the form of a letter to his New Hampshire supporters. The state not only has the nation's first primary but is also the site of several pivotal events in Mr. Nixon's long political career.

title: Jonathan Booth Hill Marries Jill McKelvie in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  Miss Jill McKelvie, daughter of Mrs. Richard Helms of Chevy Chase, Md., and Dr. Allan McKelvie of Washington, was married here today to Jonathan Booth Hill, a lawyer with the Federal Aviation Administration and son of Mr. and Mrs. John Hill of Boston. The ceremony in the Great Choir of the Washington Cathedral (Episcopal Cathedral Church of SS Peter and Paul) was performed by Dean Francis B.

title: Point of View
description: Is the individual investor, disenchanted with the experience of the last couple of years, pulling out of the stock market? Rather unexpectedly, the answer is that he is not. A close look at the transactions on the New York Stock Exchange shows that the individual is trading more shares today than he ever did before. In 1971, he traded twice as many shares as he did a decade ago. And more and more individuals will be coming in to the market in the years ahead.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Jan. 8 (AP)  Nick Weatherspoon's jump shot with 4:57 left put Illinois ahead for the first time tonight and the Illini went on to beat Northwestern, 6763. Northwestern led by as much as 13 points in the first half.

title: 76ers Defeat Suns
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 8 (UPI) Bill Cunningham, Bob Rule and Dave Wohl combined for 84 points tonight in leading the Philadelphia 76ers to a 130119 victory over the Phoenix Suns.

title: Housing Starts Up
description: WASHINGTON  The production of housing, which lagged badly in the early months of the Nixon Administration, rose dramatically during 1971 and should continue to do so this year.

title: TEACHERS STRIKE WORRIES YORKERS
description: YONKERS, Jan. 8  With the teacher's strike here entering its second week Monday, a worried city is trying to cope with the strike's impact on the present and its implications for the future.

title: Budget Stimulus Likely to Lessen
description: WASHINGTONA moderately stimulative Government monetary and fiscal policy is in store for the United States economy in 1972.

title: Speakers From Sports World Add Flavor to the RubberChicken Circuit
description: Some of North America's most famous and wealthyathletes will take over television screens today as home viewers will be treated to hockey's Bobby Hull and Stan Mikita, basketball's Jerry West, and golf's Charles Coody.

title: SAVING THE SPECIES
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Chemicals Hope Is Pickup in '72
description: A livelier year.

title: Television
description: FAIR is fair. Or at least it is as fair as the particular definition that happens to be under consideration. In broadcasting, innumerable definitions can be found swarming around something called the fairness doctrine.

title: New Year's Bacchanal In Exciting Forest Hills
description: I had never in my entire life greeted a new year on the corner of Queens Boulevard and Continental Avenue. I may never do it again. It lacks the excitement one expects from the heart of Forest Hills.

title: Koalas Succumb to Tourism
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Jan. 8 (Reuters)  The first koala bears introduced to the nearby Tidbindilla nature reserve have died  apparently from fright due to exposure to thousands of tourists. New koalas are being introduced, gently, slowly and with no publicity, and staff members think they will thrive.

title: Miss Henning Sets Second World SpeedSkating Mark in Swiss Competition,
description: DAVOS, Switzerland, Jan. 8 (Reuters)  Leo Linkovesi, of Finland, and 16yearold Anne Henning of Northbrook, Ill., warmed up for next month's Winter Olympics by setting three world records in an international speedskating competition today.

title: Dominguez in Final
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 8 (AP)Patrice Dominguez defeated Colin Dibley of Australia, 61, 36, 76, 06, 60, today end became the first Frenchman to reach the men's singles final in the 80 years of the New South Wales tennis championships,

title: Theft Suspect Called Alarm Installer
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan, 8  The head of detectives here, Capt. Bernhard Seit, disclosed this week that a 27yearold man arrested and charged with possessing property stolen from Helen Hayes had been working as a burglaralarm installer.

title: Criminals At Large
description: One reason for the popularity of the Maj SjowallPer Wahlod series involves the shock of recognition. The locale is Sweden. The characters sport names like Kollberg, Kristiansson, Backlund. But here are police officials working much as police officials do in New Yorkpolice officials who have the same hangups, virtues and Vices, who painstakingly sift bits of evidence, who at night go home to wife, mistress or lonely flat.

title: The Sports Game
description: While about 60 million Americans watch the Super Bowl football game on television next Sunday, someone, weary of interruptions by $200,000a minute commercials, is sure to utter one of the least destructible sports myths:

title: Not Science Fiction But If Fiction
description: We are in the midst of science fiction boom. Unhappily, however, it seems to be most marketable when it isn't called science fiction and when it is written by people who never appeared in Analog or Galaxy or The Magazine of Fantasy and Science Fiction. Most readers and viewers of science fiction are as unaware of what they are purchasing as was Moliere's amateur gentleman that he had been speaking prose. Ezekiel was writing science fiction when he reported the flying saucerand Lucian of Samosta with his Icaromennipos. Cyrano wrote it; Rabelais wrote it; Voltaire, Samuel Butler and of course Swift. A journalist named Richard Locke held the readers of The New York Sun enthralled by a continuing account of a supertelescope invented by the contemporary astronomer Herschel, with which he could report on the doings of the inhabitants of the moon; all going well until it was revealed that, while Herschel had not invented the telescope, Locke had invented the story.

title: ST. JOHN'S WINS IN TRACK MEET
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Jan. 8 St. John's University won a triangular track meet from Army and N.Y,U. at the Army field today. The Rednien accumulated 52 points against Army's 56 and N.Y.U.'s 19 by taking nine of 14 first places.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTON  When Senator Birch Bayh complained last fall that President Nixon was violating all precedents by sending Lewis F: Powell Jr. and William H. Rehnquist to the Supreme Court together  Like Hansel and Gretel,  he was technically wrong.

title: Royals Wait for New Home
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 8, (AP) William E. Clarkson, Jackson County Sporty Authority chairman, says the Kansas City Royals new baseball park won't be ready for use before late May or early June. The Kansas City Chiefs football stadium in the Harry S. Truman Sports Complex should be ready by August.

title: New York
description: The gilded cherubs adorning the Hotel Pierre's lobby wear a cheerful look, and well they might. The place is a sort of jolly stockade for the old rich, the new r:ch, and the wouldbe rich as well

title: MONTANA DENIES SMELTERS PLEAS
description: HELENA, Mont., Jan. 8  The Montana Board of Health unanimously denied yesterday request by the Anaconda Cornpany and the American Smelting & Refining Company to lower the state's strict sulphur emission requirements to the more relaxed Federal air standards.

title: The Nation
description: Glenn W. Turner is a 37yearold former doortodoor salesman, a Florida sharecropper's son who became the says) a multimillionaire by developing a success motivation course called Dare to Be Great and a home cosmetic sales.program called Koscot Interplanetary. Last year the Orlandobased Mr. Turner put up the money to finance the defense of Capt. Ernst L. Medina in his courtmartial for responsibility for the Mylai massacre In Vietnam. And today he is scheduled to receive the American of the Year award from the Lions International Club.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Once again, J. Edgar Hoover and Attorney General Mitchell have been playing ducks and drakes with the statistics they use to justify their reliance on wiretapping and bugging and,. their assertions that they are really doing something about the crime that plagues the country.

title: The Nation
description: President Nixon's antiinflation program turned a couple of important corners last week, but new challenges marched up on the wage and price controllers almost as fast as they mowed down old ones.

title: 3 New OTB Branches Will Open This Week
description: The Offtrack Betting Corporation said yesterday It would open three new offices next week, two in Queens and one in East Harlem.

title: Edward Kane Weds Georgia Ann Kelly
description: VALLEY STREAM, L. I., Jan, 8  In the Holy Name of Mary Roman Catholic Church here this morning, Miss Georgia Ann Kelly, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George William Kelly of Valley Stream and Shelter Island, was married to Edward Patrick Kane, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas James Kane of New York and Shelter Island. The Rev. Robert Lane performed the ceremony at a nuptial mass.

title: Monday Signs Cub Pact
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 8 (UPI) The Chicago Cubs today signed Rick Monday, speedy outfielder obtained. from Oakland in trade for Kenny Holtzman, pitcher, in November. Monday was the seventh Cub to sign.

title: The World
description: ROME  This city, where traffic still moves  usually at a snail's pace  over roads and bridges built by the Roman consuls more than 2,000 years ago, is now exploring what may become breakthrough in modern urban transportation. The idea is to lure commuters and city dwellers back from their cars into buses by making public transii attractive, speedy, efficient  and, possibly, free.

title: Airlines Seeking to Balance Capacity and Demand.
description: In ads plastered on subway walls and in national periodicals, the public was invited recently to fly to Europe for $75sometimes lessaboard nonscheduled charter flights.

title: Son to the Deckers
description: A son waeborn Dec. 20 to Dr. and Mrs. Norman Decker at Lenox Hill Hospital. Mrs. Decker is the former Miss Hannah Dorothy Shulman. Dr. Decker is a psychiatrist. The child has been named William Karl.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: This is being written as a public service. Because of the shortsightedness of the Founding Fathers, who imposed on the U.S.A. a Presidential system of government that does not allow giveandtake debate between prime minister and parliament (as in England), the press must assume that role.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: British Auto Maker Is Fined In Violating U.S. Safety Law
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI)  A British automobile manufacturer has been fined $20,000 for violating the United States auto safety law.

title: Neiv SpeedSkating Aces Carry U.S. Hopes in Olympic Games
description: The United States, never a power in the Winter Olympics; is banking on its speed skaters for a strong showing in the 1972 games at Sapporo, Japan, Feb. 3 through 13.

title: IRT's Flushing Service Cut 2 Days for Repairs
description: The Transit Authority has temporarily terminated service at Grand Central instead of Times Square on the IRT Flushing line to make repairs on the route.

title: Reader's Report
description: John Rowan Wilson, an English doctornovelist, here concerns himself with the Schweitzer phenomenon: largerthanlife medical missionary, sacrificing himself to good works and worldwide renown. Dr. Wilson's version is Edward Barrington, whose career in Central Africa is being posthumously vetted by a lawyer representing the possible savior of an insolvent foundation. The lawyer, a sensitive operative named Perrin, soon finds himself involved in an expose of his subject's feet of clay. Interviewing Barrington's survivors and associates, he concludes that what the debunkers have been saying is wholly true, but not the whole truth.

title: Connecticut Starts Ticket Sales For State Lottery Next Month
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 8  Connecticut will hold its first statewide lottery about the middle of next month.

title: Port on Ohio
description: Louisville, Ky., 1,255 miles by water from the sea, has set its sights on becoming an ocean port, in the wake of the arrival at its Ohio River bank of a 3,120ton Greek freighter, the Mini Lama, the first selfpropelled ocean vessel to reach Louisville.

title: Economy on an Express Track
description: UNLESS some unforeseen political Or economic obstacle derails it, the American economy should be speeding on an express track in 1972, even picking up momentum as the year progresses. All of the reliable gauges of business activity and prospects were giving positive readings as 1971 ended.

title: Jews Here Honor West German Who Rescued 1,400 in Nazi Era
description: For 64yearold Oskar Schindler  a West German national and a Roman Catholic the night was something beautiful to remember.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Pop
description: ATTER months of anticipation and weeks of public haggling over the details of its release, the recording of George Harrison's Madison Square benefit concert for Pakistan relief has finally arrived. Titled The Concert for Bangla Desh (Apple.STCX 3385), it is a beautifully boxed package that includes three disks and a 64 page booklet of fullcolor photographs.

title: The World
description: Long Tieng is a strategically finportant base for an Americansupported native army fighting the Communists in Laos. In recent days the future of Long Tieng has become uncertain. Prolonged shelling from North Vietnamese forces using 130mm. guns  the heaviest employed by the enemy in Laos  have destroyed the base's ammunition dump and made it extremely difficult for American aircraft to land there. A few weeks ago, more than 30,000 civilians were evacuated from Long Tieng; last week it was reported that all infantry troops had been moved out of the base Into surrounding hills.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: HIGH RATING IS GIVEN TO KENNEDY BY A.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP)  Americans for Democratic Action has given Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, its highest performance rating during 1971 of all the potential Presidential candidates in Congress100 per cent.

title: Senior Bowl Is a Showcase for Pro Scouts
description: MOBILE, Ala., Jan. 8Mrs. Louise Jackson, wearing a cameo at the throat and serving as a hostess at the pregame Seafood Jubilee dinner, said, Now you all come back and see us. They will.

title: Black Stand Restated
description: MIAMI, Jan. 8 (AP)  Senator Muskie restated today the political reality that the 1972 Democratic ticket could not win with a black VicePresidential nominee. He pledged to try to change that.

title: Tiny Fiji Community Suing Britain Over Mining Issue
description: SUVA, Fiji, Jan. 8 (AP)  A tiny Pacific island community has announced that it will sue the British Government.

title: Pottstown Is Site of a Football Movie...Starring Reality
description: In the second game of Phil Tuckett's football filmmaking career, Kermit Alexander of the Los Angeles Rams ran over him on the sidelines, smacking him in the head with his helmet.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: As a reply to Anatomy of an Accident, let me relate what happened to us when we visited the ancient Indian dwellings in Chaco Canyon in New Mexico. We failed to notice the thunderheads gathering off to the west, and soon after we had clambered into our rented 1970 car and begun driving down a clay road to return to Gallup, the rains started. Soon we were slipping, sliding and skidding from one side of the road to the other, and spinning the steering wheel feverishly in an effort to avoid the ditches on either side. We were overtaken  with no difficulty four Ford pickup trucks.

title: Yale Conquers Columbia
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 8Yale defeated Columbia tonight for the first time in five years, 7161. Columbia had beaten the Elis eight straight times.

title: Gardens
description: ALL I meant to do was to try growing wax begonia from seed for summer bedding plants. From the catalogue listings chose the double varieties Christmas Candle and White Christmas. Then my eye wandered down the page and was caught by Wooly Bear listed under Unusual and Rare begonias. For 50 cents I had to try that one.

title: The Nation
description: It wasn't exactly a new idea  or necessarily a better idea. The shock was that it came from a Ford.

title: The ellipse that is the Jewish people
description: Alas, being Jewish is no longer in these days. Meir Kahane has not made it into the sancta of Radical Chic (that he is a reactionary is only part of the reason), and Philip Roth, bellwether of the Jew's role in American fantasy, has turned from Sophie Portnoy to Richard Nixon.

title: Trial Here of the Harlem Six Interests Student Observers of All Age Groups
description: Thirteen year old Vaughan Dweck lowered his head and squinted at the four young men in the front of the courtroom. They had been on trial for six weeks for a murder committed in 1964, when they were 17 years old and he was 6.

title: 5th Suspect  With Packed Suitcases  Seized in Pierre Robbery
description: A fifth man was arrested yesterday as a suspect in last Sunday's armed robbery of the luxurious Pierre Hotel in which jewelry and other valuables with a value estimated at more than $1million was stolen.

title: JOHN J. CRILLY
description: AVON, N. J., Jan. 8  John J. Crilly of 809 Ocean Avenue, who retired in 1961 as assistant vice president of the Elizabethtown Gas Company in Elizabeth, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital, Hollywood, Fla. His age was 76.

title: Press and Electronic Media Are Optimistic
description: The major media associations are predicting a better 1972, a fact that can be taken with a grain or two of salt. But their predictions are given weight by the analysts who agree with them.

title: Horse Show News
description: More than 400 delegates from all 50 states are expected to be on hand when the 55th annual convention of the American Horse Shows Association gets under way for three days Thursday at the Denver Hilton Hotel.

title: Here Comes Everybody
description: To the Editor:

title: Jessie Gillies Plans Nuptials
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 8  Mr. and Mrs. Donald Burton Gillies Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jessie Campbell Gillies, to Rogerio Arnoldo Lobo of Washington, son of Mr. and Mrs. Rogerio Hyndman Lobo of Hong Kong. The wedding is planned for June.

title: WANDERERS GAIN IN SOCCER RACE
description: LONDON, Jan. 8 (Reuters)Manchester United, already reeling from the loss of George Best, bowed to the Wolverhampton Wanderers, 31, today, and lead the First Division of the English Football League by only 1 point.

title: POWER PLANT BLAST KILLS JERSEY MAN
description: NEWARK, Jan. 8  An explosion ripped through a turbine room at a power station of the Public Service Electric and Gas Company here tonight, killing one employe and blacking out service for 8,400 customers in northern Newark and Belleville.

title: Glut of Metals Hurts Producers
description: We all recognize that even the longest cycle ends.

title: KENNETH PATOITEN, POET, DEAD AT 60
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Jan. 8 (UPI)  Kehneth Patchen, the poet who pioneered poetry reading to the accompaniment of jazz music in the nineteenfifties, died at his home here today of a heart attack. He was 60 years old.

title: Investigation Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (AP)  Representative John M. Ashbrook, Republican of Ohio, asked the House Internal Security Committee today to find out how Mr. Anderson obtained secret Government documents.

title: Bhutto Sees Mujib Off
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan, 8  Sheik Mujibur Rahman ended nine months of imprisonment today in darkness and secrecy but with a sendoff befitting a chief of state.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: N.Y.U.'s Healey Voted Coach of Year in Track
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Jan. 8 Joe Healey, who has been an assistant and the head track and field coach at New York University for more than 30 years, was named today coach of the year by the United States Track Coaches Association.

title: Columbia Fencing Team Defeats Harvard, 20 to 71
description: Columbia's fencing team opened defense of its Ivy League title yesterday with a 207 victory over Harvard.

title: 36 Per Cent Enrolled
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 8 (AP)  Thirtysix per cent of the newly eligible 18to20yearold voters have already registered, according to a yearend survey by the Youth Citizenship Fund.

title: CONNECTICUT BEATS COLUMBIA IN TRACK
description: The University of Connecticut track and field team took advantage of a 359 margin in five field events to down Columbia, 6741, in a meet at Baker Field's Mason Airdrome yesterday.

title: Mrs. Edwards Rewed
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Jan.  Mrs. Raye Carpenter Edwards, widow of William A. Edwards, was married here this. afternoon to Dunklin Burnside, a widower. The Rev. Donald H. Allen, an Episcopal priest performed the ceremony at the home of Mrs. Joshua A. Davis. Mrs. Burnside's first husband was a vice president and senior credit officer at the Chemical Bank.

title: PAUL NETTL DIES; WRITER ON MUSIC
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Jan.  Dr. Paul Nettl, emeritus professor of musicology at Indiana University and the author of many books on music and musicians, died today. He would have been 83 years old Monday.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: New York
description: Commuters on the Long Island and New Haven lines learned last week that they're in for a 20 per cent boost.

title: Kerr on Fun City
description: AS I came away from Fun City, I suddenly realized that there is nothing in the world more exhausting than a bad comedy. You get so terribly tired from not laughing.

title: Switzerland
description: ZURICH, SwitzerlandThe shock waves which President Nixon triggered throughout the free world by the Aug. 15 announcement of his new economic policy have not yet entirely subsided.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: AUTO SALES in the United States in 1971, given spur late in the year by the wageprice freeze and excisetax repeal, hit a record total of 10,155,411 units. This topped the previous mark of 9.66 million units, set 1968.

title: The death of men and feeling
description: The air war in Southeast Asia must he the great metaphor for depersonalized evil of our age, for it most utterly removes the killer from the humans he is killing, from the mano a mano of combat, from control over what he wrecks, hence from the humanness of his killing. It dehumanizes the killers. These instruments, the pilots who fly the F105's, are victims of their own warfare. The gook gets killed, or maimed; the United States airman is unnerved.. His death is abstract.

title: Saigon Curbs Its Youths
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan: 8 (Reuter)  All South Vietnamese under 18 years old were banned today from going to Saigon's snack bars, nightclubs and massage parlors. Observers believe the ban was imposed to curb increasing undisciplined behavier among youths and the effects that the G.I. culture might have on them.

title: Braves Say They Lost Over Million in Soccer
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 8 (UPI)The Atlanta Braves say their soccer operations over a fiveyear period resulted in a loss of just over $1million.

title: For Ages 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10..; Nanook of the North; By Robert Flaherty. Edited from the film by Robert Kraus. Illustrated. Unpaged. WindmillIntext. $4.95. (Ages 7 to 11)
description: Filmed in 1920, Nanook was the first great documentary by a man with a unique capacity to make us sense our kinship with all men and all cultures. Flaherty and his work deserve to be introduced to a new generation, but to honor an artist one must not mutilate his work in the process. This book is nothing more than a series of blurred frame enlargements from the film. In several cases you cannot tell what you're looking at. Adding to the confusion, the pictures are too few and too small, and sparsely captioned so what appears on the pages amounts to nothing more than an idiotic photo album of Nanook and friends disporting themselves among walruses and icebergs.

title: ... Or A Dangerous, Criminally Irresponsible Horror Show'?
description: IN Stanley Kubrick's extravagantly praised A Clockwork Orange, Alex, the leader of a quartet of British street brawlers and a devotee of Beethoven, murders a woman by smashing her head in with a huge statue of a phallus. Now, of course, the foolish female had attempted to drive the intruding Alex from her home  and her yoga exercises  by going after him with a bust of lovely Ludwig Van...

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8My wife and I went to the movies.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Point of View article For Reasonable Attitude on Coops [Dec. 12] by Louis Smadbeck is commendably frank, but it hardly adds up to all argument for tenants to get involved in coops under current conditions in the city.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Free Bus Rides End in Rome
description: ROME, Jan. 8 (AP)  Romans vent back to paying for their bus rides today after a nine(lay experiment that attracted! more bus riders but failed to unsnarl the city's clogged traffic.

title: Eastman Theater: Bright New Look at 50
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 8  The Eastman Theater of the University of Rochester is 50 years old, and like many an aging beauty, it has just had its face lifted. The public had a chance to see the results last night for the first time when the Eastman Philharmonia presented a gala concert in the theater under the direction of Walter Hendl.

title: For Ages 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10...; The Adventures of Three Colors; By Annette Tison and Talus Taylor. Illustrated. Unpaged. World. $3.95. (Ages 4 to 7)
description: Part coy story, part looking game, an eyecatching book that shows, in an amusing and concrete way, what happens when you mix two primary colors. The format is ingenious: blue seal on a clear acetate overlay drops over a pink ostrich forming purple turtle; in another set, a yellow butterfly falls over a pink pig forming an orange snail, and so on until a flower becomes a color wheel.

title: CITY TO PHASE OUT DETENTION HOMES
description: The city's Human Resources Administration is developing comprehensive plan to phase out large detention centers and shelters for problem children and to replace them with small er reception centers and long term group homes in high risk neighborhoods.

title: SOME RETAILERS ALLOWED TO AVOID ITEMIZED REPORTS
description: WASHINGTON., Jan. 8  The Price Commission has decided not to require retail stores to report on prices item by item unless that is their traditional accounting practice.

title: COURT BARS SALE OF ALLIGATOR SKIN
description: New York State's tight law protecting animals near extinction has been extended to cover, in some cases, the entire country in a decision by State Supreme Court Justice Edward J. Greenfield of Manhattan.

title: Oddy Advances to Semifinals In Squash Racquets Tourney
description: GLEN COVE, Jan. 8Roland Oddy of the New York Athletic Club, led the way into the semifinals of the annual Luckenbach memorial invitation squash racquets tournament at the Nassau Country Club today.

title: The Old Magician At Home
description: There is a difficult novel in progress to attend to under great stress, notes Vladimir Nabokov.

title: Students Blas On Job Offers
description: Career Day, an annual fixture at many high schools around the country, is going to be different for the class of 1972 at Horace Greeley High School in Chappaqua, N.Y. The difference will reflect the thoughtful, independent view of the business world held by these young people, most of whom will be going to college.

title: McCulloch of Ohio Shifts; Seeks Reelection to House
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI)  Representative William M. McCulloch of Ohio, the ranking Republican on the House Judiciary Committee, announced yesterday his intention to seek a 14th term in Congress from the Fourth Congressional District, in the westcentral part of the state.

title: MRS. HAGGE, 140, LEADS GOLF BY 4
description: Mrs. Hagge had three birdies to offset three bogeys for her par and a tworound total of 140 going into the final round tomorrow. Sandra Palmer, who had a 73 in the opening round, recorded a 71 and moved into second place.

title: T. R. Sheehy Fiance Of Maureen McGlynn
description: MANHASSET, L. L, Jan.  Mr. and Mrs. John J. McGlynn have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Maureen Ann McGlynn, to Thomas R. Sheehy, son of Mrs. Thomas V. Sheehy of Weston, Conn., and the late Mr. Sheehy. The wedding is planned for June 17.

title: Letter to the Editor 12  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: UPTURN PREDICTED IN L.I. ECONOMY
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Jan. 8  The NassauSuffolk Regional Planning Board has projected an upturn in the economy of Long Island within the next 12 months.

title: PARAGUAY COURT BARS EXTRADITION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  The United States has received setback in its attempt to extradite Auguste Joseph Ricord, 61yearold former Gestapo agent who is under Federal indictment as the alleged kingpin of an international narcotics ring.

title: Williams Five Tops Bowdoin
description: BRUNSWICK, Maine, Jan. 8 (AP)William College fought off a closing drive by Bowdoin today for an 8075 basketball victory. Dave Green led WilHams with 29 points.

title: Reader's Report
description: One generation's disenchantment is another's nostalgia. Robert Graves wrote Goodbye to All That to bury the Edwardian era, and storytellers ever since have exhumed this same segment of the recent past in search of glamour and certainty before the popularization of the income tax, the electric light and egalitarianism. This period melodrama by Mr. Stewart revisits the plush and gilt world of turnofthecentury London, albeit in peppy colloquial style.

title: Point of View
description: A mixture of optimism and pessimism pervades the railroad industry these days. Induttry spokesmen almost unanimously predict disaster in the years just ahead, while financial analysts see increasingly favorable rail prospects.

title: HIGH COURT TO GET PLEA ON SCHOOL TAX
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 8 (AP)  The State Board of Education voted unanimously today to appeal directly to the Supreme Court a San Antonio Federal court decision triking down the state's system of financing public schools through the propertey tax.

title: RESURRECTION GAP
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: ALL IS QUIET AGAIN AT COAST COLLEGE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. (UPI)  From the window of the office where S.I. Hayakawa, the president of the college, sometimes sins tea on a winter afternoon, hundreds of students can be seen heading to class on the broad campus common.

title: Ezra Pound's Voice of Silence
description: Take thought: I have weathered the storm, I have beaten out my exile.

title: The Unemployment Freeze.
description: The harshest of economic statistics is the unemployment rate, and the latest official report makes it clear that 1971 ended with no start toward fulfillment Administration predictions that joblessness would taper off. The rate hovered all year at close to 6 per cent, the highest level in a decade. That means five million persons looking for work and not finding it.

title: SHEIK MUM'S TRIP SURPRISES DACCA
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Jan. 8  Bengalis were surprised and confused today by the sudden announcement that their leader, Sheik Mujibur Rahman, had flown to London after having been released from arrest in West Pakistan.

title: The Road To Damascus Is Open (If You Haven't Been to Israel)
description: BEIRUT, LebanonWhen my driver reached the Syrian frontier post, I sat tight in the back seat and let him do the talking. As he chatted to a customs inspector, a smiling young Arab leaned against the rear window of the car and offered me what looked like a book of raffle tickets. He was an activist of one of the Palestinian guerrilla organizations, seeking a contribution. I handed him a Syrian pound (about 50 cents). He gave me a receipt and walked off quite happily. I noticed, incidentally, that a passenger in the next car in line had the courage to refuse to give him anything.

title: 2 Rinks From Plainfield Gain in Douglas Bonspiel
description: MOUNT HOPE, N.Y., Jan 8Two Plainfield, N.J., Curling Club rinks, respectively skipped by Robert Fuller and Langtry Lynd, reached the semifinal round of the 37th annual Douglas Medal bonspiel at St. Andrew's Golf Club today.

title: Saigon Bars Indian on Control Team
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan, 8  The South Vietnartiese Government announced today that it would bar the new Indian head of the International Control Commission in Vietnam from entering the country in reprisal for India's elevation of diplomatic relations with Hanoi to ambassadorial level without doing the same hi Saigon.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Happy Days for the Ducks
description: NAGS HEAD, N. C.So warm it might have been born in the tropics, a strong southwest breeze ruffled the dark waters of Collington Bay as we awaited dawn, and it was almost certain that we would shoot few ducks.

title: Child to the Uziellis
description: A daughter was born last Monday to Mr. and Mrs. Giancarlo Uzielli of New York at the LyingIn Hospital. Mrs. Uzielli is the former Miss Anne Ford, daughter of Henry Ford 2d, board chairman of the Ford Motor Company, and Mrs. Deane Johnson of Los Angeles. Her husband is vice president of the Charles Evans Development Company, Inc., here. The child has been named Allegra. The Uziellis also have a 5yearold son, Alessandro.

title: Capitol Dispute: Waste in Waters
description: WASHINGTONThe Senate's water pollution control bill, voted unanimously in November, sets a goal of zero discharge for industrial pollutants into the nation's streams and lakes by 1985.

title: Campaign Aide Named
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 8  Gordon Machines of New Jersey has been appointed regional coordinator for Senator Edmund S. Muskie's Democratic Presidential campaign in Connecticut, it was learned today. Mr. MacInnes is on Senator Muskie's Washington campaign staff.

title: Phase 2: Residue of Trouble
description: By yearend many of the doubts and much of the confusion attending the Nixon economic program of wage and price controls had evaporated, but a residue of resentment by consumers and smallbusinessmen remained. They contended that the program favored the larger established union and business intereSts.

title: Laird for Budget Rise
description: WASHINGTON The next defense budget will rise as much as $4billion in expenditures, and $5billion to $6billion in budget authority, if Defdnse Secretary Melvin It Laird has his way.

title: Point of View
description: Strong and growing forces are at work in the United States endeavoring to turn the vision of Americans in ward. Repelled by our policy in Vietnam and taking for granted the assumption that no foreign power will present a serious military threat to the nation, these forces focus on the nation's domestic needs, implying that they can best be met if we turn our hacks on the rest of the world.

title: $44,268.20 Superfecta At Rockingham Park
description: SALEM, N. H., Jan. 8 (AP) An unidentified bettor won $44,267.20 for a $2 ticket on the superfecta last night as Rockingham Park opened a 105night harnessracing meeting.

title: Devaney Gets Pay Raise
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Jan. 8 (AP) The University of Nebraska Board of Regents approved a $3,000 pay increase today for its football coach and athletic director, Bob Devaney. Devaney's annual salary will now be raised from $32,000 to $35,000.

title: The World
description: As they left the Western White House at San Clemente, Calif., after two days of talks, President Nixon and Japanese Premier Eisaku Sato were all smiles. Mr. Nixon referred to a natural interdependence between the two nations and Mr. Sato talked of mutual trust. But behind the kind words, there had been tough bargaining in this fifth summit talk Mr. Nixon has had with allied leaders prior to his trips to Peking and Moscow.

title: CHAPOT'S MOUNT JUMPING VICTOR
description: READINGTON, N.J., Jan. 8Freddie, owned by Mrs. S. Lorillard of Far Hills, N.J., and ridden by Frank Chapot or the United States Equestrian Team, won the limit open jumper championship today, although he competed in only two of the three classes at the Four Seasons Farm horse show.

title: Medicine
description: Nobody's perfect. On that little truth rests a $2.7billionayear business  the sale of drugs for which you don't need a doctor's prescription. You just walk into any pharmacy, supermarket, or even candy store and buy a little something to medicate the human imperfectionof the moment: headache, cough, constipation, cold, dandruff, menstrual cramp, or  as the advertisements put it  the blahs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In a Point of View article Nov. 28, Dr. Frank Kristof made three points: there is no housing shortage in New York City, building abandonment and the flight of the middle class from older changing neighborhoods is caused by crime, and a black and Puerto Rican middle class will preside over the rebirth of what now appear to be dying neighborhoods.

title: Modest Gains Forecast For Garment Industry
description: For the apparel industry, last year showed some improvement over the depressed conditions in 1970, and a similar modest gain in real growth is anticipated for 1972.

title: Some Little Guys Profit in Recession
description: In many instances, smallbusiness men have been able to turn the recession to their advantage, interviews across the nation show, although others have suffered from the erosion in consumer confidence just as the industrial giants have.

title: Party's Treasury Low
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Jan. 8 (UPI)  The Conservative party of Kansas, one of the state's minor political parties, has reported a $141 balance in its treasury as of last Nov. 30.

title: All naked into the world of art
description: What's this? John le Carre mounting Parnassus? Leaving Leamas and Leiser behind in the squalid lowlands so that he can hobnob with Gide and Joyce and Mann? Ah well, it was bound to happen; so many admirers of The Spy Who Came in From the Cold, The Looking Glass War and A Small Town in Germany had remarked that their author was not only a brilliant plotter of espionage fiction, but a brilliant novelist, full stop. Now, as though to prove the merits of his most extravagant admirers most extravagant praise, le Carr has taken himself all naked into the world of art, has divested himself of spies, cold war machinations, the Berlin Wall, faceless victims and grand suspense.

title: New York
description: ALBANY  With all the skill and dispatch of a Raffles, the state, city and Federal Governments moved with almost indecent haste last week to relieve the taxpayers of still more loot.

title: Aerospace Unions to Sue Pay Board
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 8  The United Automobile Workers and the machinists union said today that they would sue the Pay Board over its rejection of their new contracts in the aerospace industry.

title: 38% OF FIRE CALLS FALSE HERE IN 71
description: Thirtyeight out of every 100 calls answered by Nev York City firemen last year were false alarms, Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery reported yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Miss Laura Mintz Student's Fiancee
description: MIDDLEBURY, Conn., Jan. 8  The engagement of Miss Laura Sue Mintz to Gary Peter Sklaver, son of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Sklaver, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Archie Mintz. Both families reside in Middlebury. A wedding next spring is planned.

title: Bridgeport Beats Iona
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Jan. 8Paul Schaum connected on 13 of 14 free throws in the second half tonight to lead Bridgeport to an 8983 victory, over Iona.

title: Jean T. Maier To Be Married To Bank Aide
description: NORTHBROOK, Pa., Jan. 8  Mr. and Mrs. Robert Edward Maier have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jean Therese Maier, to Fal de SaintPhalle, son of Thibaut de SaintPhalle, professor of international law and finance at the University of Geneva in Switzerland, and the late Mrs. Rosamond de SaintPhalle.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for, the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: LINER ELIZABETH IS SWEPT BY FIRE
description: HONG KONG, Sunday, Jan,  Fire raged through the former luxury liner Queen Elizabeth today while workers were aboard refitting the 83,600ton ship for a new career as a combination cruise ship and floating campus for a California college.

title: AFarmBelt Town Optimistic on '72
description: WATERLOO, Iowa  In this northeastern Iowa town of 75,000 people in the heart of the farm belt there seems to be a more openminded willingness to give President Nixon's economic stabilization program an opportunity to work than there is in the big cities on the East and West Coasts.

title: Nearly a Century of Communal Peace
description: TABOR, S. D. (AP)  Our wants are simple. We have food to eat, we have a place to sleep and we have friendly companionship. No one should ask more from life.

title: High School Rezoning for Bronx and Manhattan Is Proposed to Cut Racial Imbalance
Miss Edwards Gains Final In Jersey Squash Racquets
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 8Marigold Edwards of Pittsburgh, the No. 1 seeded player, advanced to the final of the New Jersey State women's squash racquets championship today, eliminating Wendy Zaharko, a Princeton University sophomore, 1015, 154, 1115, 157, 158.

title: GREEK CHIEF URGES FOES TO REPENT
description: ATHENS, Jan. 8  Premier George Papadopoulos today invited his political opponents to confess their past errors to the people, repent, and support his efforts to establish disciplined democracy in Greece.

title: FINDINGS RELEASED IN TENNIS WALKOUT
description: The United States Lawn Tennis Association released this week the findings of its disciplinary committee on the refusal of Mrs. Billie Jean King and Rosemary CasaIs to play the women's singles final at the Pacific Southwest open championships in Los Angeles Sept. 26.

title: On the Titanic, noblesse oblige
description: There is a sort of gloating respect that even quite radical Americans reserve for the period of their history associated with the Big Spenders. Supercilious Europeans can point out that Americans have precious little history. A bit of extravagance by the families of Vanderbilt, Astor, Morgan and Hearst must compensate for centuries of excess by the crowned and titled heads of Europe. But I do not think that this is the true answer. Something in the American character even now yearns towards the idea of conspicuous consumption. The Vanderbilts and their ilk performed a vital social function by pandering to this appetite in the fantasy lives of their generation at far smaller cost than their modern equivalents, the space program and the arms race.

title: Johnson Triumphs in $100,000 Bowling
description: Dan Johnson of Akron had been Walking around with his fingers stuck into a raw white potato to heal his blisters, but yesterday he shot the eyes out of the new lanes specially erected in the Felt Forum to win the $100,000 Bowling Proprietors Association of America United States open tournament

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Davis Favors Eventual Cut In Forces of Sky Marshals
description: The head of the Govern, ment's antihijacking program, Benjamin O. Davis Jr., said yesterday that his office had recommended an eventual cutback in the sky marshal force provided ontheground protective measures were bolstered.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The article on roof water tanks [City's towering Profile Berated, Nov. 161 was amusing and interesting, but in its comparison between the roof tank and the tankless pumping system it was onesided in favor of the tankless system. In balance, there are three important facts of which every engineer, architect and builder should be aware.

title: The Knapp Commission Didn't Know It Couldn't Be Done
description: IT is said that there is a code of silence among police that is greater than the omerta of the underworld, veteran cop and police investigator Captain Daniel McGowan testified at the Knapp Commission hearings. And, as every cop down to beat level knew until last Octoberand one very gabby one unwittingly said into a Knapp investigator's concealed transmitterthe commission was a joke. They [the Knapp Commission], the cop rattled on in the tape made last May, have no power. None at all. All they can do is recommend to the police department. They end next month. The end of June they run out of money.

title: Penn Downs Harvard, 8152, and Fashions 30th Straight Ivy League Victory
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 8 (AP) Sixthranked Penn rolled to its 30th straight Ivy League victory tonight by defeating Harvard, 8152.

title: New York
description: Shocking... alarming... astonishing. That was the way Dr. David Bernstein, acting executive director of the Citizen Budget Commission, last week described the estimates of how much the New York City real estate tax is about to rise. Based on figures prepared by Controller Abraham A. Beame on the city's debt for 197273, the commission  an independent civic group with an exceptional record over the years in predicting tax rates  estimated that the real estate tax was going up by a record 8.87 per cent, or 53 cents, from $5.97 to $8.50 for each $100 of assessed value.

title: Clue to China's Strength
description: In his television interview last week, President Nixon stressed the importance of a renewed PekingWashington dialogue before China becomes a superpower with an abundance of modern weapons. A day earlier, however, the traditional New Year's Day editorial Peking's chief publications had an altogether different emphasis, stressing that China is a developing country with a relatively backward economy. The pattern international relations for the rest of the twentieth century depends in part on the rate at which the Chinese People's Republic advances from its present comparative weakness, economically and militarily, to the superpower parity position whose future likelihood haunts Moscow's policymakers even more than Washington's.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The World
description: I regret very much that in one year, three months and three days I did very little.

title: Deborah Gould to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Herman Gould of Bayside, Queens, have annouced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Deborah Dee Gould, to Howard Jay Bresin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Millard Bresin of Oceanside, L.I. The future bride is a junior at Syracuse University, of which her fiance is a graduate. He is a student at the University of Pennsylvania's School of Dental Medicine.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: For Ages 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10..; The Beggar King of China; By Dale Carlson. Illustrated by John Gretzer. 185 pp. Atheneum. $5.95. (Ages 10 to 14)
description: This convincing historical novel based on an episode in the history of Chinathe overthrow of Mongol rule that led to the establishment of the Ming Dynasty in 1368reminds one that history repeats itself and that the Communist revolution led by Mao Tsetung, a farmer's son, is merely the most recent upheaval led by peasants. The narrative centers on Chu Yuanchang, who later became Emperor Hungwu, and follows his career from age 17, when he saw his parents die of hunger, to his ultimate victory 20 years later.

title: Mass Transit Growing Across Nation
description: It may not seem so to hapless commuters stuck on the Lexington Avenue IRT or the Hollywood Freeway, but help, like the cavalry in a John Wayne Western, is on the way.

title: Joan Patricia Maddy Married To Capt. William R. White
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 8  Miss Joan Patricia Maddy and Capt. William Richard White, U.S.A., Medical Corps, were married here this morning in St. Timothy's Roman Catholic Chapel by the bridegroom's cousin, the Rev. Joseph Gleeson, who also celebrated the nuptial mass. The Rev. Thomas Guinan assisted.

title: Dispute Imperils Gulf stream Opening
description: MIAMI, Jan. 8Gulfstream Park is scheduled to start a 40day meeting one week from Monday, but there is some question whether the track will open on time.

title: Gunmen Rob Supermarket
description: Two gunmen robbed Bohack supermarket at 2233 Flatbush Avenue in the Flatlands section of Brooklyn last night of $3,696. 50 in cash. The police said they forced the store manager to open the safe and then fled with the money. No one was injured.

title: Gardens
description: TWOYEAROLD Matthew T. Hanson of Stony Brook, L. I., turns up his nose at canned baby vegetables. He's been raised exclusively on fresh produce from his parents garden, starting with pureed peas.

title: On the Side of the Angels
description: ON the face of it, there is absolutely nothing about director Gordon Davidson to suggest the storm and rage of controversy. A man of uncommon gentleness, he exudes an air of tranquility, even passivity. But beneath the gentleness, behind a face that is as sensitive as it is engaging, demons are clearly stirring.

title: TWO CHILDREN DIE IN BROOKLYN FIRE
description: Two children were burned to death yesterday when they were trapped by a locked scissor gate on the fireescape window of their thirdfloor bedroom in the East New York Section of Brooklyn.

title: Ben Barka Figure Freed
description: PARIS, Jan. 8 (AP)  Antoine Lopez, a French intelligence agent convicted of organizing the kidnapping in Paris and presumed murder of an exiled Moroccan leftist leader, Mehdi Ben Barka, has been granted amnesty after serving slightly more than half of an eightyear prison sentence, the Government announced today. It said Lopez, 47, years olds, was released on Christmas Eve, under amnesty by President Pompidou.

title: Freeman Named as Coach
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 8 (UPI)Jim Freeman, a former world recordholding sprinter, today became the first black head coach in the history of the University of Louisville. Freeman's appointment as head track coach was announced by the school's athletic director, Bernard Hickman. Freeman will succeed Tollie Bibb, who resigned for personal reasons.

title: Et Al.
description: The authors, Chris Clark, a dean at Bryn Mawr, and Sheila Rush, Director of the Community Law Offices in New York, both lawyers, both black, address themselves to Whitey. Advice on terms (Negro, Black, AfroAmerican); what not to talk about at parties (The Problem  you don't want to talk about mortgage payments either); general comments on interracial affairs and the motives of those involved. This tells it straight and perceptively. One does wish for more irony and wit: the usual social intercourse between the races in America contains, after all, rather a large dash of absurdity (for which wit and irony are good solvents).

title: Jill Leslie Dworkin Is Betrothed
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio, Jan. 8  The engagement of Miss Jill Leslie Dworkin to Mark Elliott Talisman has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Harry J. Dworkin, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mrs. Julius J. Talisman of Warrensville and the late Mr. Talisman.

title: 76% of Freshmen In a Survey Plan A Presidential Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  Threefourths of the nation's 1.6 million college freshmen plan to vote in the Presidential election in November, according to a survey conducted by the American Council on Education.

title: FUNDS FOR GIFTS SENT TO NEEDIEST
description: Rochelle Goldman of East Northport, L. I., decided not to send. Christmas gifts to her eight junior high school teachers last month. Instead, she sent a check in their honor to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Sapporo Night Clubs Set for Olympics
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Jan. 8 (UPI)  About 5,000 night club hostesses gowned from minidress to kimono are ready to entertain visitors to the 1972 Winter Olympics in northern Japan.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Americans Reaffirm Faith in Technology
description: ALTHOUGH technology has come to be regarded as a mixed blessing there are still Americans who be lieve that many of the nation's social and economic ills can be treated. only with a carefully administered dose of more technology  more research and better machines, new applications of Yankee ingenuity.

title: Corvair Damages Asked
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 8 (AP)  A suit asking that the General Motors Corporation be required to fix allegedly faulty exhausts on all Californiaowned Corvairs and pay $1,000 damages to each of about 80,000 California Corvair owners has been filed in Superior Court.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: False Policeman Spotted
description: DETROIT, Jan. 8 (UPI)  Earl Jones, 21 years old, was arrested on charges of posing as an undercover policeman after he was spotted by two real undercovxer policemen yesterday. The police said that Mr. Jones had been posing as a policeman and shaking down area merchants for about six months.

title: Diane Drops Back In
description: TWELVE years ago, at 21, with an Academy Award nomination for Peyton Place behind her, Diane Varsi ran away from Hollywood, a promising career and fame and fortune, and settled into herself to work out some inner vision. In her years away from filmsshe didn't start out to be an actress and she doesn't really care whether or not she performsshe taught, wrote (poetry and a screenplay), took photographs and cared for her children.

title: Point of View
description: The United States is at a watershed in Federal tax matters. Heavy reliance on income taxes is coming to an end, and in the future, the Federal Government will depend increasingly on regressive, flatrate taxes on payrolls and sales.

title: 2 FloridaBased Companies Temporarily Barred in Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 8 (AP)  Two Floridabased companies that state Attorney General Crawford Martin says engaged in deceptive trade practices have been barred temporarily from doing business in Texas,

title: Article 4  No Title
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Jan. 8 (AP)With Ernie Johnson leading a secondhalf surge, Michigan pulled from a 3836 halftime deficit today to lead nearly the entire second half and down Michigan State, 8375, in their Big Ten basketball openers.

title: They Danced the Csardas at the Plaza and Two Schools Benefited
description: The Piarist Ball, the oldest of the city's Hungarian balls, observed its 20th anniversary Friday night at the Plaza Hotel and as the 600 guests danced csardas, polkas, waltzes and rock, one of the honorary chairmen sat at a ringside table and said somewhat bitterly that, as far as she was concerned, it was the last one.

title: Financial Woes Beset French Press
description: PARIS; Jan. 8  The Government's decision this week to provide a $3million subsidy to keep newsprint costs down reflects the deteriorating financial position of France's daily newspapers.

title: Washington Notes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  Despite its big debt (more than $9million) and its difficulties in raising a war chest for the 1972 campaign, the Democratic party has turned a cold shoulder on a new fundraising idea.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Translated from the Chinese
description: This is the year of the Chinesein fashion. It all began in Paris, not in Peking, and long before those famous tabletennis games and Henry Kissinger's trips. The first sign was the Chinese worker's suit that appeared on the French scene last summer. And now there something Chinese for every Occidental. The choice ranges from casual workers suits bright colors to luxurious gowns and silken slit robes over straight pants.

title: The World
description: TEHERAN  As tens of thousands of Iranians deported from neighboring Iraq clustered in tent communities along the border, Iran's stylish Empress Farah arrived on the scene last Wednesday and spoke with blackshawled women among the refugees. Meanwhile, the Empress's husband, the Shah, was accusing Iraq of staging the deportations to create a diversion and provide an excuse for not being more vigorous in attacking Israel. They are afraid of the Israelis, he was quoted as saying.

title: TORE ME UP
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Key Democrats Differ
description: WASHINGTON  The Democrats always want to put another nickel in the pot, said a prominent academic economist recently, and the Republicans always want to take another nickel out.

title: Complain Call the F. T C.
description: Twenty or thirty times a day the telephone rings at the Federal Trade Commission office here with calls from unhappy consumers.

title: Heart Recipient Gains
description: STANFORD, Calif., Jan. 8 (UPI)  James Casper, 32 years old, of Canton, Ill., was in satisfactory condition today after receiving a new heart yesterday in Stanford Medical Center's 39th transplant operation.

title: The World
description: They loved her in Monrovia.

title: Chiefs to Oppose Bombers In Roller Derby Today
description: Charlie O'Connell, the playercoach of the Chiefs, will be skating against his former team for the first time in New York this season.

title: Defense Contract Given Columbia Despite Inquiry
description: The Department of Defense has agreed to renew a $2million contract with Columbia

title: New York
description: In midafternoon last Tuesday, a young black man pushed a savingsdeposit slip across a counter to Mrs. Catherine Sweet, a loan teller at a Chemical Bank branch in Times Square. On the slip were the words: This is a stickup. Give me all your money or I'll shoot.

title: BedStuy Children Learn How to Nurture Trees
description: It began with a, fight to save an 87yearold magnolia tree. Now hundreds of new striplings  sycamores, ginkgos and even a few Dutch elms line the streets of BedfordStuyvesant. But in this city, young trees die easily if not nurtured. So community youngsters are learning to help these trees survive.

title: Keel for Submarine Laid
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Jan. 8 (AP)  The keel was laid here today for the first in a new class of nuclear submarines specifically designed to hunt and destroy enemy submarines. the ship is the U.S.S. Los Angeles, SSN688, whose expected top speed is classified but is thought to be one and a half to two times as fast as the 30knot Sturgeon class she will succeed.

title: Review 1  No Title
description: INDUSTRIAL SECURITY MANAGEMENT: A COST EFFECTIVE APPROACH.. By Richard J..Healy and Dr. Timothy J. Walsh. 274 pages. Ainerican Management Association. $15.75.

title: Miss Patrick Engaged to Officer
description: JAMESPORT, L. I., Jan. 8  Mr. and Mrs. Charles C. Patrick have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Millicent Marie Patrick, to Lieut. Colin Miles Gershon, U.S.N.R., son of Mr. and Mrs. A. Arnold Gershon of Shelter Island.

title: The Example of Bangladesh
description: Arriving in London yesterday after his release from Pakistan, Sheik Mujibur Ralunan immediately appealed for international recognition of his new nation, Bangladesh. The reluctance of most countries to recognize Bangladesh arises from the fact that Indian troops are still occupying its territory. This is a reasonable and, one hopes, temporary condition. But there is a certain irrationality in the coolness with which many governments continue to treat the Bengali secession.

title: Forecast Favorable On Pension Reform
description: I think it's fair to say, said Michael S. Gordon, a Senate aide who has been in the forefront of the battle to reform the private pension field, that the outlook for pension reform is now more favorable than it has ever been.

title: Marcie Louie Wins
description: STATELINE, Nev., Jan. 8 (AP)Marcie Louie of San Francisco, Karen Krantzcke of Australia and Wendy Gilchrist, an Australian living in New York, scored opening victories in the British Motors women's professional tennis qualifying round today.

title: L.I.U. Beats C.W. Post
description: GREENVALE, LI., Jan. 8 (AP)  Fred Gibson, Walter Jones and Harvey Smith accounted for 62 points, leading Long Island University to a 7966 triumph over C.W. Post tonight.

title: The Nation
description: The special delivery letters arrived at several Chicago and San Francisco newspapers and television stations Thursday night. A look at the first paragraph was enough to spark hurried calls to police in those cities and in New York. Signed by a group calling itself Movement in Amerika, the handprinted letters warned that during July, 1971, nine unusual prototype bombs were planted in nine different banks across the country.... in safety deposit boxes in the vaults. The bombs, the letters said, were timed to go off seven months after they had been planted. The letters listed the banks.

title: Whatever Became of The Bridge Over the Sound?
description: ALBANYLike the Emperor's clothes, the Governor's Long Island Sound bridge study has still not been seen, and there is a popular fascination over its absence.

title: Canton Pate 3d Plans to Marry Anne C. Nelson
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn., Jan. 8  Mr. and Mrs. Sanford Eugene Nelson have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss. Anne Carol Nelson, to Carlton Overton Pate 3d. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Pate Jr. of Greenwich.

title: Britain
description: LONDONQuite the most obvious point about the United States economy on the threshold of 1972 which hits the British observer is the change which is taking place in its relationship with the The second most obvious point is a definite turning inward of the focus of economic policy toward domestic problems and away from international problems: a greater emphasis on the need to stimulate the domestic economy, to reduce unemployment, to reduce price inflation and to improve the economic and social environment.

title: CITY GOVERNMENT OUTPAYS INDUSTRY
description: Government workers in New York City and its suburbs are generally paid more and get more paid time off than their neighbors who work in private industry, according to the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Oil Replay
description: The historymaking agreements sigrted last year in Teheran by the international oil companies and the petroleum producing countries were characterized then by industry executives as having achieved peace in our time.

title: FRESHMEN GIVEN VARSITY STATUS IN MAJOR SPORT
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Jan. 8Major colleges were given permission today to use freshmen on their varsity football and basketball teams, starting with the 1972 football season and the 197273 basketball season.

title: The State Assembly And Senate Slate Series of Hearings
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8  Following are public hearings scheduled for the near future by committees of the Senate and the Assembly:

title: Priests Play It by Ear In Bay Ridge Innovation
description: A Roman Catholic parish without school or church buildings has been formed in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn as part of a diocesan decentralization effort.

title: Nixon RockThrowing Case
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Jan. 8 (AP)  The books have been closed with a suspended sentence for the last of five defendants in a rockthrowing incident in 1970 when President Nixon was campaigning here. Four others were sentenced earlier on misdemeanor charges. On Wednesday, Municipal Court Judge William J. Harris suspended sentence for Ronald J. Cosetti.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Canucks Triumph, 51
description: BLOOMINGTON, Mimi., Jan. 8Consecutive goals by Rich Lemieux and Orland Kurtenbach in a wild, decisive second period tonight powered the Vancouver Canucks to a 51 victory over the Minnesota North Stars.

title: Record Profits, Spurred by ElectionYear Politics, Foreseen by Many
description: Will 1972 follow last year's corporateprofit upswing, duplicating the breakout after the 1958 recession? In 1959, earnings, which had slumped in 1958 to $18.9billion, soared to a thenrecord of $23.8billion.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Iowa State Interests Listed
description: AMES, Iowa, Jan. 8 (UPI)  A survey here indicated that Iowa State University students were interested in cultural change, sex and bicycling, in that order.

title: Reader's Report
description: The Russians were first in space with Sputnik, but they are far behind the Americans in pornography. In an effort to close the obscenity gap, Olympia Press (if we are to take them at their word) now brings us the first authentic erotic novel written in the Soviet Union, an underground, clandestine production, of course. As a gnomish type named Matsa puts it: I'm convinced that Russia needs this sort of thing more than any other country... for we have never had this sort of thing up till now.

title: Brown Point Mark Falls
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Jan. 8 (AP)Arnie Berman, a 6foot7inch senior, set a Brown University basketball career record tonight, hitting for 38 points in leading the Bruins to a 10188 Ivy League victory over Cornell.

title: Grenade Kills 9 and Wounds 110 A t Youth Rally in South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Jan. 9 (AP)  A terrorist hurled a grenade into a Governmentsponsored youth rally in coastal city of Quinhon last night, killing nine teachers and students and wounding 110 other persons. The terrorist escaped.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Expertise of City Agencies Used in Lindsay Campaign
Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Hospital Reports McNamee Tale After Knockout Here
description: Dennis McNarnee, stopped in the 10th round of a fight at Madison Square Garden Friday night, was reported in fair condition yesterday at St. Care's Hospital, where he is being kept for observation.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayMiddle Island, Middle Island Arena, Rocky Point Road, Middle Island, L. I. Regular and green working hunters, intermediate jumpers, equitation. 9:30 A.M.

title: Religion
description: Not many works are produced in Boston and banned elsewhere. But the UnitarianUniversalist Association may have come up with just such an item, in the form of a controversial new sex education program now being implemented in about 250 of its Sunday schools.

title: Brooklyn, Though It Won't Host Chess Tournaments, Provided Many Stars
Feud Stymies Housing Start In Brighton
description: Just off the boardwalk in the Brighton Beach section of Brooklyn sits a blocksquare parking lot that in its emptiness demonstrates the tangle of difficulties that can keep desperately needed housing from being built here.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Assessments of domestic economic developments in 1971 tend to begin with the word despite or the phrase In, spite of.

title: Eating Out Is Much More Than Going to a Restaurant
description: This year the food industry, like the horseman in Stephen Leacock's Gertrude the Governess, will ride madly off in all directionsor so say several food company executives whose business it is to discern trends. Among the paradoxes:

title: Drug Use Besets an American School in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 8  The use of drugs by students at the Americanrun International School here is causing serious concern not only to the American community but to the Hong Kong authorities as well.

title: M'GOVERN BIDS U.S. SET PULLOUT DATE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  Senator George McGovern said today that a conversation he had this week with a North Vietnamese representative at the Paris peace talks had convinced him that American prisoners of war would be released if the United States set a definite date for ending all military operations fit Indochina,

title: Local citizens lose to oil interests at Santa Barbara
description: On Jan. 28, 1969, workers finished drilling the fifth oil well from a platform located in the Santa Barbara Channel off the California coast. As they were attempting to pump in drilling mud to restore a pressure equilibrium, oil locked beneath the ocean floor erupted, and the Santa Barbara oil spill had begun.

title: Zoo Workers Are Led On a WildGoat Chase
description: A 60pound wild goat that escaped from tits cage at the Children's Zoo in Prospect Park in Brooklyn eluded captors for an hour yesterday morning as it zigzagged through the park and nearby streets.

title: For Ages 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10..; Baby Baboon; By Elizabeth Emanuel. Illustrated by Bernard Garbutt. 62 pp. Golden Gate. $4.50. (Ages 8 to 12)
description: A straightforward rather dry account of the first year in the life of an Olive baboon in Kenya. Starting with the birth of the baby, the book first covers the life style of the baboon troop and the mother's relationship to her offspring and others of the troop. The last half traces the weakening maternal tie and the increasing exposure of the baby to its social and physical environment. It's hard to tell for whom this book is designed. In appearance it seems to be for the under10 set, but the presentation is better suited for those over 10.

title: Carolyn P. Walker Prospective Bride
description: SALISBURY, Conn., Jan. 8  Mrs. Alfred E. Brewer and Jeffrey P. Walker have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carolyn Place Walker, to Edward F. Evans, son of Mr. and Mrs. H. Earl Evans of Mountainside, N.J., and Arlington, Vt.

title: MANHATTAN IN BID FOR TRACK HONORS
