title: Sonics Win 4th in Row
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 11 (AP)The Seattle SuperSonics went on scoring splurge midway through the fourth period tonight to beat the Houston Rockets, 141 126, for their fourth straight victory.

title: 4 Democrats Give G.O.P. Jersey Assembly Control
description: TRENTON, Jan. 11In a surprising and dramatic rever sal, the Republican minority, succeeded in organizing major ity control of the New Jersey Assembly in a tumultuous opening session here tonight.

title: Nubar Gulbenkian, Oil Millionaire, Dies
description: Nubar Gulbenkian, the flam boyant financier who was one of the wealthiest men in the world, died Monday night at the English Hospital of Can nes, on the French Riviera, of a heart attack. He was 75 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Negotiators in the twoweek old Yonkers teachers strike resumed bargaining yesterday after a session that began at 11:30 A.M. Sunday and ended at 4:30 this morning had failed to bring agreement.

title: M'GOVERN RETIRES FROM THE POLICE
description: The last of the six top police officials under former Commis sioner Howard R. Leary an nounced his retirement yester day after 32 years on the force.

title: Democratic Hopefuls Jockeying for the Reform Group's Support
description: New York supporters of Mayor Lindsay, Senator Ed mund S. Muskie and former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy are working hard to head off an endorsement of Senator George McGovern's Presiden tial candidacy by the liberal New Democratic Coalition.

title: Yarborough to Enter the Senate Primary in Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 11for mer United States Senator Ralph W. Yarborough an nounced today that he would be a candidate for Senator in the Democratic primary May 6. He said that national conditions and the declining number of Democratic Senators had made him decide to run.

title: Saigon Pulls Back Forces In Krek Area of Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 11A South Vietnamese mili tary spokesman confirmed reports today that Saigon was pulling its forces out of Krek in eastern Cambodia in a move ap parently intended to bolster the Government's defenses around the capital. The Government is known to believe that Saigon may be a target of a Commu nist offensive in midFebruary at the time of the Lunar New Year holidays.

title: Footprints May Prevent Addict From Getting Extra Methadone
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 Heroin addicts receiving metha done treatment may soon be identified and, thus, prevented from obtaining extra doses, by photographs of the whorls on the soles of their right feet.

title: PRINCETON SNAPS PENN STRING, 6956
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 11 Princeton's young, disciplined basketball team waged a tight defense and controlled a delib erate offense perfectly to upset Pennsylvania, 6956, tonight, snapping the Quakers' Ivy League record winning streak at 30 games.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Some may consider this a breach of confidence, but, as Howard Cosell would say, reportorial honesty compels the disclosure that Joe Frazier is about to defend the havyweight championship of the world against Terry Daniels a former defensive back on the Southern Methodist freshman football team who does needlepoint on the side.

title: KING TRIBUTE ENDING WITH MONDAY RITES
description: The Rev, Wyatt Tee Walker, Harlem pastor and former aide to the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., said yesterday that a weeklong celebration of the slain black leader's birth day would culminate in a serv ice next Monday, two days after the actual birth date.

title: Deadlock on Submarines Said to Persist in Vienna
description: VIENNA, Jan. 11The United States and the Soviet Union reportedly remain unable to break their deadlock on the crucial issue of limiting submarinebased nuclear missiles in the face of rising pressures on both sides for a new buildup of undersea arsenals.

title: Liberals Criticize Lobbying and Financial Reports
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 11  The National Association of Laity, an organization of liberal Ro man Catholic laymen, charged today that the United States Catholic bishops were issuing incomplete and misleading fi nancial reports. At the same time, the association said, the bishops are spending more than $6million a year lobbying to obtain tax support for Catholic schools.

title: NEED TO PREDICT IN REPORTS SEEN
description: James A. Russell, partner in the accounting firm of Ernst & Ernst, predicted here yesterday at a merchants' convention that projections of sales and earnings and future corporate appraisals would ultimately be required in all company prospectuses for stock issues and financial pur poses in the United States.

title: John J. Fenley, 67, Official Of Electrical Union Local 3
description: John J. Fenley, a vice presi sident of Local 3 of the Interna tional Brotherhood of Electric Workers, died on Monday, ap parently of a heart attack, near the midtown Port Authority bus terminal, He was 67 years old and lived at 253 Hoke Avenue, Oceanside, L. I.

title: Schick Votes Name Change And Issue of Debentures
description: Stockholders of Schick Elec tric, Inc., at yesterday's annual meeting in Lancaster, Pa., ap proved management's proposal to change the name of Schick, Inc., and to a financing pro gram to provide the company with up to $6million through issuance of new convertible de bentures.

title: Michigan State Wins
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Jan. 11 (UPI)Michigan State, led by Mike Robinson's 26 points, rallied for an 8376 Big 10 vic tory over Wisconsin tonight.

title: Humphrey Assesses Race
description: TAMPA, Fla., Jan. 11 (AP) Senator Humphrey said today that Florida's primary was a national primary in a very real sense and that if he finished close to the top it would give his candidacy momentum.

title: Operation Snowy Beach
description: Maine's Reid State Park in Georgetown, at the mouth of the Kennebec River, is an ecological gem sensitively adapted to the diverse interests of naturalists and of those who just like to splash in the ocean, be on a beach or wander in the woods.

title: Elizabeth Howkins, Editor, Dies; Headed Times's Women's News
description: Elizabeth Penrose Howkins, former womens news editor of The New York Times, died Mon day evening of pneumonia at New York Hospital. She was 71 years old and was the wife of Col. Walter Ashby Howkins, a financial consultant.

title: U.S. Bars Immediate Departure Of a Russian Who Tried Suicide
description: The State Department said yesterday that a Soviet exchange student who slashed his wrists and throat while being driven to Kennedy Inter national Airport Sunday night on his way to a Moscowbound flight would not be permitted to leave the country until he had been interviewed by Federal of ficials.

title: Nassau's Employes To Get 5% Raises In a OneYear Pact
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 11 Nassau County employes will receive a 5 per cent pay in crease under the terms of a contract settlement announced today by the county and the Civil Service Employees As sociation.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Flying back to Washington from San Clemente with the President this week, Secretary of the Treasury John B. Con nally told newsmen that legis lation to devalue the dollar, by raising the official price of gold from $35 to $38 an ounce, would be submitted to Con gress during the first week of February. Will this be the occasion for a big protec tionist demonstra tion in Congress? Earlier, when the Administration was holding out against a dollar devaluation in terms of gold, it used to warn foreigners not to press because Congress would turn a request for a dollar devaluation into a Christmas tree of protection ism.

title: Coach Bryant Is Taken III During Lecture in Florida
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Jan. 11 (AP)Paul (Bear) Bryant, the Alabama football coach, be came ill during a lecture to day.

title: Gov. Love Endorses Nixon
description: DENVER, Jan. 11 (UPI) Gov. John A. Love of Colorado, a supporter of Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller of New York in 1968, endorsed President Nixon today for reelection. Governor Love said Mr. Nixon's policies were aimed at a generation of peace.

title: Gordon Clarke, Actor, Is Dead; A Familiar Figure in TV Ads
description: Gordon B. Clarke, a stage actor who in recent years had appeared in television commer cials, died of a coronary attack yesterday. He was stricken at The Lambs, 130 West 44th Street, and was taken to Poly clinic Hospital.

title: DOROTHY FIELDS IS FETED IN SONG
description: A Tribute to Dorothy Fields, which involved not only Miss Fields' songs but Miss Fields herself, was held on Monday evening at the Top of the Gate.

title: Sheppard in Piano Debut Here; Interpretations Individualistic
description: Craig Sheppard gave a piano recital at the Metropolitan Mu Seum of Art on Monday night, and throughout the evening his instrument's pedalaction clat tered like a stick run along a wooden fence.

title: Yugoslays' Thirst for Wine Keeps Exports to Minimum
description: SPLIT, YugoslaviaNikola Viceic is a master wine maker. On the island of Hvar, 2 hours by slow ferry from this Adriatic coast town, he watches over the quality of his wines.

title: He Bought $200,000 Stock for $0
description: A 19yearold college sopho more apparently parlayed a per suasive voice on the telephone into a $200,000 stake in the stock market in December with out ever putting up a penny in cash.

title: Executive Changes
description: Eugene R. Black, former chairman of the Interna tional Bank for Reconstruction and Development, and Robert Ellsworth, former assistant to President Nixon, have been named directors of Kinney Serv ices, Inc. Mr. Black retired from the World Bank in 1962. Mr. Ellsworth was United States Ambassador to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization from 1969 to 1971. He is now with Lazard Frres & Co.

title: Ungovernable Monster
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association's decision to allow firstyear college students to play varsity foot ball and basketball is merely the latest in a long string of surrenders to professionalism and commercialism in college sports. It is ironical that faculty representatives of major colleges who rammed this change through the recent N.C.A.A. convention should claim that the conse quent elimination of freshman teams would save money.

title: CHANGE APPROVED IN TRADING OF GAS
description: The membership of the LPG (liquefied propane gas) Associ ates of the New York Cotton Exchange yesterday adopted what they described as a sub stantially changed propane gas futures contract that will be come effective Feb. 1.

title: BAY STATE COURT DISBARS A JUDGE
description: BOSTON, Jan. 11A Superior Court judge, accused of taking a bribe in 1962 to arrange a suspended sentence for a con victed stock swindler, was dis barred today by the Massachu setts Supreme Judicial Court. Another judge implicated in the case was censured.

title: Nets' Late Comeback Beats Stars, 110104
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Jan. 11The key baskets, free throws, passes, steak and re bounds were made by the New York Nets in the closing min utes tonight, and those plays brought them a 110104 vic tory over the Utah Stars before crowd of 5,061 at Island Gar dens.

title: GLAMOUR ISSUES LEAD STOCK RISE
description: The young bull market of 1972 thundered along yester day, to the surprise of many Wall Street analysts who had been predicting a pausethat refreshes consolidation.

title: Blazers Defeat Bullets
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 11 (UPI)Sidney Wicks hit 14 of his 22 points in the third peri od tonight to propel the Port land Trail Blazers to a 114106 victory the Baltimore Bullets. Archie Clark had 30 points and Wes Unsold had 29 rebounds for the Bullets.

title: 2 Football Players Cleared By Grand Jury in Georgia
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Jan. 11 (UPI) A special Cobb County grand jury ended a weeklong investi gation today by exonerating two Atlanta Falcon football players involved in a raid.

title: LAKERS SET BACK PISTONS, 123103
description: DETROIT, Jan. 11 (UPI)  Wilt Chamberlain scored 29 points, including his 12,000th field goal, and the Los Angeles Lakers got 18 straight points in the third period for a Cobo Arena record tonight as the Lakers beat the Detroit Pistons, 123103.

title: A Love Affair With Ice
description: Madison Square Garden has housed more splendiferous rink revues than the 32d edi tion of Ice Capades. But few recent ice shows have achieved the same tonic ef fect and balance. Last night's opening was pitched warmly and expertly at the families thronging the huge arena. The love affair was mutual.

title: Bridge: Reputation as Hard Loser Puts Partner at Disadvantage
description: A great veteran of the New York bridge scene re cently moved from Long Is land to Florida. Abe Gold stein, in his 70th year, was not, however, contemplating retirement, for he is continu ing in his new home the dy namic style of bridge teach ing that has endeared him to thousands of students in the last three decades.

title: Faulk of U.S. Captures 2 Matches in N. Zealand
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 11 (AP)Steve Faulk of Madisonville, La., scored two victories today in the North Island tennis championships. He defeated Don McLeod of New Zealand, 61, 63, in the first round and then whipped John Sutherland, another New Zea lander, 64, 62.

title: South Asian Irony
description: The many disastrous aspects of President Nixon's policies in the IndiaPakistan conflict have masked the main irony disclosed by the Anderson papers. It is that the NixonKissinger approach, favoring Pakistan over India, helped bring about precisely what it was their chief objective to forestall: a Soviet victory and a major increase in Soviet influence in the subcontinent and the Indian Ocean.

title: Laotians Report Losses
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 11 (UPI)  Government military sources today reported the loss of key positions in both north ern and southern Laos and said the military situation was de teriorating rapidly.

title: U.N. COUNCIL TO HOLD A SESSION IN AFRICA
description: UNITED NATIONS, Jan. 11 The Security Council agreed today to hold a special session in Africa some time between Jan. 20 and Feb. 20.

title: More Broadway Shows Add Matinees
description: A growing number of Broadway stage shows are offering three or more mati nees a week, instead of the traditional two, in pursuit of larger boxoffice receipts.

title: L.S.U. Ignores Bomb
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Jan. 11 (UPI)Louisiana State officials passed off a bomb threat as a hoax, declined to order the L.S.U. gymnasium cleared and Alabama went an to down the Tigers, 10180, on the 22point performances of Wendell Hud son and Alan House. Police had urged that the basketball game be interrupted for a bomb search, but the L.S.U. officials refused.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A total of 700,000 shares of Dana Corporation common stock reached the market yes terday at $34 after negotia tion with a Merrill Lynch un derwriting gorup. The shares of the producer of components and parts for the transportation industry were sold by the Charles A. Dana Foundation.

title: Padraic Colum, 90, Irish Poet, Essayist and Folklorist, Dead
description: Padraic Colum, the Irish poet, playwright, essayist and novel ist, died last evening at the Parkway Pavilion, a nursing home in Enfield, Conn., where he had been since he suffered a stroke in the summer of 1970. He was 90 years old.

title: Man in the News
description: VALLETTA, Malta, Jan. 7 Every morning the embat tled Prime Minister of Malta, Dom Mintoff, braces himself for yet another round in his running duel with Britain by swimming in the Mediter ranean.

title: Camera Goes Under Cover
description: LAKE GROVE, L. I., Jan. 11 (UPI) Three gunmen made sure that an overhead camera did not record their $12,000 holdup here this morning. Ac cording to Suffolk County po lice, one of the men brought along a bed sheet, which he threw over a camera at the Central Federal Savings and Loan Association office on Nesconset Highway.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Recent articles in both the daily Times and The Week In Review of Dec. 26 suggested that President Nix on's decision to liberalize the oil im port program by 100,000 barrels per day east of the Rocky Mountains in 1972 was a victory for East Coast consumers. While I welcome any lib eralization of the oil import program in response to the continuing urgings of East Coast consumers, I feel that we should all understand that the President's recent actions will not benefit those consumers at all.

title: Thirty Years to Build an Ark
description: BIRMINGHAM, Mich.  Probably twenty years of intensive, honest ef fort will be required for Americans to bury the corpse of the era from which we are now emerging. It was an era of want in the midst of plenty, of war while pursuing peace, and the destruc tion of imperishable values. All these were reflected in an economy which long since has served its purpose.

title: Cable TV Gets $2.5Million and Capital Center
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The Ford Foundation, an important catalyst in the Federal Govern ment's new policies encourag ing cable television, announced today a $2.5million grant to help city and state governments get the most out of the develop ing medium.

title: Racial Tension Rises in Baton Rouge as Versions of Shootout That Killed Four Vary
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Jan. 11  Armed riot troops remained garrisoned in this Mississippi River city today as racial ten sions mounted following a shootout in the streets yester day that killed two white po licemen and two black mili tants and left 31 persons in jured.

title: Soviet Recognition Seen
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 11The de cisions by East Germany and Bulgaria to recognize Bangla desh are expected here to be followed by similar action by the Soviet Government. There was no indication when this might happen.

title: RATES DOWN AGAIN IN CREDIT MARKET
description: The credit marks, goaded again by the Federal Reserve, continued yesterday to push aggressively toward lower in terest rates. However, signs be gan to pop up that the drive was tiring.

title: ALTMAN PREDICTS RENT RISE OF 8.6%
description: Rent Commissioner Benjamin Altman predicted yesterday that rents on New York City apartments covered by Federal guidelines might well in crease by as much as 8.5 per cent, far above the 3 or 3.5 per cent originally predicted by the Federal Price Commission.

title: Barge Canal System Reports a Sharp Drop in Traffic
description: Commercial freight on the historic New York State Barge Canal System dropped sharply in the 1970 and 1971 navi gating seasons after having stayed at a fairly constant vol urne in the nineteensixties.

title: A Correction
description: In the review in The New York Times yesterday of the play Demon at La Mama, Donald Harrington was inad vertently identified as the actor playing the aged servant. The role is played by William Finley, Mr. Harrington is the narrator.

title: Adolphus Spence 2d, 55, Dies; Head of U.S. Printing Office
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP)Adolphus N. Spence 2d, head of the Government Print ing Office, died today at his home in Alexandria, Va. He was 55 years old.

title: Culebra, Navy Target, Beset by Wealthy Squatters
description: CULEBRA, P. R., Jan. 11 We never had any fights, robberies, delinquencies or drugs, the Mayor of this tiny island boasts. Now if we could only get rid of the squatters. As he drives his jeep across the narrow roads that wind over and around Culebra, occasionally picking up a hitchhiker or waving to one of the 850 island ers, Mayor Ramon Feliciano finds much to boast of. The island is surrounded by remarkably clear bluegreen water, and the 28 square miles of Culebra and nearby Culebrita are endowed with unspoiled white beaches rarely visited by outsiders. Recently the islanders have obtained a water desaliniza tion plant, tourism developers have taken an interest in Culebra and, most important, the United States Navy has cut back on the use of the island for target practice by booming offshore batteries and divebombing planes.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In his letter (Dec. 30) Patrick J. Herrity points to the United States policy of Vietnamization and calls for a similar policy of Germanization to end the need for stationing United States troops in the Federal Republic.

title: Policeman Gets 18 Months On Plea of Selling Heroin
description: A suspended city policeman who pleaded guilty to selling heroin drew an 18month prison sentence in Federal District Court yesterday.

title: Nixon Picks Prague Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP)  President Nixon announced today that he would nominate Albert W. Sherer Jr., a career diplomat, to be Ambassador to Czechslovakia, replacing Mal colm Toon who has become Ambassador to Yugoslavia.

title: U.S. Jet Is Target of Missiles From Deepest Site Yet in Laos
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 11The United States com mand said today that a North Vietnamese missile site near Tchepone, deeper and farther south in the Laotian panhandle than one has ever been re ported before, fired two sur facetoair missiles yesterday morning at an American fight erbomber that was attacking enemy supply trails.

title: Striking British Miners To Block Fuel for Power
description: LONDON, Jan. 11 (Reuters) Britain's striking coal miners moved today to make their walkout more effective by blocking fuel supplies to elec tric power stations.

title: Test Run at Indian Point Is Asked by A.E.C. Unit
description: CRUGERS, N. Y., Jan. 11The United States Atomic Energy Commission's Division of Reactor Licensing recom mended today that the commission's Atomic Safety and Licensing Board permit the Consolidated Edison Company to begin testing its Indian Point No. 2 nuclear power plant at up to 50 per cent of full power.

title: Danish King Has Relapse
description: COPENHAGEN, Jan. 11 (AP) King Frederik IX has suffered a relapse, physicians attending the 72yearold Danish monarch said today. A bulletin from Municipal Hospital said the King's temperature had risen to 103 and he was very tired and dozing. Specialists said this indicated a recurrence of the pneumonia from which the King was suffering before his heart attack eight days ago.

title: Chicago Teachers for Strike
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 11 (UPI) The Chicago Teachers Union voted today to strike Jan. 18 if the Chicago school board fails to honor a twoyear contract signed in January, 1971. It would be the third strike in as many years. Board of Education members had said they would eliminate an 8 per cent salary increase for teachers and cut back school programs to meet a projected $125million budget deficit.

title: Hippie Family Life: Rooted in Past?
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa. (UPI) The family life of hippies or freaks, as they prefer to call themselvesis not much different from the life of their middleclass, Middle American parents, according to a study by two Pennsyl vania State University so ciologists.

title: Rangers, Long on Easy Street, Now Face Pitfalls of Road Trip
description: The clutch part of the Na tional Hockey League season the second half  starts for the Rangers tonight at Chicago as they begin a sixgame road trip that can go a long way in deciding the final standing in the East.

title: EastBloc Nations to Meet
description: VIENNA, Jan. 11 (UPI)The Communist nations of the War saw Pact alliance will hold a meeting in Prague this month, their Governments announced today. No date was given.

title: Two Drivers Break Famine by Splitting Pace at Westbury
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Jan. 11 Maurice Pusey found his way to the winner's circle after the feature race at Roosevelt Race way tonight, even though he had only a piece of the vic tory. He drove the Capital Hill Farm's General Dayan in the onemile pace, and the 5year old horse wound up in a dead heat with Redmond Lane driven by Ben Steall.

title: Bankers Trust Plans Deal With Bradford Computer
description: The Bankers Trust Company and Bradford Computer and Systems, Inc., are planning a joint venture that would apply Bradford's data processing ca pabilities to the transfer agent, registrar and related services of Bankers Trust, it was an nounced yesterday by William H. Moore, chairman of the bank.

title: Insider Trading Is Upheld By High Court in 43 Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  The Supreme Court ruled today that certain corporate insid ers can avoid some of the financial penalties for insider trading if they sell the com pany's stock in two separate transactions instead of all at once.

title: Complaint at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 11 (UPI) Lebanon registered an energetic pro test with the Security Council today against the Israeli incur sion.

title: BANGLADESH GAINS RECOGNITION BY 2
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 11  East Germany granted recognition today to Bangladesh, the nation proclaimed by Bengali seces sionists in East Pakistan.

title: Price Panel Chief Urges Consumer Boycott of Errant Retailers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 The chairman of the Price Commission, C. Jackson Gray son Jr., recommended today that consumers boycott retail ers who violate price controls and reward stores that hold the price line by shopping in them.

title: Detour to 10th Avenue
description: Tenth Avenue, normally a northbound artery, will tempo rarily become a twoway street between 19th and 23d Streets starting today. The Traffic De partment said that change would be made to accommo date traffic displaced from southbound 11th Avenue, which will be closed between 19th and 21st Streets for about four months to allow construc tion of a sewer.

title: Allied Stores Chief Quits; Macioce Named Successor
description: Theodore Schlesinger an nounced yesterday his resigna tion as chairman and chief ex ecutive officer of the Allied Stores Corporation, the coun try's second largest department store chain, effective Feb. 1. He will not reach the concern's mandatoryretirement age for more than a year.

title: Eastern States Are Pledged Role In Decision on Offshore Drilling
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  East coast states were prom ised today that they would be consulted before any decision on whether to permit offshore oil drilling in the Atantic.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Conor Cruise O'Brien's piece on The Right to Secede (OpEd Dec. 30) brings to mind this definition of a nation: A people with a common con fusion as to their origins and a com mon antipathy to their neighbors.

title: Mr. Cahill's Message
description: Republican Gov. William T. Cahill of New Jersey may well succeed where his Democratic predecessor, Richard J. Hughes, failed: to persuade his state to accept a mod ern income tax to meet pressing public needs.

title: U.S. AIDE ACCUSED ON TV VIOLENCE
description: A charge that the office of the Surgeon General allowed the television industry to veto proposed members of its com mittee investigating violence on the home screen was made by Representative John M. Murphy, Democrat of Staten Island.

title: MRS. WARREN C. MEYER
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 11 Mrs. Jean Loughlin Meyer, former Urban Renewal Direc tor for North Tarrytown, N. Y., and the wife of Warren C. Meyer, died yesterday at Nor walk Hospital after a brief ill ness. She was 43 years old. For the last four years she had lived at 74 Newtown Turnpike in Westport.

title: MUJIB GETS BRIEFING BY CABINET IN DACCA
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Jan. 11, (Reuters)Sheik Mujibur Rah man, home in triumph from nine months of detention in West Pakistan, took over today as President of Bangladesh, a na tion of 75 million people pro claimed by the Bengalis in what was East Pakastan.

title: LEONARD PLATT, 71; A RETIRED BANKER
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 11 Leonard Scranton Platt of 27 Oneida Drive, a retired banker, died yesterday at Greenwich Hospital after a short illness. He was 71 years old.

title: 2 Who Sold to PX's Given 18 Months for Tax Evasion
description: Two who operate businesses selling to the worldwide mili tary postexchange and Navy ship'sstores system were both sentenced yesterday to 18 month prison terms and fined $100,000 for conspiracy and evading an estimated $2million in income taxes.

title: Cerro Ends Service to Chile
description: The Cerro Sales Corporation, a subsidiary of the Cerro Cor poration, announced yesterday that it had agreed to quit pro viding Corporation del Cobre, an agency of the Chilean Gov ernment with purchasing and traffic service for mines con trolled by the Government. The service will end Jan. 15.

title: PANELISTS ARGUE PRESS VS. COURTS
description: The subject was supposed to be A Free Press and a Fair Trial, but for a while last, night, in the chandeliered and reddraperied auditorium of the New York County Lawyers As sociation, it seemed more like Newspapers and Judgesor, more precisely, the newspapers against the judges and the judges against the newspapers.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: CORK, Ireland, Jan. 11 (UPI) Senator Edward M. Kennedy has repeated his call for with drawal of British troops as a prerequisite for peace in North ern Ireland.

title: Writers Union in Soviet Assails Solzhenitsyn Novel
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 11 (Reuters) A Soviet publication today made the first official comment on the latest novel by Alek sandr Solzhenitsyn, August 1914, the book was said to have proved very helpful for antiSoviet elements of every description.

title: Duquesne Upset, 7069
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 11 (UPI) George Gervin scored on a driving layup with two seconds left to give Eastern Michigan a 7069 upset victory over previously unbeaten Duquesne tonight.

title: Court Lets Abortions Continue
description: A Fordham law professor's suit to halt abortions in municipal hospitals here was temporarily blocked yester day by the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court in Brooklyn.

title: Boston Gas Strike Averted
description: BOSTON, Jan. 11 (AP)The Boston Gas Company reported today that an agreement had been reached with union nego tiators averting a strike by some 1,100 workers scheduled for midnight. The company spokesman said that terms of the contract would not be an nounced publicly until after the union membership votes on the contract tomorrow night.

title: Hartke Gives Job Pledge
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Jan. 11 (UPI)Senator Hartke opened his campaign for Presidential delegates in Florida today with a pledge to end unemployment by providing Government jobs, including work on the proposed $5.5billion space shuttle.

title: Luxembourg Prisoners Hold a Warden Hostage
description: LUXEMBOURG, Jan. 11 (Reuters)  Twentyone pris oners demanding an increase in pay for compulsory work have barricaded themselves in a prison workshop with a senior warden seized as a hostage.

title: Facts on Proposed Con Ed Plant
description: Following are some of the basic facts on the second nuclear plant that Consolidated Edison proposes to open at Indian Point:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It has been disheartening to read the recent Times editorials on Forest Hills and to see this great newspaper take an editorial position on such scant acknowledgment of the facts. This is deeply discouraging to anyone who believes in the press as a means of informing the public.

title: Ending of Censorship Announced by Pakistan
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 11 (UPI) Information Minister Abdul Hafiz Pizada has announced the ending of censorship in Pakistan.

title: Bunnies Triumph
description: OLEAN, N. Y., Jan. 11 (UPI) Glen Price scored 20 points and pulled down 11 rebounds to night to lead St. Bonaventure to a 7051 victory over Xavier of Cincinnati.

title: THORNTON F. JACKSON
description: Thornton F. Jackson, a tex tile soles executive, died of a heart attack at his home, 370 East 76th Street, on Monday evening. He was 56 years old.

title: A FEDERAL COURT VOIDS STATE LAW ON PAROCHIAL AID
description: A law providing $33million in New York State funds to aid financially troubled paro chial schools was declared un constitutional here yesterday by a panel of three Federal judges.

title: Notes on People
description: Prof. Loren Graham, on a re cent investigative stroll around the Columbia University cam pus to seek evidence of male chauvinist attitudes, noted the labeling of the faculty wash room doors in Philosophy Hall.

title: WINGS WIN, 5 TO 0, AND EXTEND SKEIN
description: DETROIT, Jan. 11 (AP) Mickey Redmond scored his 16th goal in 13 games and as sisted on another tonight to lead the Detroit Red Wings to their seventh straight homeice victory, a 50 triumph over the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: Wire Service Guild Rejects Associated Press Contract
description: Members of the Wire Service Guild local of the Newspaper Guild rejected, in a mail ballot, a new twoyear contract pro posed by The Associated Press. The vote, still incomplete, was 428 to 139.

title: Unitarians Fight Subpoena of Records
description: BOSTON, Jan. 11 (AP) The Unitarian Universalist As sociation, accusing the Federal Government of invading its right to religious liberty, asked a United States District Court today to block a grand jury subpoena of its financial rec ords in connection with the so called Pentagon papers case.

title: FRATERNAL CLUBS THAT BAR NEGROES ARE HELD TAXABLE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The Treasury Department was told today by a threejudge Federal District Court here that it may no longer grant tax exemp tions to fraternal organizations that exclude Negroes as mem bers.

title: Mayors Ask the State to Take Over School Costs
description: ALBANY, Jan. 11The State Conference of Mayors called upon the Legislature today to establish a program for a phased and eventually com plete state takeover of the costs of elementary and sec ondary education.

title: Clear Photos Sent After Mars Storm
description: The threemonth dust storm on Mars is over and the Mari ner 9 spacecraft, in orbit around the planet since last Nov. 13, is sending to earth the most detailed pictures of another planet ever made public.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Preparatory Committee for Conference on Human En vironment, intergovernmen tal working group on declaration on human en vironment  10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Savannah Gets Nuclear Ship
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Jan. 11 (UPI)  The 595foot nuclear ship Savannah was pulled up the Savannah River by tugs yesterday to become part of the Eisenhower peace memo rial. The deactivated ship will be formally welcomed in cere monies Saturday. She was handed over to the city of Savannah yesterday by the Todd Shipyards Corporation of Galveston, Tex., for the token price of $1.

title: U.S. Speed Skater Takes 500Meter Event in Italy
description: CORTINA D'AMPEZZA, Italy, Jan. 11 (Reuters)Gary Jon land of Park Ridge, Ill., won the 500meter race as the Doria Trophy speedskating meet got under way today.

title: GEORGE JOHN HENRY, INVESTMENT EXPERT
description: George John Henry, a vice president of Carl Marks & Co., Inc., and well known on Wall Street as a trader in foreign se curities, died on Monday eve ning while dining with friends. He was 46 years old and lived in Great Neck, L. I.

title: Coast Guard Planning Inquiry Into Sinking of Tanker Off L.I.
description: PORT JEFFERSON, L. I., Jan. 11  The Coast Guard an nounced today that it was con vening a formal marine board of inquiry Thursday to investi gate the cause of the breakup and sinking of the 34,000ton oil tanker Martha R. Ingram in Port Jefferson harbor yester day.

title: Crank Phone Call Aborts A Brooklyn Bank Robbery
description: A crank caller inadvertently prevented the holdup of a Brooklyn bank yesterday when a wouldbe robber noticed policemen searching for a bomb and fled before an employe could hand over a brown paper shopping bag stuffed with $7,000.

title: Soyer Painting Is Stolen From Syracuse U. Gallery
description: A painting by Moses Soyer, the contemporary American artist, was stolen yesterday from the Joe and Emily Lowe Art Gallery of Syracuse Uni versity. The painting, entitled Portrait of a Dancer and in sured for $15,000, was part of a retrospective exhibition of the 72yearold artist's work.

title: Graduated Federal Tax Proposed on Cigarettes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (UPI)Jesse L. Steinfeld, the Surgeon General of the Pub lic Health Service suggested today that the Government could reduce smoking haz ards by imposing a graduated cigarette tax based on tar and nicotine content.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I was grieved to read Prof. Harvey Cox recent OpEd article, Wild Blue Yonder Revisited, because it plays games with the facts.

title: PENNSY IS MERGING 4 TRUCK UNITS INTO 1
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 11 (AP)The ailing Penn Central Railroad, now in a Federal bankruptcy reorganization, an nounced today it has merged its four trucking subsidiaries into one company to improve the service.

title: JAVITS IS SEEKING DEVALUED DOLLAR
description: LONDON, Jan. 11Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York said today he would press for immediate devaluation of the dollar against gold without waiting for America's major overseas customers to make trade concessions to the Unit ed States.

title: British Commission Arrives in Rhodesia To a Black Protest
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 11 (Reuters)Britain's com mission to test the accepta bility of the terms of the inde pendence settlement flew to Salisbury today to a sullen, silent demonstration by hun dreds of black nationalists.

title: Couple Charged in Hjacking
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 11 (AP) Federal warrants were issued today for two San Francisco residents, charging them with the hijacking last Friday of a jetliner at gunpoint, officials said. The two were identified as Allen Gordon Sims, 25 years old, and Ida Patrice Robinson, 21, according to a Federal Bu reau of Investigation spokes man. The jet was hijacked mo ments before it landed at Los Angeles International Airport by a black man and woman who carried a baby. The cou ple and the child disembarked in Havana.

title: Suns Upset Bucks, 115114
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 11 (AP) Dick Van Arsdale sank two free throws after time had ex pired to give the Phoenix Suns, who had trailed by 17 points in the first half, a 115114 vic tory over the Milwaukee Bucks tonight.

title: Hogan Commends Police for Fewer Bad Arrests
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan released statistics yes terday that he said showed the Police Department was doing better work and making better arrests.

title: EDWARD G, O'NEILL PROSECUTOR, DIES
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Jan. 11 Edward G. O'Neill, a former assistant state attorney general who was special prosecutor of local officials of the Hod Car riers Union in 1942, died yes terday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 79 years old.

title: SCHOOLS IN VIRGINIA GET MONTH TO MERGE
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 11 (AP) The city of Richmond and sub urban Henrico and Chesterfield Counties were given 30 days by a Federal judge today to take all steps necessary to merge their school systems in September.

title: ALLIES IRK BRITAIN WITH MALTA MOVE
description: LONDON, Jan. 11Prime Minister Heath showed signs of irritation today at what he evidently considered to be be lated intervention by Britain's allies in the Malta crisis.

title: An Amusement Park Planned in Jersey On Meadows Site
description: NEWARK, Jan. 11  An amusement park will share a tract in the Hackensack Mead dows with the proposed new stadium for the New York foot ball Giants.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: DENVER, Jan. 11 (AP) Indiana scored 71 points in the second half tonight and all five Pacers starters hit 17 points or better as they rolled to a 11499 victory over the Denver Rockets in the American Basketball Association.

title: Upstate Arsonist Pleads Guilty At Trial Closed to the Public
description: A 21yearold Monticello, N. Y., man whose trial on arson charges had been ordered closed to the public pleaded guilty yes terday to three of the 18 counts against him.

title: Hofstra Defeats Iona
description: Hofstra, which led by as many as 36 points in the sec ond half, held off a late surge by Iona and defeated the Gaels, 8270, last night at Mount St. Michael Academy in the Bronx. Dave Bell paced Hofstra with 25 points.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Jan. 11 (AP)Three Americans ad vanced today at the opening of the Tasmanian tennis cham pionships.

title: 2 Senators Ask Recognition
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Sen ator Hubert H. Humphrey and Senator Edward M. Kennedy called today for early United States recognition of Bangla desh.

title: Secret U.S. Cables Hinted Possible Aid In War to Pakistan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Two secret United States cablegrams published tonight by Jack An derson, the columnist, in his column for tomorrow appeared to indicate that the United States sought to keep India guessing about the possiblity of indirect aid to Pakistan dur ing the recent IndiaPakistan war.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTONEver since the Indo Pakistani war, there has been con siderable doubt here about the wisdom of President Nixon's military strategy, in backing Pakistan, but there should be little doubt about the domestic political strategy he had in mind when he sided with Pakistan and China against India and the Soviet Union.

title: ELEVATORS CALLED A POTENTIAL PERIL
description: The head of the building in spectors union warned yester day that thousands of elevators in the city were potentially dangerous because they had not been examined regularly.

title: Seoul Bars a Nixon Decision on Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Jan. 11 President Park Chung Hee declared today that South Ko rea would not accept any big power decision on the fate of Korea made without the con sent and participation of the South Korean Government.

title: Habeas Corpus Is Restored In Philippines by Marcos
description: MANILA, Jan. 11President Ferdinand E. Marcos restored the constitutional right of ha beas corpus today, ending more than four months of public clamor over the curtailment of the civil liberties.

title: CHRISCRAFT TALLY IS DUE IN NINE DAYS
description: CORTLAND, N.Y., Jan. 11 (AP)Stockholders of Chris Craft Industries voted today on slates of directors presented by company officials and a group of dissident shareholders, but official results of the balloting were not expected to be an nounced for 10 days.

title: Political Perquisite
description: When is a public employe working for the public and when for the politician who appointed him? This question arises so routinely in almost every political campaign that it has long since ceased to be a serious issue. While the outs regularly denounce the ins for exploiting the time and talents of public employes to do their cam paign chores, the historical record is clear. Incumbents at every level from city hall to the White House have normally made greater or lesser use of their subordinates for political purposes in election years. The news that one candidate or another is following this seamy tradi tion is hardly a surprise.

title: Pastor Charles Westphal, French Protestant Leaded
description: MONTPELLIER, France, Jan. 11 (AP)Pastor Charles West phal, former president of the Protestant Federation of France, died of a heart attack today. He was 75 years old.

title: Executive Changes Expected at A.B.C.
description: American Broadcasting Com panies, Inc., is expected to make some major changes in its top echelon when the board of directors meets next Mon day.

title: Detroit 10182 Vietor
description: DETROIT, Jan. 11 (UPI)Bill Pleas scored 25 points and a 7 foot center, Gerald Smth, got 23 tonight as Detroit trounced St. Francis of Pennsylvania, 10182.

title: CUTBACK OPPOSED FOR YORK COLLEGE
description: A widespread drive was un der way yesterday to persuade Governor Rockefeller to recon sider his decision to cut $62.5 million that was to have been used for a major expansion of York College, in Jamaica, Queens.

title: LEONARD S. ARMSTRONG
description: WEST ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Jan. 11Leonard S. Arm strong, who retired as a cost accountant at Bell Laborato ries in New York in 1962, died on Sunday at Holy Name Hos pital, Teaneck. He was 74 years old and lived at 88 Bed ford Avenue.

title: ALBANY TO GET BID FOR WIDER GAMING
description: ALBANY, Jan. 11  Encour aged by favorable public hear ings, the State Gambling Com mission is expected to recom mend a constitutional amend ment this month that would per mit the Legislature to legalize various forms of gambling as new sources of revenue.

title: A dvertising:
description: Last year was a bad one for newproduct introduction, but it was not so bad as 1970, according to a survey by DancerFitzgeraldSam ple's New Product News.

title: Knicks Beaten By Bulls, 11691
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 11The New York Knicks got off to a dismal start on a sixgame road trip tonight by absorbing a 11691 pounding from the Chicago Bulls at Chicago Stadium be fore a delighted crowd of 13,010.

title: MRS. ALICE CROWLEY, FORMED PLAYHOUSE
description: Mrs. Alice Lewisohn Crowley, a daughter of Leonard Lew who founded a major copper mining concern with his younger brother, Adolph, died in Zurich last Thursday. She was 88 years old.

title: OTC AND AMEX ADVANCE AGAIN
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market continued to move higher yesterday in ac tive trading.

title: In Defense of Chavez
description: George Gannon's article [Dec. 20, 19711 makes serious allegations that Cesar Chavez's United Farm Workers Union deals dishonestly with manage ment and its union members in its West Coast organizing drive. Because the West Coast drive is so important to this country, a reply is necessary.

title: Study of Newborn Children To Seek Radiation Effects
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (Reu ters)A study will be made of possible genetic effects of radia tion on newborn children in Colorado, where uranium waste was used to build houses, the Government announced today.

title: King Hussein Reported to Have Dropped Opposition to Municipal Elections on Occupied West Bank
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 11Pales tinian politicians received word today that King Hussein had withdrawn his Government's opposition to the holding of longdelayed municipal elec tions in the westbank area of Jordan under Israeli military occupation.

title: Hamlet More Troubled by Looting Saigon Troops Than by Foe
description: QUANGTRI, South Viet nam, Jan. 8In the northern most hamlet of South Viet nam, which lies three miles below the demilitarized zone, the villagers are more trou bled by their own soldiers' cruelty and looting than by the threat of North Viet namese attack.

title: Niland Charting Blocks For Cowboy Game Plan
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 11 John Niland, the Dallas Cow boy all pro guard preparing to play the Miami Dolphins in the Super Bowl game on Sunday, explained his role in the pit, the tradesman's name for the scrimmage line. My job, he said, is to hit the guy across the line on every play and drive him back as far as I can. It's that simple.

title: Britain's Swinging Soccer Star Banished to Tea and Crumpets
description: MANCHESTER, England, Jan. 11 (Reuters)George Bestthe Broadway Joe Namath of British soccer has been ordered by his club, Manchester United, to aban don his playboy image and move from his $91,000 man sion to a boarding house run by a motherly landlady.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 11 (AP) Israeli troops crossed the Lebanese border last night and attacked villages reportedly in retaliation for a recent increase in attacks by Arab guerrillas from southern Lebanon.

title: Soviet Official Asserts Patients Are Kept Too Long in Hospitals
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 11The av erage Soviet patient is being kept far too long in a hospital, a publichealth planner com plained today in urging broad reforms to raise the effective ness of the system of social ized medicine.

title: 10% IS IMPOUNDED IN FOOD STAMP AID
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Con fidential budgetary documents obtained today disclose that the Nixon Administration has impounded $202million in funds for the campaign against hunger.

title: PRESIDENT APPOINTS 3 TOP JUSTICE AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP)  President Nixon announced today the recess appointments of three Assistant Attorneys General.

title: Miss Stoner Joins Ormiston to Offer Program of Dances
description: Gale Ormiston and Jeanette Stoner offered a concert Mon day at the Cubiculo in which the choreography played a dis tant second to the dancing, which was smooth and clean as a hound's tooth. Mr. Ormis ton favors cool design in his works, while Miss Stoner is in trigued with dramatic and ec centric encounters.

title: Canadiens Lose, 73
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 11 (UPI) Mike Murphy scored two goals and assisted on another tonight to lead the St. Louis Blues to a 73 victory over the Montreal Canadiens.

title: Former Aide Believes Voice Was Hughes's and Autobiography Is Authentic
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 11Noah Dietrich, who down the years has known Howard Hughes probably better than anyone else, said tonight that he was sure it was Mr. Hughes who talked with reporters over a telephone hookup last Friday and that he also thought the forthcoming disputed Hughes autobiography was authen tic.

title: Greater Fashion Interest Urged for Boys' Apparel
description: Greater fashion excitement for the boys' apparel market was urged yesterday by Mar vin S. Traub, president of Bloomingdale's.

title: COUNCILMAN SEES PLOT AGAINST OTB
description: Councilman Mario Merola urged the state yesterday to conduct an investigation of the State Harness Racing Commis sion to determine whether the commission had conspired with track and horse owners to kill the city's Offtrack Betting Cor poration.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I must correct the impression given of my views in a news article from Jerusalem by Peter Grose in The Times of Dec. 27.

title: Inquiry Is Ordered Into Sabotage of Suffolk Welfare
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. L, Jan. 11 Suffolk County Executive John V. N. Klein said today that he had ordered an examination of reports that social service caseworkers were sabotaging the County Welfare Depart ment's operations.

title: Army Makes Little Effort to Find Deserters
description: RICHMONDPfc. Charles Haskell Hatton 3d, an Army deserter for 15 months, turned himself in to the au thorities on Monday. But he needed persistence to sur render.

title: U.S. AIR DEFENSE IN SOUTH SCORED
description: WASHINGTON; Jan. 11 The House Armed Services Investigating Subcommittee charged today that the nation's air defenses were virtually useless, particularly in pro tecting the southern flank of the United States against a bomber attack.

title: Base Near Saigon Raided
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, Jan. 12 (AP)A small hand of enemy commandos slipped into the big United States air base at Bien hoa just outside of Saigon to day and blew up a revetment containing smallarms ammu nition, the Seventh Air Force announced.

title: 10 in Foundation Cited
description: MIAMI, Jan. 11 (AP)Two di rectors of the Bush Foundation of St. Paul have sued 10 other directors for $39.75million, ac cusing them of stock manipula tions and conflicts of interest in violation of Federal regula tions.

title: Stars, Canucks Tie
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Jan. 11 (UPI)Bill Golds worthy scored from behind the net as the Minnesota North Stars rallied for a 22 tie with the Vancouver Canucks tonight.

title: Mr. NASCAR Calls It a Career
description: About Motor Sports

title: Tchepone, in Laos Jungle, Long a Strategic Center
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 The remote town of Tchepone in the panhandle of southern Laos, now a bombedout ruin, is a familiar placename in the records of conflict in Indochina.

title: Michigan Tops Illinois
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Jan. 11 (AP)With five starters scor ing in double figures, Michigan upset Illinois, 7570, tonight in a Big Ten game.

title: Teacher Dies in Car Crash
description: BERKELEY HEIGHTS, N. J., Jan. 11A 44yearold science teacher was killed here early today when his small foreign car swerved from a fogcov ered stretch of Springfield Ave nue and crashed into a utility pole. The teacher Ronald Ho nigsberg of 10 Marshall Street, Irvington, was pronounced dead at the scene. The police said Mr. Honingsberg taught at Mont clair High School in Montclair.

title: BugakuReappears With Feet Flexed And Toes Pointed
description: A combination of flexed foot and pointed toe signaled the end of the Nutcracker season Tuesday night at the State Theater as the New York City Ballet went back into repertory with George Balanchine's Ja panese ballet, Bugaku.

title: Firm in Liquidation
description: Actions involving major part ners of Axelrod & Co., a for mer member firm of the New York Stock Exchange that is now in voluntary liquidation, were announced yesterday by the exchange and the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Williams's Brother in Race
description: FAIRVIEW HEIGHTS, Ill., Jan. 11 (UPI)Dakin Williams, brother of Tennessee Williams, the playwright, opened his campaign for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator today with a speech written by his 88yearold mother, Mr. Williams, of Col linsville, read to the local Ro tary Club a speech written by Mrs. Edwina Dakin Williams that criticized President Nixon for breaking his campaign promises.

title: Market Place:
description: Perhaps the language is too cryptic for the sharehold er, but one thing is sure, Wellington Fund's policy on capital gains didn't please everyone this year.

title: Even Before Her Movie, Face Was Familiar
description: A bell rang. A zebrastriped clapboard marker slammed shut. A director yelled Action, and a beautiful blond model in a green leotard slithered down a runway in a film studio on West 45th Street.

title: British Still Dominant In Persian Gulf Area
description: JUFAIR, BahrainThe with drawal of British forces from the Arab Persian Gulf is nearly complete, leaving an urgent question: Who will suc ceed Britain, which has domi nated this strategic area since the early 19th century?

title: BRUSSELS PARLEYS FAIL ON 2 ACCORDS
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 11Two candidates for membership in the European Economic Com munity, Ireland and Norway, failed today after a frustrating dusktodawn negotiating ses sion to reach agreement with the bloc on the final terms for entry.

title: TV FARE STIRS UP BUDAPEST DEBATE
description: BUDAPESTWhen television came to Hungary more than a decade ago, antennas near the Austrian border were found to be turned toward Vienna. Now, the story goes, the Austrian frontier sets are tuned in Buda pest.

title: Jackson to Run in Primary Here
description: Senator Henry M. Jackson announced yesterday that he would be a candidate in this state's June 20 Presidential pri mary.

title: Energy Is Eternal Delight
description: NEVADA CITY, CalifA young woman at Sir George Williams Uni versity in Montreal asked me, What do you fear most? I found myself answering that the diversity and rich ness of the gene pool will be de stroyed and most people there understood what was meant.

title: Fuld Named by Hospital
description: Judge Stanley H. Fuld, chief judge of the state, has been named to the board of the Beth Israel Medical Center at 307 Second Avenue. Also announced yesterday as trustees were Fed eral Judge Milton Pollack; David A. Goldberg, an investment banker; Arthur Potash, an in surance executive, and Herbert Tenzer, a lawyer and former Representative.

title: Flemming Takes Post As Adviser on Aging
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (UPI)  President Nixon swore in today, Arthur S. Flemming, former Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, as his special con sultant on aging. Mr. Flem ming was chairman of last month's White House Con ference on Aging.

title: War Critic, at Dartmouth, Bids Audience Join Politics
description: HANOVER, N.H., Jan. 11 John Kerry, the war critic and spokesman for Vietnam Veter ans Against the War, told a Dartmouth College audience of 300 persons here last night to get into politics and make the system work.

title: Rep. Ford Foresees Higher Wage Floor
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11De spite current wage curbs, the Nixon Administration appears ready to support at least a modest increase in the mini mum wage this year.

title: 8 in Family Get $750,000 For Injuries in 68 Accident
description: Eight members of a New York City family headed South to spend the Christmas holidays in 1968 were awarded $750, 000 in damages yesterday for injuries they sustained whentheir car collided with a trac tortrailer truck south or Wash ington, The car was demolished in the accident.

title: MORTGAGE RATES DIP AT FANNY MAY SALE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  Mortgage interest rates de clined slightly further at this week's auction of the Federal National Mortgage Association, it was disclosed today.

title: Crime News Is Checked To Catch Relief Cheats
description: George F. Berlinger, the state's new Welfare Inspector General, has taken to read ing the newspapers to spot clever criminals who might also be welfare cheaters. So far, he has found three.

title: Jefferson High Honored for Winning Football Title
description: Jefferson High School of Brooklyn, which won the Pub lic Schools Athletic League football championship, was honored yesterday by Sebas tian Leone, Brooklyn Bor ough President, at Borough Hall. He gave Moe Finkel stein, the coach, a plaque commemorating Thomas Jef ferson High School Day in the borough.

title: Track Yields $154,939
description: ALBANY, Jan. 11 (AP)The fall meeting at Buffalo Race way in Hamburg, N. Y., pro duced $154,939,04 in revenue for the state, Tax Commission er Norman Gallman announced today.

title: Warriors Extend Streak
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 11 (UPI)Cazzie Russell and Jeff Mullins each scored 24 points tonight to lead the Golden State Warriors to their seventh straight victorya 10192 de cision over the Cleveland Cava liers.

title: PROS DEFEAT CHAPS IN THE LAST MINUTE
description: MEMPHIS, Jan. 11 (AP)  George Lehmann scored 4 points in the final minute tonight as the Memphis Pros rallied to beat the Dallas Chaps, 8886.

title: Gus Hall a Candidate
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 12 (AP) Gus Hall, head of the national Communist party, announced his candidacy for President to day and said only his party could give meaning to the rhetoric expressed by other Presidential candidates about changes in American society.

title: Taxi Industry May Drop Theater Area Dispatchers
description: The Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade said yesterday that it might have to abandon its 15weekold taxicab dis patching service in the mid town theater district. The board represents the city's taxi fleet owners.

title: Beirut Describes Attack
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 11 Israeli forces killed three Pales tinian guerrillas last night and destroyed a number of build ings, according to a military spokesman here. A Lebanese woman was also reported killed and her husband wounded.

title: Smith Brothers Plant To Relocate in Illinois
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Jan. 11The small, brick plant here on North Hamilton Street that has produced Smith Brothers cough drops for more than a century will close later this year.

title: U.S. Shows Cambodia How to Send Pleas for Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The State Department said today that its technical assistance to Cambodia extended to showing the Government how to send fundraising letters asking other countries for money.

title: Kennedy Plans to Inform Florida That He Won't Seek Nomination
description: A spokesman for Senator Ed ward M. Kennedy of Massachu setts said yesterday that the Senator would sign this week an affidavit stating that he is not now, and does not intend to become, a candidate for the 1972 Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: JERSEY BOLSTERS BUYER PROTECTION
description: TRENTON, Jan. 11  A bill giving New Jersey consumers greater legal recourse when they buy goods on the install ment plan was signed into law today by Gov. William T. Cahill.

title: Sahl Returns, Unsheathes. Wit
description: Humorous insight, which seemed to have gone the Judge Crater route in recent years, returned to New York Monday night in the guise of Mort Sahl.

title: Poultry Quarantine Set
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP) The Agriculture Department annouced today a Federal quar antine on the movement of poultry from Puerto Rico in an effort to curb a disease threat ening the island's cockfighting industry. The curb, effective, immediately, is aimed at pre venting the spread of New castle disease from Puerto Rico to the mainland, particularly Florida, officials said. The dis ease has also been reported in California and Texas.

title: Canadian Unemployment Rate Dips in Month to 6.2%
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 11Canada's unemployment rate declined in December for the third month in a row.

title: OIL NATIONS REJECT OFFER BY COMPANIES
description: GENEVA, Jan. 11The oil producing countries tonight re jected an offer by the major Western oil companies to re imburse them for the higher prices they are having to pay for imports from developed countries as a result of the de valuation of the dollar.

title: Weeden Profit Declined In Quarter Ended Dec. 31
description: Weeden & Co., a major third market brokerage house, re ported yesterday that profit for its first fiscal quarter ended Dec. 31 was $1,819,000, or $1.04 a share, on 1,749,000 common shares outstanding, compared to $2,311,000 or $1.68 a share, on 1,373,000 shares a year earlier.

title: Theater: Gloomy Drama
description: The Matinee Theater Series at the Theater de Lys wound up its season yesterday after noon with a play by Robert Koesis, A Place Without Mornings. It was filled with the darkest of glooms.

title: NAUSEA GAS IS FIRED AT BRITISH IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 11 (UPI) Nausea gas Cartridges and a rifle shot were fired at a British Army post in Londonderry today, presumably by Irish Republican Army ex tremists. The British Army called the use of gas a most unusual departure from pat tern.

title: Hijacker Holds a Jet 6 Hours, Asks $1Million, Then Gives Up
description: DALLAS, Jan. 12 (UPI)A former mental patient used a briefcase he said was stuffed with dynamite to hijack a Braniff International jetliner over Texas today, demanded $1million ransom and safe passage to South America, and then surrendered to the police after holding the plane for six and a half hours.

title: 4 Oil Companies Fined $500 In Santa Barbara Oil Spill
description: SANTA BARBARA, Call., Jan. 12 (AP)A Judge has dis missed 342 counts of criminal pollution in the 1969 oil well blowout in the Santa Barbara Channel after four oil com panies pleaded guilty to one count each.

title: Cowboys 6Point Favorites
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan 12 (AP)  Major bookmakers in Las Vegas and Reno reported today that the Dallas Cowboys were 6point favorites to win the Super Bowl game Sunday.

title: I.R.S. Team Collects Data On Extremists for Tax Use
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The Internal Revenue Service ac knowledged tonight that it has a special sevenman unit whose sole job is to collect information on extremist political organiza tions of the left and right and their leaders to uncover situa tions where there may have been tax evasion.

title: PENGUINS, BRUINS PLAY TO A 22 TIE
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 12 (UPI) Ken Schinkel's two goals gave the Pittsburgh Penguins a 2.2 tie tonight with the Bos ton Bruins, who got one of their goals after a penalty on Pittsburgh's coach, Red Kelly, for charging onto the ice to protest a call.

title: Celtics Defeat Bulls
description: BOSTON, Jan. 12 (UPI)Don Nelson, playing in his 400th consecutive game for the Bos ton Celtics, converted on a 3 point play with three seconds remaining tonight to lift Boston to a 113112 victory over the Chicago Bulls.

title: City Hospitals Laundry Chief Charged With Grand Larceny
description: The chief of laundry services for the 16,000bed municipal hospital system was arrested yesterday on charges of grand larceny receiving bribes and accepting unlawful gratuities.

title: LAFAYETTE ROUTS COLUMBIA, 10064
description: Tracy Tripucka's 36 points and Walt Kocubinski's 21 paced Lafayette to a 10064 victory over Columbia last night at the loser's gym.

title: Home Journal to Publish Interviews With Hughes
description: The Ladies' Home Journal said yesterday that it would publish next month an article containing an alleged series of interviews with Howard Hughes, the billionaire indus trialist.

title: News Analysis
description: TRENTON, Jan. 12Moments after one of the most raucous and devisive Assembly leader ship fights in New Jersey's his tory, Gov. William T. Cahill warned the Legislature last night that the state's problems could not be solved by dema goguery or political expedi ence. He also strongly suggested that his chances of enacting a grad uated state income tax, along with statewide reforma tion of what he described as regressive, unjust and antiquated local property taxes, would depend ultimately on whether the Legislature could unite unselfishly, for a worthy cause.

title: TAKING OF PROFITS HALTS STOCK RISE
description: The winds of profit taking buffeted the stock market yes terday and sent prices lower by the closing bell. Glamour issues, which had spearheaded the recent advance, generally were clipped by losses.

title: Atlanta Is 104102 Victor
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 12 (UPI)  Walt Bellamy and Lou Hudson combined tonight to lead the Atlanta Hawks to a 104102 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks in the National Basket ball Association.

title: Canada Signs Trade Pact
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 12 (Canadian Press)The signing of a com mercial agreement to continue trade regulation between Can ada and Venezuela was an nounced today by the External Affairs Department. The agree ment was first signed in 1950, and has been renewed an nually since then. It assures Canada most  favored  nation status in trade with Venezuela.

title: Enemy Attacks Reach a 3Month Record
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 12 (AP)Enemy shelling and ground attacks in South Vietnam rose today to the high est level for any 24hour period since early last October, the Saigon command reported.

title: ISRAEL TO REDUCE MILITARY OUTLAY
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 12Israeli military spending is to be cut back in the coming budget year as the needs of social welfare for the poor and of housing and other costs for new im migrants receive priority.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Stockholders of the Loctite Corporation, a Hartford concern that produces sealants and ad hesives, disposed of 315,000 common shares yesterday at $41 in an offering managed by Goldman, Sachs.

title: Wage Exemption Urged
description: WASHINGTON, San. 12 (UPI) Representative William F. Ryan, Democrat of Manhattan, today called on the Cost of Liv ing Council to exempt from wage controls those workers earning less than $6,960 a year. He said the Economic Stabiliza tion Act, under which President Nixon acted to control wages and prices, provided that sub standard earnings shall not be limited in any manner. The intent of Congress in adding the provision to the act, he said, was to define substandard earnings to mean a level of income of $6,960 annually.

title: MORTON N. PIERSON
description: DARIEN, Conn., Jan. 12 Morton N. Pierson, who retired from the Standard Oil Com pany New Jersey) after scrvice in many overseas posts, died Tuesday in the Harkness Pavil ion at Columbia  Presbyterian Medical Center, New York. He was 60 years old and lived at 135 Brookside Road.

title: Advertising:
description: Bob Schmidt and I have acquired all of the stock of this company and, after al most a half century, Mervin Levine is going intoI hate to say retiringactive retire ment.

title: 3 POLICE INDICTED IN A BRIBERY CASE
description: Three policemen were indict ed by a Manhattan grand jury yesterday for allegedly accept ing a $2,000 bribe to allow a reputed underworld figure and heroin dealer to flee from the scene of a murder.

title: Textile Trade Unit Set Up to Promote U.S. Sales Abroad
description: A new nonprofit trade as sociation has been formed to promote the sale of Ameri can textiles abroad, it was an nounced yesterday by organiz ers of the project.

title: Maier of Milwaukee to Run
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 12 (AP) Henry Maier announced today that he would seek his fourth fouryear term as Mayor of Milwaukee in the spring elec tion.

title: Shenandoah Oil Elects
description: James P. McFarland, chair man of the board and chief executive officer of General Mills, Inc., has been elected to the board of Shenandoah Oil Corporation.

title: Rangers Tied By Hawks, 55
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 12The New York Rangers and the Chicago Black Hawks, leaders in their respective divisions of the Na tional Hockey League, showed how evenly matched they were tonight by playing a hard fought 55 tie. It was their sec ond tie of the season.

title: High Court Clarifies Rule on Confessions
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The Supreme Court ruled today,4 to 3, that trial courts could admit into evidence the con fessions of criminal defendants even if the courts were not convinced beyond a reason able doubt that the confes sions were voluntary.

title: Advertising:
description: CampbellEwald is making it official. James J. O'Neal, a former executive vice presi dent of D'Arcy, is the head of its New York office, with the title of senior vice president.

title: STOCK ESCAPADE DRAWS SCRUTINY
description: The Federal Government, the New York Stock Exchange and six prominent brokerage houses began intensive investigations yesterday into how Abraham H. Treff, a 19yearold college student, was able to buy more than $200,000 worth of stock without putting up any cash.

title: St. Regis Reports Turning Garbage Fiber Into Paper
description: The St. Regis Paper Com pany announced yesterday that it had successfully produced paper from fibers processed from ordinary garbage.

title: Pressure Is No Problem for Frazier
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 12 With his blood pressure an nounced as normal again, Joe Frazier disclosed today that being slammed in the side by a medicine ball in his gym work was responsible for the ailment that hospitalized him following his 15round triumph over Muhammad Ali last March in their title showdown.

title: Lindsay Defends His Campaign Travel
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday de fended his campaign travels for Presidential primary races as in the best interest of the city.

title: 3.2 MILLION CANS OF SODA RECALLED
description: More than 3.2 million cans of CocaCola, Fanta and Sprite have been withdrawn from the market in New York State in the last month, the Food and Drug Administration said yes terday, because the aluminum lids on some of the cans were found to be contaminated.

title: S. Carolina Routs Manhattan
description: COLUMBIA, S. C. Jan. 12 (AP)South Carolina's fourth ranked quintet routed Manhatt an tonight, 11678, behind the 37point scoring of Danny Traylor.

title: Nixon Back in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House this afternoon following an overnight stay at Camp David where he worked on his State of the Union ad dress and messages he will send to Congress this month.

title: Chicago Today Fills Post
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 12 (UPI)J. Scott Schmidt has been ap pointed managing editor of Chi cago Today. Mr. Schmidt, 34 years old, has been with the newspaper and its predecessors since 1958.

title: 30,000 Buicks, Pontiacs And Oldsmobiles Recalled
description: DETROIT, Jan. 12 (UPI) The General Motors Corpora tion anounced today the recall of 30,000 Buicks, Pontiacs and Oldsmobiles of the 1971 models to find 1,250 wheels with weak welding that could wobble and collapse.

title: Chess: Sometimes Book Analysis Bows to Imaginative Play
description: If the study of the chess openings was as cut and dried as it sometimes appears, the results could be summar ized simply in tabular form without comment. As it is, among the moves themselves that are the raw data for analysis, the personal factor sometimes enters very strong ly and gives rise to little mysteries that mere chess analysis cannot solve. The opening variation played in the games presented below is a case in point.

title: Forced Arbitration Now Law Here in PublicEmploye Disputes
description: Compulsory arbitration in deadlocked municipal labor dis putes became the law here yes terday with the signature of Mayor Lindsay, but a major labor leader warned that it would not end strikes by pub lic employes.

title: U. S. Holds Up Departure Of Soviet Student 6 Hours
description: An attempt by Soviet officials to fly a Soviet exchange student out of the country after he slashed his wrists and throat at Kennedy International Airport on Sunday was de layed six hours last night and early today while American officials insisted on question ing the student.

title: The Groundwork for Phase 3
description: WASHINGTONThe fight against Inflation is not just for this year, but for the seventies and beyond.

title: Fairfield Halts St. Francis
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Jan. 12 (AP)Dave Bradley, Steven Romano and Bob Bogad com bined for 64 points tonight as Fairfield University snapped a threegame losing streak with an 8773 victory over St. Fran cis of Brooklyn.

title: Tax Inquiry Pressed In Narcotics Drive; 328 Investigated
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 More than $17million in taxes and penalties has been as sessed in the first six months of a tax investigation of major figures in narcotics traffic, Government officials said to day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bankers Hit Proxmire Charge That Treasury Discriminates
description: Bankers her responded an grily yesterday to charges by Senator William Proxmire that the Treasury Department is discriminating in favor of the country's 10 biggest banks in the way it handles deposits of Government funds.

title: Foe Gains Near Long Tieng
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 12 (AP)North Vietnamese forces captured two Government po sitions on high ground over looking the embattled base of Long Tieng, informed sources here reported today.

title: Shula Rebuts Charge of Former Coach
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 12 Don Shula, coach of the Miami Dolphins, is known as a man with a temper. Under restraint today, he replied to accusations of George Wilson, the coach he succeeded at the helm of the Dolphins. Wilson had said that the Miami team was readymade when Shula ar rived in 1970 to take over as coach.

title: Sports of The Times
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 12Whenever any of the Dallas Cowboys begins to assay victory chances in Sunday's Super Bowl game, they all reach the same inevitable conclusion. Those victory chances will depend to a considerable extent on how skillful they are in bottling up the explosive charges of Nick Buoniconti, the Miami middle linebacker with the low center of gravity and the high percentage of smearing enemy ballcarriers. We have to make certain on every play, said Tom Landry, the ranch foreman of the Cowboys,that we block out Buoniconti. Otherwise our running game just won't work. He isn't big but he's quick, a hardnosed guy who takes off running and begins piling up plays. He sets the tempo for the Miami defenses and it doesn't seem to me that he even isguessing where the play is going. It's as if he already knows. But it's his great pursuit that makes him such a great linebacker.

title: SELECTIVE SERVICE ALTERS TWO RULINGS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 The Selective Service system announced today that poten tial draftees would be permit ted to appeal adverse decisions of their draft hoards after they had appeared in person before the boards.

title: Chaps, Despite Poor Start, Turn Back Rockets, 107102
description: DALLAS, Jan. 12 (AP)The Dallas Chaparrals, plagued by spoor shooting in the first half, caught fire in the final quarter to take a 107102 American Basketball Association victory over the Denver Rockets to night.

title: Separated Twins Doing Well
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Jan. 12 (Canadian Press)Cynthia and Christine, Siamese twin girls separated in a twoand ahalfhour operation Sunday, are now taking oral feedings and are coming along well, Dr. Reuben Weinberg, pediatrician for the twins and spokesman for the surgical team that per formed the operation, said to day.

title: Kialoa II Is First Yacht to Finish in Race to Auckland
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand Jan. 12 (Reuters)  The American yawl Kialoa II was first across the finish line today in the HobarttoAuck land yacht race.

title: Warm Weather Stirs Concern Over Infestation by Pests Later
description: The vagaries of the jet stream that have been bringing unus ually mild weather here so far this winter may result in un usually severe infestations of gypsy moths and inchworms later this year.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12When the President's advisers met to ponder the complexities of India's war upon Pakistan, Professor Kissinger, the President's man in the White House, did most of the talking We have the records of some of those meetings; they were leaked to Jack Anderson, the syndicated columnist, and later published.

title: TV: Suffer Little Children of Northern Ireland
description: Good news, bad news. The good news: Some of the more notable duds of the television season are finally being replaced. The bad news: One of the replace ments is something called Me and the Chimp.

title: Jury Awards $800,000 in a Malpractice Case
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 12 (UPI) A Circuit Court Jury has awarded $800,000 in damages in one of the largest medical malpractice judgments ever returned here.

title: Trade and Mark Leaving the State
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Jan. 12They call them Trade and Mark, routinely and with some affection, around the Smith Brothers cough drop factory here.

title: GRAEBNER VICTOR IN FLORIDA TENNIS
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Jan. 12 (AP)Clark Graebner of New York stopped Valdmir Zednick of Czechoslovakia, 60, 64, in the opening round of the Jack sonville indoor tennis cham pionship today.

title: PUPIL INTEGRATION PACED BY SOUTH
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (UPI) The Government reported to day that for the first time there are more black pupils attending allNegro schools in the North than there are in the South. Officials said busing in the South was one of the main rea sons for the change.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Once again, the New York Power Squadron is offering its annual saltwater game fishing course for those who wish to learn more about the sport from recognized experts.

title: ROCKEFELLER PLANS TO HOLD SPENDING AT CURRENT LEVEL
description: ALBANY, Jan. 12Governor Rockefeller will present a $7.9 billion barebones budget to the Legislature on Monday for the state fiscal year beginning April 1.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: News of Skiing
