description: TORONTO, Jan. 15The New York Rangers, playing with un usual slovenliness, dissipated 20 lead in the third period to night and then let the Toronto Maple Leafs beat them in the last 23 seconds, 43.

title: Maids Are Joining Union on Long Island
description: ROOSEVELT, L. I.The young black girl was grad uated fifth in a class of 215 in a small Southern town.

title: Surprises Expected in Choices For U.S. Olympic Ski Squads
description: KITZBUEHEL, Austria, Jan. 15The United States will name its Alpine skiing team for the Winter Olympics this week and some hearts will be broken.

title: Blues Halt Stars, 72
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 15 (AP) Garry Unger and Jack Eggers scored two goals each tonight, leading the St. Louis Blues to a 72 triumph over the Min nesota North Stars.

title: Classes in Boating To Begin Tomorrow
description: Registrations for free pilot ing and smallboat handling course are still being accept ed by the New York Power Squadron. The first class starts tomorrow at 6:45 P.M. at the High School for Art and Design, Second Avenue and 57th Street.

title: Cartoonists Will Honor Paige at Dinner Jan. 25
description: Satchel Paige, who now is in the Baseball Hall of Fame, is to receive the Na tional Cartoonists Society's No 1 award at a dinner in the Hotel Commodore Jan. 25.

title: WALL STREET
description: Which stocks will be the best performers in 1972?

title: Article 4  No Title
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 15 (UPI) The Soviet Communist party newspaper Pravda said today that the world's balance of forces had shifted in favor of Communism, thus ?? possible the limitation of the arms race.

title: Miss Victoria A. Chanski Is Bride
description: Miss Victoria Anne Chain ski, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Edward L. Chainski of Lake Forest, Ill., and Jonathan George Verity, son of Mr. and Mrs. C. William Verity Jr. of Middletown, Ohio, were married here yesterday after noon in St. Thomas Epis copal Church by the Rev. Arnold Morris.

title: Fassbender Advances
description: DURBAN, South Africa, Jan. 15 (AP)Jurgen Fassbender, the West German Davis Cup player, gained the men's singles final of the Natal Sugar Tennis tournament today by beating Andrew Pattison of Rhodesia, 63, 64, 57, 26, 62.

title: Nets Turn Back Cougars, 10998, as Baum Scores 16 Points in Fourth Quarter
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Jan. 15The New York Nets lost both a 20point lead and Rick Barry tonight but with massive help from their re serves managed to defeat the Carolina Cougars, 10998.

title: Bruins Top Hawks, 42 on Late Esposito Goals
description: BOSTON, Jan. 15 (UPI)Phil Esposito beat his goaltending brother, Tony, twice in the final six minutes tonight for a 42 Boston Bruins' victory over the Chicago Black Hawks that snapped a threegame Boston streak without a victory.

title: Cairo Is Said to Assure Peking on Raid's Visit
description: CAIRO, Jan. 15  Egypt was reported today by the Cairo paper Al Ahram to have assured China that a disrupted visit to Peking by Foreign Minister Mahmoud Riad would be carried out as soon as possible.

title: Scribner Asks Revamping Of Posts at School Board
description: A sweeping reorganization of the Board of Education's top level headquarters structure has been proposed by Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner in a move to provide stronger educational and administrative leadership to the decentralized city school system.

title: Connors Upsets Graebner
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Jan. 15 (AP)Jim Connors, 19 years old, of Belleville, Ill., playing his first event as a professional, won the Jacksonville indoor tennis tournament today by upsetting No. 2 seeded Clark Graebner of New York City, 75, 64.

title: Pricing Flexibility for Squibb
description: Dennis C. Fill, president of E. R. Squibb & Sons, Inc., the ethicaldrug unit of the Squibb Corporation, became increasingly enthusiastic as he discussed the advantages of the Federal Price Commis sion's new plan called term limit pricing.

title: Malta, After New Talks, Cancels Ouster of British
description: ROME, Jan. 15Prime Minis ter Dom Mintoff of Malta to day canceled his deadline, set for this date, for the with drawal of all British forces from his island and said that a new agreement on military bases now seemed possible.

title: Television
description: IN New York recently, some discus sion about television could suddenly be heard again. The odd thing is that the talk centered on a series of news programs, most of which dated back to 1953 and 1954. The weeklong series, presented by public TV's Channel 13/WNET, was called A Murrow Retro spective, consisting of a look at and discussions of the work of the late Edward R. Murrow.

title: Giants and Tokyo Team Make 2Player Trade
description: HONOLULU, Jan. 15 (UPI) The San Francisco Giants and the Lottie Orions of Tokyo today announced the first international player transaction in major league baseball history.

title: Religion
description: ALBANY  Three Federal judges threw out as unconstitutional last week a new state law that permits $33mil lion of the taxpayers' money to go to parochial schools each yearbut of ficials of the Roman Catholic church seemed not terribly surprised or upset.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Polypropylene fiber, one of the newer manmade fibers that had experienced some what of an arrested growth in the apparel trades, is gain ing a new lease on life.

title: Mailing of RentRise Notices Put Off to Week of Jan. 24
description: The mailing of notifications to landlords and tenants of new rent increases has been put over to the week of Jan. 24 because of technical diffi culties and the necessity for certification by the Federal Price Commission, it was an nounced yesterday.

title: A Slightly Obstructed View Of the Nightclubs Of Paree
description: PARISThe scene: the Cityrama travel agency, off Rue de Rivoli. The time: early evening. People waiting. Hunched on low stools, standing. Leafing through tour folders or Michelin's Guide to Paris or Europe on $5 a Day. Examining their hands. Sighing heavily. Staring at the clock.

title: Gardens
description: THE waving plumes of the common reed, phragmites, are typical of marshes and wet lands. They are seen along many of the parkways, bridge approaches and in boggy places. The reed's long and branching rootstocks invade the muddy shores of bays, lakes and streams. They cov er thousands of acres in Long Island and New Jersey.

title: Jane Williams Married Here
description: Miss Jane Cathryn Wil liams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank C. Williams of Mantoloking, N. J., was mar ried here yesterday afternoon to John Scarlett Custer Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Custer of Bala Cynwyd, Pa. The Rev. Dr. Terence J. Finlay performed the ceremony in the chapel of St. Bartholo mew's Episcopal Church.

title: Restaurant Guard Off Times Square Is Held in Slaying
description: A private security guard was charged with homicide early yesterday morning in the fatal shooting of a customer in the bustling Grant's restaurant on West 42d Street.

title: Storm Over Courts
description: A series of political events, related seemingly by choice rather than by chance, con tinued to leave organized tennis in a state of tumult, at a time when the sport is enjoying record participant popularity.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONLadies and gentle men, said the President, I am announcing today the withdrawal of an additional 70,000 troops from Vietnam over the next three months. This means that our troop ceiling will he down to 69,000 by May 1  There will be another announcement that will be made before May 1 with regard to a further withdrawal.

title: What He Thought Was Funny Was Funny
description: THE true and simple comic mind is ultimately unfathomable. Georges Feydeau, I think, had a true and simple comic mind  true in the sense that what he thought was funny was funny and simple in the sense that a child or an octogenar ian could laugh at approximately the same timeand as he turned out his 39 confections in which a bevy of Parisian butterflies and bullfrogs tried vainly to get themselves into the wrong beds he did indeed, from time to time, toss us a line or a situation that could be readily explained as humor.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15In these remarkable clays of the women's lib movement, it is astonishing that no body has come to the defense of the most admirable and intelligent but also the most masculinedominated, down trodden and longsuffering women in America todaythe wives of the candi dates for the Presidency of the United States. Dear Ms. Gloria Steinem, how could you have missed it?

title: Bhutto Willing to Arrest More If He Is Asked by Sheik Mujib
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 15President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto of Pakistan offered to day to arrest one or two peo ple if asked to do so by Sheik Mujibur Rahman, Prime Minis ter of the Bengali regime that has taken over East Pakistan.

title: A GHANA GENERAL AND 2 ARRESTED
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Jan. 15 The leaders of Ghana's new military Government crushed today what they said was a plot to reinstate Prime Minister Kofi A. Busia, whom they had overthrown Thursday. The lead ers had three alleged plotters jailed.

title: Wings Defeat Kings, 74
description: DETROIT, Jan. 15 (UPI) Mickey Redmond's two third period goals enabled the De troit Red Wings to recover the lead and post a 74 victory over the Los Angeles Kings tonight, their eighth home triumph in a row.

title: WHITE HOUSE SET POLICY ON ASYLUM
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 The White House has stepped into a yearlong dispute be tween the State and Defense Departments and decided in favor of the State Department on new guidelines issued this week on how to treat foreign ers seeking asylum.

title: Reader's Report
description: Of Love Remembered

title: Syracuse Wins, 8472
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Jan. 15 (AP)Syracuse rallied in the second half and pulled away in the final minutes to score an 8472 victory over Manhattan tonight.

title: Study Shows That Increases in the State's Taxes Are Following a Trend Seen Throughout the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 New York residents who looked at the latest incometax in crease and concluded that taxes in their state must be rising faster than those anywhere else in the country are wrong. The rate at which taxes have been going up in New York in recent years is very close to the national average.

title: Selling Computers to Soviet
description: The American computer in dustry has long cast cove tous glances at the virtually untapped Easternbloc mar ket.

title: St. John's Swimmers Beat Fordham on Disqualification
description: St. John's defeated Fordham in swiming, 57 to 56, at Alumni Hall Pool in Jamaica, Queens, last night. The decision went to St. John's when Fordham was disqualified in the final event, the 400yard freestyle relay.

title: Taxpayers Warned of Bills Higher than Witholdings
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) if taxpayers believe insuf ficient funds were withheld from their paychecks to cover their tax bills during 1971, they should file their income tax returns early, the Internal Revenue Service said today.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Miss Titova, Soviet Union, Wins in 500Meter Skating
description: INZELL, Germany, Jan. 15 (AP)Ludmilla Titova of the Soviet Union won the women's European 500meter speed skating title today with a time of 43.27 seconds.

title: Transfer of 90 West Side Police Asked on Grounds of Efficiency
description: The divisional commander of four precincts on Manhattan's West Side announced yesterday that he would seek the trans fer of 90 of the 273 policemen in the 24th Precinct this week to other, less demanding areas.

title: Neighborhoods: Changing Inwood Middle Class
description: Who knows Inwood, which is where people think River dale or Washington Heights ought to be, and is bounded by 193d Street on the south and the Harlem River Ship Canal on the north?

title: U.S. Move Foreseen
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 15 (UPT)  The Government will move quickly to force a settle ment of the dock dispute if longshoremen walk off the job Monday, Mr. Counts said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Serena Welles Fiancee Of Ambler H. Moss Jr.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Welles have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Serena Welles, to Ambler H. Moss of Brooklandville, Md.

title: Reader's Report
description: Like Samuel Richardson (author of Pamela, the first epistolary novel) Lawrence Block is into letterwriting and sex. Richardson's novel was subtitled Virtue Rewarded; Mr. Block's might be billed Vice Rewarded. I'm not go ing to strain for further comparisons.

title: A book so bad it was impossible to put down
description: Recently when I was ordered to bed with what we now call a viral infection, I took along some books that I hoped would not overtax my dimmed wits, and the one on top of the pile was Robert Sencourt's T. S. Eliot: A Memoir. Reading the opening pages I found them so little taxing that I could only conclude that it was the tem perature I was running that made this prose seem so ab surdly vacuous. But then I came to page 33, where I readin dubitably read, for my eyes were good enough  this re markable sentence: Scrupulous as he was, Tom would never deny the existence of sex in stinct either in himself or any body else.

title: F.A.A. Is Training Dogs To Help Find Explosives
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 The Federal Aviation Admin istration is having four Ger man shepherd dogs trained to sniff out explosives in the luggage of airline passengers and in cargo holds.

title: Cathy Gelfand Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Herman G. Gelfand of Flushing, Queens, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Cathy Susan Gelfand, to Leon Allen Pollack, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nat Pollack of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Bible Class in Kearny Sends Donation to Fund for Neediest
description: Declaring that faith without works is dead, the Adult Bible Class of the First Presbyterian Church of Kearny, N.J., sent $120 as a contribution to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund. The gift was one of 260 contributions from individuals and societies recorded yester day. The total amount received was $13,380.54.

title: Bank Aide Fiance Of Myrn E. Thayer
description: CHATHAM, N.J., Jan. 15 Miss Myrn Ellen Thayer, an assistant personnel man ager with CBWLHayden Stone, Inc., New York in vestment bankers, and Rob ert Gene Barrett, a second vice president with the firm, plan to be married in March at the Fifth Avenue Presby terian Church in New York.

title: The War Wards Are Emptying
description: Many wards in the huge hospital are empty and have been closed down. Other wards have been combined. No longer are any wards filled to capacity in this hos pital that once bulged with victims of war.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONMost of the for eign ambassadors in this city are, if anything, discreet when they speak in public. That has been especially true of ambassadors from Japan; for years they have bored American audi ences with dry recitations of trade figures and said little about the funda mental issues in United StatesJapan relations.

title: Review 1  No Title
description: No: Ephemeralization is the key word in Buckminster Fuller's bulging lexicon. To him it means in creasing the obsolescence rate of all goods in order to speed up the recycling of elements. The corollary is regenerative or inflamed con sumerism. Therefore, the secret of Fuller's Synergistic Utopia is what Dr. Seuss, in his new book, The Lorax, calls biggering, and iden tifies as the way to oblivion.

title: Alas, Poor Doug! I Knew Him Well
description: A couple of people asked me the other day, What's become of Doug? I was frankly touched that they should remember or care about my family's first Doug las fir, a tree whose presence added so much to our Christ mas spirit.

title: Democratic Unit In Massachusetts Backs McGovern
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Jan. 15 (UPI)  Senator George Mc Govern, Democrat of South Dakota, won today the en dorsement of the Massachu setts Citizens Presidential Cau cus.

title: Maurice Chevalier 18881972
description: AT83, Maurice Chevalier was much too young to die. He radiated optimism, goodwill and above all the joie de vivre that every human being longs for. Yet when I first knew him, these qualities seemed to belong only to Chevalier, the entertainer, not the man. This was 40 years ago, when I directed him in Love Me Tonight.

title: The Nation
description: Ever since President Nixon's eco nomic stabilization program went into effect last summerand particularly since the start of Phase Two in No vemberthe question of retroactive pay increases, frozen under the Presi dent's order, has bedeviled employers, employes and the Government. Con gress had ruled that employes could collect retroactive pay increases ex cept when the Pay Board considered them unreasonably inconsistent with the Phase Two program. That left it all up to the Pay Board, and last week the board made its ruling.

title: Paula Sperber Best Bowler
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 15 (UPI) Paula Sperber, a 20yearold blonde from Miami, was named woman bowler of the year to day by the Bowling Writers As sociation. Miss Sperber had 362 points in the voting by 117 writers, to edge Mrs. Millie Martorella of Rochester, who had 339, and Patty Costello of New Carrolltown, Md., who had 308.

title: Jim Bostwick Beats Scott
description: Jimmy Bostwick of Brook ville, L. I., won the United States open court tennis cham pionship yesterday by defeating Gene Scott of New York. Scott, a former Davis Cup player, lost on the courts of the Racquet and Tennis Club, 65, 64, 26, 62.

title: Aspiring Actor Is Given Hope
description: To Julius Hollingsworth, a teen  ager with theatrical aspirations, Dorothy Stick ney's message was persist ence.

title: Floridians 110105 Victors
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Jan. 15 (AP)Mack Calvin pumped in a seasonhigh 40 points tonight to lead the Floridians to a 110105 success over the Dallas Chaparrals.

title: R. L. Cullen Jr. Is Married Here To Miss Byrnes
description: Miss Barbara Ann Byrnes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank M. Byrnes of New York and Westhampton Beach, L. I. was married yesterday after noon to Richard L. Cullen Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Cullen of Lake Forest, Ill.

title: Sally Edwards Plans Nuptials
description: HINSDALE, Ill., Jan. 15 Mr. and Mrs. Robert Edwards have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Sally Edwards, to Warren L. Simpson, Jr., son of Lieu tenant Colonel Simpson, U.S.A.F., and Mrs. Simpson of Riverside, Calif.

title: Jonathan P. Matson Marries Miss Laura Bishop in Mt. Kisco
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., Jan. 15Miss Laura Mary Cun ningham Bishop and Jonathan Philip Matson were married here this afternoon in St. Mark's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Phil Porter. The Rev. Richard Mayberry as sisted.

title: Queens Comes of Middle Age
description: There are 120,000 more women than men living in Queens and, according to un gallant census statisticians, the chances are 5050 that a Queens woman is more than 37 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy's charge that the Civil Service system acts as a handcuff, inhibiting promo tion of strong leaders in his department, was challenged yesterday by Controller Abra ham D. Beame.

title: Defects Found in Chevrolets By Wisconsin Auto Bureau
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 15 (AP)The Wisconsin Division of Motor Vehicles here says that nearly 40 per cent of the 19661969 Chevrolets it has tested have faulty engine mounts.

title: Individuality Marks Repertory of Songs By Joe Hickerson
description: Joe Hickerson's position as a folk archivist for the Library of Congress gives him access to an unusually broad repertory of songs. He drew on this repertory during his per formance Friday night for the New York Pinewoods Folk Music Club at the Church of Our Lady of Peace Auditorium, 237 E. 62d St. But he added to everything he sang a personal dimension through the close communication he established with his audience, giving each of his songs a very warm in dividuality.

title: The Nation
description: On the nation's movie screens these days, James Bond is skirmishing again with his old nemesis, Ernst Stavro Blofeld. In Diamonds Are For ever, the crafty Blofeld is ensconced in the heavily fortified penthouse of a Las Vegas hotel and impersonating a billionaire recluse, Willard Whyte.

title: ExSenator Smathers Rewed
description: HENDERSONVILLE, N. C., Jan. 15 (AP)Former Senator George Smathers of Florida and Miss Carolyn Hyder were married Jan. 4 in Albany, Ga., the mother of the bride said to day. Mrs. Margaret Hyder of Henderson said her daughter had worked on the Senator's staff in Washington for about five years until 1968, when Mr. Smathers did not seek reelec tion. Miss Hyder is 29 years old. Mr. Smathers, who is 59, was divorced by his wife, Rosemary, last Sept. 24 They had been married 32 years.

title: WOMEN AN ISSUE AT HARVARD CLUB
description: If Harvard admits women, can the Harvard Club of New York be far behind?

title: ASIAN COUNTRIES FEAR A RICE GLUT
description: TOKYO, Jan. 15The rice revolution in Asia, while easing the threat of mass starvation, has begun to cause economic strains as production soars, prices fall and markets for traditional rice exporting coun tries dwindle.

title: Stamps
description: APLEA for the NonPro liferation of Nuclear Weapons, will be the message carried by United Nations stamps sched uled to appear Feb. 14 here and In Geneva, Switzerland.

title: Real Note, $8.80, Wins by Neck In Germantown at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 15It was all in the family at Liberty Bell racetrack today as Menotti Aristone rode his father's horse, Real Note, to victory by a neck, over Andrew J. Somerville's Crack Ruler in the $28,525 Germantown Handicap.

title: PRICE RULE EASED FOR SMALL STORES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 The Price Commission an nounced today that retail stores and businesses with annual revenues under $200,000 would not be required to post signs listing price information.

title: Ian Smith to Meet With Black M.P.'s On Rhodesia Issue
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 15 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Ian D. Smith has agreed to meet black Rhodesian members of Parliament to discuss the current dispute over the terms of the projected British Rhode sian settlement. The British Rhodesian crisis began when Rhodesia unilaterally declared independence from Britain in 1965, largely because of the British pressure on Salisbury to prepare to increase the vot ing rights of the black Rho desians.

title: How Eddie, Marcia and I Smuggled Pickled Frogs Through Guatemala And Lived to Tell All
description: June 2, 1971 BOARD Greyhound for San Juan, Tex., with $200 cash and Mas ter Charge card. In dubious standing with Master Charge. Leaving Iowa City an university life for good. G.I. Bill exhausted. Profes sional student days over. No prospects for future in land of opportunity. Vic tim of the times. Thirty years old and can't find work. Outstanding creden tials worthless. Seven years college. Hard worker and honest. Type 60 words per minute, no errors. Leaving country for fresh start in El Salvador, Central America.

title: ALBRIGHT EXCELS IN ORGAN RECITAL
description: It is taking an unconscion ably long time for the organ to catch up with other instruments and enter the 20thcentury mainstream. Only Messiaen in France has written a sizable literature that exploits the or gan's immense potential for contemporary musicmaking.

title: Helen Brown Wed in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 In All Saints Episcopal Church at Chevy Chase Cir cle here, Miss Helen Alexan dra Duma Brown was mar ried this afternoon to Paul Edward May by the Rev. Richard Allan Miller.

title: Education
description: The decision to let young college students register to vote in their college towns has led to a new question that could aggravate the alreadytight financial condition of publicly supported institutions.

title: CELTICS TROUNCE HAWKS, 122 TO 106
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 15 (AP) The Boston Celtics, behind John Havlicek's seasonhigh 40 points, crushed the Atlanta Hawks, 122106, tonight in a National Basketball Associa tion game.

title: AntiNixon Drive Is Gaining Among Conservatives in California
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 15  Delbert Curtis drove his car into a service station on the Camino Real for gasoline one day last week, a few blocks from the Western White House where President Nixon was meeting with Premier Elsaku Sato of Japan.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15One trick for following the news during a political campaign begins with under standing that American reporters, Vice President Agnew's testimony notwithstanding, almost invariably write in an idiom of praise.

title: Education
description: Should government have the right to force children to attend school? Thousands of dropouts and truants obviously challenge that power of the state just as vigorously as the army of truant officers tries to uphold it. But in recent years, as opposition to governmental power has spread from the political right to the left, compulsory education, once considered a high achievement of liberal social policy, has come under increasing attack.

title: Pearce Group Prepares
description: SALISBURY, Jan. 15Lord Pearce and the members of his commission prepared today to begin their countrywide travels to test Rhodesian opinion on the settlement terms.

title: Boe Ready to Gather His Sports Clan Under Permanent Roof on Long Island
description: Since he got into sports in 1968 with a football team called the Westchester Bulls, Roy Lars Magnus Boe has brought his clubs into the big arenas everywhere else but home. It soon will be different.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 15 (AP) The Air Force Academy scored in the first halfminute and the last halfminute of the game tonight as it defeated St. Louis University, 75.

title: Heart Attack a Peril of Super Bowl Fan
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 15 Harris Ray will not be among the millions of Americans watching his favorite pro fessional football team, the Dallas Cowboys, play the Miami Dolphins here tomor row because the tension of the Super Bowl might kill him.

title: New Medical Specialty Urged To Help One Die With Dignity
description: A physician with a philosoph ical bent, writing in a leading medical journal, has suggested the establishment of a new medical specialty that would provide peace, comfort and re lief rather than heroic measures to prolong the lives of medically hopeless patients.

title: Italy's Judiciary Divided on Role of Judges in Politics
description: ROME, Jan. 15Italy's high est magistrates warned this week that the crime rate was rapidly rising throughout the nation and disagreed in public on whether judges should get involved in politics.

title: Art
description: NOT having seen Narrow Road to the Deep North, a new play by Edward Bond at the Reper tory Theater of London Center, and having been unable to determine whet ier or not James Cahill, one of the actors, does or does not have anything to do with James Cahill, a member or the faculty of the Uni versity of California at Berkeley, who wrote the catalogue of Scholar Painters of Japan: The Nanga School, an exhibi tion at Asia House Gallery, 112 East 64th Street, In which The Narrow Road to the Deep North, a handscroll on loan from the Hirayama collection in Tokyo, is exhibited, and being worn out anyway, having contracted a nasty head cold in line of duty by getting chilled and wet en route to Asia House to preview the exhibition, I am taking the privilege of copping out on any crossreferences between the exhibition and the play, the whole problem having arisen as a bothersome coincidence through the choice of the illustration for this report, discovered after it was too late to make a change.

title: Tennessee Beats Georgia
description: ATHENS, Ga., Jan. 15 (AP) Tennessee intercepted a Georgia inbounds pass in the closing seconds to clinch a 5957 Southeastern Conference victory tonight.

title: HOSICK IS WINNER IN SKI JUMP AGAIN
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N. Y., Jan. 15Jack Hosick wasn't too happy a week ago when he won the skijumping tourna ment on the 50meter hill here.

title: MILLER, WITH 210, TAKES SHOT LEAD
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 15John Miller, a member of golf's mod set, moved ahead of Jack Nicklaus and Tony Jack lin today and led the Bing Crosby tourney by one stroke. With a fiveunderpar 67 over the Pebble Beach course where he won the 1968 California amateur title, the slim, 24year old professional from Napa, Calif., brought his 54hole ag gregate to 210.

title: CAMBODIANS CHARGE PLOT BY 17 TO AID FOE
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 15 (AP)A colonel in the Cam bodian high command's mili tary intelligence department faces a possible death penalty along with 16 other Cambo dians charged with attempting to sell a truckload of antibiot ics and other medicine to the enemy.

title: Rural Crime Spreads Fear and Distrust
description: PERRY, Iowa, Jan. 15  There was a time when the Durwood Scheibs left the front door of their farm home unlocked day and night and offered a steamy cup of cof fee and a cheery Hello, there! to any stranger com ing up their muddy lane to break their isolation.

title: WORTHY MATCHUP
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 15 The Dallas Cowboys are favor ites, by 5 points in wagering circles, to win the sixth Super Bowl game tomorrow from the Miami Dolphins before 81,023 people in Tulane Stadium.

title: Kari Vilamaa to Wed Annemarie Montera
description: WAPPINGERS FALLS, N.Y., Jan. 15The engagement of Miss Annemarie Montera, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Peter P. Montera of Wappin gers Falls, to Kari Vilamaa, son of Mr. and Mrs. Simo Vilamaa of Lomala, Hope well Junction, has been an nounced by the prospective bride's parents.

title: To Him Bad Taste Can Be Good Taste
description: PARIS (AP)Mrs. Aristotle S. Onassis took home a marble dog. Doris Duke bought a few Indonesian columns. And the last thing Chanel is reported to have bought was a dressing table studded with horses' heads as a present for Jacques Chazot, the ballet dancer.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: 15 Vietnam Mourners Killed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam Jan. 15. (Reuters)Fifteen civilians were killed when a funeral vehicle struck a mine in South Vietnam's nothern province of Quangnam, the Saigon high command announced today.

title: Music
description: IT is hard to think of Alexander Scriabin  who was born a hun dred years ago last Jan. 6as a figure of this cen tury. But is is equally hard to think of him as a figure of the 19th. When he died, in 1915, he bestrode a no man's land, living in a world of his own devising. Toward the end he was probably mad, dreaming of visions, planning a musical work that would encompass all the arts. He would hook hells on clouds to summon spectators from all over the world. His Tenth Sonata (that shudder ingly sick piece; the sickest, I think, in the history of music, but eternally fascinat ing) was a sonata of insects. Insects are born from the sun  they are the sun's kisses.

title: Pacers Sink Pros, 117106
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 15 (AP) Bob Netolicky scored a game high of 29 points and Mel Daniels added 26 tonight as the Indiana Pacers beat the Mem phis Pros, 117106.

title: Christine Rockhill Is Wed to Student
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J. Jan. 15Mr. and Mrs. Robert K. Rockhill have announced the engagement of then daugh ter, Miss Christine Rockhill, to James R. Lane, son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald E. Lane of Glen Ridge, A June wedding is planned.

title: Zaire to Liberate Pygmies
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Jan. 15 (Agence France  Presse)  A general census of pygmies in Zaire will be made soon, the Social Affairs Ministry an nounced this week. President Joseph D. Mobutu announced recently that he would liber ate the pygmies completely from their wild state in the immense jungle areas of Zaire formerly known as the Congo.

title: Pay Unit Member Hopes Controls Will Ease Soon
description: Kermit Gordon, president of the Brookings Institution and a public member of the Federal Pay Board, said yesterday that he hoped to see an early lift ing of many of the controls in stituted under Phase Two of President Nixon's economic pro gram.

title: Penguins Down Flyers, 42
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 15 (AP) Tim Horton set up all goals as the Pittsburgh Penguins de feated the Philadelphia Flyers, 42, for their first victory in their last nine games.

title: The Quarterbacks
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 15The quar terbacks in the Super Bowl, Bob Griese of the Miami Dolphins and Roger Stau bach of the Dallas Cowboys, have much in common. Their wives are former nurses; they work in real estate apart from pro football; they are Catholics; they grew up in Ohio River cities not far apart, Staubach in Cincinnati and Griese in Evansville, Ind.; their uniform number is 12, and they both can throw a football with astounding accuracy and force.

title: Castellaras  Where All the Houses Bear One Man's Imprint
description: CASTELLARAS, FranceThe Ro mans must have had an eye for property values. When all roads led like spokes in a wheel to the hub of Rome, the empire was studded with Pony Expresstype outposts, each on a highly desirable chunk of land almost as if they had been selected by a patrician preoccupied with his invest ment portfolio.

title: NOTRE DAME FIVE TOPS TULANE, 8778
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 15 (AP) Tom O'Mara, a sophomore forward, scored 35 points, 23 of them in the secondhalf to day, to lead Notre Dame to an 8778 basketball victory over Tulane.

title: Opera: Modern Touch
description: STRATFORD, Conn., Jan. 15There are at least two ways of thinking about the production of Four Saints in Three Acts presented at the Shakespeare Festival Theater here this weekend by the music department of the University of Bridgeport.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Junket to Africa
description: At a time when the United Nations is reeling toward bankruptcy, the Security Council's decision to hold a costly special session in Africa is incredible. To take this decision without even a formal vote on the eve of a desperate drive by the new Secretary General to pare $6 million from the U.N. budget is to invite the late Dean Acheson's derisory question in another con text: Who's loony now?

title: Law
description: In September, 1969, Milwaukee's militant civil rights priest, the Rev. James F. Groppi, led about 1,000 angry followers into the Wisconsin State Assembly chambers to protest welfare cuts. Assemblymen were forced from their seats and before the demonstra tors were routed, they did about $26,000 in damage to furnishings. Father Groppi was arrested on disor derly conduct charges (a jury later acquitted him) and two days later the Assembly held him in contempt and sentenced him to six months in jail. Father Groppi served 10 days of that sentence and then was released when he appealed the action.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Law
description: WASHINGTONAmericans of all ages, conditions and all dispositions constantly form associations, Count de Tocqueville observed in the early years of independenceand the trend has, if anything, accelerated.

title: LEVITT SCORES CITY ON RELIEF CHEATS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 15State Con troller Arthur Levitt charged today that New York City was lax in keeping ineligibles off its welfare rolls and that this cost $60million a year.

title: An M.D. Reviews Dr. Welby of TV
description: THE scene, barely believable and yet commonplace, has repeat ed itself over and over again in the past six years, ever since my hospital installed television sets in every room. I'm making late rounds or examining an emergency admis sion, working at the patient's bed side, palpating his abdomen, check ing his pulseand all the while the patient is staring fixedly at the TV set, where (when I glance up from my own work) a TV doctor is ex amining a TV patient. Probably it's hard to tell from my own glances the TV patient isn't really paying at tention to her TV doctor, but is instead watching the matchboxsized screen in the corner of her TV room.

title: Giants' Future (on the Field) Must Be Decided in Next Two Weeks
description: During the next two weeks, the management of the New York Giants must make fundamental decisions. Be tween the completion of the Super Bowl game today and the college draft on Feb. 1, the basic shape of the 1972 team must be determined at least in theory.

title: Senate Outtalks House, Record of 1971 Shows
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI)  The Senate talked almost twice as much as the House in 1971.

title: Virginia Tech 7060 Victor
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Jan. 15 (AP)Allan Bristow scored 29 points to lead Virginia Tech to a 7060 victory over Wake Forest tonight.

title: Hunter Stops C.C.N.Y., 7466
description: John Bradley and Reggie Speights led a Hunter College spurt last night that lifted the Hawks to a 7466 triumph over City College at the losers' Win gate Gymnasium.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Rome, which experienced a rise and a fall, had only one Colosseum. The United States, which may yet have a fall, has built dozens of coli seums, arenas and stadiums, domed and undomed. The fi nancing of these structures has not yet contributed to whatever descent our society may be enduring. But there may come a day.

title: Books:
description: HOUSEHOLD ECOLOGY. By Julia Percivall and Pixie Burger. PrenticeHall, Inc. 230 pages. $5.95.

title: Medicine/Science
description: The leading cause of death among newborn babies is hyaline membrane disease (HMD)  the illness that killed President Kennedy's infant son. It takes some 20,000 newborn lives in the United States each year.

title: U.S. HORSES FACE 3NATION BOYCOTT
description: DENVER, Jan. 15The Unit ed States Equestrian Team is faced with the grave problem of a possible embargo on American horses in several Eu ropean countries after March 31, Whitney Stone the group's president, said today.

title: Judge Cuts Temporary Rise In ThirdClass Mail Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) Users of thirdclass mail won a partial victory when Federal District Judge George L. Hart Jr. ordered a temporary rate in crease reduced to 20 per cent from 24 per cent.

title: KENNEDY URGES U.S. HALT NUCLEAR TESTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (Reuters)Senator Edward M. Kennedy urged President Nixon tonight to announce a mora torium on underground nuclear tests to last as long as the Soviet Union refrained from testing any nuclear weapons of its own.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The Nation
description: The Interstate Highway System, threequarters complete, winds across 32,000 miles and, en route, has de voured more than 485 million barrels of cement. It has been hailed as one of the great engineering achievements of all time.

title: Mrs. King and Miss Melville Gain Final in $ 17,000 British Motors Tennis
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 15 (UPI) A new face  Kerry Melvilleand a familiar one Mrs. Billie Jean Kinggained the final of the $17,000 British Motors protennis tournament last night with impressive vic tories before a packed gallery at the Civic Auditorium.

title: CITY UNIT TO SEEK FUNDS ON OUTSIDE
description: The Department of Consumer Affairs, the smallest of the city's major departments, will seek industry, foundation and Federal funds this year to pay for extra programs Commis sioner Bess Myerson says the administration cannot afford out of its own treasury.

title: News of the Rialto
description: THAT mischievous Anthony Shaffer is at it again. Having supplied us with Sleuth, a thriller whose shenanigans continue to delight its beholders at the Music Box, lie's promising another of similar ilk next fall. He's calling it This Savage Parade and, under standably, clams up when pressed for further informa tion. As Morton Gottlieb, who will sponsor the play with Helen Bonfils (they were involved with Sleuth) was saying the other day, If you tell anything, you are liable to give away too much. Still, it was possible to elicit, if not some hints, at least enough to whet an appetite.

title: Pave the Wetlands Or Let Them Be?
description: TAKE the most productive farm land in the United States. Pave it. Then put factories on it.

title: Petty Captures TopDriver Award And $7,500 Prize
description: Richard Petty of Randleman, N. C., the American race driver of the year for 1971, received the Martini and Rossi Golden Eagles trophy and a check for $7,500 at a special dinner last night at Charlotte, N. C.

title: G.O.P. Picks Delegates
description: FRAMINGHAM, Mass., Jan. 15 (AP)The Republican State Committee today named 10 delegates and 10 alternates, to be headed by Senator Edward W. Brooke, to the party's 1972 national convention in San Diego.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Nation
description: VIENTIANE, Laos  For years, the war in Laos has followed a repeti tive pattern. In the winter dry sea sons the North Vietnamese and their Pathet Lao allies have overrun towns and territories, only to withdraw be fore Government counterattacks when the summer rains came. It is winter again, but this time things are begin ning to look different.

title: PHILIP S. WOOD
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 15 (AP) Philip S. Wood, brother of the late inventor and speedboat racer Gar Wood, died here yes terday of a heart attack. He was 78 years old.

title: Son to Mrs. Schecter
description: A son was born Dec. 28 to Mr. and Mrs. Keeve Earle Schecter of New York at University Hospital. Mrs. Schecter is the former Miss Phyllis Nancy Pugatch, whose husband is an asso ciate registrar at Herbert H. Lehman College of the City University. The child has been named Clifford Douglas.

title: Eisendraths Have Son
description: A son was born Dec. 30 to Mr. and Mrs. Charles R. Ei sendrath in the American Hospital in Paris. Mrs. Ei sendrath is the former Miss Julia Alihe Cardozo of Wash ington. Her husband is a reporter with the TimeLife Bureau in Paris.

title: Peabody in Delegate Race
description: BOSTON, Jan. 15 (AP)for mer Gov. Endicott Peabody has obained papers to enable him to run as a delegateatlarge to the Democratic National Con vention. Mr. Peabody took out the papers yesterday after state election officials told him he could not enter his name on the ballot for Vice President in the state's April 25 Presidential primary. Mr. Peabody has en tered his name in the New Hampshire primary, which has provisions for VicePresidential candidates.

title: Marist Quintet Wins, 7662
description: KINGS POINT, N.Y., Jan. 15 Marist College defeated the United States Merchant Marine Academy, 7662, tonight in O'Hara Hall.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Relocation Hotel
description: Mrs. S., her three daugh ters and five grandchildren were burned out of their East Bronx tenement by a fire in July, 1970.

title: Recordings
description: WE LIVE in an age of discovery and re discovery. How for tunate for us that among those tirelessly look ing into forgotten piano man uscripts, Frank Cooper, pro fessor of piano at Butler Uni versity out in Indianapolis, labors midst the musty scores. Besides having been a guiding light in that Uni versity's past Romantic Mu sic Festivals, Professor Cooper has been recording some pi ano pieces himself and writ ing pages of program notes for a series of unusual piano music coming out on Genesis records.

title: Cut in Bank Interest Rates Announced by South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Jan. 15 In line with its policy of gradually lowering South Ko rea's high bank interest rates, the Government announced to day that the rates will be re duced to 19 per cent a year for loans and 16.3 per cent for time deposits, effective Mon day.

title: Warrior Inside Man Beats Knicks on His Long Shots
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 15Any one ever exposed to the clichs of sport is familiar with a hardearned victory. But the New York Knicks, en route to Houston today for a nationally televised game tomorrow, were contemplating the seldommen tioned but no less real hard earned defeat, which they suffered here last night at the hands of the Golden State Warriors, 115111.

title: BRUINS TROUNCE RED WINGS BY 92
description: BOSTON, Jan. 16 (UPI)A sixgoal outburst in the second period, their biggest in nearly three years, carried the Boston Bruins back into first place to night in a 92 rout of the De troit Red Wings.

title: Warfield Says Cowboys Closed Off Nixon's DownandIn Pass
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 16In his stoical manner Paul War field contended today that the Dallas Cowboys' pass defense had been committed to stopping the downandin pattern that President Nixon suggested to Coach Don Shula of the Dol phins nearly two weeks ago.

title: Clock Stops at Old Church
description: BOSTON, Tan. 16 (UPI)Time stood still for the first time ?? 245 years at a meeting yester day of the Bay State Historical Society at the Old North Church. The famous Avery Ben nett Clock, believed to be the oldest clock in a public meeting place, stopped Friday afternoon.

title: Back From the Dead
description: The state legislature is the Lazarus of American governmental structures. Once vital and alive and a focus of activity, then dead, it rises now across the country to tackle a backlog of unmet public needs.

title: Governor to Put Pressure On Albany to Save Budget
description: ALBANY, Jan. 16Governor Rockefeller will exert strong pressure in coming weeks to keep his proposed $7.9billion spending plan for the 197273 state fiscal year intact as legis lators, faced with November elections, start proposing changes.

title: EXCHANGE JOINED BY EQUITABLE LIFE
description: The Equitable Life Assurance Societythe thirdlargest life insurer in the nationdis closed yesterday that it had joined the PhiladelphiaBalti moreWashington Stock Ex change in a move to save money on brokerage fees.

title: PAKISTAN TO RUN 11 MORE CONCERNS
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 16  The Government today took over the management of 11 more industrial companies as part of its program of plac ing Pakistan's heavy industry under Government control.

title: Stage: Equity Library Theater Scores With 3 Old Revue Hits
description: A pink, winking cloud of joy has bounced into the Master Theater. The name of the game, comprising titles and material from three past Broadwayrevue hits, is One for the Money, Two for the Show and Three to Make Ready. Count 'em from way back1939, 1940 and 1946.

title: HENLEY HILL DEAD; EDITOR AT TRIBUNE
description: Henley Hill, for many years a senior editor at the old New York Herald Tribune, died Thursday in Los Angeles. He was 74 years old.

title: Kennedy Center Board Is Assailed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 Four months after its spec tacular opening, the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, still straining for funds, is haunted by another prob lem that won't go away charges within the Govern ment that the $70million project was badly misman aged by its supervisors and the center's chairman of the board.

title: Census Reports a Drop hi Median Age to 27.9
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP)The median age of the United States population is 27.9 years, the Census Bureau reported today higher than many people had thought.

title: Eric Jacobs Weds Gayle Greenberg
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 16 Miss Gayle Greenberg was married here at noon today to Eric McKible Jacobs. Rabbi Leon Kronish per formed the ceremony at the Fontainebleau Hotel.

title: W. S. KNICKERBOCKER
description: WABAN, Mass., Jan. 16Dr. William S. Knickerbocker, a former teacher of English at the University of the South, where he edited The Sewanee Review, died yesterday in a Newton nursing home. He was 80 years old.

title: 15 KILLED IN GREECE AS 2 TRAINS COLLIDE
description: LARISSA, Greece, Jan. 16 (Reuters)At least 15 persons were killed and 60 injured when an international express train and a freight train collided headon tonight 20 miles south of here, a police spokesman said.

title: Boeing Sells Iberia Airlines 16 Planes for $125Million
description: Iberia Aarlines of Spain an nounced yesterday a $125 million order for 16 advanced Boeing 727 airliners. This ver sion of the threejet craft fea tures a new interior designed to give the conventionalsize plane something of the wide body look introduced by the 747 jumbo jet.

title: Mayors' Meeting Scheduled
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 16 (UPI)  The Legislative Action Committee of the National Con ference of Mayors will meet here tomorrow to discuss big city health problems. Included on the meeting agenda was a ?? of the statesupported Charity Hospital.

title: Susan Anne Cameron Married To Christopher Throp Barrow
description: ROCKPORT; Mass., Jan. 16 Miss Susan Anne Cameron and Christopher Throp Barrow were married here this afternoon in St. Mary's Episcopal Church. The Rev. Richard A. Bamforth per formed the ceremony.

title: Bangkok Warned by Hanoi On Role in Indochina War
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 16 (Reu ters)  North Vietnam warned Thailand today of the conse quences of her involvement in the Indochina war, the North Vietnam press agency reported. The Hanoi daily, Nhan Dan, quoted by the agency, said:

title: Harlem Tenants Doing Owner's Job
description: Until last March, the ten ants at 17 West 118th Street most of whom had lived there for at least 25 years felt comfortable enough not to complain about minor leaks, dirty hallways, poor security and rats.

title: Canada Star Injured
description: GRINDELWALD, Switzerland, Jan. 16 (AP)  Betsy Clifford, Canada's giant slalom world champion skier, was injured in a fall today, forcing her out of the World Cup races and next month's Winter Olympics.

title: Rev. Matthew Smith Dead; Episcopal Canon on L.I., 75
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Jan. 16 The Rev. Matthew E. Smith, former canon of the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation here, died yesterday in Wolfe boro, N.H., where he had been living since his retirement. He was 75 years old.

title: 11 From Congress Attending Conference in Zambia Today
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Jan. 16 Eleven American Congressmen and 11 elected African officials and others will meet here to morrow in a conference de signed to create greater aware ness of Africa in the United States.

title: Consumerism's Other Half
description: Ralph Nader has become a folk hero. Congressmen are standing in line to affix their names to consumer legislation. And the word on the tip of every hoard chairman's tongue is consumerism. The dissatisfied cus tomer, once a loner, has become a political and economic powerpart of the loosely knit but potent consumer movement.

title: Hawks Belt 76ers, 124116, As Maravich Gets 50 Points
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 16 (UPI) Pete Maravich scored a career high of 50 points tonight to lead the Atlanta Hawks to a 124116 victory over the Phila delphia 76ers.

title: Blues Edge Leafs
description: TORONTO, Jan. 16 (UPI) Terry Crisp's second goal of the game at 11:10 of the third period tonight proved to be the winner as the St. Louis Blues defeated the Toronto Maple Leafs, 43, in the first Sunday night regularseason game ever played at Maple Leaf Gardens.

title: Advertising:
description: Borden, Inc., a widely div ersified company that has an ad agency list as long as your arm, has just dropped two and moved the assign ments into one of its other shops.

title: KNICKS TURN BACK ROCKETS, 109108
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 16  The Knicks ended their fivegame losing streak today by beating the Houston Rockets, 109108, when Dave DeBusschere hit the winning shot with 26 seconds left.

title: Liberal Democrats Press for a Health Insurance Plank in Platform
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16A liberal wing of the Democratic party is quietly building public support for a comprehensive national health insurance pro gram, hoping it will become adopted as a plank in the party's platform at the Demo cratic National Convention.

title: The Clouded Crystal Ball
description: WASHINGTONThe time is ap proaching for the publication of the economic report of the President and the annual report of the Council of Economic Advisers. It might be useful to recall some of the projections made in these reports last year to see what happened to them.

title: A 33Ship Maneuver Begun At Points Along East Coast
description: GEORGETOWN, Me., Jan. 16 (UPI)The Navy's Operation Snowy Beach began today at points along the Eastern Sea board. Its ultimate objective is a 33ship naval maneuver off the Maine coast culminating in an amphibious landing of 900 marines on Saturday at Reid State Park.

title: Excerpts From the Budget Message Sent to the Legislature by the Governor
description: ALBANY, Jan. 16Following are ex cerpts from the budget message Gov ernor Rockefeller sent today to the Legislature:

title: 4 From Tanker Rescued
description: PORTSMOUTH, Va., Jan. 16 (AP)Four men in a lifeboat were picked up by a merchant ship tonight after they had left their tanker, its one remaining lifeboat and 59 fellow crew members when high seas and heavy winds buffeted the ship into a 45degree list, the Coast Guard said. The tanker Plym, of Liberian registry, was re ported out of immediate danger. A message relayed by the mer chant vessel Jacksonville said the Plym had corrected the list.

title: RyeOyster Ray Span Apparently Still Alive
description: ALBANY, Jan. 16.  The controversial plan for a Rye Oyster Bay Bridgedespite its elimination from the pro posed 1972.73 state budget and the recent defeat of the transportation bond issue is not dead, according to Governor Rockefeller.

title: NETS ARE BEATEN BY PROS, 129123
description: MEMPHIS, Jan. 16 (AP) George Lehmann tied a club record with six 3point goals and scored a total of 34 points tonight to lead the Memphis Pros to a 129123 American Basketball Association victory over the New York Nets before 8,437 fans, a record here.

title: MICHAEL LEITER, 62, A TRANSIT ATTORNEY
description: Michael Leiter, a former chief trial attorney for the Transit Authority, died Saturday of heart attack in Miami Beach, where he lived. His age was 62.

title: JERSEY SKI TITLE GOES TO GOODWIN
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y., Jan. 16  A 15milean hour wind and a 10degree temperature didn't seem to bother 21year old Thomas Goodwin of Au burn, Me., today, as he won Class A in the New Jersey State ski jumping championship with flights of 146 and 155 feet for 203.1 points.

title: 2.1 MILLION TO GET FULL RESTORATION OF FOOD STAMP AID
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16In a major policy turnaround, the Nixon Administration ordered the restoration today of full food stamp benefits to 2.1 mil lion needy poor persons in New York and other industrial states.

title: Associate Proud of His Role
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 16Last Friday, attorneys for Anthony J. Russo Jr. filed a motion in Federal District Court here asking that the charges against him in the Pentagon papers case be dismissed.

title: Big Heroin Ring Smashed With U.S. Aid, French Say
description: PARIS, Jan. 16 (Reuters) American and French narcotics agents have broken up one of the biggest narcotic rings oper ating in France, police spokes men said today as the United States Narcotics Bureau chief, John Ingersoll arrived here to ?? FrenchAmerican cooper ation on drug control.

title: Shah of Iran Warns Outsiders Against Gulf Military Positions
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan. 16 Shah Mohammad Riza Pahlevi has warned against the estab lishment of a military presence in the Persian Gulf by the big powers and by Arab countries not in the gulf area.

title: West's Thirst for Water Is Questioned
description: DENVER, Jan. 16The con stant hunt for water, an ex pensive and almost compulsive tradition in the American West, is coming under increasing crit icism, and the big projects de signed to bring more of it to arid land are running into trouble.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: DURBAN, South Africa, Jan. 16 (AP)  Jurgen Fassbender, a West German Davis Cup player, won the men's singles in the Natal sugar tennis tour nament today. He defeated Juan Gisbert of Spain, 63, 64, 62. Brenda Kirk beat a fellow South African, Pat Pretorius, 63, 63, in the women's final.

title: Doris Perkel Bride Of Jonathan Gordon
description: Miss Doris Susan Perkel, a senior at Fairleigh Dickinson University, was married yes terday to Jonathan David Gordon, a graduate of the university.

title: Man in the News
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Jan. 16 When Col. Ignatius Kutu Acheampong took over the Government of Ghana in coup d'tat last week, some of his friends were not par ticularly surprised.

title: Lindsay Effort in Arizona
description: PHOENIX, Ariz, Jan. 16 Mayor Lindsay wound up a hrief but intensive campaign for Arizona delegates to the Demo cratic National Convention with visits here today to Chicano and black communities.

title: Parks Director Says Rise In Crime Has Been Curbed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (UPI) The director of the National Park Service said today that the growth of crime and ?? orderly behavior in national parks had been greatly cur tailed, in part by providing more varied facilities and adopting more humanized su pervision methods.

title: Rockefeller Delighted
description: ALBANY, Jan. 16 (AP)Gov ernor Rockefeller said today that he was delighted with the Nixon Administration's de cision to reverse its food stamp policy and restore full benefits to all eligible needy persons.

title: Temperatures Fall And Area Residents Know Winter's Here
description: New York City yesterday sported a plethora of mufflers, fur hats and hoods, of re luctant automobile engines, and of faces windblasted red and raw.

title: As Mates Roar, Thomas Stings and Floats
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 16 After so many years of frus stration, the Dallas Cowboys were celebrating. One of their players yanked Gil Brandt, the personnel direc tor, by the collar and tossed him, along with the silver Super Bowl trophy, under one of the shower sprays.

title: Hungary Makes a Few Changes As Economic Reform Hits Snag
description: BUDAPEST, Jan. 7The Hungarian economic reform, introduced just four years ago, has run into trouble, but ap parently not seriously enough to prompt a revision of the plan. Some changes in the lib eral economic program are being made, however, to re verse, a negativetrade balance and to slow the rate of invest ment.

title: Children of God Return Home From Visits to Rejected Past
description: ELLENVILLE, N. Y.When 20yearold Kirk Allen went home to Dallas for the recent holidays, his parents plied him with steaks and offered him a 1971 Ford if he would stay home.

title: Mary Spinner, M. H. Hess 3d Are Wed Here
description: Miss Mary Katherine Spinner and Mortimer Henry Hess 3d were married yes terday afternoon in St. Bernadette's Roman Catholic Church in Brooklyn by Msgr. Sand J. Privitera.

title: McCarthy Is Undismayed by His Defeat in Massachusetts Caucus
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 Former Senator Eugene J. Mc Carthy sought today to mini mize his decisive defeat at last night's gathering of the Massa chusetts Citizens Caucus with the comment, I don't see it as a very serious problem.

title: Bridge: Players of Metropolitan Area Dominate TriState Regionals
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y., Jan. 16Players from the New York metropolitan area have continued to dominate the TriState Regional Champion ships, which end here today. They had won both major titles when play began Thurs day, and there followed a victory by Augusta Cantor of New York and Bob Bowers of Kings Park, L. I., in the master pairs, flight A. In the open pairs played yesterday, Dorothy Hayden of Riverdale, the Bronx, and this writer headed a field of 518 pairs.

title: Une de Mai Wins Prix de Bourgogne In Photo Finish
description: PARIS, Jan. 16Une de Mai maintained her remarkable form today by barely nosing out Vismie in a photofinish with a nearrecord time in the Prix de Bourgogne at Vincennes.

title: British Strike in 2d Week
description: LONDON, Jan. 16 (Reuters) The British coal miners strike entered its second week today with no sign of either side giv ing in and, thus far, no serious effects on the public. The state run National Coal Board said there had been no reports of shortages despite picketing to block the import or movement of coal.

title: Difficult Task in Rhodesia
description: A British Commission has now begun its effort to ascertain whether a settlement reached in November between Britain and Rhodesia's white minority Govern ment is acceptable to the people of Rhodesia as a whole. It will be a delicate, difficult task, the outcome of which will have considerable bearing on the chances for peaceful evolution of whiteblack relations in south ern Africa as well as on Britain's international standing.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 34Story Building At E. 71st St. Proposed

title: Frederik's Burial on Jan. 24
description: COPENHAGEN, Jan. 16 (Reu ters)The funeral of King Frederik IX, who died Friday, will be held next Monday, the Danish Court announced to night. The ceremony will take place in the Cathedral at Ros kilde, 25 miles west of Copen hagen and the traditional burial place of Danish kings.

title: Shop
description: Few things look fresher on a dim winter's day than a room full of plants. In the six model rooms that go on display to day on Abraham & Straus's seventh floor, Gerda Clark demonstrates a variety of approaches to this idea.

title: Bucks Rout Blazers
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 16 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks out scored the Portland Trail Blazers, 204, to open the sec ond quarter, and 194 in the first four minutes of the third peroid on the way to a 126971 rout tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Washington Crime Story
description: There is another area where the Federal Government has the opportunity to make a dramatic demonstration of its concern with the problem of crime, its commitment to new solutions and the efficacy of its proposals. That is in Washington, D. C.the nation's capital where the au thority of the Federal Government is great and its prerogatives many.

title: Judith Cohen Bride of Lawrence Klein
description: OAK PARK, Mich., Jan. 16 At Temple EmanuEI here today, Miss Judith Lynn Cohen, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Lewis Cohen of Hunt ington Woods, was married to Lawrence Robinson Klein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph B. Klein of Detroit. Rabbis Milton Rosenbaum and Ben jamin Gorrelick officiated.

title: STUDENTS AID CITY IN CULTURE TASKS
description: A plan that has been getting Hunter College students aca demic credits for working off campus with the city's Cultural Affairs Department has taken root and is beginning to blos som.

title: Ancient Glass Slippers Are Found in Cologne
description: COLOGNE, West Gemany, Jan 16 A pair of glass slip pers, dainty and Intact and unique among relics of the world of ancient Rome, has been found by amateur ar cheologists at a construction site in Cologne.

title: ANNA HELLMAN, 70, POET AND LECTURER
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 16 Anna McClure Hellman, a poet and lecturer, died yesterday at Norwalk Hospital. Her age was 70 and she lived at 84 Orchard Hill Lane, Fairfield.

title: Sabres Halt Canadiens, 42
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 16 (UPI) Jim Lorentz scored his first two goals of the season and assisted on a third tonight as the Buffalo Sabres ended a sevengame streak without a victory with a 42 triumph over Montreal that extended the Canadiens' losing string on the road to seven games.

title: Frazier Prefers to Give Foreman Next Shot at Title
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 16 Joe Frazier indicated today that George Foreman, rather than Muhammad Ali, would be the opponent in his next heavy weight title defense, possibly at Madison Square Garden in March.

title: TOKYO STOCKS HIT HIGH DESPITE YEN
description: TOKYO, Jan. 16Prices on the Tokyo Stock Exchange raced to new highs last week, ignoring the adverse effects of the yen revaluation and slug gish business conditions.

title: FEDERAL BUDGET AND JOBS STUDIED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16The Federal Government's full em ployment budget should in clude a big adjustment in ex penditures, as well as revenues, to take account of the state of the economy, a Brookings In stitution study concluded today.

title: U.S. Nurse Is Slain In Guerrilla Attack, Israeli Army Says
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 16 (AP)An American nurse at the Baptist hospital in Gaza was wounded fatally tonight by Arab guer rillas who ambushed the car in which she and an American minister were driving through an Arab refugee camp, Israeli Army officials said.

title: Joblessness Up in Europe; U.S. Boom Is Hoped For
description: PARIS, Jan. 16Unemploy ment figures are rising all over Western Euprope.

title: Albany Budget Proposals
description: ALBANY; Jan. 16Following are the major parts Governor Rockefeller's proposed budget for the fiscal year beginning April 1, and the tax increases and other fiscal plans already approved for the 15month period that began Jan. 1:

title: Community Groups Assail Messages of Necessity
description: The use of gubernatorial messages of necessity in the legislative session was criticized yesterday by a group of 25 community organizations in a statement addressed to Gover nor Rockefeller and legislative leaders.

title: COUNCIL IMPASSE REPORTED BROKEN
description: The political logjam that has kept two key City Coun cil chairmanships vacant for months reportedly has been broken. A fragile accord is said to have been fashioned, involving the delegations from three boroughs.

title: LIPMAN IS HEARD IN PIANO RECITAL
description: Samuel Lipman, hailed in this newspaper as one of the most promising pianists of the sea son when he made his Town Hall debut in 1955, has made good on that promise. His last major appearance here, as solo ist with the National Orchestral Association, was in 1966, and his Hunter College concert Sat urday night was his first New York recital in 15 years.

title: MARKETING TEST CONFRONTS STEEL
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 16Steel producers were approaching another market test last week.

title: KEINO WINS MILE AT ALBUQUERQUE
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Jan. 16 (Reuters)  Kipchoge Keino of Kenya won the mile run in 4 minutes 4.2 seconds last night at the Albuquerque invitation track meet. His time is the fastest run in this milehigh city.

title: Personal Finance: ShortTerm Trust
description: Has Congress tarnished the reputation of the shortterm trust (10year trusts) as a taxsaver for middle and upperincome taxpayers?

title: Nepal Recognizes Bengalis
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 16 (Reu ters)  The Himalayan King dom of Nepal today announced recognition of Bangladesh, The Press Trust of India reported from Katmandu. Other coun tries that have extended recog nition are India, Bhutan, East Germany, Poland, Bulgaria, Mongolia and Burma.

title: State Fiscal Pinch Seen Squeezing the Suburbs
description: ALBANY, Jan. 16Suburban areas in the state, despite ex tensive pressure and cries of desperate fiscal squeezes, will be facing an oven greater crisis this year, largely as a result of Governor Rockefel ler's at tempts to hold the line on his, new $7.9billion budget.

title: Senators in Contest to Succeed Mansfield as the Majority Leader
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 While Democratic Senators speculate and squabble over which of them should be the Presidential candidate, a little noticed yet significant contest is developing within their ranks over who should be the future Democratic leader of the Sen ate.

title: Electronic Fingerprints Track Down Air Pollutant
description: A system of electronic fingerprinting of airborne dirt particles will be tried by the city in an attempt to find an answer to the baffling question of why the amount of dirt in the city's air is growing despite increasingly stringent air pollution con trol measures.

title: Maltese Crowds Hail Victory for Mintoff
description: VALLETTA, Malta, Jan. 16 (UPI) Singing, chanting crowds waved flags and marched through Valletta to day, hailing Prime Minister Dorn Mintoff as a victor in his battle to obtain more money for allowing British troops to remain on Malta.

title: Jazz Fete Names Aides
description: Jimmy Lyons, the jazz impre sario, and John Lewis, pianist and music director of the Mod ern Jajj Quartet, have been ap pointed executive director and music adviser, respectively, for the American College Jazz Fes tival. About 200 college jazz groups will compete in the fes tival. Finalists will perform at the Kennedy Center in Wash ington May 2829.

title: Newsman Warned in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 16 (Reuters) David Bonavia. Moscow cor respondent of The Times of London, told colleagues that he was detained for 30 minutes by plainclothesmen today as he left the home of Pyotr Yakir, a dissident intellectual whose home was raided Friday by the security police. He said that agents drove him and his wife to a police station and that they were told, Do not inter fere in our internal affairs and do not go back to that address.

title: GORDON GRAND, 54, PRESIDENT OF OLIN
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 16 Gordon Grand, president and chief executive officer of the Olin Corporation since 1965, suffered a heart attack today while playing tennis in the Round Hill Club here and died on the way to a hospital. He was 54 years old and lived on Knollwood Drive.

title: Books of The Times
description: For over 10 years, Ladislas Faragothe Hungarianborn journalist and author of some dozen military histories, among them Patton: Ordeal and Triumph, on which the movie was basedhad been trying to gather material for a book about the Ab wehr, the German secret service under Admiral Wilhelm Canaris.

title: City Hall Notes
description: Unlike most politicians who build their support from the inside out in widening ?? Mayor Lindsay hopes to solidify his position in the state and city by doing well on the road.

title: 24 RULES CHANGES ARE MADE BY N.C.A.A.
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Jan. 16 (UPI)The National Collegiate Athletic Association football rules committee adopted 24 rule changes here today, includ ing one which will make an un touched kickoff going into the end zone a dead ball.

title: Astronauts in Warsaw
description: WARSAW, Jan. 16 (Reuters) The Apollo 15 astronauts, David Scott and Alfred Warden arrived today for a sixday visit during which they will meet Polish scientists. They will be joined here Tuesday by the third Apollo 15 astronaut, James Irwin.

title: EXCHIEF'S ASSETS FROZEN BY ACCRA
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Jan. 16The new military government of Ghana today froze the bank ac counts and other assets of former Prime Minister Kofi A. Busia, who was overthrown in a coup d'etat Thursday, and those of his ministers.

title: China to Permit Visit By Liner's Passengers
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, Jan. 16The luxury liner France, in the fourth day of a 91day cruise around the world, has received definite assurances that at least some of her 1,150 passengers will he permitted into mainland China when the ship arrives in Hong Kong Feb. 26.

title: Clue for Soviet Writers: Thrillers Need Message
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 16  In the Soviet whodunit it isn't who done it that counts, but why he done it and how he can be kept from doing it again.

title: Advertising:
description: Matt Connor, chairman of Tucker Wayne & Co., one of the big agencies in the South east, was in town from At lanta last week, as he some times is.

title: CZECH WORKERS URGED TO RESIST
description: ROME, Jan. 16An under ground group in Czechoslo vakia has called on workers to fight against the country's pro Soviet leadership from within the Communist party and the trade unions, and to boycott official rallies, according to a document made available here.

title: Chess: Is a Sacrifice Necessary To Call a Game Brilliant?
description: One of the small but inter esting differences between tournament chess in the Eng lishspeaking world and in continental Europe is the meaning of the prize usually awarded to the bestplayed game of an event. In the United States especially this is a socalled brilliancy prize, and goes to the game containing the most flam boyant sacrificial combina tion; in other countries it ordinarily goes to the game that the judges deem the most beautiful, whether it contains sacrifices or not.

title: Dance: Les Sylphides
description: Ever since the company's first appearance in 1940, American Ballet Theater has made a special treasure of its production of Michel Fokine's Les Sylphides. The produc tion was the choreographer's final recension, and it has been preserved accurately since then. These really were Fokine's last thoughts on his most famous ballet.

title: Mujib Says That Bhutto Foiled An Execution Order by Yahya
description: Sheik Mujibur Rahman has disclosed that an order for his execution in the final hours of the IndiaPakistan war was thwarted by Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, who arranged to have him smuggled out of a prison where he had been in solitary confinement for nine months. At the time, Mr. Bhutto had not yet replaced Gen. Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan as Pak istan's President.

title: WINWOOD DOMINATES ROCK GROUP TRAFFIC
description: The English rock group Traf fic, appearing at the Academy of Music Friday night, was very much a oneman show. Steve Winwoodpianist, or ganist, guitarist, singer and composer of much of the band's materialeasily dominated the performance.

title: The Penn Central Inquest
description: After every disaster, an inquest: that is the American way. And the inquest into what caused the wreck of the Penn Central, one, of the greatest business disasters in American history, has barely got under steam.

title: Blumenthal Named to Panel
description: Albert H. Blumenthal, Deputy. Minority Leader of the State Assembly, has been named chairman of the New York State Democratic Advisory Council, it was announced yes terday by Joseph F. Crangle, New York State Democratic chairman. The Advisery Coun cil is charged with developing programs, defining issues and writing campaign platforms for the New York State Democratic Committee.

title: For Landry, Frustration Runs Out After 12 Years
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 16 For the Dallas Cowboys, all their seasons of frustration ap peared today to make their Super Bowl triumph more worth while.

title: Kleindienst Given Award
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (UPI) Deputy Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst has been given the outstanding American award by the Dis trict of Columbia Chapter of Phi Beta Kappa. Mr. Kleindienst was elected to Phi Beta Kappa at Harvard in 1947.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: HEARING PLANNED ON L.I.R.R FARES
description: The Metropolitan Transporta tion Authority will hold a pub lic hearing on proposed Long Island Rail Road fare increases today at 10 A.M. in the Forum Room of the Park Sheraton Hotel, Seventh Avenue and 56th Street.

title: Flyers Tie Kings, 33
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 (AP) Ed Van Impe's blueline slap shot at 7:22 of the final period gave the Philadelphia Flyers a 33 tie with the Los Angeles Kings tonight.

title: Governor's Veto of Expansion Plan Upsets York College's Students and Faculty
description: Governor Rockefeller's deci sion to halt the expansion plan for York College has caused a serious morale problem among the faculty and students of this city college in Jamaica, Queens, according to its president, Mil ton G. Bassin.

title: NEW ERA CHOICE IS DUCK DANCE
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16At 2 o'clock tomorrow afternoon, Hobeau Farm's Duck Dance will leave his Hialeah barn for a 25mile van ride to what is being ad vertised here as the home of the fivefoot giants.

title: SCHOOL STRIKE SET IN PORT CHESTER
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y., Man day, Jan. 17Public school teachers here voted overwhelm ingly last night to go out on strike this morning after a 16 hour negotiating session ended with no progress reported on a new contract.

title: Radosta of The Times Wins Motor Sports Writing Prize
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Jan. 16 (AP)  David Howell of The Greenville (S. C.) News and John Radosta of The New York Times have won the National Motorsports Press Association writing awards for 1971.

title: Religious Assembly Terms Vietnam Policy Immoral
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Jan. 16 An ecumenical assembly ex amining the attitude of organ ized religion toward the war in Vietnam charged today that the Nixon Administration's Vi etnamization policy was fun damentally immoral because it forces Asian people to be our proxy army, dying in our places for our supposed interests.

title: Irving Gray, 66, Manager Of Berle on TV 16 Years
description: Irving Gray, who had been manager of Milton Berle on television for 16 years, died yesterday of a heart ailment in Miami Beach. He was 66 years old and retired about five years ago to North Miami Beach.

title: Proposed State Budget Distresses City Officials
description: City officials said yesterday that passage of the Governor's $7.9billion proposed budget, which freezes most state spend ing at Current levels, would force the city to continue its job, freeze in vital services and might cause additional layoffs of teachers.

title: Sierra Club Report Seeks an Agency to Regulate Energy Policy
description: JOHNSON, Vt., Jan. 16A Sierra Club task force, winding up a threeday conference here of toplevel electric utility ex perts, economists and environ mentalists, completed today a report recommending the crea tion of a national energy plan ning agency to regulate energy policy for the country.

title: Newfoundland Retires Premier of 22 Years
description: ST.JOHN'S, Newfoundland, Jan. 15The man chiefly re sponsible for bringing the Brit ish colony of Newfoundland into Canada 22 years ago is being retired at 71. But Joseph R. Smallwood, the only Pre mier Canada's 10th province has ever had, proved this week that he is not a retiring man.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Expert Likens Tax System to a Fish Net
description: WASHINGTON  Question: Do you make out your own income tax return?

title: Mrs. Attje KeulenDeelstra, Dutch Mother, Takes Speed Skating Title
description: INZELL, Germany Jan. 16 (UPI)Mrs. Attje KeulenDeel stra, a Dutch mother of three children, broke the Soviet Union's monopoly on European speedskating titles today. She captured the fourevent over all championship with a record of 182.805 points. Mrs. Keulen Deelstra, who is 33 years old, took the title from Nina Stat kevitsch of the Soviet Union. Miss Statkevitsch, 29, finished second with 183.135 points. She was followed by two other Soviet competitors.

title: Andruss Captures Final
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Jan. 16 Bill Andruss of the host club won the Bronxville Field Club Class C invitation squashrac quets tournament today by de feating Gerald Jabara of the New York Athletic Club, 1511, 1512, 1115, 1815, in the final.
