Your Jan. 10 editorial Priorities in Transit contends that the Highway Trust Fund will  have an accumulated surplus of over $4 billion at the end of fiscal 1972. This is simply not true.

title: RANGERS DEFEAT GOLDEN SEALS, 50
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 21The rugged Rangers from New York manhandled the gallant California Golden Seals tonight and shut them out, 50. The Seals, playing before a record crowd of 10,478, tried hard, but they just did not have the muscle to stop the Rangers or the plays to capitalize on scoring opportunities.

title: The Dance: Chopiniana
description: CHOPINIANA, music, Frederic Chooint Vested by Alexandra Danhova alter Michel Fokine; pianist, Gordon Boelznor.

title: 7Day Monte Carlo Rally Starts As Heavy Snow Forces a Detour
description: MONTE CARLO, Jan. 21 (UPI)Competitors in the 41st Monte Carlo Rally faced deteriorating weather conditions in France as they set off today from nine cities throughout Europe on the first stage of the grueling sevenday event.

title: New York City:
description: May I suggest her Ladyship extend her voyages to include Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia where she would be able to physically enjoy this very American form of culture.

title: U.S.CANADA STUDY OF LAKE PLANNED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21A yearlong intensive study of Lake Ontario, the most ambitious research effort ever directed at any of the Great Lakes, will begin April 1, United States and Canadian organizers of the program announced today.

title: Man Arraigned in Murder Of His Mother in Flushing
description: Lawrence Ehrlich, 27 years old, was arraigned and held without bail in Queens Criminal Court yesterday on charges that he beheaded his 55yearold widowed mother.

title: New York City:
description: To the Editor: The author [Mr. Carty], residing comfortably in Larchmont, N. Y., unintentionally (?) implied: New York is a wonderful place to visit, but, wouldn't want to live there.

title: INDIA SEEKS RISE IN REFUGEE FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Indian Government has appealed through the United Nations to the world for $50million to $60million in additional aid to help care for East Pakistani refugees still in India over the next two months.

title: Miss Goolagong Voted Woman Athlete of Year
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Jan. 21 (AP)Evonne Goolagong, The Associated Press female athlete of the year, ecstatically accepted the honor today, then coolly whipped her opponent to advance to the final round of the South Australian state tennis championships.

title: Books of The Times
description: Page Stegner's second novel (his first was The Edge) is a book about failures. All the characters are losers. They are people who can't go home again and don't want to. For them as for Macbeth it is as tedious to go o'er as to turn back. Partners in an overdrawn account, they are guaranteed bankruptcy. The milieu, the moment and the man conspire to produce the inevitable result. In one sense they are people who never had it so good. But it is a good whose worth they keep picking at until it unravels in their hand. Their action is a kind of perversity to be sure, except that one can scoop up samples of it from bombed out Eleventh Street, in New York, to HaightAshbury on the West Coast. All this makes the book sound somber, and I'll not pretend that Mr. Stegner has provided a rosyglow ending or that he has exalted the indomitable spirit of man or however it is referred to. But its violent and lacerating ending is not the whole book. A good part of it is screamingly funny. The dialogue is sharp, aphoristic, bright. It makes one envious. I don't know people who talk like that, but I wish I did. Mr. Stegner makes it all sound natural and convincing. The structure of the novel is tight; the pace is quick. It's good reading.

title: Benjamin Braunstein, 79, Dead; Architect of Garden Apartments
description: Benjamin Braunstein, a leading architect in Queens, who designed many garden apartments there, as well as in Brooklyn and New Jersey, died yesterday in Long Island Jewish Medical Center. He was 79 years old and lived at 4369 170th Street, Flushing.

title: CITY BANK LOWERS PRIME RATE TO 4
description: The First National City Bank trimmed its base, or prime lending rate, by  point to 4 per cent yesterday and a short time later the 4 per cent rate initiated by City Bank and Irving Trust a week ago became general at almost all other major institutions.

title: Music: Solo Mandolins and Maderna
description: How often does one get to hear solo mandolins at a symphony concert? The question answers itself. Thus there was at least some tonal curiosity about the Vivaldi Concerto for Two Mandolins and Orchestra, which led off Thursday night's Philharmonic program conducted by Bruno Maderna.

title: Bargaining May Resume
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 21 (UPI)Union and management moved today to resume negotiations next week in the West Coast dock strike in the wake of President Nixon's call to Congress to end it.

title: JOHN BURFORD; HELD U.S. POSTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 John B. Blandford, administrator of the National Housing Agency during World War II, who was a prime mover in providing homes for war workers and returning soldiers, died here Sunday at the age of 74.

title: Notes On Metropolitan Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Although the Mayor of their city and one of their Congressional colleagues are running for the Democratic Presidential nomination, the Democratic House members from New York City for the most part are shying away from Presidential endorsemerits for now. Some New York Democratic Representatives said that they were not about to commit themselves to anyone until they saw who in the crowded field was still in the running after a few Presidential primaries in other states.

title: EXECUTIVE IN SPAIN FREED BY BASQUES
description: EIBAR, Spain, Jan. 21 (Reuters)  A Spanish business executive returned home tonight, freed by his Basque nationalist abductors after his company agreed to rehire workers in a labor dispute.

title: Finland and Barbados Plan To Recognize Bangladesh
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Jan. 21 (UPI)Finland decided today to recognize Bangladesh, the nation proclaimed in East Pakistan, the Foreign Ministry, announced.

title: Designer Gets 5 Years
description: John Vesey, the decorator and furniture designer, was sentenced to five years in prison yesterday for homosexually assaulting and seriously injuring a17yearold boy in March, 1970. Vesey, 47 years old, of 105 East 64th Street, was convicted last December, by a 12man State Supreme Court jury in Manhattan.

title: Consumer Price Increase Here Of 0.3% Seen Within U.S. Limits
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday that prices for goods and services in the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area rose threetenths of 1 per cent in November, marking the 56th successive monthly price advance in thin area.

title: New York City:; Have you ever tried the L.A. freeways?; To the Editor:
description: What other city in the United States offers such a potpourri of events? Where else can you choose from such a wide variety of cultural activities, from an indeterminable number of Broadway plays to free concerts in the park?

title: Landscape Mood Noted In Twombly's Canvases
description: For the last 15 years the art of Cy Twombly has been heavy with childhood allusions. In his handwriting canvases the artist produced what looked like scribbling and graffiti to some and blackboard penmanship exercises to others. In his landscape pictures he used a childlike imagery rendered with the simplicity of an infant at work on a coloring book.

title: Tibet Uprising Reported
description: CALCUTTA, India, Jan. 21 (Reuters)The Dalai Lama, the exiled spiritual leader of Tibet, said today that he had heard from reliable sources that his people were rebelling against the Chinese in the Beru area of eastern Tibet. My people there are starving and desperate and there have been largescale uprisings against the Chinese, he told newsmen.

title: New York City:; Is this the same city where thieves prey?; To the Editor:
description: Mr. Carty offers paeans of joy to the sheer delight New York City presents.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A 203,500share secondary offering of New York Times Company Class A common reached the market yesterday at $19. The nonregistered transaction was handled by Salomon Brothers, which reported the stock entirely placed with investors.

title: MISS RAVAN EARTHY IN SINGING THE BLUES
description: Can a pop singer make it on sheer animal presence? It looks as though Genya Ravan, who once sang with a rock group called Ten Wheel Drive, is going to try. Her performance at the Bitter End Wednesday night was long on physicality and short on music.

title: Country's Youngest Condemned Prisoner Waits at Ease
description: CUMMINS PRISON FARM, Ark.  Joe Newton Kagebien, 16 years old, is waiting for the electric chair in this grim prison in the middle of a windswept cotton field in the Arkansas River lowlands.

title: GHANA COUP LAID TO OFFICERS IRE
description: LONDON, Jan. 21Dr. Kofia A. Busia, who was ousted last week as Ghana's Prime Minister, said today that the military coup d'etat had stemmed from unhappiness among officers over the loss of some privileges.

title: Yevtushenko Criticizes Journalists in Talk Here
description: Yevgeny Yevtushenko last night had words of criticism for American journalists and television personalities who have been asking him only about the bad things in Soviet life.

title: KNICKS 130 BURST HELPS MOLD UPSET OF LAKERS,104101
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 21A 130 spurt starting in the closing moments of the third period enabled the New York Knicks to score a 104101 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers tonight before a capacity crowd of 17,505 at The Forum.

title: TUITION INCREASE VOTED IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21 (AP)The State Board of Higher Education voted to raise tuition at the state's fouryear public colleges to $600 a year, an increase of $250.

title: IMARKET DECLINES AS TRADING FALLS
description: Stock prices moved lower yesterday, extending the decline that began in the final hour on Thursday.

title: N.A.B. TV Board Votes a 25% Cut in Ads for Children
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) The TV Code has been amended to reduce by 25 per cent the time devoted to commercials and other nonprogram material during weekend television programs designed mainly for children.

title: Executive Changes
description: Warren M. Shapleigh, 51 years old, has been elected president of the Ralston Purina Company, St. Louis, Mo. He formerly was an executive vice president and a director of the company and president of its consumer products group. The announcement was made by R. Hal Dean, chairman of the board and chief executive officer. The company's administrative organization has not included a president since 1970. During this time three vice presidents served as presidents of the three major groups in the company. Also announced were the appointments of Dr. Clifford M. Hardin, vice chairman of the board, to the executive committee and of Paul F. Cornelsen, executive vice president, to the board's finance committee.

title: State Halts Its Processing Of 157 Sewage Projects
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21  The State Department of Environmental Conservation disclosed today that it had halted the processing of plans for 157 sewage treatment projects, with an estimated total cost of $1.5billion, because there was not enough state and Federal money for them.

title: Town Hall Begins Interludes at 5:45 With Jazz Program
description: Town Hall has dreamed up a new way to spend an hour or so before dinner without interfering with what may be one's present way of passing the time. It is called Wednesday. 5:45 Interludes, a weekly series of onehour programs featuring jazz, classical music, dance and choral groups.

title: Cooper Won't Seek Reelection; Served 20 Years in the Senate
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 21John Sherman Cooper, who has served nearly 20 years as a Republican Senator from Kentucky, formally announced today that he would not seek reelection this fall.

title: Congress Is Asked By President to End Coast Dock Strike
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Jan. 21President Nixon asked Congress today for special legislation to stop what he called the intolerable West Coast dock strike.

title: 76ers Beat Blazers, 136122
description: HERSHEY, Jan. 21 (AP)Fred Carter scored 29 points, including 13 in the final period, to spark the Philadelphia 76ers to a 136122 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight at the Hershey Sports Arena.

title: Jean Casadesus, Noted Pianist, Dies in an Auto Collision at 44
description: Jean Casadesus, talented pianist son of the renowned pianists, Robert and Gaby Casadesus, died Thursday In an auto collision near Renfrew, Ontario, on his way from Deep River, where he had given a recital, to Ottawa and thence to Sarnia, where he was to have given a concert last night. He was 44 years old.

title: A 9th High Republican To Leave House Post
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP)Representative frank T. Bow, the ranking hopublican member of the House Appropriations Committee, today became the ninth highranking House Repubcan to announce that he would not seek reelection this year.

title: ExParatrooper Is Held in Hijacking
description: DENVER, Jan. 21A 23yearold former Army paratrooper was ordered held without bail today in the $50,000 hijacking of a jet airliner.

title: No Place for Sophistry
description: Hunger is no stranger to any land. Even in the United States, despite food surpluses and general affluence, there are thousands who suffer from malnutrition as a result of either quantitative or qualitative food deficiencies. But in America there are available the resourcesif not always the willto undertake programs that will alleviate hunger: foodstamp plans, school lunch programs, surplus food distribution, welfare assistance. Here debate can rage over how poor a family must be to be eligible for food stampsuntil politics settles the issue.

title: Merger News
description: The Lomas & Nettleton Financial Corporation announced yesterday it has agreed to buy for approximately $35million in cash the $655million mortgage servicing portfolios and certain other assets of three wholly owned subsidiaries of the Kardon Investment Company, a diversified privately owned concern in Philadelphia. The transaction will bring the Lomas & Nettleton mortgage servicing portfolio to over $4billion and its mortgage banking office locations to 89.

title: Bulls Rout Braves, 11393
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 21 (AP)Jerry Sloan scored 23 points and Chet Walker 22 and every other Chicago Bulls player scored tonight en route to a 11393 victory over the Buffalo Braves.

title: Screen:
description: The current program at the Film Forum offers a rerun of Karen Johnson's celebrated fourminute erotic Orange"; Pat Sloane's A Knee Ad, a fairly elaborate aural and visual montage dealing with time and desire and perception and creation; Penelope Spheeris's I Don't Know, which treats a tender but unfortunately limited relationship between a homosexual and a lesbian living together in southern California; and all the collected works of Frans Zwartjes (running altogether for 25 minutes) so far released in this country.

title: TICKETING DELUGE CALLED A TACTIC
description: A police union delegate in the 24th Precinct said yesterday that the parkingticket offensive by men in that command was undertaken deliberately to stir up the public and to force police superiors to rescind a controversial ticket quota.

title: New York City:
description: To the Editor:

title: Postal Service Delays Plans To Raise 3dClass Mail 24%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) The Postal Service said today that it was suspending plans to increase thirdclass mailing rates by 24 per cent on Monday because the issue is tied up in a Federal court.

title: Soviet Development of Advanced Computer Stalled
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 21The Soviet Union acknowledged today that its allout effort to develop the newest generation of electronic computers was lagging behind expectations. Computer development is a key goal of the current fiveyear plan.

title: VIRGIL C. PAVIA DIES; MADE FINE BINDINGS
description: Virgil C. Pavia, owner and founder of the Alpha Bookbinding Company of 127 West 24th Street, who specialized in fine binding, died Thursday of cancer in Franklin General Hospital, Valley Stream, L. I. He was 60 years old and lived at 19609 Foothill Avenue, Hollis, Queens.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A Barcelona paper has just published an editorial comment regarding the budget of Andorra, the minination between France and Spain. It appears that public funds to be spent in 1972 amount roughly to $4 millimi. The sum earmarked for Arms and Defense is less than $5. The rest goes to education, health and public works. If the socalled great nations would adopt proportionate percentages of their outlays for these purposes hope for the world could become more than a dream. FERNANDO ALEU, M.D. Barcelona, Jan. 17, 1972

title: PRICE INDEX ROSE 0.4% IN DECEMBER, LED BY FOOD ITEMS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The nation's economy in the final months of 1971 had more growth and less inflation than was the case for several years, Government reports disclosed today.

title: LIEDER OFFERED BY IRENE GUBRUD
description: Irene Gubrud's exceptional musical taste shows up in everything she doesthe way she sings, the works on the program, her choice of pianist. The soprano demonstrated this in her debut recital last year, and it was apparent again in her appearance in Carnegie Recital Hall Thursday night.

title: For a Fortnight of Italian Specialties, The Rainbow Room Imports Cooks
description: Letitzia Dolce is the head pasta maker at the Grand Hotel in Florence, Italy, but for the next two weeks she will be turning out fettucine, tortelloni, cannelloni and other pasta shapes for the Rainbow Room's Italian Fortnight.

title: Notes on People
description: At the Oakland Army Terminal, in California, Specialist 4 Christopher J. Jimenez received a unique honor: an official ceremony proclaiming him the 1,750,000th American serviceman to return from Vietnam since 1961, when the first American troops were sent there.

title: GIRL'S SAFETY CITED IN CUSTODY RULING
description: A 7yearold daughter of divorced parents has been ordered to live with her father in New Rochelle, N. Y., because a Family Court judge ruled that the Lower East Side, where the girl lived with her mother, was unsafe for children.

title: LEONE BIDS COLOMBO FORM A NEW CABINET
description: ROME, Jan. 21  President Giovanni Leone formally asked Premier Emilio Colombo late tonight to succeed himself as head of another centerleft coalition government.

title: M.T.A. Trims Fare Rise Sought by L.I.R.R. to 16%
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority announced yesterday that it had approved a package of restructured fares for the Long Island Rail Road, including an average increase of 16 per cent in ticket prices and eliminating the popular 10trip discount ticket.

title: ROBERT C. TAIT, 72; HEADED STROMBERG
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 21 (AP)Robert C. Tait, who was president for 11 years of the Stromberg Carlson Company, now a division of General Dynamics Corporation, died today in Strong Memorial Hospital. He was 72 years old.

title: F.C.C. VOTES SHIFT IN BOSTON STATION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 21 Moving to close the longest dispute in its records, the Federal Communications Commission today set March 19 as the date for transferring television Channel 5 in Boston from the Boston HeraldTraveler Corporation to new owners, Boston Broadcasters, Inc.

title: Fire Destroys Manila's Airport Building, Killing 6
description: MANILA, Saturday, Jan. 22A fire of undetermined origin destroyed the fourstory Manila International Airport building early today, forcing the diversion of all domestic and international flights to Mactan, Cebu, in the Visayas area. At least six persons were killed and several were missing.

title: NASTASE DEFAULTS AGAINST GRAEBNER IN SHOUTING MATCH
description: LONDON, Jan. 21 (UPI) Clark Graebner gained a controversial default victory over Hie Nastase of Rumania today in the semifinal round of the Rothman's indoor tennis tournament after a stormy firit set in which the two players traded insults.

title: Stock Prices on the Amex Show a Slight Decline
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market finished lower yesterday in moderate trading.

title: P.S.C. BACKS CITY ON COALUSE CURB
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21The Public Service Commission today backed a ruling by New York City's Environmental Protection Administrator and ordered the Consolidated Edison Company to curb the operation of its coalburning electric generator at Arthur Kill No. 3 in Staten Island so as to produce only 200 megawatts of electricity.

title: S.E.C. CHARGES 9 ON INSIDER RULES
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced, yesterday that it had charged nine men with violaticins of Federal insidertrading regulations in connection with their alleged dealings in shares of Harvey's Stores, Inc., on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Columbia Is Beaten, 7158 Wright Leaves Team a 2d Time, Assails Coach
description: The racial dispute that rocked Cornell's basketball team earlier this season surfaced again last night at Columbia University's Gym, but Cornell managed to overcome the loss of its leading scorer and defeat Columbia, 7158, before 1,054 fans.

title: ANTIQUES SHOW OPENS AT ARMORY Handsome Display on View at Seventh Regiment
description: The scene changes yearly with each staging of the Winter Antiques Show, but the imprint remains unmistakable, not withstanding dropout longtime dealers who had achieved a kind of landmark status.

title: No Wallace Comment
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Jan. 21 (AP)Mr. Wallace's office said the Governor had received Mr. Lindsay's telegram with the challenge and that the Governor had no comment.

title: Reform Urged to Make Phase 2 Succeed
description: Virgil B. Day, chairman of the business sector of the Pay Board, yesterday challenged the Administration and the Congress to institute structural reforms that, he said, would be needed to turn Phase Two into a lasting success.

title: JUDGE FINES CHIEF OF AIRPORT UNION; Assessed $75,000 in Case on Restaurant Damage
description: Cosme Rosado, the president of an airport union awaiting trial on Federal charges of racketeering, was fined $75,000 yesterday for acts of vandalism and sabotage that forced the closing of the elegant Restaurant America at Kennedy International Airport more than five months ago.

title: Panel Sets $360,000 Figure As Indemnification to Spurs
description: An arbitration hoard ruled yesterday that the Texas Rangers of the American League must pay $360,000 to the Texas League Spurs as a result of moving into the minor league club's territory, according to baseball commissioner Bowie Kuhn.

title: Fear of Freedom in Greece
description: Greece's military rulers have now admitted openly what had long been suspected: They will not allow leaders of the two major parties to resume political life even when elections are scheduled. Byron Stamatopoulos, chief spokesman for the regime, has applied the ban specifically to former Premier Panayotis Cannellopoulos of the National Radical Union and to George Mavros and Demetrios Papaspyrou of the Center Union.

title: Smith Calls Blacks Stupid If They Bar Rhodesia Pact
description: SALISBURY. Rhodesia, Jan. 21Prime Minister Ian D. Smith warned tonight that if blacks rejected the terms of a new settlement of Rhodesia's rebellion against Britain, his white Government would be happy to maintain its present laws, aimed at maintaining white supremacy forever.

title: DEMOCRATS SCORE NIXON'S MESSAGE IN REBUTTAL ON TV
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Congressional Democrats presented their own state of the union message today on a nationwide television program, accusing President Nixon of neglecting problems on the home front and prolonging the war in Indochina.

title: U.S. Held Ready for Talks
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 21  The United States and the Common Market have declared themselves ready to hold longterm talks on world trade, Market officials said today.

title: MRS. FRANCIS BOARDMAN
description: MANCHESTER, Mass., Jan. 21Mrs. Francis Boardman, the former Anne Mary Calef of Boston, a social worker, died last evening in a nursing home here at the age of 90. Her husband, a professional engineer and railroad executive, died many years ago.

title: ISRAEL IS TERMED READY FOR TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Senior Administration officials said today that it was now inevitable that Israel, given United States assurances in recent weeks of additional F4 Phantom jets and of Washington's neutrality, would soon agee formally to resume negotiations on an interim Middle East agreement opening the Suez Canal.

title: Negro Heads Virginia County
description: SURRY, Va., Jan. 21 (UR) M. Sherlock Holmes, a 32yearold black man, ??? chairman of the Board of Supervisors yesterday in Surry County, Va once the heart of the Tidewater plantation country. Mr. Holmes was named chairman of the fivemember board which now has a majority of three blacks. Surry County, where blacks outnumber whites, is the first Virginia county to he under black rule since Reconstruction.

title: New York City:
description: To the Editor: Has Mr. Carty forgotten since college days that New York has at least 100,000 heroin addicts and a murder rate which exceeds four per day? Has he forgotten that its school system is in virtual chaos, that many, many of its students are dented a chance for life by the very authority which is supposed to give them a chance? Has he forgotten, since he lives in Larchmont, that twenty miles away city of eight million people is falling into a concentrated state of decadence that defies repair?

title: ValueAdded Tax Backed
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 21 (AP) Sidney P. Marland Jr., United States Commissioner of education, said today that the Federal Government sould increase its share of aid to schools to 30 per cent and pay for it with some form of new tax.

title: Milburn Sets N.A.I.A. Mark In 60Yard Hurdles Trial
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 21 (AP)  Rod Milburn of Southern Louisiana University shattered the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics 60yard high hurdles record tonight by winning the event in 6.9 seconds in a quarterfinal heat.

title: Lord Chandos, Financier, Dies; Headed British Metals Concern
description: LONDON, Jan. 21  Lord Chandos, who since the outbreak of World War II had been at the center of Britain's political and industrial life, died today at the age of 78.

title: Theme in a Louis Dance: Couples and an Outsider
description: Subtle and abstracted gesture along with fastidious surface finish is the stylistic lingua franca of Murray Louis's choreographic works. Thursday evening at the Brooklyn Academy of Music his company presented the first performance of his fluidly calm work Continuum.

title: New York City:
description: As Lady Haire says, Paley Fountain and Greenacre Park are two veritable oases if you get there in a chauffeurdriven limousinebut you risk your life and limbs if you walk or travel by subway. Always carry money in your shoe so you can get home after your bag is stolen and you get roughed up.

title: Philharmonic Encounter Is Shifted to New School
description: Tonight's Prospective Encounter by the New York Philharmonic has been transferred from Martinson Hall in the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater to the New School Auditorium, 66 West 12th Street. The change was made necessary when New York City's Department of Buildings imposed restrictions on the occupancy of Martinson Hall.

title: Malta Talks Suspended Alter Reaching Impasse
description: ROME, Jan. 21The talks on military bases in Malta that began here last Saturday reached an impasse today and were suspended.

title: SOLDIER IN ULSTER KILLED NEAR BORDER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 21A British soldier was killed today, four days after his arrival in Ulster, by a guerrilla mine detonated from the Irish Republic.

title: 23 MORE AIR CADETS RESIGN AT ACADEMY
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Jan. 21 (UPI)The number of cadets found guilty in the Air Force Academy's third cheating scandal within a decade increased to 39 today, and an academy spokesman said officials had also turned up evidence of marijuana smoking among the cadets.

title: DOLE URGES PANEL TO FIX WAR BLAME
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Senator Robert J. Dole, Republican National Committee chairman, criticized the leading Democratic Presidential aspirants today and proposed that a special Congressional committee investigate the Vietnam war to place the responsibility where it lies.

title: Archer Sets Golf Pace on 136
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Jan. 21 George Archer, who shared the lead yesterday, had it alone today in the $150,000 Dean MartinTucson open golf tourney. The former ranch hand from Gilroy., Calif., scored a 71 for a 36hole aggregate of 136.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The City Council committee investigating the Municipal Loan Program voted yesterday to widen its inquiry and also to seek legislation in Albany to curb the Mayor's spending power.

title: The Democrats Reply
description: Judged as political dialogue rather than show business, the skillfully produced Democratic reply to President Nixon's State of the Union Message was less than successful.

title: ANNA MOFFO HEARD AS GILDA AT THE MET
description: In the Metropolitan Opera performance of Verdi's Rigoletto given Thursday night, Anna Moffo made her first appearance of the season with the company as Gilda and Enrico DiGiuseppe took the part of the Duke for the first time.

title: Dyce Runs Mile in 4:01.8; Adelphi Sets Relay Mark
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 21Byron Dyce, who said, I felt very powerful at the end, recorded his fastest indoor mile, 4 minutes 1.8 seconds, en route to an impressive victory in the Philadelphia Track Classic tonight.

title: New York City:
description: To the Editor: No doubt Lady Haire is safely ensconced in one of the uppermost vaults on the East Side and doesn't have to face the gauntlet of filth, verbal abuse and physical danger that most New Yorkers are apt to encounter anytime and anyplace.

title: Fallout Found in 16 States Is Linked to China ATest
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (Reuters)The Atomic Energy Commission reported today the detection of fresh fallout in 16 states as a result of a Chinese nuclear test two weeks ago.

title: Oarsmen ReElect Knecht
description: Bill Knecht of the Vesper Boat Club of Philadelphia was reelected yesterday to a fouryear term as president of the National Association of Amateur Oarsmen.

title: Will the Seychelles Find the Garden of Eden in Time For Queen Elizabeth's Visit in March?
description: VICTORIA, Mah, the Seychelles There are still islands where the beaches belong to the birds, and where natives their bring daily catch of fish by outrigger canoe. The Seychelles (pronounced sayshells) are like that, but the people of these 90odd islands shimmering in the middle of the Indian Ocear have been bitten by the tourist bug, and no one knows how long the Seychelles are likely to remain in their pristine state.

title: Ft. Lauderdale Editor To Be Honored Here
description: Johnny Wilson, 42yearold outdoors editor of the Fort Lauderdale, Fla., News, will be honored tonight at the annual dinner of the National Association of Engine and Boat Manufacturers.

title: Miss Farman, Robert Evans Plan Nuptials
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 22The engagement of Miss Constance Reid Farman to Robert Sheldon Evans, son of Thomas Mellon Evans of New York and Greenwich, and Mrs. Charles Miller Kase of Pasadena, Calif., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Hans L. Farman.

title: Nautical Touch for Greeting Cards
description: Someone once described an optimist as being a fisherman who would go out to fish and bring along his camera and his frying pan. But in my case, even that isn't enough.

title: Stricter Food Bill Offered
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (UPI) Representative Jonathan B. Bingham, Democrat of the Bronx, has introduced legislation to establish stricter Federal regulation of the food industry. The proposal, entered on Wednesday, includes new registration and licensing requirements for food processors, and new emergency recall and embargo powers for the Food and Drug Administration to keep foods posing health hazards from reaching consumers.

title: World Mark Sought For Speed Sailing
description: A prize of $5,200 and recognition as the official world sailing speed record holder awaits the helmsman who sets up the fastest time under sail this year over a halfkilometer coarse.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: John Canaday's article suggesting a type of Nielsen rating for the art world in which the Pierpont Morgan Library would be the ultimate victor, was internally inconsistent, blatantly elitist and, in short, utterly reprehensible. In the first sentence he slips out the praiseworthy phrase service to the public. Yet he proceeds with complete abandon to discredit himself and to deny entrance to the public. Perhaps Canaday should have begun his article with the phrase service to the lite rather than service to the public. Surely there are many legitimate reasons for visiting a museum and surely one need not be initiated in order to have one. In fact, although museums should serve the elite, they have certainly an even greater duty to serve the looseenders, the wanderers, the semiconscious, the school children and all other members of the uninitiated audience. The role of the museum in simple terms is to educate and give pleasure to the general public. And these people, despite Canaday's doubts that they absorb any culture, must he deriving benefit and pleasureeven though not legitimate by some standardsor they would not return.

title: Donna Machcinski Married in Rye
description: RYE, N. Y., Jan. 22 Miss Donna Victoria Machcinski was married here this afternoon to Scott William Peterson by the Rev. Wendell Phillips in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Pan Am Highway and Cattle Disease
description: The livestock industry is concerned lest efforts to speed the completion of the Pan American Highway result in the spread of footandmouth disease.

title: The Five Warring Tribes Of South Africa
description: SOUTH AFRICA is one of nature's fortunate areas, a most beautiful land blessed with everything except adequate water. I was unprepared for the majestic landscape, especially in the south. In its spectacular setting Capetown competes favorably with cities like Rio and Hong Kong, except that none of its beauty is spoiled by billboards or inappropriate building. The great game preserves are surpassed nowhere. Kruger National Park is 200 miles long and 40 miles wide, a treasure house of elephants, giraffes, lions and hippos. Lesser known parks like Umfolozi, with its white rhinos, are little gems.

title: Home Improvement
description: GYPSUM wallboard is probably the most widely used form of paneling or surfacing material for walls and ceilings in modern homes and apartments both in new construction and in remodeling jobs.

title: Seton Hall Wins on Mat
description: TEANECK, N. J. Jan. 22Seton Hall's wrestling team raised its wonlost record to 64 today with a 2818 victory over Fairleigh Dickinson at the loser's gymnasium. Fairleigh is now 35.

title: Providence Tops Niagara
description: PROVIDENCE, Jan. 22 (AP) Marvin Barnes scored 22 points and grabbed 17 rebounds and had plenty of help from Ernie DiGregorio and Don Lewis tonight as Providence registered an 8979 victory over Niagara.

title: AUTHOR CERTAIN HUGHES MET HIM
description: Clifford Irving, the novelist who contends he has compiled an authorized biography of Howard R. Hughes, said through his attorney yesterday that he continued to believe his material was authentic.

title: BIG SHOT II WINS COAST TURF RACE
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 22 (UPI)Favored Big Shot II survived a claim of foul today to win the faster $30,000 division of the San Marcos Handicap at Santa Anita. Aggressively, a long shot, captured the first division.

title: Marion RobinsonDuff of Finch Engaged to Patrick Oliver Filley
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Jan. 22The engagement of Miss Marion RobinsonDuff to Patrick Oliver Filley has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Jay Robinson  Duff, parents of the future bride. Her fiance is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Oliver Dwight Filley of Far Hills, N. J.

title: Editorial Cartoon 4  No Title
description: Editorial Cartoon 4  No Title

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The Club Mediterranee article omitted the most negative factor for Americans: the rudeness and hostility toward them displayed by French staff members. This animosity is directed particularly toward American married couples and single males. The only ones spared are a few single females, apparently because they have been targeted as sex objects, These few females are the ones who benefit from the instruction in sports activities. Other Americans have to fend for themselves.

title: Blues Stop Penguins, 10
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 22 (UPI)Ernie Wakely beat the Pittsburgh Penguins for his first shutout of the season and Billy Plager's first goal of the season gave the St. Louis Blues a 10 victory tonight.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  Like every other following, a constituency of conscience likes to be wooed. Liberal activists in Massachusetts gave former Senator McCarthy a harsh reminder of that basic political fact last weekend when they voted to concentrate their strength in the April 25 primary behind Senator George McGovern.

title: Methadone Center Opposed in BedStuy
description: A report that the recently closed Sumner Avenue Armory is being considered for use as a methadone treatment center provoked unified opposition from central Brooklyn residents at a meeting of Community Board 3.

title: LAFAYETTE SUBDUES RUTGERS FIVE, 8170
description: EASTON, Pa., Jan. 22 (AP) Lafayette outscored Rutgers 246 in the final 5 minutes today to defeat the Scarlet Knights, 8170, for the first time in seven years.

title: STOL Plane Tests Noise Level of Landing Here
description: Groups of Chelsea residents, some with tape recorders and all with their ears perked, stood in the chill along West 23d Street yesterday to evaluate the noise of a STOL plane that flew over the area simulating landings and takeoffs.

title: Chiefs Meet New Entry In Roller Derby Today
description: The Chiefs, Madison Square Garden's Roller Derby team, will be in Pittsburgh tonight to skate against the Eagles in an International Roller Derby League game. The game will mark the debut of the Eagles, who have been added to the league at midseason and will compete for a playoff berth on the basis of wonlost percentage.

title: CHILEAN SENATE CONVICTS OFFICIAL
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 22The opposition majority in the Senate, in Impeachment proceedings today, convicted Jose Toha Gonzalez, the former Minister of the Interior, of tolerating armed leftwing groups.

title: BIRD MIGRATIONS TO JAPAN REDUCED
description: TOKYO, Jan. 22 (Reuters) Many species of birds have stopped their seasonal migration to Japan because of pollution and the destruction of thei natural habitats.

title: DUKE FIVE UPSETS N. CAROLINA, 7674
description: DURHAM, N. C., Jan. 22 Robby West of Duke hit a 20foot shot with five seconds left today to hand thirdranked North Carolina its second loss of the season in a 7674 upset.

title: The World
description: One Labor Member of Parliament dashed across the floor of the House of Commons and shook his fist under Prime Minister Heath's nose. Another threw a newspaper at the Conservative leader. Others chanted Heath outl Heath out! until the uproar in the normally genteel British Parliament last Thursday forced the Speaker to suspend proceedings.

title: 73 of Foe Reported Slain
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 22 (AP)The South Vietnamese command reported that 35 enemy soldiers were killed in a series of skirmishes in South Vietnam today, and South Korean headquarters said its troops had killed 38 more of the enemy.

title: Cornell Sextet Wins, 54
description: CANTON, N. Y., Jan. 22 (AP) Cornell, on a goal by David Westner at 2:11 of an overtime period, defeated St. Lawrence, 54, in hockey tonight. Westner banked a 15foot shot off the pads of Allen Howe, the St. Lawrence goalie, for the winning goal.

title: A poet's journal, a strange Western, a novel of quest, a philosopher's fantasy
description: Page Stegner's second novel has some terrible flaws and some terrible graces. Let's start with the bad news. Hawks and Harriers is about a 28yearold Californian, Jack Crowe, who backtrails to New England in search of a more acceptable reality than he knew whilst perched in Monterey on Frontier's End. Searching for himself, this improvident son of a dead, dreaming fisherman finds Sandy, the idealistic daughter of a wealthy manufacturer of business machines. She is sexually free, socially repressed. He is strangely inhibited, socially a rebel. She wants to escape to California. He wants to penetrate the Eastern mysteries, starting with Sandy. Son of Jay Gatsby meets Daisy Miller rediviva. Unnaturally they fall in love, and out of love and back into love, until they end in a purgatorial limbo. Each has bad dreams, and they flail about, bruising their bed partners. Jack does most of the dreamingand the flailing. At novel's end Sandy has become an automaton, living death, while Jack is all set to light out for some other, as yet untrammeled territory.

title: St. Peter's Routs Wagner
description: Ted Martiniuk and Harry Anderson scored 30 points each to lead St. Peter's to a 127102 victory over Wagner last night on the losers court on Staten Island.

title: Ryen of Staten Island Wins Wictorin Trophy in Bear Mountain Ski Jumping
description: BEAR. MOUNTAIN, N. Y., Jan, 22A Staten Island carpenter, Thorbjorn Ryen, won the John Wictorin jumpoff trophy here today as the Swedish Ski Club marked its 48th anniversary.

title: Susan Dougherty Wed to Army Officer
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 22 Miss Susan Frances Dougherty and First Lieut. Richard Raymond Gratton 2d, U.S.A., were married here this afternoon in the Princeton University Chapel by the Rev. Charles B. Weiser, the Catholic chaplain at Princeton.

title: Bulls Beat Rockets, 115108
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 22 (AP)Chet Walker acquired a hot hand in the fourth quarter tonight as he saved the Chicago Bulls from dissipating a 15point advantage and led the Bulls to a 115108 victory over the Houston Rockets. HOUSTON (108) CHICAGO (115)

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Your picture feature, Look, J. B. How About a Train Wreck? (Travel section, Jan, 9), evoked an exciting recollection of a staged headon train wreck at the Iowa State Fair in 1932. As a lad, I hitchhiked 200 miles to see this spectacle. Two vintage locomotives, each pulling a wooden coach, started at each other down long inclines. They collided, in front of the packed grandstand, with a crash and roara symphony of smoke, hissing steam and pirouetting wheels, boards and debris filling the air. One of the coaches carried a huge sign, Hoover, and the other, Roosevelt"the candidates who were then approaching a collision at the Presidential polls.

title: Movies
description: THE phenomenal success of Love Story a year ago has not yet inspired the blatant imitations some of us fearedan assembly line of plastic preppies frolicking in the snow, and expiring to Mozart crescendoesbut it changed the direction of American movies all the same.

title: GARDEN FINISH LINE HAS ELECTRIC EYE
description: The Bulova Accutron Phototimer will be used for the first time in this indoor track season at Madison Square Garden at the Millrose Athletic Association games on Friday night.

title: Skippers Told to Think Big
description: AMTTYVILLE, L. L. N. Y. A think big mentality in boat buying will surface in 1972, a prominent Long Island marine dealer has predicted.

title: TV Series To Explore U.S. Waters
description: Loyd Bridges will return to television this monthnot as the familiar Mike Nelson of Sea Hunt, but as the principal of a new boating format.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Citing a decrease in burglaries last year, City Council President Sanford D. Garelik said yesterday that he had some hope of a beginning in the long, hard battle to reverse the growth in crime linked to narcotics use.

title: Interest Fanned For World Race
description: A fully crewed round the world race has been proposed for a fall, 1973, start by Anthony Churchill, editor of the English magazine, Yachting and Boating, and a member of Prime Minister Edward Heath's crew in Morning Cloud.

title: Princeton Stops Colgate, 31
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 22The Princeton hockey team rallied for a pair of goals in the final period tonight to defeat Colgate, 31, and snap a ninegame losing streak. Three sophomores, Ogden Hunnewell, Pete McCann and Walt Snickennberger, each scored goals for the Tigers, Al Forslund, freshman center, tallied the lone goal for Colgate.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISThis weekend marks a fateful event in modern European history. Britain, Ireland, Norway and Denmark formally accede to the Common Market or, as it is often known, Europe and that enlarged community for the first time can see on its horizon the chance to become a kind of collective superpower in an evolving world.

title: Nan Marmon Fiancee Of Paul Sabel, S tudent
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., Jan. 22Miss Nan Leslie Marmon, who expects to be graduated in December from Clark University, and Paul David Sabel, a secondyear student at the University of Massachusetts Medical School, plan to be married in July.

title: Nancy Arnold Engaged
description: GREENS FARMS, Conn., Jan. 22Mr. and Mrs. William R. Arnold have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy Arnold, to Peter Van Leight, son of Mrs. Foxhall Finney of Hampton, N. J., and the late Eugene Van Leight. Miss Arnold, niece of the late Maj. Gen. William Arnold, U.S.A., Chief of Chaplains for the Armed Services, is assistant promotion director of Travel and Leisure magazine. Her fianc is retail advertising manager of New York magazine.

title: 8 OFFICES ARE LOOTED IN 48TH ST. BUILDING
description: An office building off Fifth Avenue on 48th Street was looted during the early hours yesterday. The police listed among the business establishments invaded a wig maker, a tailor shop, a doctor's office and a company called the Mind Control Institute of New York.

title: Thefts on Rise in South Vietnam As Costly Holiday Approaches
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 22  Thefts, burglaries and armed robberies have risen sharply throughout the country during the weeks before the Lunar New Year, or Tet, as Vietnamese search for money to pay traditional holiday expenses.

title: Remington Team Advances In Mixed Platform Tennis
description: RYE, N.Y., Jan. 22Charles (Chuck) Remington of the Manursing Island Club, Rye, and Mrs. Thornton Gerrish of Apawamis, the defending champions, led the way today through the quarterfinal round of the Apawamis Club mixed platform tennis tournament.

title: Sorties
description: The journals that make up twothirds of this book belong more to the history of public relations than private ones. What James Dickey says about two of his contemporaries may be said of Sorties as well: The  public styles of people like Allen Ginsberg, Robert Bly with his serape, and other curiosities: If you can really write, you don't need to dress up funny.

title: Significant Market Dates
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 22 (UPI) Following are the significant dates in Britain's attempts to enter the Common Market.

title: Power Lack Next Summer?
description: Relatively mild winters and cool summers in recent years appear to have lulled the public into doubting the chances of any future energy crisis.

title: Chaps Beat Rockets, 9493
description: DALLAS, Jan. 22 (AP)Steve Jones's 15foot jump shot with 1:30 left capped a seesaw fourth quarter as the Dallas Chaparrals took a 9493 victory tonight over the Denver Rockets.

title: TURBINEPOWERED QUEEN OF THE SHOW: The 48foot Sportfisherman from Pacemaker of Little Egg Harbor, N.J
description: A new heavyduty, directreading loran receiver leads Raytheon's line of marine electronic equipment for navigation, communications, and safety for 1972. Also making their boatshow debuts are fullpower VHF/FM. radiotelephones and a combination Fathometer depth sounder that reports the depth of water as either a profile graph or an instantaneous flashing light.

title: Bridal Planned By Miss Gayton And G. H. Hawn
description: VIENNA, Ohio, Jan. 22Miss Henrietta Gayton, an assistant utilities analyst with Stone & Webster Securities Corp in New York, and Gates Helms Hawn, who is with the corporate finance department of the Bankers Trust Company in New York, will be married March 18 at the Woodmont (Md.) Rod and Gun Club.

title: OHIO STATE SINKS INDIANA, 80 TO 74
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 22 (UPI)Allan Hornyak scored 36 points tonight to lead sixthranked Ohio State to an 8074 Big Ten basketball victory over Indiana.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  President Nixon, in steelgray attire, seemed to hurry through his text, though he appeared not the least bit nervous. There was only perfunctory applause, yet he did not try hard to solicit it. The Democrats responded with some criticism, but not much. Republicans hailed it as a great and historic speech, but they displayed little emotion.

title: Alcohol: Affliction Of 110,000 on L. I.
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I.The former stewardess lying drunk in her Westbury living room. The private investigator from Franklin Square lurching through the Bowery. The Vassar graduate drinking secretly in the kitchen of her elegant North Shore home. The successful lawyer too hung over to drive to his Mineola practice.

title: Sadat Sees Students
description: CAIRO, Jan. 22 (Reuters)President Sadat and top ministers met student leaders here today and discussed their demands for an early resumption of the war with Israel, but the meeting failed to end the sitin at Cairo University.

title: PARTY IN CROATIA PLANNING REFORM
description: ZAGREB, Yugoslavia, Jan. 22 The new leader of Croatia's Communist party, Mrs. Milka Planinc, said today that major changes would be made in the republic's administration of selfmanagement, the basis of the Yugoslav economy.

title: Offshore Rule Confounds Yachtsmen
description: Owners of sailboats capable of competing in offshore and longdistance races in the United States and Canada are confused, concerned and contemplative as another yacht racing season gets under way.

title: British Sailing Woman at Show
description: Nicolette Milnes  Walker, the 28yearold who last year became the first woman to sail the Atlantic alone by the northern route, will appear in the British area of the boat show.

title: N.A.E.B.M. Expected To ReElect President
description: Armand A. Hauser is in line for election to his second oneyear term as president of the National Association of Engine and Boat Manufacturers at the board of directors meeting today.

title: Reader's Report
description: Benny Kramer, who inhabited the lower East Side in an earlier Weidman novel, returns in this one with a long, long flashback. As Benny remembers East Fourth Street in 1924, life is a mishmash of Harry Golden and Mack Sennett. The wrapping for these fictional memories is a pungent milieuand Mr. Weidman recalls it with some of, his distinctive sourness and verve. The innards of the package are a cockamamie pipe dream that might have been sub  titled Benny Kramer, Boy Bootlegger.

title: Jane Bloch Is Fiancee Of Dr. Robert Mayer
description: FREEPORT, L. I., Jan. 22 Mr. and Mrs. Irwin Bloch have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jane Caroline Bloch, to Dr. Robert James Mayer, son of Dr. Eugene L. Mayer of New Hyde Park, a physician, and Mrs. Mayer. The wedding is planned for June.

title: Warren Loses 13 Pounds
description: SOLANO BEACH, Calif., Jan. 22 (AP)Former Chief Justice Earl Warren's weight is down to 198 pounds, a reduction of 13, and he credits swimming, walking and gym work. No handball, the 80yearold Mr. Warren told pupils to Earl Warren Junior High School. That used to be great exercise for me, but no more.

title: Must I Side With Blacks Or Whites?
description: I CAN'T think of any theater I would rather sit down in than the New Lafayette at Seventh Avenue and 137th Street, gust around the corner from Mother Zion Church. It is an auditorium that combines the best of both worldsthe hospitable Informality of Off Off Broadway buildings and the comfortable formality of conventional theaters with seats fixed to the floor and arranged in neat rows. It's nice also because they don't have the house lights on full before the show. A dim religious light burns, as does incense which however, has an odor agreeably unsuggestive of either the Pope or the Maharishi: a hedonistic irreligious incense.

title: Hempstead Focus: Research Projects
description: POINT LOOKOUT, L.I.Many of the 50,000 boatmen Is Hempstead Town's waters have doubled their pleasure because Harold F. Udell is as sticky as chewing gum when it comes to details.

title: 59 ENTERED TODAY IN STATE TENNIS
description: Harry Ilopman's crop of young tennis talent will be on display today as the New York State men's indoor championship starts at noon at the Port Washington (L.I.) Tennis Academy.

title: St. Maarten Ideal For Lazy Boatmen
description: ST. MAARTEN, Netherlands AntillesSome islands may be unheard of, but there are others that should he heard from. In this category are the tripleS Caribbean isles of Saba, Statia and St. Maarten.

title: Brussels Faces the Inevitable: A Rise in Eurocrat Population
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 22 (Reuters)  The entry of Britain and three other countries into the European Common Market with the formal signing of documents here today is expected to swell an already substantial force of civil servants working for the community.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: As a student, I applaud the producers of Inner City for lowering the price of admission to $3 for a few nights. I, for one, would not have paid the full price after reading some of the critical reviews. And yet, after seeing it, I would gladly pay the full price to see it again.

title: Three Are Seized in Holdups At Airport Parking Lots Here
description: Two men and a woman who the police believe to have been responsible for a series of holdups of parking attendants at Kennedy International Airport were arrested early yesterday morning.

title: DR. MAX RABINOWITZ, ORTHOPEDIST, DEAD
description: Dr. Max S. Rabinowitz, former chief of orthopedic surgery at Maimonides Medical Center Brooklyn, died yesterday there. He was 73 years old and lived at 303 Beverly Road, Brooklyn.

title: CHARLES A. SWANSON
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 22Charles A. Swanson, a retired vice president of Arnold Bakers, Inc., died yesterday at Norwalk Hospital. He was 58 years old and lived on Shorehaven Road here.

title: Glastron Offering 2 Modern Designs
description: Two new fiberglass powerboatsa 21foot camper of advanced bowrider design, and a sport boat with sculpted seating arrangementsare being shown by Glastron.

title: Cruising Lazy Rivers Relaxing Sport
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md.The guy who wrote the song, Up a Lazy River may not have had the Severn or the Patuxent or the Sassafras or the Chester or the Miles or the Choptank or even the Potomac in mind, but lately more and more people have.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: New York (Felt Forum)Josue Marquez, 139 pounds, Caguas, P. R., outpointed Adolphus (Doc) McLendon. 141, Paterson, N. J. 10 rounds: Walter Seeley, 127, Sayville, L. L, outnointed Jesus Nieves, 126, Naranjito, P. R., 10.

title: Outrigger and Sloop Make Debut
description: Already well known for its Sunfish, Sailfish and other fiberglass boats, AMF Alcort is corning out with two new models, a 12foot6inch sloop to be known as the Puffer, and a slim, 14foot outrigger called the Hilu.

title: Adults Are Advised to Be Honest With a Dying Child
description: Susie was seven years old, dying of leukemia and tired of being lied to about the fate of friends who disappeared from her hospital ward.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: William T. Hogan, a Roman Catholic priest and professor of economics at Fordham University, made secure his position as the Boswell of the steel industry last month with publication of a fivevolume, 2,178page economic history of the nation's steel makers.

title: CHARLES FRANCK
description: MIAMI SHORES, Fla., Jan. 22  Charles Franck, founder, and former president and chairman of the Holophane Company, a maker of lighting equipment and components, now a subsidiary of the JohnsManville Corporation, died yesterday in his home at the age of 90.

title: The villain is better described as corporatism
description: Liberal politics has changed since the Tonkin Gulf incident, and liberal rhetoric has changed with it. American Imperialism, a concept once comfortably at home in the pages of Ramparts, has migrated toward the center, and may even on occasion be glimpsed on The Times editorial page. Imperialism needs a motive, and the number one candidate is Economic. Claude Julien's America's Empire presents the case for America as economic juggernaut. His mlange of hyperbole and outright distortion, what might best be classified as the European paranoid view of postwar America, ignores the ambiguities of foreign economic affairs. Raymond Vernon's Sovereignty at Bay and the contributors to Charles Kindleberger's The International Corporation: A Symposium rather soberly provide the raw material for counterargument.

title: Virginia Cooke Is Bride on L.I. Of R. L. Arvay
description: GARDEN CITY, LI., Jan. 22  Miss Virginia A. Cooke, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Joseph Cooke, was married here today to Robert Leslie Arvay of Moorestown, N.J., son of Mr. and Mrs. Leslie Arvay of Allentown, Pa. The ceremony was performed at a nuptial mass in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church by Msgr. Francis X. Fitzgibbon.

title: Tourism and the Good Life Stir Pacific Isle of Taboga
description: PANAMA CITY, Panama Guests will please wear shirts in the dining room.

title: Movies
description: LEE GRANT, who stars on Broadway as the troubled wife of Peter Falk in Neil Simon's The Prisoner of Second Avenue and will soon be seen on screen as Richard Benjamin's troublesome mom in Portnoy's Complaint, may be letting herself in for more trouble. She's going to direct a movie. It's called I'm Waiting and is based on an original script by former actor Sam Reese. Miss Grant's husband, Joe Feury, will produce the film, which should start shooting some time next summer.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTONIn his State of the Union Message, Mr. Nixon challenged Congress to put aside politics and act on the needs of the nation. The chances now seem good that the Senate will do just that on the question of equal employment opportunities, and hand the challenge right back to the President.

title: Riad Still to Visit China
description: CAIRO, Jan. 22 (AP)EgyptianChinese contacts are under way to fix a date for a visit to Peking by Mahmoud Riad, President Anwar elSadat's foreign affairs adviser, the daily Al Ahram said today. Mr. Riad was to have visited this week in the capacity of Foreign Minister, but Mr. Sadat's Cabinet shuffle disrupted that plan. Murad Ghaleb succeeded Mr. Riad as Foreign Minister.

title: 2 Youths Knifed to Death in Chinatown
description: Two Chinese youths were fatally stabbed Friday night at the fringe of Chinatown on the Lower East Side when, the police said, they were attacked by a group of 10 to 15 Chinese youngsters who wielded knives.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Ken Bernstein used to be a correspondent for N.B.C., stationed in several capitals abroad for extended periods. This has given him a leg up on those writers who (like Count Smorltork in The Pickwick Papers) go to a country for a week, take notes and are prepared to write the definitive history. When Bernstein's novel Intercept came out last year, it was hailed for its insights into Russian life and character; the author had spent a great deal of time in Moscow. Now he is represented by THE SENATOR'S RANSOM (Coward, McCann & Geoghegan, $5.95). This one has Brazil as its locale.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:  I have long been appalled by executives who hide behind their secretaries.

title: Moscow Criticizes Britain
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22 (AP)The Soviet Union said today that by signing the Common Market treaty the British Government ignored the profound dissatisfaction that this step evokes among the majority of the country's population. Tass, the Soviet press agency, said opinion polls showed a majority of the British public was against joining the market and that it would mean a drastic growth of the cost of living in Britain.

title: The Nation
description: The Nation

title: STUDY SUGGESTS A GATEWAY TONE
description: A careful balance of carnival atmosphere and natural surroundings is suggested for the proposed Gateway National Recreation Area in a report prepared under the auspices of the Mayor's Council on the Environment.

title: Horse Show News
description: Just five years ago, Tom Gruenebaum, a Wall Street broker, was looking around northern Westchester for some real estate. He came on an interesting parcel in Somers and bought it.

title: Johnson Racing Handbook
description: A handbook designed to help the outboard speed buff become involved in organized racing is available for 25 cents from Johnson Motors, Waukegan, Ill. Called Take Charge, the 20page booklet takes the highperformance outboarder through an explanation of the various racing classes and describes the steps involved in setting up boat and motor for competition.

title: Hulls Wood, Decks Ciass
description: Broadwater of Mayo, Md., has four of its halfwood, halffiherglass power cruisers in the show. All have marine plywood hulls and fiberglass decks and superstructures.

title: New Look in Radiotelephones
description: It's strictly the new look in radiotelephones at this year's boat show. Medium frequency shiptoshore AM units covering the standard 2 megahertz marine band are no longer on the sales counters.

title: Hy Whuhawnt You Hy Neeheed You
description: AS Hollywood welcomes back stars like Victor Mature to new film assignments, and revives nostalgic tales of the years of the studios, so rock and the record industry are welcoming back departed, retired or stillchugging stars of the 1950's, when teenpop evolved into rock'n roll.

title: The Island's Sound Today Is Country
description: TERRYVILLE, L. I.Long Island's country musicians will hold their second almost annual festival today at the Elks Lodge, adjacent to the Wagon Wheel Restaurant.

title: Education
description: Open admissions will develop best in a heterogeneous setting, and not in colleges ghettoized by income, ethnic background or academic preparation. With these words, Luis QueroChiesa, chairman of New York City's Board of Higher Education, explained a decision last week that could result in considerable shuffling among the 10 senior colleges and eight community colleges of the City University of New York (C. U. N. Y.).

title: The Guest Word
description: It's a fact, sophistication aside, that the publishing industry is as trendy as the garment industry. And its real motive is the sameto sell. We have witnessed the Kennedy Season, the Black Season (basic or otherwise), the Revolutionary Season (boutique or plain piperack bomber), the Feminist Season and the Mafia Season (Italian knit).

title: KENTUCKY DOWNS TENNESSEE, 7270
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 22Jim Andrews scored for Kentucky with two seconds reImaining today to enable the Wildcats to defeat 19thranked Tennessee, 7270, in a Southeastern Conference basketball game.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: John O'Toole and Ed Ney have recently broken into print with recommendations for radical change in the use of television for political campaigning. Both men are strongly opposed to commercials per seMr. O'Toole pleading for a fiveminute minimum for exposures, which is really a short program, and Mr. Ney calling for the elimination of paid TV time and, in its place, the granting of special program periods to the political parties. I am sure these positions have found many followers.

title: LowFlying Spinnaker Does Its Job
description: It may have been the result of a bad dream, but I came up with an idea to put as large a spinnaker as possible on a highsheer 7foot9inch Dyer Dhow!

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:  You might he interested in an old motto that occupies a prominent place on my office wall:

title: Amphetamine Maker Will End Criticized Production in Mexico
description: The Pennwalt Corporation, whose Mexican plant was said by Federal officials last week to be selling amphetamines that eventually enter the illicit drug market in the United States, has announced that it is going out of the amphetamine business in Mexico.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:  When I was a young man in the agency business I recall asking Wells Peck, leader of Peck & Peck, how he managed to spend a little time with everyone who walked into his reception room, and how he managed to speak to practically everyone who called him. His answer helped me all through my business career. It was, Donald, it doesn't cost a penny to be polite.

title: A Cat Bit The Countess
description: LAST month, a Maori soprano named Kin Te Kanawa made a sensation at Covent Garden in London with her singing of the role of the Countess in The Marriage of Figaro. Before that, however, she had thrilled audiences in the part at the Sante Fe Opera.

title: John F. Osta Weds Nancy J. Sommers
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Jan. 22 Miss Nancy Jean Sommers, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. B. Klare Sommers of Delhi, was married here this morning to John F. Osta, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank M. Osta of Syracuse. The Rev. Joseph B. Dorsey performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception.

title: New Signature on Paper Currency
description: COLLECTORS of United States paper money have enjoyed a bonanza in recent years with the numerous changes in signatures of both the Treasurer of the United States and the Secretary of the Treasury. The names appear on the face side of all Federal Reserve notes.

title: Yacht Complex Labors All Winter
description: What's happening et the East Coast's biggest yachting complex In midwinter, when nothing seems to be happening? Plenty. Yacht Haven East and Yacht Haven West, flanking Stamford Harbor, and Cedar Island Marina North in Clinton, Conn., seize the winter days for all kinds of undercover and overcover activity.

title: PREP MILE WON BY CENTROWITZ
description: Matt Centrowitz of Power Memorial Academy continued to live up to his reputation yesterday in the 16th annual St. Francis Prep indoor track games at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: Stamps
description: UNDER the heading Collecting stamps an offense in China,  a clipping, presumably from a Hong Kong newspaper, sent by Jill Durdin of The New York Times Bureau there, reports that Stamp collecting is now an offense in China. This once widely publicized national habit has been banned since the Cultural Revolution.

title: The Nation
description: It is, declared Russell D. Hemenway, director of the National Committee for an Effective Congress, one of the most significant political reforms in many years  a crucial first step toward cleansing politics of secrecy, duplicity and special interest influence. Object of his praise: The campaign spending reform bill, passed by the House last week and sent to President Nixon, who is expected to sign it into law. The bill will, for the first time in history, set limits upon the amount of money that can be spent on election campaigns for Federal offices.

title: Daughter to Mrs. Zaks
description: A daughter was born on Jan. 10 to Dr. and Mrs. Arthur Zaks at the University Hospital. The child has been named Karen Leigh. Mrs. Zaks is the former Miss Mary Leanore Rega of Huntsville. Ala.

title: ORT CELEBRATING ITS JUBILEE YEAR
description: Who would have thought that a voluntary organization created to liberate Jews from their economic ghettos in Eastern Europe would 50 years later aid developing nations?

title: Tokyo Slowly Widening Contacts With North Korea
description: TOKYO, Jan. 22  Along with the pursuit of improved; relations with China, Japan is also inching toward better contacts with North Korea. However, no real enthusiasm for ties can yet bb detected among the conservativeminded leaders of the LiberalDemocratic Government.

title: Egypt Reported to Restore Citizenship Rights to 12.000
description: CAIRO, Jan. 22  President Anwar elSadat has reportedly allowed 12,000 Egyptians to recover their full citizenship rights after 10 years of being in political isolation.

title: Mr. Pow Wow Also Scores
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., Jan. 22 A heavy rain just before noon ruined the day at Gulfstream Park today, the downpour forced the management to switch four scheduled grass races to the main course and caused 18 late scratchesnine of them in the two divisions of the $20,000added Appleton Handicap.

title: About Motor Sports
description: The Sports Car Club of America has set up its Formula B program as an independent professional series, with an 11race schedule for 1972. Formula B races, formerly part of the L. and M. Continental 5000 Championship, will now he run as supporting features with other S.C.C.A. eventsfive CanAms, three Continentals, two TransAmericans and one National.

title: 10 COUNTRIES SIGN PACT TO ENLARGE COMMON MARKET
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 22  Ten nations of Western Europe joined today to create a larger and more powerful economic community.

title: Dreaming Is Ladder To Owning
description: Donald H. Ross of Benton Harbor, Mich., is an upperechelon example of what happens to the yachtsman over the years as he finds himself able to buy new boats to fulfill his deep dream of the perfect yacht.

title: Free Booklet Available
description: A free 16page booklet, Let's Go Boating, is available to the public upon request. Write to NAEBM, 537 Steamboat Road, Greenwich, Conn. 06830, or, Boating Industry Association, 333 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, M. 60601.

title: Lake George Winning Battle Against Pollution
description: LAKE GEORGE, N. Y.Communities in this historic Adirondack Mountain region are winning their fight to keep Lake George's waters clean. Constant vigilance by paid boat patrolmen, the growing awareness by local residents that they must monitor their own behavior around the lake and increasing cooperation by visitboatmen are helping to put the ecology drive over the top.

title: Bridge
description: FOR those who like to play their bridge dangerously, there is no surer way than to overcall vulnerable at the level of two or higher with insufficient assets. You hold, for example:

title: Maderna Directs Philharmonic In Two  Prospective Encounters
description: The New York Philharmonic's Prospective Encounters are not unlike Earle Brown's openform music, which turned up in the third of this season's innovative series. The ingredients that go into them are fixed, but they can interact in different ways for results that are sometimes dull, sometimes arresting. The first two Encounters reportedly failed to jell. The one on Friday night, which was held in the New School Auditorium, held the attention from the beginning almost to the end.

title: Miss Saundra Bill To Wed in Summer
description: CANANDAIGUA, N.Y., Jan. 22  Mr. and Mrs. Clarence E. Bill have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Saundra Leigh Bill, to Thomas Hargrave Farnham, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sherman Farnham of Rochester. The wedding is planned for this summer.

title: Art
description: THE new exhibition at the Guggenheim Museum called Ten Independents has an awful lot wrong with it by my personal score, which gives one Bravo, two Well dones, two Don't cares and five No, no, nos to the ten members of the group. Even so, one thing about Ten Independents is so good that if I didn't like any of the work I would still settle for an overall Bless you! to the Guggenheim for giving space to the show even while explicitly abjuring any inferred endorsement.

title: DUTCH AUTO TEAM FORCED FROM RACE
description: MONTE CARLO, Jan. 22 (AP) A Ford Escort, driven by Rob Slotemaker of the Netherlands, caught fire near Gdynia, Poland, today as a result of a short circuit, eliminating the Dutchman and his codriver, Fergus Van Der Geest, from the Monte Carlo Rally, the organizers reported.

title: COAST SPRINTER TAKES DASH TITLE
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 22 (AP)  Jean Louis Ravelomanantsoa of Westmont College of California, successfully defended his title i the 60yard dah tonight in the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics seventh annual indoor track and field championships.

title: Rain Chases Runyan From Pro Golf Post
description: REDMOND, Wash., Jan. 22 (UPI)Paul Runyan, twotime Professional Golfers Association champion, has resigned as pro at Sahalee Country Club here because he couldn't adjust to the rainy climate.

title: St. Francis Loses, 7168
description: Fairleigh Dickinson University clung to a 14point lead in the second half in the face of a pressing St. Francis rally to post a 7168 victory at the Brooklyn school's gym last night. Glenn Bolduc led Fairleigh Dickinson with 31 points while Dennis McDermott was high for the losers with 16.

title: Dakota Acts on Age Limit
description: BISMARCK, N. D., Jan. 22 (UPI)The North Dakota constitutional convention has voted to lower the age requirement for holding public office in the state to 21 years from 24. Delegates yesterday amended a proposal that would set the age to hold public office and prescribe residency requirements

title: Wishnick and Aronow: World Beaters
description: A New York chemical company executive and a Florida boatbuilder proved an overpowering combination on the 1971 world ocean powerboatracing scene.

title: Spain and Smuggling
description: MADRID, Jai. 22 (Reuters)Some 40 million packs of United States made cigarettes were smuggled Into Spain last year, informed sources in the Spanish tobacco industry reported this week.

title: Gardens
description: THE trend is to treesindoors. Local suppliers have noticed a swell in the demand for tall display plants that provide decorative accent for homes and offices. Trees which respond in limited light and air rate highest. Pictured here are the top four. Others in the running are Norfolk Island pine, podocarpus, jade plant, yucca, and fruits such as mango and loquat. Indoor trees are a large investment in comparison to a pot of philodendron. Their selection is dictated by the growing conditions available. They require good light, not necessarily full sun, proper air circulation without drafts, and warmth. These trees are tropical, trucked from Florida nursery acres where they have maximum sun, and warmth. To prepare them for city and suburban living, many suppliers housebreak these trees by giving them a few weeks acclimatization a greenhouse. They are grown in lower light, air and humidity levels before retail sale to enable the large plants to adjust to indoor climate more easily. Plants sold directly from truck to shop to consumer do not make the transition as readily and sometimes fail. Shop carefully.

title: Canada Releases Documents on War
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 22Canada's deep concern about her role in World War II is aired in secret Cabinet documents released this week on the order of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau.

title: L.I. SCHOOL AIDS NEEDIEST CASES
description: Mrs. Nancy Marin's fifthgrade class at No. 6 School in Woodmere, L. I., ran a retail store for a week last month. The economic experiment, involving all classes at the school, netted $485.15 which was contributed to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: R. J. Bundle Jr. Weds Miss Hittinger
description: Miss Patricia Elizabeth Hittinger and Ralph Johnson Bunche Jr. were married in Christ Chapel at the Riverside Church here at noon yesterday. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Charles Hittinger of Summit, N.J. The bridegroom is the son of Mrs. Bunch of Kew Gardens, Queens, and the late Dr. Bunche, former United Nations Under Secretary General for Special Political Affairs and winner of the 1950 Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Modern Times'Still Funny, Still Lovely
description: AT one point or another in our lives, most of us have lurched through the valley of the shadow of death, with no special style. The quality that distinguishes Charlie Chaplin's Tramp nnmething particularly apparent in the revival of the marvelous Modern Times at the Lincoln Art Theateris that the Tramp literally dances through it, in the manic ballet turns arntinn the ElectrnSteel plant as he is entering his nervous breakdown (after going nutty tightening bolts on the assembly line), on roller skates in the department store where he has an extremely short career as a night watchman, and, at the end, Nvben he and the Gamin (Paulette Goddard) set out handinhand on the road of life, which, you may he sure, is boobytrapped with disasters.

title: Prizes for Safety, Writing, Classes
description: A tristate sate boating council, a county recreation and park department and a national boating magazine are winners of the 14th annual Gold Cup Awards for Boating Safety.

title: News of Dogs
description: John M. Olin is known to the business world as an industrialist, the honorary chairman of the board of Olin Corporation. In the education world, he's a trustee of Washington University in St. Louis and a trustee emeritus of Cornell and Johns Hopkins. In the dog world, Olin is famous for Labrador retrievers, English springers, Brittany spaniels and pointers, and as head of the Orthopedic Foundation for Animals.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Check guywires on young trees to be sure they are secure. Drying winter winds, when there is no snow or rain, are difficult for evergreens; on mild days water city penthouses since plants have limited soil depth. Be cautious about pushing house plants with fertilizer when there is less growing light; January and February are somewhat dormant months.

title: Iowa Upsets S. Carolina, 9185, as Williams Scores 40 and Stall Halts Rally
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 22 (AP)Iowa led all the way, with Rick Williams scoring 40 points, and the Hawkeyes upset South Carolina, 9185, today after Long Beach State routed Loyola of Chicago, 7958, in a Chicago Stadium doubleheader.
