title: Are There Still No Answers To Ed Morrow's Questions?
description: AS a longtime admirer of Edward R. Murrow (dating back to the wartime days when This  is London first made his voice familiar to us), I watched with admiration as the recent weeklong Murrow Retrospective unfolded over Channel 13. The impact of the programs selected from CBS Reports and See It Now was as strong and immediate as it was when I originally saw them. Murrow's passion as a human being, and his integrity as a reporter, came through with an intensity that I had all but forgotten after his nearly 10  year absence from the broadcasting scene.

title: Housewife Will Race Again
description: Mona Daily is coming back and inboard powerboat racing's male fraternity has reason to be uneasy.

title: National League Baseball Season Will Open April 5 With Astros at Reds
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 22 (UPI)The National League will start its 1972 season on Wednesday, April 5, with the Houston Astros playing the Cincinnati Reds in Cincinnati's traditional advance opener, it was announced today by Charles S. Feeney, the league president.

title: U. S. Sues 70 Retail Outlets In PricePosting Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The Government has filed lawsuits) charging at least 70 retail establishments around the country with violations of Phase Two priceposting requirements.

title: OwnerDriver Rally Against Gypsy Licenses Is Held
description: Several hundred taxicab ownerdrivers attended a midtown rally yesterday, where leaders exhorted them to contact their City Councilmen to oppose a bill that would license gypsy cab drivers.

title: Turbine Car: Cleaner Air?
description: An experimental turbine car will be delivered soon to the City of New York for tests and demonstrations of its ability to provide lowemission power for urban driving conditions.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: People complain about the state of the theater during the last several seasons. Then, when a play like There's One In Every Family is brought to Broadway by David Merrick and receives very good reviews, there are few willing to support it. I saw the play the night after it opened and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it. Why then does it have to close after two weeks?

title: A Mother's Vigilance
description: The saddest case I heard about during my South African visit concerned a white mother who took her daughter to beginners school. While there, she spotted another little girl who looked suspiciously dark. Alerting the police, she had the child and her parents taken before the Race Classification Board. This group of pseudoscientists inspected the family, paying great attention to the texture of hair, thickness of lips and especially the presence or absence of freckles. Freckles are a good thing to have in South Africa, my informant told me. You'd get by. You have freckles.

title: Mary Johnston Wed
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Jan. 22 Miss Mary Pamela Johnston, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Emmett Johnston of Plandome, was married here this noon to John F. Nesline, son of Mr. and Mrs. George J. Nesline of Kensington, Md. The Rev. William Geary performed the ceremony at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Seton Hall Wins, 9872
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Jan. 23Ken House scored a careerhigh 38 points tonight as Seton Hall rallied in the second half to defeat Georgetown, 9872. House also had 18 rebounds.

title: Car Engine Woes Rise
description: DETROIT, Ja n. 22Isadore Birnbaum, a Detroit pharmacist, complains that his new Lincoln Continental drives me nutsyou start it up and it dies on you.

title: Colby Six Wins, 7 to
description: CLINTON, N. Y., Jan. 22 (AP)Colby defeated Hamilton, 7.1 today in college hockey. Scoring two goals each were Steve Self, Dana Hits End Doug McMillan.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 22 (AP) Temple won its second game in three days against a New York City school tonight when the Owls downed Manhattan, 7362, at the Palestra.

description: DACCA  Maybe, said Sheik Mujibur Rahman, talking informally with some Western correspondents in his living room, maybe it takes one man to lead his people to independence and another to build that nation afterward. That was almost 10 months ago, a few days before the Pakistani Army began its reign of terror in East Bengal.

description: The snap, pop and crackle of sound in small child's life  whether it is the dog barking, the front door slamming, a bee humming, or his mother's voiceplays a big part in teaching him ways to connect himself to the world.

title: Hungary Sets WineTasting

The competition's organizers expect that the judges will have to sip their way through more than 1,000 wines from 45 different countries. Countries may enter samples in proportion to their total production of wines.

title: LOCAL ELECTIONS SET FOR PAKISTAN
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Jan. 22 President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto announced today his new Government's first steps toward restoring representative government after 11 years of martial law.

title: Safe Boats, Clean Waters
description: The beginning of what could be a nationwide drive to have boating enthusiasts cooperate on improving the environment is scheduled for the boat show.

title: 6 New Ones for Chrysler
description: Chrysler Corporation's marine products for 1972 are highlighted by six new fiberglass sport boats, two of the marine industry's highest horsepowerrated outboards, the first fivecylinder heavyduty diesel and a highperformance inboardoutdrive called Super Bee III.

title: Elsie F. Myers, R. J. Martin Jr. To Be Married
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 Mrs. Walter K. Myers has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Elsie Frances Myers, to Raymond J. Martin Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin of Decatur, Ga.

title: Rhode Island Victor
description: KINGSTON, R.I., Jan. 22 (AP) Rhode Island, led by Tom Barao and Robbie Young, built a 20point lead midway through the second half today and rolled to a 9183 basketball victory over Duquesne.

description: READINGS ON THE CURRENT SOCIAL ISSUES IN BUSINESS. Edited by Fred Luthans and Richard M. Hodgetts. 312 pages. The Macmillan Company. $5.25.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22George and Martha, husband and wife, at home, day's end, fatigue immanent. They are reading newspapers but groping silently, each of them, for subject of conversation. From their reading of magazine articles, they have become aware that communication is one of humanity's deepest cravings, and they very much want to behave as humans do.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: ASAMA, Japan, Jan. 22 (AP)  Japanese Olympic hopefuls broke one women's and two men's records today in the national speedskating championships.

title: The World
description: Saint Matthew Island is a 22mile long, uninhabited crag rearing 1,500 feet out of the Bering Sea, 200 miles west of Alaska in the center of one of the world's richest halibut fishing grounds. The island is American territory and thus is covered by the United States regulation that prohibits fishing by foreigners within 12 miles of its Pacific shores. So when two Soviet ships were spotted last Monday evening transferring fish just nine and a half miles off the island, the United States Coast Guard icebreaker Storis tried to arrest the culprits.

title: Chess
description: THE Alekhine Memorial tournament, held recently in Moscow with a field that included current world champion Boris Spassky and three exworld champions (Tigran Petrosian, Mikhail Tal and Vassily Smyslov, all of the Soviet Union), resulted in triumph for relative outsiders Leonid Stein and Anatoli Karpov, also both Russians, who tied for first with 11 points out of 17.

title: Thames Barges Relics of a Briny Past
description: England is old and there's junk aplenty, but some of it is good junk, worth going to take a look at.

title: Iona Is Beaten, 8056
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Jan. 22The University of Massachusetts basketball team beat Iona tonight 8056, behind the scoring of Richie Vogeley, who hit for 16 points.

title: Loguercio Pilots Controlled Landing to Victory in Liberty Bell Feature
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 22Jockey Tony Loguercio reached his 24th birthday today and he gave himself a party at Liberty Bell Race Track that as he put it, I'll never forget.

title: KRISHNA IS VICTOR IN SUFFERN SHOW
description: SUFFERN, N. Y., Jan. 22Bob Cariddi, the husband, and Julie Cariddi, the wife, competed in the equine competition at the Catamorent Hunt Club today and when it was over they both were pleased.

title: U.S. Library in Rumania
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania Jan. 22 (AP)An American library has been officially opened In Bucharest by Frank Shakespeare, director of the United States Information Agency. The American library and a Rumanian library opened in December in New York were agreed to in 1969 by President Nixon and the Rumanian President, Nicolai Ceausescu.

title: PALESTINIAN CHIEFS DUE TO MEET IN CAIRO
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 22Thirty prominent Palestinian figures, headed by the guerrilla leader, Yasir Arafat, and including several dignitaries from the Israelioccupied west bank of the Jordan, are to hold what informed sources here describe as an important meeting in Cairo within the next two days.

title: Moscow Launches Its First Containership
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22The Soviet Union has announced the launching of its first containership in a continuing drive to expand its merchant fleet, already among the largest in the world.

title: Bermudian Gains Prize In Billfish Tournament
description: The 18th San Juan International billfish tournament in September closed with 240 anglers on 69 boats competing for honors. Howard Marirea of Warwick, Bermuda, won, capturing the individual grand championship aboard a new Striker 54. Marirea brought in three blue marlin, 4.12, 182 and 140pounders. He also won the International Club Trophy for the Bermuda International Gamefishing Club. The last four Caribbean sport of ishing tournaments Striker Aluminum Yachts of Fort Lauderdale has entered, a Striker has dieseled away with the main trophies.

title: Wives Also Serve Who Sitand Watch Frostbiting
description: The type of woman who enjoys frostbiting is the kind who could have coped with a covered wagon. And I've decided I no longer qualify, says a Larchmont Yacht Club wife, Dot Haigney.

title: The Nation
description: Harry Bridges was causing more anxiety in the White House last week than he ever had in the years when Presidents Roosevelt, Truman and Eisenhower were vainly trying to have him deported to Australia as a Communist. A Bridges order renewing last year's hundredday dock strike in West Coast ports lit a fuse that could blow up the Pay Board, battered guardian of the Nixon Administration's wagecontrol policy.

title: The Kinks: Rockers In Rebellion
description: THE KINKS are craftsmen in a musical genre that often relies on flash and force, literate chroniclers in a postliterate medium. They are also the most consistent band in rock and roll. Each of the Kinks's preceding twelve albums (thirteen if you count their Greatest Hits) is an absolutely integral piece of work. While other groups have dried up, broken down, spawned generations of sideman/superstar spinoffs, the Kinks roll on.

title: KNICKS GET HELP FROM THE BENCH
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22Red Holzman, coach, general manager and resident sage of the New York Knickerbockers, produced his usual pithy observation last night after his team had polished off the mighty Los Angeles Lakers, 104101.

title: Two Youths Show Faith In Flotation
description: They stood on the shore, cluster of spectators, and watched as the owner of the 16foot bass boat pulled the drain plug. Sea water started to flood the cockpit  some 360 gallons from the harbor at Hilton Head, S. C. The youthful skipper and his companion aboard the boat remained nonchalant. The craft was soon awash  but it resolutely refused to sink.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: How anyone gets in a position to write a review as unintelligent as Gene Thornton's review of the Robert AdamsEmmet Gowin photography exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art is a mystery. It's not the photographers who are lifeless, it's Thornton who is esthetically dead, completely oblivious to the deep lyrical strain in Gowin's work, and the irony in Adam's juxtaposition of urban desecration against the limitless, ultimately unextinguishable scale and expanse of western plains and mountains. Contrary to what Thornton says, the work of these two photographers is profoundly concerned with composition (indeed, Adams is almost classically formalistic) and centrally concerned with interpretation and comment, although in a Joycean way, via Flaubertthe artist in the background, paring his fingernails. Thornton, furthermore, quotes as Adams's view of photography exactly what Adams, in the gallery label, tells us not to do, and in damning Gowin's work as snapshots, Thornton is completely unaware of the quality of the people assembled for his photographs, and the lyrical way they are enfolded in the composition.

title: Evangelist Dug Rock Opera
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22 (AP) Oral Roberts, the evangelist, says that he saw a production of the rock opera Jesus Christ Superstar when it played in his hometown of Tulsa, Okla., and I dug about 70 per cent of it. I don't often dig that much of a church service, he told about 400 persons attending this week's ninth annual prayer breakfast sponsored by the Los Angeles Junior Chamber of Commerce.

title: Nordskog Elected By Marathon Racers
description: Bob Nordskog of Van Nuys, Calif., has been elected president of the Marathon Boat Racers Association.

title: Mrs. King Triumphs
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Jan. 22 (UPI) Mrs. Billie Jean King scored a 76, 75 victory over Helen Gourley of Australia in the quarterfinals of the $17,000 Long Beach women's pro tennis tournament last night.

title: Tice Fat FarmsOr, How To Come Home A Real Loser
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla. A trim Brooklyn psychiatrist and his shapely blond wife, whose diamond engagement ring was about the size of the radish she was eating, paused in the midst of their 300calorie dinner (filet mignon, string beans, Tab) at the PalmAire health spa here recently.

title: Carter Grandy Bride in South
description: NORFOLK, Va., Jan. 22In Christ and St. Luke's Episcopal Church here at noon today, Miss Carter Randolph Grandy was married to Glenn Allen Scott, an associate editor of The VirginianPilot. The Rev. Peyton Randolph Williams performed the ceremony in the presence of members of the immediate families.

title: Dance
description: THERE is something most unlikely about both New York City Ballet and American Ballet Theater giving seasons in New York together. There are really only sixseven if you count Stuttgartmajor classic ballet companies. These companies are major by tradition, reputation, acceptance, personnel and, of course, repertory. Many other classic ballet companies can please you. You may get just as good a ride in a Ford as in a Rolls Royce or Cadillac but there remains a subtle difference.

title: OWNERS BENEFITS IN ZONING DECRIED
description: A windfall benefit for owners of 15 tracts on Manhattan's East Side, proposed as part of citywide zoning changes, was challenged yesterday by an East Side community board chairman.

title: Gale Spergel Married
description: CEDARHURST, L. I., Jan. 22Miss Gale Aileen Spergel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Spergel of Lexington, Mass., was married here today to Ira Drukier, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Drukier of Rego Park, Queens. The bridegroom's cousin, Rabbi Sol Rothstein, performed the ceremony in the Sephardic Temple.

title: Susan Rita Cullman Is Fiancee Of John D. Sicher Jr., a Lawyer
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edgar M. Cullman of New York and Stamford, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Rita Cullman, to John D. Sicher Jr., son of Mr. Sicher of Dallas, Pa., and Mrs. Thomas Roberts of Shavertown, Pa.

title: PolishAmericans Still Favor Mtiskie
description: HAMTRAMCK, Mich., Jan 20 The first thing the visitor notices, as he drives along Caniff Street, are the signs: Krolicki Wholesale Meat, Piotrowski Insurance, Jaworski Sausage, Kisciuszko Club.

title: Ryun Beats Keino In Mile in 4:06.8
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22 Jim Ryun making his first start of the indoor season raced a strategic mile in the Sunkist Invitation track meet tonight to defeat Kip Keino of Kenya in 4 minutes 6.8 seconds.

title: Agreements to Guarantee Hiring Of Minorities Signed in Newark
description: NEWARK, Jan. 22  The Greater Newdrk Urban Coalition this week announced the signing of agreements with a number of government agencies and private companies to guarantee blacks and Puerto Ricans more work on the local construction Jobs.

title: My Search for Cool, Clear Water From the Seine to the Adriatic
description: T RSTENO, Yugoslavia  Normally, in my work as a reporter specializing in the environment, see the grimier side of civilizationsmoking factories, contaminated lakes, mountains of uncollected garbage. So when I go on vacation, what am confronted with? Too often, it seems, things are just about the samesmoke, contamination and garbage. Last year, however, while vacationing on the Adriatic coast of Yugoslavia, I managed to find a respite from the specter of pollution: a flower  bedecked villa sitting snug alongside some of the clearest and bluest water I have ever seen. For a few days here in the village of Trsteno near Dubrovnik, I escaped from the problems of the environment.

title: Roxy In His Head
description: MR. FETHERGILL was scarcely what you'd call a film buff unless you count it film watch old buffery to to movies on TV and doze off in the middle. (He invariably fell asleep when Humphrey Bogart was in terrible trouble at the hands of Sydney Greenstreet, and woke up two hours later, during a deodorant commercial.)

title: Mont Tremblant: Skiing the Laurentian Monster's Back
description: MONT TREMBLANT, Quebec There was a moment during an otherwise exhilarating week of skiing here in the Canadian Laurentians when I wondered bleakly why I hadn't chosen instead to visit one of those sunsoaked beaches in the Caribbean. This cowardly thought crept into my mind one morning shortly after I had slithered off a frigid chairlift at the summit of Mont Tremblant, the 3,750foot giant of the Laurentian range. It was 15 below, and the wind was screeching like a New York City subway car rounding a bad bend in the track. The air was blizzardwhite with snownot the fluffy kind that floats down from an overburdened cloud, but the icy sort that is whipped off the ground and torn from the boughs of fir trees by galevelocity wind.

title: Women's Lib Course Off
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 22 (UPI)Georgia State University has announced the cancellation of a planned noncredit course on women's liberation. A school spokesman said that no women had showed up  only two middleaged men.

title: SOLDIERS BATTLE RIOTERS IN ULSTER
description: ARMAGH, Northern Ireland, Jan. 22Rioting broke out here today after marchers protesting the internment of Roman Catholics suspected of terrorism were blocked by army barricades.

title: DOMESTIC MOVES ANGER EGYPTIANS
description: CAIRO, Jan. 22Egypt's new wareconomy Cabinet may lead to fewer automobiles and trips abroad for officials, less ostentatious office furnishings and a general belttightening of the Egyptian economybut the question is will it lead inevitably to war with Israel?

title: Sneakers Aid Feet On a 2Mile Tour
description: Parents visiting the boat show with children will be able to navigate the four floors of the Coliseum with ease if they make note of the special facilities and attractions for little skippers, who are admitted at half price, $1.50.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Jan. 22 (UPI)Archie Clark scored 24 points and Wes Unseld grabbed 24 rebounds tonight as the Baltimore Bullets held the Portland Trail Blazers to 15 points in the second quarter and rolled to a 11699 National Basketball Association victory.

title: Ballet: Three Classics
description: It is not just wine that has vintages  the theater has its good years and its bad years as well. Friday night at the New York City Center, the American Ballet Theater celebrated, unintentionally I suspect, one of British ballet's greatest years the season 193637. It was a time when British ballet was just emerging from the allpowerful shadow of the Ballets Russes.

title: Rich man, poor man, beggar man, thief, doctor, lawyermatch them!
description: There seems to be some consensus that the question of medical care will again be an issue in the coming political campaigns. Those who thought that the passage of Medicare in 1965 would still the growing discontent with American medicine failed to understand either the depth of the discontent, or the inadequacies of the present healthcare system

title: Hugo Moser. Art Collector And Dealer. Is Dead at 90
description: Hugo Moser, an art collector and former dealer, who helped dispose of the art collection of Kaiser Wilhelm 11 when the German emperor abdicated to Doom, the Netherlands, in 1918, died yesterday at his home, 120 Central Park South. His age was 90.

title: In the Heart of Paris A Tribute To the 200,000 Frenchmen Who Died in Nazi Camps
description: PARISOf the more than a million Americans who visit this city annually, it is safe to guess that 9 out of 10 see Notre Dame. Perhaps they get only a neckcraning glimpse from a passing taxi, but many take the complete tour, ending up high on the spires among the famous gargoyles. I am no statistician, yet I would bet that not 1 out of 10 of these same Americans ever visits another French landmark, only a twominute walk from Notre Dame, andin its own wayno less impressive.

title: Nixon Hails Competitive Ethic And World Amity of Olympics
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Jan. 22 President Nixon, vacationing on Grand Cay in the Bahamas today, wished the American Olympic team Godspeed and good fortune in the Winter Games that open Feb. 3 in Sapporo, Japan.

title: PEKING.
description: PRINCE SIHANOUK has moved. When he arrived in Peking in the spring of 1970, after his Cambodian regime was overthrown in a coup, the Chinese settled him in one of the guesthouses in the western suburbs reserved for foreigners of high rank. There, Monseigneurthe title by which he is called in conformity with French court etiquettelived for more than a year. Security is strict; his imposing but sternlooking residence was surrounded by a park that was enclosed by a high wall topped with electrified barbed wire and patrolled by security units of the People's Liberation Army carrying fixed bayonets.

title: Success Spurs Johnson
description: Johnson Motors, the world's largest manufacturer of outboard engines, is celebrating its 50th anniversary. The Johnsons never had it so good.

title: Stamps
description: FOUR famed British explorers of the Arctic and the Antarctic are honored postally in a series of stamps to be released in Britain on Feb. 16. The men are Sir James Clark Ross, Sir Martin Frobisher, Henry Hudson and Robert Falcon Scott. The stamps will be multicolored, produced by photogravure by Harrison and Sons Ltd., the British stamp printers, from designs by Marjorie Saynor, who also designed two stamps in the 1970 General Anniversaries series.

title: Television
description: THE voice on the phone was familiar. Hey, it bubbled, you really came through on Zoom. That much praise was really going out on a limb hut, as it turned out, the show really deserved it. Congratulations!

title: Child to Birminghams
description: LAKE BLUFF, Ill., Jan. 22 A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. John M. Birmingham Jr., formerly of Chatham, N. J., on Jan. 11 at the Lake Forest Hospital. Mrs. Birmingham is the former Miss Mary Lee Monroe of Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: If Not Timeless, It's At Least OpenEnded
description: IT has been nearly six years since a famous exhibition at the Jewish Museum, Primary Structures, confirmed Minimal sculpture as the premier avantgarde movement of the day and brought renown to a littleknown artist named Ronald Bladen. For it was Bladen's good fortune, on the occasion of this show, to produce an authentic masterpiece of the new art, a row of three freestanding, rakishly tilted, slabshaped volumes of painted plywood faced with aluminum  a monumental work that became the centerpiece and trademark of the exhibition (and a later version of which may now be found in the sculpture garden of the Museum of Modern Art).

title: Schenk Captures 2 European Titles In Speed Skating
description: DAVOS. Switzerland, Jan. 22 (UPI)  Cheered on by about 4,000 Dutchmen among the 5,000 spectators, Dutch speedy skaters dominated the opening day of the European men's championship today.

title: Clayton's Museum a Haven for Antique Boats
description: What's a shipyard museum doing in a village of some 2,000 population? Plenty! It's displaying old boats and nautical equipment, restoring and refurbishing long unused watercraft, serving as a repository and permanent registry for data about old boats and aiming to develop a source of appropriate material for exhibit.

title: A Spicy Cuisine for the Island
description: EAST SETAUKET, L. I.Poor, Emily Kwoh There she was, the owner of three of Manhattan's most successful restaurants, when she decided to try her luck with the suburban gourmet trade by opening a chain of Little Mandarins restaurants.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: The nation's garbagedisposed of at a cost of some $4.5billion a yearhas become a subject of increasing attention by public officials, concerned citizens and industry.

title: Astronauts Fly to Belgrade
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Jan. 22 (AP)The Apollo15 astronauts. Col. David R. Scott, Mai. Alfred M. Worden and Lieut. Col. James B. Irwin, arrived here by air from Warsaw today on a twoweek goodwill mission.

title: Editorial Cartoon 3  No Title
description: Editorial Cartoon 3  No Title

title: Moreno Gains Tennis Final
description: FREEPORT, Bahamas, Jan. 22 Jose Moreno of Spain upset secondseeded Ulrich Pinner of West Germany, 63, 62, today to move into the final of the Lucayan Towers junior tennis tournament against a fellow countryman, Jose Higueras. Higueras beat Bernie Mitton of South Africa, 62, 62.

title: Why Do Homosexual Playwrights Hide Their Homosexuality?
description: MY play Nightridc has, as its main character, a prominent playwright whose life has been spent concealing his homosexuality from the public. When the play opened several weeks ago. I was astounded by the swarm of criticism that was aimed at me because I had written it under a pen name, Lee Barton. Why, I was asked, in this age of freedom did I need to sign a false name? And, in signing a false name, was I any different from the character in my play, whose concealment of his homosexuality I so obviously disapproved?

title: Canisius Scores, 7370
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 22 (AP)Aaron Covington's layup in the final 32 seconds pushed Canisius to a 7370 victory over St. Bonaventure tonight.

title: CAIRO SAID TO SPURN U.S. EFFORT ON SUEZ
description: CAIRO, Jan. 22The Egyptian Government was reported today to have informed the United States that it would no longer go along with Washington's endeavors to achieve an agreement for a reopening of the Suez Canal as an interim arrangement between. Egypt and Israel.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In the extensive analyses in The Times of the President's forthcoming visit to Peking I have found no reference to the question whether the trip constitutes recognition by the United States of the Government of the People's Republic of China. There seems to be a tacit acceptance of the position that until the Administration says it intends to recognize the Peking Government nothing it does can be construed as recognition.

title: Beame Criticizes Use of Funds To Study Organized Crime Here
description: A planned special city study in which residents would be asked questions such as Do you have a local bookie? and What is your preception of organized crime in your neighborhood? was criticized yesterday by Controller Abraham D. Beame.

title: Propeller Big Factor In Outboard
description: On outboard boats, failure to match individual boat and motor combinations to correct propellers can reduce speed by more than 20 per cent and impede acceleration by as much as 66 per cent. These are the findings in tests recently conducted by Evinrude Motors. Milwaukee.

title: White  Water Canoeing Due for Boom
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md.If recognition by the International Olympic Committee is the mark of arrival among sports competitions, then 1972 will be the year in which whitewater canoeing and kayaking arrive.

title: Mrs. Hale Has Child
description: A daughter was born on Jan. 12 to Mr. and Mrs. Julian A. S. Hale of London in St. Mary's Hospital there. Mrs. Hale is the former Mary Kathleen Benet, daughter of Mrs. Mary Liles Bent of Cambridge, Mass., and James Benet of San Francisco. She and her husband are writers. The child has been named Laura Mary.

title: Packard Gives $7.5Million
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Jan. 22 (UPI)  Former Assistant Secretary of Defense David Packard has given $7.5million to Colorado College, a small, privately endowed college that Mr. Packard's parents attended. An announcement of the gift followed a special meeting of the board of trustees of the 98yearold school.

title: Souvanna Phouma Says More U.S. Help Isn't Needed Yet
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 22Despite the most serious North Vietnamese campaign of recent years in northern. Laos, the Premier, Prince Souvanna Phouma, said today that his Government would not ask the United States for more military aid unless the situation gets worse.

title: NICHOLS CAPTURES LEAD BY A STROKE
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Jan. 22Bobby Nichols shot a 67 today and took the lead by a stroke with 204 after the third round of the $150,000 Dean MartinTucson open. It was my greatest putting round since 1964 when I won the Professional Golfers Association championship, said Nichols.

title: DEMOCRATS ANGRY OVER SCHOOL BILL
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22The bill to extend the life of New York City's interim Board of Education for another year has run into trouble in the Senate from city Democrats who are still angry over the board's shortlived fiscal crisis last March.

title: Meanwhile, Back at Grenoble
description: GRENOBLE, France, Jan. 22Four years after the tenth Winter Olympic Games were held in this busy industrial area, there seems to be a general satisfaction over the effects of the classic in metropolitan Grenoble's development.

title: EYEGLASS LENSES WILL COST MORE
description: The 100 million Americans who wear prescription eyeglasses will be paying higher prices for their lenses this year because of a new Food and Drug Administration safety rule.

title: China Sees U.S. and Saigon Creating a No Man's Land
description: TOKYO. Jan. 22 (AP)China charged today that the United States and South Vietnam were forcing inhabitants of the northern provinces of South Vietnam to move to disguised concentration camps in the south.

title: Photography
description: PHOTOGRAPHY is suggested by the very name  Sharp  Focus Realismof the group show of painting and sculpture at the Sidney Janis gallery through Feb. 5. And so it should he. For most of the paintings are based on photographs, if not actually copied from them.

title: Bridal March 5 For Carol Boas, A Coast Lawyer
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22Maxwell S. Boas, dean of Western State University College of Law, and Mrs. Boas have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carol Linda Boas, to Jonathan Michael Goodson.

title: Voter Drive in Schools Ends
description: MINEOLA, L. I.The Nassau County Board of Elections will not send registrars to every high school and college in the county as it did last year following a deadlock between the Democratic and Republican members of the board.

title: Geometric mansion
description: A hefty budget, a splendid site deep in the woods, but blessed with a natural clearing and a pond  and an openminded client. Ideal conditions for an architect. Richard Meier, who designed this modern mansion, came up with a controlled and elegant geometric structure.

title: L.I. School Taxes Rise at Lower Rate
description: Following the pattern of recent years, school tax rates on Long Island have continued to rise, butperhaps as a reflection of the growing resistance to increasing taxesthe size of the increases this academic year was smaller than last year.

title: The Night People of Wall Street
description: When John Sikora and Benedict Hrapko chose banking as a career, they never Imagined they would serve on the evening patrol.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The pomp surrounding the Super Bowl activities might well have taken place in a country governed by a military juntathe Air Force Academy Choir, the U.S. Marine Corps Marching Band and Phantom jets flying overhead.

title: FieldEvents Sweep Helps Princeton Gain Meet Title
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 22Princeton's track team won eight of 14 events tonight, including all six field events, to capture a quadrangular meet and stretch its wonlost record to 42.

title: Architeeture
description: ON December 2, a tnajor new Concert and Congress Hall, called Finlandia Hall, designed by the Finnish architect, Alvar Aalto, opened in Helsinki. At the time, I had the pictures spread out on my desk and a well known danceanddramacritic colleague who had been through the trauma of the opening of the Kennedy Center with me happened to see and admire them. Where's that? he asked. In Finland, I replied. Oh, of course, he said, we don't build that kind of thing here.

title: Reader's Report
description: Galapagos is a tree house from which a lanky adolescent named Kip descends to practice indefatigable nonsense. Like turning his sister into a firefly. (Kip has already tried to become a firefly himself, on an experimental bicycle with fireflytype wings.) Earlier in the book, he rescues his girl friendlost in a swampby following the fireflies. Clearly, Kip has a thing about lightningbugs, but they shed only a dim glow on the intentions of his author.

title: Art Enters Pollution Battle
description: Harold Lehr is one New York artist who has placed his talents in the war against pollution. Concerned with the increasing problem of dirty water, for both boatmen and the ordinary citizen, as well as the decreasing amount of beauty on the waterfront, Lehr, a sculptor, has combined his art with an ecological function.

title: No Competition
description: George Meany's hold on his job would be secure even if he were not the cutting edge of the assault on the President and the Pay Board. Since the death of Walter P. Reuther and the downfall of Jimmy Hoffa, there has been no one on the labor scene who would even contemplate challenging Meany.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The spunkiest character in Washington these days is the Secretary of the Treasury, John 13. Connally. You may not like his politics or his economics, and the other financial ministers of the world clearly don't like his rough tactics, butt if you really want to understand the state of the nation, Mr. Connally is a better source than most.

title: Richey Overcomes Graebner in Final of London Tennis, 75, 67, 75, 60
description: LONDON, Jan. 22 (AP)Cliff Richey beat Clark Graebner, 7.5, 67, 75, 60, tonight in the allAmerican final of the $33,400 Rothman's international indoor tennis tournament.

title: Even Half a Boatman Counts
description: A recent survey shows there are almost 9 million pleasure boats in this country, which means there was boat for every 4% persons who took part in boating in 1971.

title: PANAMA OPENS DRIVE ON ART SMUGGLERS
description: PANAMA CITY, Jan. 22Panama has launched an effort to keep the relics of ancien Indian civilizations out of the hands of art smugglers.

title: TriHull Bowriders Here
description: Three new fiberglass runabouts brought to the show by Browning narine are trihull bowriders. Two other new models are trim runabouts with the company's flaredV hull design.

title: Violence Ebbs but Leaders Cite Lack of Trust
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 22A recently formed group of black leaders, called the African National Council, today repeated its opposition to the terms of a proposed settlement of the white Rhodesian Government's rebellion against Britain and said that it was impossible to trust the Government of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith.

title: Conners Gains Final
description: ROANOKE, Va., Jan. 22 (AP) Topseeded Jimmy Conners of Los Angeles and Vladimer Zednik of Czechoslovakia advanced to the final of the first Roanoke international tennis tournament today.

title: Announcements 5000
description: ALBANOMr. and Mrs. Santo J. Albano (nee Judith L. Baron) loyfully announce the birth of their son Aaron Joseph on January 1, 1972.

title: Torre of Cards Honored at Corum Dinner
description: Several outstanding athletes were honored by the B'nai B'rith last night at that organization's 21st annual Bill Corum Memorial Dinner at the Hotel Roosevelt.

title: The Missing Lady of Queens
description: ALBANY  There's a sevenfoottall lady missing from the Winfield section of Woodside, Queens, and the residents there want her back.

title: Flu Epidemic in Copenhagen
description: GENEVA, Jan. 22 (Reuters)Influenza has reached epidemic levels in Copenhagen and its suburbs, the World Health Organization said in Geneva. It said there were flu epidemics also in some areas of the Soviet Union.

title: Donald M. Markle Dead at 48; Headed Newark Audiology Unit
description: ORANGE, N.J., Jan. 22Donald M. Markle, director of the audiology department of the Mount Carmel Guild in Newark and assistant professor of education and director of the audiology department at Seton Hall University, died yesterday of cancer in St. Barnabas Hospital in Livingston. He was 48 years old and lived here at 367 Carteret Place.

title: Rich man, poor man, beggar man, thief, doctor, lawyermatch them!
description: Americans seem intrigued by the criminal trial. Novels, dramas, musicals, television shows and other media have exploited its builtin drama with remarkable frequency and even more remarkable success. These two books, one by F. Lee Bailey and the other by Sandor Frankel describe actual criminal cases, some famous, some not.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The reported statement (Jan. 7) of Allied Chemical chairman John T. Connor that passage and implementation of Senator Muskie's waterquality bill would damage the economy was so lacking in perspective and devoid of concern for his own potential leadership in the reduction of cleanup costs that I do not see how he could fully support the national goal of clean, healthy environment.

title: Who Killed the 10 Drug Pushers?
description: Ten unsolved murders and numerous shootings of persons suspected of narcotics distribution here in the last 18 months have produced two theories on the cause.

title: CANADIANS REACH AIR STRIKE ACCORD
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 22Negotiators reached agreement today, on a wage settlement that if ratified by striking air traffic controllers, would get Canada's grounded commercial airplanes back into the sky by Wednesday.

title: Area Retailers Protest PricePosting Charges by U.S.
description: Three retailers cited in Federal Court suits here yesterday for allegedly failing to post prices as required under the Nixon Administration's economic stabilization program promptly disputed the charges, A fourth named in a similar suit had no spokesman available for comment.

title: Baroness de Bilderling Wed Here
description: Baroness Mary Elizabeth de Bilderling of Paris and Nassau, the Bahamas, widow of Baron Alexandre de Bilderling, was married in the Brick Presbyterian Church here yesterday to H. Bartow Farr Jr., vice president and general counsel of the I.B.M. World Trade Corporation. The Rev. Darrell Udd performed the ceremony in the presence of members of the immediate families.

title: Big Six Mayors to Ask Albany For More Cash Than It Allotted
description: The state's Big Six mayors said yesterday they would try to get more money from Albany than the amounts built into the fiscal package that Governor Rockefeller extracted from the special legislative session.

title: 20 WOMEN OCCUPY STRIP MINING SITE
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 21Jim Branscomb has some bruises on his face, and his car has some damage, too. But he is satisfied just to be away from the country road where he and three other men were allegedly pistolwhipped late last night.

title: SternWheeler and a Gator
description: SARASOTA, Fla.  When I say three, everybody shout Oscar, said Walter G. Fox Jr. of Sarasota, the skipperlecturer for Gator Gal. A 40foot outboardpowered imitation of an old stern wheeler, Gator Gal plies Myakka Lake in nearby Myakka River State Park on daily nature tours. O.K.? One, two, three, OSCAR!

title: Stamps
description: UNITED NATIONS souvenir cards, similar in style to those released by the United States Postal Service and the Bureau of Engraving and Printing, are to appear this year. The first of the series will be released April 7 to coincide with the issuance of the World Health Day stamp. The cards will be 6 by 8 inches.

title: An Oasis Of Theater Off, Off, Off Broadway
description: In the newsroom of this great newspaper there is a large area occupied solely by critics and reporters of the arts. It is a place where words like milieu and forte are frequently used. We call it Culture Gulch.

title: CITY PLAN ARGUED BY BROOKLYNITES
description: Scolding, denouncing, exhorting and cajoling, residents of the Bush TerminalSunset Park district along the Brooklyn waterfront took strong exception Tuesday night to the assertion in the city's proposed master plan that the district is expected to remain essentially stable in the near future.

title: 4 Agencies Open Inquiry Into Manila Airport Fire
description: MANILA, Jan. 22 (UPI)Four Government agencies, checking particularly into the possibility of arson, began coordinated investigation into the fire that destroyed the Manila International Airport terminal building early today.

title: The Nation
description: SUNKEN MEADOW, L.I.There are hundreds of square miles on the floor of New York harbor and Long Island Sound where nothing lives  where a black gelatinous mass yards deep has killed off even the bacteria which help eliminate more traditional pollution.

title: Russia's Behavior and the Mideast
description: TEL AVIVRecent events have only served to emphasize the ambivalent attitude of the Soviet Union toward world affairs.

title: Wow, Has Little Ricky Changed!
description: DID you see him in the lobby this morning? I hear the hotel clerk ask a coworker. Wow, has he changed! With that long hair and everything, he looks like Jesus Christ. Upstairs in his gold and white suite, Rick Nelson seems only slightly ruffled when I repeat the clerk's remarks. Sure, he says with a smile, a lot of people expect me to look the same old way. Some of them actually resent the fact that I've grown up. They still think of me as Ozzie and Harriet's Little Rickybut that was over 15 years ago.

title: Safeguarding Alaska's Future
description: For the rest of America, Alaska has projected a succession of different images. For many years after it was purchased from Russia, it was regarded as Seward's Icebox, a vast, frozen, useless expanse dotted here and there by Eskimo villages. Beginning with the Klondike gold rush and increasingly in recent decades, it has been perceived as an immensely valuable storehouse of minerals and timber. The recent discovery oil on Alaska's North Slope has intensified this glittering economic image.

title: New Zealand Rowing a Success Story
description: A broadchested 43yearold named Russell (Rusty) Robertson is on a tour of the United States explaining why New Zealand, whose 2million population ranks with Israel's, has become dominant in world rowing circles.

title: Iceboat Racers Set for Big Weekend
description: In the kind of weather that finds most metropolitan area residents huddled close to their oil burners or fireplaces or vigorously complaining to their landlords about the lack of heat, the largest number of individuals in the history of iceboat racing is ready to gather at Red Bank, N.J., for the National Sweepstakes Iceboat Regatta.

title: Sports Week
description: WednesdayHofstra at St. John's, Delaware at Rutgers.

title: UNICEF Planning Relief for Bengalis, Its Biggest Project
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 22The United Nations Children's Fund is preparing a relief and rehabilitation program for East Pakistan that will be the largest aid operation in the agency's 25year history.

title: A Quiet Man Helped Defeat The Lindenwood Project
description: Forest Hills has received all the attention, but it was in Lindenwood where the neighbors won And Walter Ward takes some of the creditquietly, for although an advertising man, he is modest about billboarding his own achievements.

title: Golfers Brave Wintry Chills
description: From Brooklyn to Bethpage, the annual winter golf campaign is in full swing. The faces and places are the same, the groans and cheers are unchanged, but the body English that is so apparent in July is concealed by layers of thermal underwear, sweaters and jackets.

title: Child to Mrs. Noonan Jr.
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Jan. 22 A daughter was born on Jan. 5 to Mr. and Mrs. John T. Noonan Jr. at Children's Hospital in San Francisco. Mrs. Noonan is the former Mary Lee Bennett of Weston, Mass. Her husband is a professor of law at the University of California here. The child, the couple's third, has been named Susanna Bath.

title: Boy, 11, Back From Kenya With Big One
description: The biggest fish story ever heard by students at St. Bernard's School on East 98th Street is being told by 11yearold Kenneth Sellin, who not only caught a 204pound Nile perch on his Christmas vacation, but also has the evidence to prove it.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Max Frankel's Dec. 18 article on U.S.Common Market relations truly but sadly reflects a colossal  misunderstanding.

title: Hamilton 112100 Victor
description: CLINTON, N. Y., Jan. 22 (AP) Hamilton won its first college basketball game of the season today, 112100, over Norwich. The starting five for Hamilton are all freshmen. The team now has a 110 wonlost record.

title: Theater in the Home: A Nice Change From the Usual Parties
description: The Mortimer Levitts have been married 22 years, entertained thousands of guests in their fivestory townhouse and, according to Mr. Levitt, struck out only once. But it wasn't Friday evening.

title: The World
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia  The scene was the tribal village of Goromonzi. There, one day last week, members of the British Commission on Rhodesian Opinion held hearings on public response to the terms of a proposed settlement of Rhodesia's 1965 rebellion against Britain. Also present was a group of African militants, who regard the proposalwith its relegation of black majority rule to some remote future  as a British sellout to the Rhodesian white minority.

title: Books:
description: Now that the economy is on the upswing, so are the number of job seekers in all probability. Here is the latest offering in the howtolandajob sweepstakes.

title: Donohue Qualifies 3d for Winston Western 500, His First Stock Car Race
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif., Jan. 22 The new boy on the block generally is easy to pick on and put down, but Mark Donohue is something elsehe has everyone worried.

title: Sugar Price Skyrockets
description: If commodity price charts were fever thermometers, the almost vertical rise in sugar prices in the four recent weeks would spell disaster. As a matter of fact, it indicates that the world is thriving.

title: Site Dispute Dims Hopes for 76 Philadelphia Exposition
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 22 For more than a year, many Philadelphians have been saying that only a miracle could, save the 1976 Bicentennial Exposition. Today, there is a general feeling that it is too late for the passing of a miracle and that, even if the city's warring elements can agree on a site within the next few weeks, the fair would emerge as one of the worst flops in the history of show business, a disaster comparable to the 1926 Sesquicentennial Exposition.

title: Marines Land on Maine Beach
description: GEORGETOWN, Me., Jan. 22 Guard it well and it will be the source of all you anticipate, admonished Walter E. Reid, the philanthropist, in 1950 when he donated the second tract of land to complete the area for Reid State Park.

title: New School Designates Thomas Chair Occupant
description: Dr. Robert L. Heilbroner, the economist, social analyst and author, will be the first occupant of the Norman Thomas Chair at the New School for Social Research's Graduate Faculty of Political and Social Science, Dr. John R. Everet, presiden of the school, announced yeserday.

title: FRANCIS PEAK, 72, PROFESSOR OF LAW
description: Francis Deak, professor of international law at Rutgers University, a former Foreign Service officer and an author, died Friday in New York Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived in Cherry Hill, N. J.

title: REESE AND POOR GAIN IN SQUASH RACQUETS
description: RYE, N. Y., Jan. 22John R. Reese of New York, the national champion, playing out of Seventh Regiment Armory, led the way today into the semifinal round of the Apawamis Club's 30th annual invitationo squash racquets tournament.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: Prof. Sula Benet's article, Why They Live to Be 100, or Even Older, in Abkhasia (Dec. 26), resembles others describing Soviet centenarians in that it omits mention of proof of age. A birth certificate is cited only once, for example, when it challenged the belief of another Abkhasian regarding his age.

title: Walkout at C.B.C.
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 22 (Reuters) Technicians of the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation walked off their jobs in five cities today.

title: Jan Golding Wed to F. A. Cushing
description: The marriage of Jan Golding to Frederick Ames Cushing, who is with the Paris office of Lehman Brothers, the investment hankers, took place here yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read of the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. William Rose, stepfather and mother of the bride.

title: Photography
description: THE Metropolitan Camera Club Council will hold its 1972 Photo Jamboree at the High School of Fashion Industries, 225 West 24th Street, on Saturday. The program will start with a print competition at 9 A.M. and will continue until 5 P.M. with a number of wellknown photographers as speakers. There will be a lunch break at 11:50 A.M. and door prizes will be given away just before this. General admission will be $4, students $2 (only at the door). For more information contact the Council at 149 Church Street, New York, N.Y. 10007, or call (212) 2272450.

title: Small Pleasures of Boating Easily Overlooked
description: There are happy boatmen and there are unhappy boatmen.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:  Comments like: He's away from his desk, He's in conference, He's tied up for the day, and more recently, Call after Christmas, or Call after the first of the year seem inane. What now? Call after Valentine's Day?

title: Growing Pains on Ice
description: A remarkably busy halfseason of hockey will calm down briefly next Tuesday for the National Hockey League's annual AllStar EastWest Game at Bloomington, Minn.

title: Young Workers Disrupt Key G. M. Plant
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, Jan. 22 Production on the world's fastest assembly line, on which the General Motors Corporation has pinned its hopes of being able to meet foreign competition, has been seriously disrupted by mostly young workers who say they are being asked to work too hard and too fast to be able to turn out quality automobiles.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  There is now a good chance that at least one serious candidate for the presidency this year, Hubert Humphrey, will endorse in principle the strongly anti  import, antiinterna tionalinvestment bill in Congress backed by organized labor.

title: Liquor Store Owner Slain In Exchange With Gunmen
description: A liquor store owner was shot and killed and a woman passerby was wounded in an exchange of gunfire last night between the store owner and two alleged holdup men on Ninth Avenue near 20th Street.

title: Bushwick Residents Assail Planning
description: John Zuccotti, one of the Commissioners, said the meeting was designed to give the people of Bushwick and Ridgewood a chance to give their views in order to help revise the plan.

title: Children were to be seen, to be heard and to be helped
description: It was a small group, made up mostly of women. They met regularly and talked for hoursvery often late into the night. The ideas they had were radical, for the time, which was the 1920's, and even more so for the place, which was Vienna. What gave these meetings their impetus, their pioneer spirit, was an entirely new way of thinking  theoretically and practicallyabout the mental life of the child.

title: Suns Beat Lakers, 116102
description: Phoenix, Ariz., Jan. 22 (AP) Dick Van Arsdale paced the Phoenix Suns to a 116102 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers tonight.

title: Sharif Khan, Niederhoffer In Squash Racquets Final
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 22Sharif Khan of Toronto, the topranked player, advanced to the final round of the North American open squash racquets championship today by defeating Larry Terrel of Philadelphia, 1415, 159, 159, 153, at Pendennis Club. Sharif Khan is the defending champion.

title: Ruffles and taffeta
description: From out of the past, crisp paper taffeta lavished with ruffles is rustling prettily into the present. It evokes a nostalgia for white kid gloves and nosegay corsages. Romantic and demure, these taffetas are for those women who, perhaps only for an evening, want to leave the world of Future Shock. Little Women pinafores give even the most sophisticated an innocent look. The black and white acetate taffeta has a low scoop neck outlined with a bouncy ruffle echoed by the dustruffle hem. $56. Cherry red and white gingham pinafore in acetate taffeta brings back dancing school days. $85. Both of these dresses were designed by Ann Fogarty. Third floor at Lord & Taylor

title: Hellickson on Mat Team
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 22(AP) Russ Hellickson, an assistant coach at the University of Wisconsin has been named to the United States wrestling team that will compete in the Soviet Union next month. The team will leave Feb. 1 under sponsorship of the United States Wrestling Federation.

title: The Nation
description: The short, happy life of the newlook Army recruit ended last week as the military performed an abrupt aboutface.

title: RADICAL PROFESSOR OUSTED AT STANFORD
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 22Stanford University's board of trustees made final today the dismissal of a professor accused by the university of inciting students to disrupt the campus a year ago.

title: Marquette Wins 14th in Row, 7061, Turning Back DePaul Rally in 2d Half
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 22 (AP)  Secondranked Marquette mounted a 17point lead four minutes into the second half, then held off a furious DePaul comeback led by Nick Hirtzig tonight for its 14th victory without a loss, 7061.

title: Susan Klingensmith Plans Bridal
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Jan. 22  Dr. and Mrs. Walter Cameron Klingensmith have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Louise Klingensmith, to David McKnight Connard. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Frank L. Connard of New Hope. A wedding in June is planned.

title: An oblique autobiography and a lesson on how to handle the family records
description: After tea, wrote Mrs. Isherwood in her diary, C dictated a story called The Adventures of Mummy and Daddy, chiefly about himself! The date was November, 1909, and C was 5. Now, more than 60 years later, Christopher once again tackles the daring subject. Putting one's own close relations into an open book is a challenging task, for however lovingly or hatefully escaped from, family intimacy is often of the time one is scarcely able to think about, let alone coolly arrange in chapters. Isherwood's simple and most successful device for keeping the subject at a workable distance is to write about Frank, Kathleen, Emily and Christopher, instead of father, mother, granny and me.

title: 4 PROPOSALS AIM AT HOSPITAL COST
description: Four proposals for holding down soaring hospital costs are being circulated by the city's Health Services Administration, which said yesterday that it would ask the Legislature next month to enact a uniform reporting system on hospital finances as a first step.

title: Sports of The Times
description: He came out of the TV studio on West 67th Street with his two attorneys and a few friends. Among them was a stranger, a pretty brunette in a green coat with white boots. Several steps behind, she followed Joe Namath into the Des Artistes bar. Amazing, he was whispering. In the mail this morning, I got a letter from this girl with two pictures of her. She had stood off to the side of the studio as the quarterback videotaped an analysis with Howard Cosell of the Super Bowl game for the Wide World of Sports show that appeared yesterday. Now she was in the otherwise empty bar, perched on a stool between Namath and Cosell as the others glanced at her.

title: Books:
description: FROM PEASANT TO FARMER. A REVOLUTIONARY STRATEGY FOR DEVELOPMENT. By Raanan Weitz. 292 pages. Columbia University Press.

title: Curfew Ordered in Istanbul In Search for Terrorists
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Jan. 22 (Reuters)Troops moved into Istanbul today to search for leftist terrorists during a 15hour curfew ordered by the Government from 3 A.M. to 6 P.M. tomorrow.

title: The Nation
description: ALBANY  Everybody knew they didn't like each other. But over the Years, they poohpoohed the idea. It was, they insisted, an invention of the press. Yet even the demurrers were often accompanied by little winks and smiles  and the veiled and notsoveiled taunts and gibes remained a staple of the political scene.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In my estimation, the New Hampshire Democratic primary is no longer an important one. There are too many candidates in the field. This tends to reduce the number of votes the frontrunner needs to make a good showing.

title: DR. CAREY CRONEIS OF RICE UNIVERSITY
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 22 (UPI)Dr. Carey Croneis, who retired last August as chancellor of Rice University, died today at Methodist Hospital. He was 70 yeah old.

title: Squires Triumph, 121117
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 22 (AP)Charlie Scott put in two layups in the last nine seconds of overtime tonight to give the Virginia Squires a 121117 triumph over the Floridians.

title: Bruins 5Goal Burst Halts Canadien 21Game Unbeaten Streak at Home, 85
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 22 (UPI) Fred Stanfield scored twice as the Boston Bruins collected five goals in the second period tonight to whip the Canadiens, 85, and end Montreal's 21game undefeated streak at the Forum.

title: Helene Brent Married Here
description: In St. James Episcopal Church yesterday afternoon, Miss Helene Brent became the bride of Michael Bogue Jeffers. The Rev. John Corn performed the ceremony and the Rev. Almus Thorp assisted.

title: U.C.L.A. CONQUERS SANTA CLARA, 9257
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22 (AP) University of California, Los Angeles, shattered Santa Clara's offense with a fullcourt press that held the Broncos to 13 points in the first half, and breezed to a 9257 victory last night.

title: Navy Secretly Testifies It Wants To House Dependents in Greece
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr., Chief of Naval Operations, told a secret session of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee yesterday that the Navy wanted homeport facilities in Greece.

title: Lindsay Gets Friendly Crowds On Visit to Four Florida Towns
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Jan. 22 Mayor Lindsay swept through four Florida towns today, wading into friendly crowds to shake hands, sign autographs and draw on his record in New York to promote himself as contender for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: They WANT to Lose Their Homes
description: Unlike those who have organized in opposition when told that their houses were in the path of a proposed highway, a dozen homeowners in the southern part of Queens who face that situation are eager to have their homes condemned.

title: New Turbine ChrisCraft a Purring Tiger
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla.The 55foot cruiser had just cleared the inlet and moved into the open water. The mod, moustached driver opened the throttle and the boat surged ahead, spewing its filmy wake.

title: 2 L.I. MEN CHARGED IN GIRL'S KIDNAPPING
description: Two Long Island men were arrested in Hempstead early yesterday and charged with the kidnapping of a 17yearold Brooklyn girl who was forced into a car, drugged and sexually abused, and driven around the city for five hours before escaping, the police reported.

title: Miss Finch Is Married
description: THOMASVILLE, N. C., Jan. 22Miss Esther Sharon Finch and Jay Henry Van Vechten 2d, who are with the Miami office of Lando, Inc., an advertising and public relations concern, were married in the Memorial United Methodist Church here today. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Philip Shore, assisted by the Rev. Dr. Tom Haggai. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Browne Finch. Mr. Van Vechten is a son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Henry Van Vechten of Boca Raton, Fla.

title: Guild Hall Grant
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I.Guild Hall has been awarded a grant of $26,000 from the New York State Council on the Arts. The funds will be used to support its visual and performing arts programs including the MultiMedia TeenAge Theater Workshop, and a music education program for students in local schools.

title: Coach Nolan of N.F.C.Is Wary Of Runbacks in Pro Bowl Today
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22The National Football League allstars in tomorrow's 22d annual Pro Bowl abound with classy passers and 1,000yard groundgainers.

title: West Virginia Campaigns Aim at Coal
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Jan. 22Coal and politics have been allies for so long in West Virginia that it takes an extraordinary event to make their marriage noteworthy.

title: Sallie Mullins Plans Nuptials
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Jan. 22Mr. and Mrs. Lev DeWitt Mullins Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sallie Ann Mullins, to Guy Bryan Thompson, son of Dr. and Mrs. Frederick Roeck Thompson of New York and East Hampton, L. T.

title: The Kid
description: John Seelye's The Kid is a short Western novel unlike any other you are likely to readalthough, from the title on, there is no sign of apostasy from the genre. It opens thus:

title: Brooklyn Groups Rally Behind a Project
description: Feuding elements in the Ocean HillBrownsville community in Brooklyn rallied last week behind a $200million redevelopment proposal designed to place new schools, housing and industry throughout the impoverished area.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: GENE THORNTON'S review of the Paul Strand retrospective is a disservice to the work of a great photographer. It demeans his contribution to photography and it will confuse those readers who look to you for critical guidance in the area of photography as a fine art.

title: Report Airfield Falls
description: VIENTIANE, Jan. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)The airfield and military post of Mouong Phou, 28 miles southeast of the key road junction at Phou Khoun, fell to North Vietnamese and other Communist forces today, military sources reported here.

title: Rink Teams Breaking New Ice For Those Who Skate for Fun
description: For the last two days, rink teams from New York, Connecticut, Alabama. Illinois, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Tennessee and Kansas have been competing in recreational team skatingthe new in thing on iceat Lake Placid's Olympic Arena.

title: Rare Special Canoe An Exhibit at Mystic
description: Off Marblehead. Mass., is an island of jagged rocks called the Dry Breakers. No ordinary boat dares approach it so great are the hazards of swirling, foaming waters and undertow in and around that great mass of rocks.

title: Oil Refinery for Qatar
description: DOHA, Qatar, Jan. 22 (Reuters)The Qatar National Oil Distributing Company in this Persian Gulf sheikdom and the American McDormat Company have signed an agreement to establish a $7million oil refinery with a daily capacity of 6,000 barrels, informed sources said this week.

title: Illinois Explosion Injures 175 And Damages 868 Structures
description: EAST ST. LOUIS, Ill., Jan. 22 (AP)A railroad tank car containing 30,000 gallons of liquid petroleum gas exploded today, shattering windows eight miles away and sending more than 175 persons to hospitals. City officials estimated the damage at $7.5million.

title: Sailwing Accents Unusual
description: One of the most advanced racing sailboats in the world will not be competing against the Australians next month. Reason? Its unique mast collapsed in trials in Long Island Sound near Rowayton, Conn. So it's back to the drawing boards for the Patient Lady II.

title: Jane A. Williamson, a Teacher, Is Fiancee of John Badman Jr.
description: RIVERSIDE, Conn., Jan. 22 Mr. and Mrs. James Williamson have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jane Ann Williamson, to John Badman Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Badman.

title: 725 TOURING PARIS WITH ART DEALER
description: PARIS, Jan. 22Reese Palley, an American art dealer who is wealthy and flamboyant by his own admission, is shepherding 725 of his friends and customers around Paris this weekend in what he calls a nice way of marketing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Article 3  No Title
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 22 (UPI) The Cincinnati Royals took over third place from Cleveland in the Central Division of the N.B.A. tonight by handing the Cavaliers their 10th straight loss, 11396.

title: Senate Rights Bloc May Founder on School Busing Issue
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 22The civil rights coalition in the Senate  that group of Northern Democrats and moderate Republicans that, for a decade, has formed a majority on nearly every major piece of civil rights legislation  is in danger of collapse this year on the issue of school busing.

title: Education
description: The idea, of merging the City University of New York (C.U.N.Y.) and the State University of New York (S.U.N.Y.) has been kicking around for nearly a decade. It has regularly surfaced at budget time, when the city presses for more state financing and Albany says is already paying enough.

title: In the Matter Of H. Bruce Franklin
description: HBRUCE FRANKLIN is not only a scholarly authority on Herman Melville but also a member of the central committee of an armed revolutionary organization called Venceremos, a militant who keeps a shotgun handy to the front door of his house, and an unrepentant MarxistLeninistMaoist. He is, furthermore, rumored to have committed various politically inspired acts of violence, to have trained MexicanAmericans in guerrilla warfare in the hills above Palo Alto and to have supplied the Black Panthers with explosives. (He has denied these latter allegations, and no proof has been forthcoming from his accusers.)

title: STARS DEFEATED BY PACERS 119113
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 22 (AP) The Indiana Pacers withstood a oneman show by Utah's Willie Wise in the fourth period tonight to post a 119113 victory in an American Basketball Association game.

title: The Breeding Farm: First Step To the RacesOr Obscurity
description: OCALA, Fla.During breakfast, a sudden drumming of muffled hoofbeats ruptured the earlymorning stillness at Tartan Farm.

title: Fun of Boating: Something Exotic to Fret About
description: Hypnotized by the boat show last year, we bought a fiberglass cruiser and sold our wooden one. Readjustment has been hard. Not to the new boat, although the kids cried when the dealer's man drove the old boat away. What I have found hardest is the sudden withdrawal of my favorite woodtype anxieties.

title: UNESCO SUSPENDS TIE TO 42 GROUPS
description: GENEVA, Jan. 22  The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization has broken off contacts with the International Chamber of Commerce, Rotary International, and other international organizations that have branches, affiliates or operations in South Africa, Rhodesia and the Portuguese overseas territories in Africa.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Is there space to thank Frank Giordano for his beautiful tribute to Dorothy Greener?

title: Gromyko Welcomed by Fukuda
description: TOKYO, Sunday, Jan. 23 (UPI) Foreign Minister Gromyko arrived in Tokyo today and was greeted by Foreign Minister Fukuda and other Japanese Government officials. Soviet Ambassador Oleg A. Troyanovsky was also at the airport.

title: Nancy Guardino Engaged to Paul Safer
description: OGDEN, Utah, Jan. 22The engagement of Miss Nancy Lee Guardino to Paul Kremen Safer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Safer of Jamaica Estates, Queens, New York, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Peter Guardino of Ogden, formerly of Charnbersburg, Pa.

title: WALL STREET
description: Word from behind the closed doors of the paneled conference chamber on the sixth floor at the Big Board Thursday indicated that the august governors of finance were holding their stormiest session in recent memory.

title: The World
description: In a quadruplering ceremony at the Palais d'Egmont in Brussels yesterday, the Six became Ten as Britain, Ireland, Norway and Denmark joined the European Common Market. But to many outsiders  and even members of their own families  the multiple marriage still looked as controversial and unstable as a Scandinavian stor familje, where a group of young men and women set up housekeeping together without legal or religious benediction.

title: Movies
description: A TELEGRAM signed God is taped to the wall of a Howard Johnson motel room in this seedy city of Miss America, and it congratulates the recipient, Ellen Burstyn, on her sensational performance in The Last Picture Show. God concludes his message by elevating the 39yearold angelfaced actress to sainthood.

title: For the strangers came and tried to teach us their way
description: THE was the most relaxed person among the 200 people in the small ballroom of Bal Harbour's marshmallowandgold Americana Hotel, an outsized leprechaun in electric blue sports jacket and flared, doubleknit slacks. He grabbed the mike in front of the dance orchestra as the waiters poured the last of the dinner coffee, and said: We're going to have an amateur night of sorts. I'll start it off. His strong Irish baritone launched into Galway Bay, and the audience of unionists and their wives detected defiance in the lilt as he belted out the verse that goes:

title: Language Clue To Landlubbers: Better Watch It
description: If you want to appear knowledgeable when you go aboard one of those gorgeous yachts at the boat show, watch your language. Certain words are a dead giveaway and tell the world you're a landlubber. Be sure not to say floor, bathroom, kitchen, rope, right, left, front, back, up or down.

title: Losing With Distinction Must Involve In genious Planning
description: Innumerable hooks and articles have been written on the subject of winning strategy and tactics in sailboat racing, But, so far as is known, nothing has been written on how to lose.

title: Kentucky Chief for Muskie
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Jan. 22 (AP)Gov. Wendell Ford of Kentucky endorsed Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine today for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Fordham Tops Princeton, 7975
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 22Fordham kept building and losing leads, but just managed to hold on at the end to gain a thrilling and unexpected 7975 victory over Princeton today before 5,600 persons in Jadwin Gymnasium.

title: Search for Water Divides 2 Counties on Long Island
description: Long Island, which has had one of the nation's best water supplies drawn solely from rain trapped in its own porous ground, is beginning to dry up.

title: 2 Picture oats Tell Tale of Social Change
description: Though the 16foot Noble Cat and the 316foot fourmasted bark, Sea Cloud, span a technological and social revolution in yachting, the little catamaran Is related to the big ship in strange ways through the eye behind the cam era.

title: Rosalind Weil Is Betrothed
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Jan. 22Mr. and Mrs. Robert Shoenhof Well have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Rosalind Frances Weil, to Daniel Harry Markstein 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Markstein Jr. of Birmingham. The wedding is planned for March 18.

title: Muskie Is Top Choice of Democrats for the First Time
description: For the first time, Senator Edmund S. Muskie has become the top choice of Democratic voters for the Presidential nomination, the Gallup Poll said yesterday.

title: Bcwie Victor Pays $11.80
description: BOWIE, Md., Jan. 22On a card where no factor seemed to be the typical pastperformance comment, Misty Plum won the $23,300 Virginia Belle Stakes today at fogshrouded Bowie Race Course.

title: 8 D.C. POLICEMEN FACE INDICTMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22Eight vice squad policemen, including a lieutenant, were indicted here yesterday for conspiracy and for lodging false vice charges against five men and three women last year and for perjury while testifying under oath at the suspects trials.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR: Part of the job of the G.O.'s, or gentils organisateurs, at Club Mediterranee is to add to the ambience, through playful antics, skits, etc. It is regrettable that the author, Grace Lichtenstein, picked an extreme example (an incident with a sailboat) to mention the antics of the G.O.'s. A stay in a Club Med is a total vacation. The article passed over too lightly some of the great things, like the food and entertainment. (I was a G.O. at the Korba village in Tunisia last summer.)

title: BENGALI REBELS TO TURN IN ARMS
description: TANGAIL, Pakistan, Jan. 22 The most successful guerrilla army in East Pakistan during the struggle against West Pakistan was in a state of feverish preparation today to disband and turn its arms over to the Government.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR: Fortunately, we were able to get tickets for a Saturday matinee of Mary Stuart at the Vivian Beaumont in Lincoln Center. We drove up to the parking garage beneath the theater at 1:30 P.M. to find that no cars were being admitted because the garage was full. We drove around the block to the other entrance only to see the blockade sign telling us No Admittance Except Monthly Parkers.

title: Space Official Resigns
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 22 (UPI)Lieut. Gen. Frank A. Bogart, who held the No. 3 position at the Manned Spacecraft Center here, resigned yesterday.

title: $100,000 for Princeton Unit
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 22Officials of the financially troubled Princeton Particle Accelerator announced today that they had received a $100,000 grant from the Fannie E. Rippel Foundation of Newark that would enable them to continue operations through March.

title: Cruisers NowTaking Wing
description: One of the newest developments for the cruising sailer, Roller Joni Wings, is on display at the boat show. A complete foretriangle rig, the Roller Jeni Wings are a major innovation in the world of sail.

title: The World
description: When an air traffic controllers strike shut down Canada's 53 major airports last week, the Government pondered whether to call the recessed Parliament back to legislate an end to the strike. The idea was finally vetoed. The reason: Some of the legislators were thousands of miles away from Ottawa, and it would take too long to get them back by means other than air.

title: A Variety of Styles Marks Piano Recital By Antonio De Raco
description: Antonio De Raco, the Argentine pianist who appeared at Carnegie Recital Hall on Friday night under the sponsorship of the Center for InterAmerican Relations, proved to be a capable musician with the technique to communicate his thoughts and feelings about works in a variety of styles.

title: Colorado Beats Kansas, 74.69
description: BOULDER, Colo., Jan. 22 (AP)A blitz from the foul line in the final seconds of play locked up the game foz the University of Colorado today as the Buffaloes defeated Kansas, 7469, in a Big Eight Conference game.

title: Everyone At L.I.R.R. Hearing Has Gripe
description: It took the M.T.A. less than one week to rule on the request from the L.I.R.R., which is one of the authority's own subsidiaries. On Friday an average fare increase of 16 2/3 per cent was approved by the M.T.A.

title: Governor Revises Formula On Eligibility for Day Care By JAMES F. CLARITY
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22Governor Rockefeller announced today revision in the state's daycarecenter fee formula designed to reduce the cost of day care to working, lowincome families.

title: Official Emblem of Games Will Be Cartwheel Symbol
description: The official emblem for the Munich Olympic games is a design executed by Hungarianborn Victor Vasarely. The design will be incorporated in all display material proclaiming and decorating the Games, which will be held from Aug. 26 to Sept. 10.

title: Gromyko Flies to Tokyo In Countermove to Nixon
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko flew to Tokyo tonight in major Soviet countermove to President Nixon's forthcoming visit to China.

title: HANOI BIDS FORCES INTENSIFY TRAINING
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 22 (UPI)  North Vietnam's army and air force have been told of a very favorable new situation and ordered to step up military training.

title: New Sail Control Adjusts to Wind
description: Old salts have a seasoned sense of skepticism about new sailing gadgets. But even old salts heave to when claims for a spaceageinspired sailing aid come from an inventor whose flight instruments are wellproven in thousands of jet airliners and executive transports.

title: A Professional Volunteer? It's a Term That Fits Many Dedicated Women
description: WASHINGTONWhat's to replace the useful term housewife on driver's licenses and passports, now that it has become a loathsome word to so many of today's women? Professional Volunteer has been suggested for those women who give time to their communities.

title: Hanoi Reports 300 Parcels Were Delivered to P.O.W.'s
description: PARIS, Jan. 22The North Vietnamese announced here today that more than 300 parcels, weighing almost two tons, had been delivered to American prisoners of war during the Christmas and New Year season.
