description: Dr. Howard R. Marrero, professor emeritus of Italian at Columbia University's School of General Studies, died Tuesday night in his home at 600 West 116th Street, after a threemonth illness. He was 74 years old.

title: BLACKS HERE PROTEST RHODESIAN ACCORD
description: Groups of Africans and Americans of African descent demonstrated for several hours yesterday at midtownManhattan locations protesting the proposed BritishRhodesian political settlement.

title: Fred Wolcott, Oilman, Dead; Hurdler Set 4 World Marks
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 26 (UPI)Fred Wolcott, an independent oilman who was the world's leading hurdler at the outbreak of World War II, died today in Twelve Oaks Hospital after a brief illness. He was 55 years old.

title: Mrs. Vin Scully Dies
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 26 (UPI)  Mrs. Joan Scully, wife of Vin Scully, the Los Angeles Dodgers radio and TV announcer, died in her sleep today from an accidental overdose of drugs, the police reported. Mrs. Scully, who was 35 years old, had been under the care of a physician for severe cold and bronchitis and the medication was to help her rest. The couple, married in 1958, had three children.

title: T.W.A. Posts 1971 Profit; Airline Unit Cuts Its Loss
description: Trans World Airlines, Inc., operated in the black last year, although the company's airline operations showed a deficit that was sharply reduced from the huge loss of 1970, the report disclosed yesterday.

title: OUSTERS PROPOSED AT WILLOWBROOK
description: The parents association of Willowbrook State School for the mentally retarded has asked Governor Rockefeller for the immediate removal of Dr. Jack Hammond, director; Dr. Milton Jacobs, assistant director, and Emmanuel Sternlicht, chief of habilitation services.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Deer hunters in New York State took 47,784 deer in the 1971 season, according to the Department of Environmental Conservation.

title: Marines Quit Maine Beach
description: GEORGETOWN, Me., Jan. 26 (AP)The last of some 900 Marines who participated in the Navy's Operation Snowy Beach were evacuated from Reid State Park today. About 140 Marines and Navy beachmasters were flown by helicopter to an awaiting flotilla around noon after inclement weather forced a 36hour postponement of the final phase of the operation.

title: TWO TRUSTS GIVE NEEDIEST $45,918
description: The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund has received gifts totaling $45,918.18 from trusts under the terms of the wills of Hoyt Miller, who died in 1957, and his Aster, Madge D. Miller, who died in 1934.

title: ABLE VIOLINIST MAKES HER DEBUT
description: Annie Kavafian, a Turkishborn violinist of Armenian descent who has studied extensively here with Ivan Galamian and other teachers, was presented in her recital debut at Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night by the Concert Artists Guild. Miss Kavafian's expertise was not unknown previously, since she has made number of solo and chambermusic appearances in New York and elsewhere in the last few years.

title: Con Ed Tells of 20Year Plan, Warning Rate Rises Are Likely
description: Consolidated Edison announced yesterday a revised longrange construction program to meet a projected growth in energy demand at the rate of 450,000 kilowatts a year over the next two decades. It would provide a capacity of 19,610,000 kilowatts in 1990 to meet an expected peak demand of 17,350,000.

title: Governor in Virgin Islands
description: ALBANY, Jan. 26 (AP)Governor and Mrs. Rockefeller left New York City today for a brief vacation in the Virgin Islands, the Governor's office announced. They are expected to return Sunday.

title: CAHILL STUDYING TAXATION AREAS
description: TRENTON, Jan. 26  Gov. William T. Cahill said today that he was considering 10 areas of taxation to close an I anticipated deficit of $140million to $175million in the 197273 state budget he will present to the Legislature on Feb. 14.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 26With those lachrymose chords from the studio organ, we bring you another installment of Just Plain Dick, Ed, Hubert, George, Scoop, Shirley, Teddy, Vance, John, Wilbur, Gene, Sam, Doc, Paul, Rocky, Ronnie and George Wallace, the story that asks the question, If everybody insists on driving, who will be left to sit in the back of the bus?

title: New Tax Form to Cover Capital Loss Carryovers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 26 (UPI)The Internal Revenue Service said today that it would issue a new form to be used by tax payers in computing capital loss carryovers to 1971 on this year's tax return.

title: E.P.A. Official Ousted After Article Links Him to Campaign Memos
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 26 (UPI) The Environmental Protection Agency dismissed its legislative director today after the publication of confidential memorandums linking the agency's environmental policies with President Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: Unusual Pianism From Abbey Simon
description: The historic phrase all deliberate speed came to mind while listening to Abbey Simon's recital in Tully Hall Tuesday night. The pianist can play about as fast as anyone, but he articulates the notes so beautifully he never sounds rushed. He also works his way through a piece in a thoughtful manner, no matter how virtuosic the music.

title: Irving, Here, Says He Can Shed No Light on Mystery
description: Clifford Irving, the novelist who says that he put together an autobiography of Howard R. Hughes, arrived in New York yesterday with his wife and two sons.

title: Nets Reschedule Came
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Jan. 26 (UPI)The New York Nets announced tonight that their postponed game with Pittsburgh last Saturday had been rescheduled for Saturday, March 4 at 3 P.M. The game was postponed when the Condors missed their flight to New York from Greensboro, N.C. and were then fogged in at the airport.

title: The Talk of Ibiza
description: IBIZA, SpainThose who came 15 years ago, bought farmhouses for nearly nothing and struggled with kerosene stoves and hand pumps while writing their books or painting their pictures, are living decidedly, easier these days.

title: Cook of Bengals to Quit Football With Bad Arm
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 26 (UPI)A Cincinnati quarterback, Greg Cook, sidelined the entire 1971 season with a bad arm, said today he was retiring from football.

title: Blues Down Penguins, 21
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 26 (AP)The St. Louis Blues moved into third place in the tight race for a playoff berth in the N.H.L. West Division by defeating the Pittsburgh Penguins, 21, tonight.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 26 (AP)Lord Pearce said at an open meeting today that he was investigating the reported detention of at least 300 persons by the Rhodesian Government since his commission arrived three weeks ago.

title: In Guadeloupe's Chez Odette, a Piscatorial and Peppery Taste
description: PORT LOUIS, GuadeloupeIt is the high season on this tropical, volcanic French island, but here in Port Louis, a fishing village roughly 20 miles from Pointe a Pitre, Guadeloupe's ugly principal town, nary a tourist clutters the beach. Port Louis has no hotels, only a few boats and a superb Creole restaurant called Chez Odette.

title: WARDEN RETIRING FROM ATTICA POST
description: ALBANY, Jan. 26The State Correctional Services Commissioner, Russell G. Oswald, announced today that Vincent R. Mancusi, superintendent of the Attica Correctional Facility, was retiring.

title: Shop Talk
description: Across the nation there are probably many housewives who would be delighted with an immersible nonstick buffet fry pan with an Early American motif. Or so the Westinghouse Electric Corporation hopes, now that it has decorated its electric cooking device with eagles and made twoslice toasters and a 10cup automatic coffee maker to match. Not to discriminate against shoppers who might prefer Spanish Renaissance styling in their twentieth century appliances, Westinghouse is also putting out the three appliances with Moorish scrolls. Those who like eagles get a copper finish, if it's scrolls you're after, the look is pewter.

title: International Paper Rise
description: The International Paper Company announced yesterday that it would increase prices for corrugated shipping containers, effective Feb.15.

title: Personal Finance: Help for Debtor
description: Buddy W. is a $40,000ayear advertising executive, but he has been looking for work for so long that he decided not too long ago to take a job paying only $18,000far less than he needs to live in the style to which, he has been accustomed.

title: 9 ELDERLY WOMEN PERISH IN OHIO FIRE
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 26 (AP)Nine of the 10 etderly women patients in a North Side nursing home died in a fire that destroyed the home early today.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Experience has taught baseball historians that it usually is a waste of time to accept the challenge from Casey Stengel and check the facts on whatever the rambling discourse he has just concluded. His closing words never vary.

title: Symbolic Candidacy
description: The art of the possible has always been an inadequate definition of politics. If it were a sufficient definition, the status quo would change very slowly if at all. In truth, politics is an unstable and unpredictable interplay between visible necessities and intangible ideals.

title: W.H.O. VOTE FAVORS PEKING MEMBERSHIP
description: GENEVA, Jan. 26The executive board of the World Health Organization decided today to invite China to the annual conference of the 132member agency here next May. This foreshadowed the expulsion of Nationalist China from the organization.

title: Shelters for Runaways
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 26 (UPI)  A Senate subcommittee unanimously approved today legislation to set up a $30million program to establish a nationwide system of temporary shelter homes for runaway children. The measure, sponsored by Senator Birch Bayh, Democrat of Indiana, won the endorsement of the Juvenile Delinquency subcommittee he heads.

title: Singer Settles Divorce
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 26 (AP) Jack Jones, the singer, is to give his former wife $1,000 a month, household furniture, a chess set and a painting of a dog under a divorce settlement reached yesterday In Superior Court here. His former wife, Gretchen, pledged to vacate the 33yearold singer's house in suburban Sherman Oaks within a few days. They were divorced last Dec. 16.

title: Financial Writers Elect Katz of The Daily News
description: Jerome Katz of The Daily News was elected yesterday as president of the New York Financial Writers Association He succeeds John J. Concannon of Newsweek.

title: FLORIDA DOUBLE RETURNS $6,683
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., Jan. 26 (AP)Holders of 17 $2 tickets collected record daily double payoffs of $6,683 each today at Gulfstream Park.

title: Search for Impartial Berrigan Jury Meets Snags
description: HARRISBURG, Jan. 27Two developments indicated today that it may be difficult to find an impartial jury for the conspiracy trial of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and six other antiwar activists.

title: Impoverished Haitians Sell Plasma for Use in the U.S.
description: PORTAUPRINCE, Haiti, Jan 26An Americanowned company here is buying blood plasma from impoverished Haitians who need the money and exporting 5,000 to 6,000 liters of it every month to the United States.

title: That Whatchamacallit In 70 Was Recession
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (AP) It was a recession after all. The White House says so, two years later.

title: Holiday Finds Bhutto Grim, Karachi Gay
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Jan. 27Haji Dawood bought a camel yesterday for $120, then slit its throat this morning in his back yard.

title: WILLIAM SHERMAN
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Jan. 27 William Sherman, a former New York restaurateur, died yesterday at his home here, apparently of a heart attack. He was 69 years old.

title: Moffo Out of Rigoletto
description: Gail Robinson will replace Anna Moffo as Gilda in the Metropolitan Opera performances of Verdi's Rigoletto to be given tonight and on Feb. 5. Miss Moffo is suffering from a thyroid condition and has returned to her home in Rome.

title: ALBANY URGEDTO END AID FOR CITY STUDY
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27The political feud between Mayor Lindsay and Governor Rockefeller continued to simmer today, with Richard A. Brown, the Mayor's legislative representative here, urging legislators not to continue funding of the controversial state commission created to investigate the governmental operations of New York City.

title: A Train Is Robbed Of $78,000 in Silver In the London Area
description: LONDON, Jan. 27 (Reuters) Thieves escaped with some $78,000 worth of silver bullion and coins bound for Rome early today in a raid on a freight train in the London area.

title: Vikings Get Tarkenton For Snead and 4 Others
description: Fran Tarkenton, the quarterback of the New York Giants for the last five seasons, was traded to the Minnesota Vikings yesterday for three players and two draft choices.

title: Five Hurt in Manila Clashes
description: MANILA, Jan. 27 (AP)Thousands of striking university students clashee with the police here today and at least five persons were injured. Some of the students threw large firecrackers and the outnumbered riot policemen fired tear gas. The students have been boycotting classes for 10 days to protest a 15 per cent increase in tuition.

title: COUNT ROSSI, 68
description: TURIN, Italy, Jan. 27Count Metello Rossi di Montelera, chairman and chief executive officer of the Martini and Rossi Vermouth Company, died of stomach tumor in a clinic here last night. He was 68 years old.

title: SENATE PANEL KILLS PRICE SUPPORT RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The Senate Agriculture Committee has killed a Housepassed bill that would have raised Federal price supports for wheat and feed grains by 25 per cent.

title: DR. DAVID HSIA, 46, LOYOLA PROFESSOR
description: EVANSTON, III., Jan. 27Dr. David YiYung Hsia, professor and chairman of the department of pediatrics at Loyola University Stritch Medical School and chief of pediatrics at Loyola University Hospital since 1969, died today after having been injured in an auto accident last month. He was 46 years old.

title: An Appraisal
description: Whenever Mahalia Jackson poured the power and the majesty of her voice into one of her favorite songs, I Believe, there could never be any doubt that she meant it, meant every word. She did believe. She believed in her God and she believed in herself. And the sincerity of her belief rang through every note that she sang. Because of her belief, she cut a very straight, direct path through life and she held to it all the way. There were no deviations, no compromise. She sang the Gospel. She sang the glory of God.

title: The Politics of Vietnam
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Jan. 27President Nixon's account of his secret efforts to negotiate a peace in Indochina has clearly helped him in the Florida Presidential primary election campaign, and embarrassed the leading Democratic candidates for the Presidency.

title: AUSTRALIAN JAILED IN AIRLINE BOMBHOAX
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 27A man who collected $560,000 from the Australian airline Qantas last May in a bomb hoax modeled on a movie shown on television was sentenced to 15 years in jail today. The sentencing judge said he thought that the defendant, Peter Macari, a 36yearold chauffeur, still had about $380,000 of the missing money.

title: Johnson Disputes the Theory That He Was Misled by Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27Former President Lyndon B. Johnson said tonight that it was a lot of bosh  tommy rot that he had been misled by the military and his civilian advisers in his five years in the White House.

title: Police Scandals Spreading
description: Police corruption, including charges of selling heroin, accepting payoffs from gamblers and procuring prostitutes, has been uncovered recently in police departments and sheriffs offices in at least 23 states and the District of Columbia.

title: Possibility of Curb on Immigration to the Netherlands Is Worrying Surinamese
description: PARAMARIBO, SurinamThe news that K.L.M. will introduce the first Boeing 747 jumbo jet service in South America here in April has heightened fears long held by Surinamese that The Hague is preparing to further reduce its ties to former New World colonies.

title: NO SKI BOYCOTT SEEN AT SAPPORO
description: TOKYO, Jan. 27 (UPI) Marc Hodler, president of the International Ski Federation, arrived in Tokyo today and said his organization had no intention of boycotting the Winter Olympic opening next Thursday at Saporro.

title: A Talkative Day in the Life of Martha Mitchell and Friends
description: Two years ago Attorney General John N. Mitchell was ready to quit the Nixon Cabinet, his wife says, but she talked him into staying.

title: U.S. Hints Better Ties With India
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 27 Secretary of State William P. Rogers hinted today at an imminent easing of the tension between Washington and New Delhi that arose from the recent IndianPakistani war.

title: 4 Sought in Fire Bombing of Midtown Talent Offices
description: The police are seeking two teenage youths and two men in their 30's who visited two midtown talentbooking offices minutes before flash fires raced through their reception rooms, Chief of Detectives Albert A. Seedman disclosed yesterday.

title: Price Panel Permits Fares On 2 Lines Here to Go Up
description: The Federal Price Commission in Washington yesterday approved proposed fare increases and ticketing procedures for the Long Island Rail Road and for the Staten Island Rapid Transit line.

title: PRICES OF SILVER AND COPPER RISE
description: Prices of silver futures rose 3.50 cents to 3.60 cents an ounce on the Commodity Excnange in New York yesterday following a rise in the stock market here and an increase In the price of gold to $46.60 from $46.20 an ounce in London.

title: DEFICIT'S IMPACT ON BONDS VIEWED
description: A leading investment banking firm's economist has concluded that the Nixon Administration's new estimate of a $38.8billion deficit for fiscal 1972 likely will have an adverse impact on interest rates and the economy.

title: Point of View
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic  Three years of steady economic growth have enabled the Dominican Republic to turn her back on the disruption that followed the 1965 civil war and the intervention by the United States.

title: U.N. Security Council Meets in Addis Ababa Today to Discuss the Problems of Africa
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 27  The United Natons Security Council has come to Africa, bringing with it 36 verbatim reporters, 30 typists, 19 interpreters and 8,100 pounds of special equipment.

title: The Military Grip Tightens on Peru
description: LIMA, Peru  The radical military rulers of Peru survived a tough economic obstacle course last year with far less red ink than had been expected.

title: Menacing Games Depicted in Dance By Laura Pawel
description: Unlike many young choreographers who employ natural nondance movement, Laura Pawel does not use it for its own sake. If her performers turn, tumble, fall and walk, they do so to express relationships within little psychological dramas.

title: 3 ESPOSITO GOALS HELP BRUINS WIN
description: BOSTON, Jan. 27 (UPI)Phil Esposito scored three goals tonight and became the second player in National Hockey League history to score more than 40 goals in four straight seasons as the Boston Bruins defeated the Philadelphia Flyers, 42.

title: Lawyer Asks F.B.I. Entry
description: Martin S. Ackerman, Mr. Irving's attorney, said here yesterday that the novelist had not been interviewed by agents of the F.B.I. although the lawyer had urged the agency to enter the case.

title: JERSEY TO CLARIFY FOODDATING CODE
description: TRENTON, Jan. 27  Consumers will be able to learn the shelf time of bakery and dairy products more easily in New Jersey supermarkets beginning Tuesday.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: U.S.I.A. The White House announced that President Nixon had asked William F. Buckley Jr. to accept anotheir term as a, member of the advisory board of the United States Information Agency.

title: Soviet Steps Up Criticism of Israeli Life
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 27  In an effort to combat the emigration movement among Soviet Jews and to hit back at the antiSoviet tenor of the Zionist Congress in Jerusalem earlier this month, the Soviet Union has recently stepped up its domestic criticism of Zionism and the conditions of life in Israel.

title: Film: 'Winter Soldier':Vietnam Documentary Opens at Whitney
description: "Winter Soldier," which opened at the Whitney Museum yesterday as part of its New American Filmmakers Series, is a documentary feature composed entirely of Vietnam veterans' testimony, most of which was photographed and recorded during hearings in Detroit, Jan. 31-Feb. 2, 1971, sponsored by the Vietnam Veterans Against the War.It includes occasional official newsreel clips, as well as still photographs supplied by the testifying veterans (including one Brownie snapshot of a triumphant, smiling G.I. standing at the head of a newly murdered Vietnamese), but it is most agonizing in its young, barely molded words and facesthe record of men trying to make some sense of an experience that to them clearly makes no sense. Yet something very important is missing from the movie and, by extension it seems, from what might be called the American character.The movie is an oral history, told by former United States soldiers, sailors and marines who, for the most part, admit to having participated in various atrocities without question. What is obviously missingand I suppose this is hardly news nowis some explanation as to how we could have managed to raise a couple of generations of people who could participate in the conduct described without experiencing the kind of sorrow that activates conscience. This, I assume, is the question that the film intends to raise.The other question, which is as much a moral question as a dramatic one, is what happened to change these men's minds, and when? At what point, for example, does a man, who could pose with the corpse of someone he has just shot, decide that he doesn't want to do this anymore? About halfway through "Winter Soldier" there is a moment that tells us about all the stories we are not hearing, when a clean-cut former G.I. recalls walking down a street in Cambridge and going out of his way to push a bearded student off the sidewalk. The student, he remembers, said simply: "You make it very difficult for anyone to get to know you."The former soldier then says something on the order of: "I told my wife about this, and she helped me straighten my head out."That is as close as "Winter Soldier" ever comes to providing an obligatory scene. The other conversions are unremembered. They take place silently, off-screen. All of which effectively limits the larger purposes of "Winter Soldier," even for one who is sympathetic to its ends. I suspect that one of the reasons that what happened could happen is that we live in a culture whose slang, among other things, persists in referring to the mind as the head. We refuse to make distinctions that can, in the long run, recognize the difference between life and death.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Off
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic in the week ended Jan. 22 was 13.9 billion tonmiles, 3.4 per cent below volume in the corresuonding week last year. Carloadings totaled 462,959, down 7.4 per cent.

title: S.E.C. APPOINTS 3 TO STUDY POLICIES
description: William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, disclosed yesterday that he had appointed A threeman committee of leading lawyers to study the enforcement policies of the S.E.C. and to make recommendations for improvement.

title: Man in the News
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 17Two weeks ago, when White House aides first approached Robert S. Ingersoll about becoming Ambassador to Japan, he says, he was not interested. He already had a challenging job as board chairman and chief executive officer of the giant BorgWarner Corporation, which has its international headquarters here. But then Mr. Ingersoll, who was nominated for the ambassadorship yesterday by President Nixon, began to study the proposal and to examine its ramifications. He changed his mind.

title: China Says U.S. Bolsters Portugal's Rule in Africa
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 27 (Reuters)China accused the United States today of helping Portugal maintain her African colonies to allow continued American exploitation of them.

title: Politics Blocks Venezuelan Gains
description: CARACAS, Venezuela President Rafael Caldera has a rare complaint for a LatinAmerican head of state. It is that congress will not let him spend the vast sums of foreign exchange that flooded Venezuela last year.

title: Rogers Encouraged
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that despite Hanoi's public denunciations, he was somewhat encouraged by the absence of a North Vietnamese rejection of President Nixon's latest Vietnam peace plan at the Paris talks.

title: Soviet Sets Talk to Sign Japan Pact
description: TOKYO, Jan. 27Japan and the Soviet Union agreed today to begin negotiations within this year on a peace treaty, it was announced in a communiqu tonight after a visit by Andrei A. Gromyko, the Soviet Foreign Minister.

title: Libett Rallies Wings
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 27 (UPI) Nick Libett got all Detroit's goals tonight as he rallied the Red Wings from a 10 deficit to a 31 triumph over the Buffalo Sabres.

title: Tarkenton Sent to Vikings
description: The New York Giants traded Fran Tarkenton, their regular quarterback of the last five seasons, back to the Minnesota Vikings yesterday for two high draft choices and three players, Bob Grim, a wide receiver; Norm Snead, a quarterback, and Vince Clements, a running back.

title: Senate Panel Approves Boldt and Grayson as Pay and Price Chiefs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The Senate Banking and Currency Committee by voice vote today in the face of only token opposition recommended the confirmation of Judge George H. Boldt as chairman of the Pay Board and C. Jackson Grayson Jr. as chairman of the Price Commission.

title: MIDDLE SOUTH GAINS PUT AT RECORD HIGHS
description: Middle South Utilities, Inc., reported yesterday record highs in 1971 operating revenues, consolidated net income and total energy sales.

title: Theater: Wise Child
description: Simon Gray is clearly an uneven writer. In Wise Child, which opened last night at the Helen Hayes Theater, he is positively erratic. This essay in the Joe Orton style of a comedy of menace seems more murky than black. Some of the writing is goodnoth so good as in his latest play Butley, which is one of the current hits of Londonbut the total effect is hopelessly muddled and, indeed, dismal.

title: Honduras Perils Market Bloc
description: GUATEMALA  The Central American Common Market, still suffering the aftereffects of the war between Honduras and El Salvador in July, 1969, came closer to collapse last year than at any time since its formation 10 years ago.

title: RATTENNI DRAWS 3 YEARS IN PRISON
description: Nicholas A. Rattenni was sentenced yesterday to three years in prison for conspiring to protect organized gambling in Rockland and Westchester Counties by bribing state policemen.

title: Executive Changes
description: Nabisco, Inc., has elected Matthew B. Rosenhaus a director, member of the executive committee and vice chairman of the board. He is chairman and chief executive officer of the J. B. Williams Company, recently acquired by Nabisco. Robert M. Schaeberle, president of Nabisco, has also been elected chief operating officer, while Lee S. Hickmore, chairman, remains chief executive officer.

title: Yevtushenko Composing A Poem on Hurok Fire
description: Yevgeny Yevtushenko, the Soviet poet, made a 20minute tour yesterday of the burned and smokedamaged offices of the impresario Sol Hurok, the man who is known as the father of SovietAmerican cultural exchanges.

title: JACOBSES CALL LINK TO CRIME GARBAGE
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 27 (UPI) Ambrose Lindhorst, an attorney representing the Jacobs family, which owns the Cincinnati Royals, has branded as malicious garbage allegations by a Congressman that the Jacobses have connections with organized crime.

title: Stars Down Canadiens
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 27 (UPI)Lou Nanne matched a threegoal game by Montreal's Frank Mahovlich tonight as he scored with 3:33 left in the game to give the Minnesota North Stars a 65 victory over the Canadiens.

title: Rangers Call Up McMahon
description: The New York Rangers called up Mike McMahon, a defenseman, yesterday from the Providence Reds of the American Hockey League for duty this weekend in games against the Minnesota North Stars. Abe DeMarco suffered a sprained ankle against the Buffalo Sabres Wednesday night and will be out of action for the next two games.

title: The Absolutely Essential Bombing
description: WASHINGTONSnort of the negotiated settlement which we seek, and if we are to continue phasing down U.S. involvement in the war in a safe way, U.S. air activity in Southeast Asia though diminishing is absolutely essential.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Jan. 14 editorial Smothering a Dream expressed welcome support for the Peace Corps in its struggle with Congress to obtain a sufficient budget to maintain Peace Corps activities in fiscal year 1972. However, in an effort to pinpoint blame, you have inaccurately paired the President with an unrelenting, longtime opponent of the Peace Corps, Representative Otto Passman of Louisiana.

title: Visitor From Nation of Shopkeepers: Only Woman Who Runs Betting Shop
description: Paula Fudge is 26 years old, with big brown eyes, long dark hair, a trim figure and polished fingernails. She wears gold jewelry, false eye lashes and elegant dresses. You would think she was an actress, a model, a leisurely young housewife or, perhaps, an airline stewardess.

title: Canadian Air Strike Goes to Arbitration
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 27The Government and Canada's air traffic controllers agreed tonight to submit their differences to binding arbitration, ending the 11day strike that paralyzed all civil aviation across the country.

title: Oil Raising Ecuador's Political Stakes
description: QUITO, EcuadorAn explosive mixture of petroleum and politics is about to engulf this nation of 6 million, most of whom are Quechuaspeaking Indians.

title: Moscow Hears a Clamor for Earplugs
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 27The Soviet Government newspaper Izvestia has taken time out from affairs of state to lament the absence of ear plugs in Moscow drug stores.

title: NEGOTIATORS PRESS FUNERAL PAY TALKS
description: Negotiators for funeral estabd lishments and for pallbearers and hearse chauffeurs intensifled their efforts yesterday to resolve their contract dispute and avert the possibility of a; strike tomorrow.

title: News Analysis
description: Federal officials trying to cope with air piracy are gravely worried about the trend to extortiona trend, they say, that adds many perils to those of the familiar hijacking to Cuba, in which the hijacker is simply fleeing the country.

title: NEW ATTICA HEAD FAVORS REFORMS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27  Ernest L. Montanye, who will be the new superintendent of the Attica Correctional Facility, said today that he favored a number of reforms at the prison, including those proposed by Governor Rockefeller and some demanded by the inmates.

title: Results and Entries at Various Race Tracks
description: Entries at Bowie Today

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Giant bluefish, some more than 18 pounds, arrived in the surf off Cape Hatteras on Jan. 18, and in the next several days more than 1,000 of these fish were caught by shore anglers, according to Aycock Brown, the reedthin and charming Pied Piper of North Carolina's Outer Banks.

title: PRIMARY REVISED IN RHODE ISLAND
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Jan. 27 (AP)  Gov. Frank Licht has signed into law a measure revising Rhode Island's Presidential primary system to bring it into line with Democratic party reforms.

title: Chile's Expansion Prompts Questions
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  The socialistminded Government of Chile has brought consumerbuying to a high pitch, at the cost of investment, and inflation is again on the rise.

title: Layup Wins for Chaps
description: DENVER, Colo., Jan. 27 (AP) Joe Hamilton's layun, with one second left tonight gave the Dallas Chaparrals a 9998 victory over the Denver Rockets.

title: 2 Enemy Attacks Reported in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Jan. 28 (AP) Enemy forces reportedly staged two heavy attacks today in the southern half of South Vietnam. In the Central Highlands, South Vietnamese troops were said to have stumbled onto an enemy base camp yesterday and engaged in a major battle.

title: MARCO DISPIAYS EASE ON CLARINET
description: John Marco, a splendid young clarinetist, took on strenuous and diverse program at Carnegie Recital Hall Wednesday night and played it with disarming ease and appealing tone. From the instrument's deep chalumeau region to its piping upper limits, Mr. Marco's creamy sounds blended seamlessly.

title: Big Construction Raises Backed by Panel in Secret
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 27The committee that oversees construction pay has secretly approved 100 to 200 labor contracts since November in what officials concede was an effort to hide the size of the pay increases well above guidelines set by the Pay Board.

title: Heavy Going in Italy
description: As Emilio Colombo launches his effort to form Italy's 33d Government since the founding of the Republic, his assets are mostly negative. A large majority among Italy's democratic forces is frightened of the possibility of a dissolution of Parliament and new elections. Most are also eager to head off a referendum in May aimed at repealing the 1970 divorce law.

title: PATROLMAN SLAIN, PARTNER IS SHOT
description: A 22yearold foot patrolman on the police force for less than two months was shot and killed and his partner was critically wounded in a burst of gunfire late last night as they emerged from a routine inquiry at luncheonette on the Lower East Side.

title: Leprosy Patients Show Resistance to Sulfone Drug
description: CARVILLE, La.  Public Health Service officials are concerned about new difficulties in treating a small but growing number of leprosy patients whose infections have become resistant to sulfone drugs.

title: Mayor at Lowery Rites
description: Mayor and Mrs. Lindsay attended the funeral yesterday morning of Mrs. Marjorie Harding Lowery, wife of Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery, in Riverside Church. The 45minute service was conducted by Rev. Robert L. Polk, a minister of the church, with eulogies by Rev. H. Carl McCall, a family friend, and William Strickland, a soninlaw.

title: Music: Polish and Ideas Mark Ashkenazy's Playing
description: Vladimir Ashkenazy's piano recital in Carnegie Hall started a bit late Wednesday evening, and the audience did not consist entirely of music lovers. Carnegie Hall's own security police were scanning everybody who entered the hall, looking into women's bags and men's attach cases. Bomb squad men and plainclothesmen from the Police Department were spread throughout the auditorium.

title: Major Concerns Shift Officers
description: A number of major companies announced changes in top management yesterday. They are:

title: Wallace Gets Convention Space The Washington Star
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 Governor Wallace has asked for housing accommodations at the Democratic National Convention and the national party chairman, Lawrence F. O'Brien, said today that he would get them.

title: Vancouver: Funnel for Fortunes
description: VANCOUVLR, B. C.Two casually dressed youths with a disheveled and lackluster appearance lounged at a tiny table in a corner of one of Gastown's new, selfconsciously oldstyle restaurants.

title: Nixon Flies to Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., Jan. 27President Nixon unexpectedly flew to Camp David this afternoon for an overnight stay at the Presidential retreat in the western Maryland mountains. He is expected to return about midmorning tomorrow.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Hughes v. Hughes case is the best publicity circus I have witnessed since Adolf Hitler signed a nonagression pact with Joe Stalin. With the kind of publicity which both Hughes are getting, everyone comes out ahead, for no one is interested in transcendental truths when the show hits town. J. T. FRASER Assoc. Professor, History of Science Fordham University New York, Jan. 22, 1972

title: 2 From Minnesota Five Dropped as Fight Result
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 27 (UPI)The University of Minnesota announced late today that two basketball players allegedly involved in a fight during last Tuesday night's game with Ohio State had been suspended.

title: N.C.R. and Control Data Set Deal
description: The National Cash Register Company and the Control Data Corporation announced yesterday details of a major program of cooperation in the computer field.

title: In Brazil, the Bloom Is on the Boom
description: SAO PAULO, BrazilHumor has traditionally been the clearest mirror of Brazilian thought and life. For many years a typical selfdeprecating quip was: Brazil has a tremendous futureand always will have.

title: Milton Loeb, Lawyers Who Began Brillo Corporation, Is Dead at 84
description: Milton B. Loeb, creator of the name Brillo for the familiar household cleaning product and the former president of the Brillo Manufacturing Company, died yesterday at his home, 983 Park Avenue, after a long illness. He would have been 85 years old today.

title: Rights Bloc Wins Test on Job Bill; Filibuster Possible
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The Senate defeated another attempt today to dilute the bill giving enforcement powers to the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, but there were indications that some Southerners would mount a filibuster in an attempt to prevent the bill from coming up for a final vote.

title: The Talk of South America
description: B RASILIAThe Amazon Basin, the Lost Continent within South America, is again being invaded by man in quest of riches.

title: Laura F. Delano Is Dead; Dog Show Judge Was 86
description: Laura F. Delano, a widely known judge of dog shows and a cousin of President Franklin D. Roosevelt, died today at her home in Rhinebeck, N.Y., after a long illness. Miss Delano was 86 years old.

title: Village Voice Loses Court Test to Protect Source
description: In one of the first judicial tests of the state's newsman's privilege statute, The Village Voice has been overruled in its attempt to avoid a subpoena directing it to turn over the original manuscript of an article it had published.

title: Stars Pull Away
description: OGDEN, Utah, Jan. 27 (UPI) The Utah Stars broke a 120120 deadlock with less than two minutes to play tonight to defeat the Memphis Pros, 127120. The victory raised Utah's Western Division lead to four games over Indiana.

title: SPOCK IS SOUNDING LIKE GOV. WALLACE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 Dr. Benjamin Spock, the pediatrician turned Presidential candidate, has been a minority party nominee for only two months but he is already beginning to sound like George C. Wallace.

title: Bolivian Coup Ends in Paralysis
description: LA PAZ, BoliviaThe political pendulum swung from left to right after a brief and bloody coup d'etat here last August, but the movement only set the stage for more violence in this tragic land.

title: Mujib Warns U.S.
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Jan. 27Sheik Mujib said today that he would close down the American diplomatic mission in Dacca if all other major Western nations recognized his country and the United States did not.

title: STANS QUITS TO AID NIXON'S CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 President Nixon accepted the resignation of Maurice H. Stans as Secretary of Commerce today and nominated Peter G. Peterson, the White House assistant for international economic affairs, to replace him.

title: Cougars on Top, 102101
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 27 (AP) Jim McDaniels sank two free throws with a minute and a half to play to help the Carolina Cougars beat the Floridians, 102101, tonight. The Floridians missed three chances to win in the last seconds.

title: Uruguay Awaits Recount
description: MONTEVIDEO, UruguaySouth America's smallest republic faces its biggest economic helache in decades as it awaits a recount to determine who was elected President last Nov. 28.

title: To Indians, School Means Frustration
description: PUNO, PeruTheir faces are bright, flushed by the cold of the Altiplano or perhaps by a touch tuberculosis. The alert eyes of the boysonly preteenagers have yet to be dulled by cocaine and toil. And the girls have not yet been wasted by years of childrearing and mindless drudgery.

title: Stiffer Fire Rules Asked
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 27 (UPI)  Gov. John J Gilligan said today that he would ask the Ohio General Assembly to upgrade fire regulations for nursing homes. His action followed a nursing home fire in Cintinnati yesterday in which nine elderly women Wed. The Governor said that inspections of nursing homes last year tound no violations, so obviously he laws and their enforcement are inadequate.

title: British Send Fleet in Caribbean Dispute
description: LONDON, Jan. 27The aircraft carrier Ark Royal, the biggest ship in the British fleet, two frigates and a guidedmissile destroyer were heading for the Caribbean tonight after unconfirmed reports that Guatemala was concentrating troops on her border with British Honduras, a British colony in Central America scheduled for early independence.

title: Point of View
description: PORTAUPRINCE, HaitiHaiti's tiny money economy has been reviving since the death of President Francois Duvalier last April, but little has changed for most of the country's impoverished population.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: DORM FAVORED IN 1,000YARD RUN
description: Ralph Doubell, who is confident of winning another Olympic gold medal, and Martin McGrady, who is hoping to find his Olympic specialty, lead a contingent of outstanding athletes for the 65th Wanamaker Millrose Games tonight. The meet opens the Madison Square Garden indoor season.

title: LITTLER CARDS 66 FOR 2SHOT LEAD IN SAN DIEGO GOLF
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 27Gene Littler arrived at the Torrey Pines course in one of his old cars today and with an 18yearold putter in his golf bag. When he left, it was after scoring a sixunderpar 66 in the $150,000 Andy WilliamsSan Diego open and taking a twostroke lead after the first round.

title: 2 Ulster Policemen Slain In Londonderry Ambush
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Jan. 27 (Reuters)Two Northern Ireland policemen were slain in a daytime ambush here today in a steppedup campaign against the province's already hardpressed police force.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Senator Taft's bill of amnesty for young Americans imprisoned by the Nixon and Johnson Administrations is useful in directing attention to a vital problem, but it is based on a false assumption. It fails to lighten the burdens imposed by their elders; it adds new punishment and servitude.

title: 2D MINISTER IN YEAR QUITS BONN CABINET
description: BONN, Jan. 27 Chancellor Willy Brandt dismissed his Minister for Science and Education, Dr. Hans Leussink, today at Dr. Leussink's own request, and replaced him with the State Secretary from the same ministry, Klaus von Dohnanyi.

title: American Motors Announces $22aCar Price Increase
description: DETROIT, Jan. 27 (UPI)The American Motors Corporation announced today a price increase of $22 a car to pay for federally required retractable seat belts and a buzzer and light system to alert drivers to buckle the belts.

title: Mahalia Jackson, Gospel Singer And a Civil Rights Symbol, Dies
description: Mahalia Jacksbn, who rose from Deep South poverty to world renown as a passionate gospel singer, died of a heart seizure yesterday in Little Company of Mary Hospital in Evergreen Park, Ill., a Chicago suburb. She was 60 years old, and had been in poor health for several years.

title: For Colombia, Uncertainty
description: BOGOTA, ColombiaWorld monetary revaluation, while aimed at setting aright trade relations between the major powers, has drawn a demurrer from Colombia.

title: Hockey Program Price Cut
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 27 (UPI)United States District Judge Julius Hoffman granted a temporary injunction today requiring the Chicago Black Hawks hockey team to drop the price of their programs to 50 cents for the 14 games remaining during the regular season.

title: Latin Policy A Mystery For the U.S.
description: SAO PAULO, BrazilIs anybody in Washington lobbying for the United States about economic matters pertaining to Latin America?

title: Kerner Trial Is Delayed
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Jan. 27 (Reuters)The criminal trial of Federal Judge Otto Kerner and four other men was delayed today when Judge Robert L. Taylor granted extra time for the defense to prepare its case. Judge Kerner, a former Governor of Illinois, is charged with mail fraud, perjury, income tax evasion, bribery and conspiracy.

title: L. I. Fire Kills Two Children
description: HUNTINGTON STATION, L.I., Jan. 27Two small children died here early today in a fire that partly destroyed their home. They were Damon Henrickson, 4 years old, and his brother, Darren, 11 months, of 39 Tower Street.

title: UNION URGES ACTION FOR WILLOWBROOK
description: Union officers said they would demand the removal of top administrators at Willowbrook State School on Staten Island if they did not press for more employes to operate the institution.

title: Cocoa Conference Set
description: GENEVA, Jan.27The United Nations announced today the convening on March 6 of an international conference to seek an agreement regulating world trade in cocoa.

title: Apollo 16 Expected To Fly on Schedule In Spite of Repairs
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 27 (UPI)The Apollo 16 spacecraft was returned today to its assembly building for repairs that the Naional Aeronautics and Space Administration said could be made in time to keep an April 16 launching date for its flight to the moon.

title: Broadcasters Ask Hearing On 70 Ban on Cigarette Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (AP)  Six broadcasting companies have appealed to the Supreme Court for a hearing on the 1970 law that banned cigarette advertising on radio and television.

title: Workers Bank Stirs Trinidad
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad A new economic force that could have a profound impact on Caribbean development was unleashed here. Dec. 1.

title: Nephew of Chambers Dies After Being Shot by Client
description: Nathan L. Levine, a nephew of and lawyer for the late Whittaker Chambers, died yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital of gunshot wounds inflicted Tuesday, following an argument with client at his law office.

title: Gimbels Sets Opening Date
description: The new Gimbels East store, under construction at 86th Street and Lexington Avenue, will open Feb. 24, Bruce A. Gimbel, president of Gimbel Brothers, Inc., announced yesterday.

title: Sadat to Visit Moscow
description: CAIRO, Jan. 27 (UPI)President Anwar elSadat of Egypt will visit Moscow in the next few days to discuss the Middle Eastern crisis, the semiofficial newspaper Al Ahram said today. He then will visit several Arab nations and other friendy states, it said.

title: Fire Department to Tell Tenants Of Offices What to Do in a Blaze
description: Within the next two weeks, the Fire Department will be training maintenance employes of office buildings in how to supervise fire drills and how to inform office workers of evacuation procedures.

title: Hawks Esposito 40 Victor
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 27 (UPI)Tony Esposito, the Chicago goalie, gained his third straight shutout, running his string of scoreless minutes to 185 tonight in a 40 victory for the Black Hawks over the Vancouver Canucks.

title: Bridge: Routine Bids Are Useful, But Some Thought Helps, Too
description: Players who are content to rely on routine bids and plays can do well up to a point, but occasionally a situation arises in which there is no substitute for thought. A case in point is the diagramed deal reported by Richard Frey.

title: Homosexuals Bill Protecting Rights Is Killed by Council
description: A controversial bill to prohibit discrimination against homosexuals in employment, housing and public accommodations was killed yesterday by the City Council Committee on General Welfare.

title: Bears Sign Gibron as New Coach
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 27 (AP)Abe Gibron, an assistant coach for the Chicago Bears since 1965, signed a multiyear contract as new head coach today.

title: Advertising:
description: The City's Health Department next month will begin its most intensive public service advertising campaign aimed at halting the epidemic of venereal disease.

title: Cyprus Gives Recognition
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Jan. 27 (Reuters)  The Government recognized Bangladesh today.

title: LINDSAY SETS UP DRIVE IN FLORIDA
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 27Cries of Right on, John greeted a hustling, tired but smiling Mayor Lindsay who trudged, half an hour late, into the lobby of the crowded Barcelona Hotel to open officially his Presidential campaign headquarters in Florida.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Observer Russell Baker may well be correct in assailing the esthetics of the Port Authority Trade Center, but he has surely goofed in attributing to Archimedes, of all people, a request to a conquering politician to get out of the light (column Jan. 18).

title: PROTECTION SOUGHT FOR THE CANDIDATES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (AP)Secret Service protection for Presidential candidates who make a prescribed showing in public opinion polls was recommended today by a special Congressional commission.

title: U.S.Japan Pact Near
description: TOKYO, Jan. 27 (Reuters)Japan's Ministry of International Trade and Industry said today Japan and the United States had virtually reached agreement in trade talks that have been in progress in Washington since early this month.

title: PLIANT VOICE AIDS RANDY CRAWFORD
description: When Randy Crawford, a 19yearold singer from Cincinnati, arrived in New York a couple of months ago with a jazz and rack group called the Mixed Emotions, she made such a vivid impression with her strong, polished singing and her warm, communicative personality that it seemed only a matter of time until she was out on her own.

title: 2 Medals Are Awarded For 71 Children's Books
description: Nonny Hogrogian, a New Yorkborn author and illustrator, and Robert C. O'Brien of Washington are the winners of the Randolph J. Caldecott and the John Newbery medals, awarded for the most distinguished children's books in 1971. For Mrs. Hogrogian, it is her second Caldecott prize.

title: TWO CAST CHANGES ARE MADE IN BALLETS
description: Coming down the stretch of its current City Center run, American Ballet Theater offered interesting cast changes in Dark Elegies and Fancy Free on Wednesday evening.

title: West Germany Is Haven
description: BONN, Jan. 27Knowledgeable sources in the intelligence community report that West Germany remains the main sanctuary of the Croation terrorists who have for years been organizing bombings and shootings to harass the Tito Government of Yugoslavia.

title: Thurmond Paces Warriors
description: OAKLAND, Cal., Jan. 27 (AP) Nate Thurmond grabbed his 10,000th career rebound tonight and scored 31 points to lead the Golden State Warriors to a 108107 National Basketball Association victory over the Chicago Bulls. Thurmond joined eight others in N.B.A. history.

title: Economic Storm Over Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRESThe economic storm that had been gathering over Argentina since 1946 burst last year.

title: Slain Air Hijacker a DebtRidden Father of 7 With a Harmless Gun
description: The hijacker of a Mohawk Airlines plane who was slain, early yesterday as he tried to flee in a car with $200,000 an a stewardesshostage was an unemployed father of seven who was deeply in debt.

title: Snead and Boros Card 69's, Share P.G.A. Senior Lead
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Jan. 27 (UPI)Sam Snead and Julius Boros shot threeunderpar 69's today to tie for the lead in the opening round of the 37th Professional Golfers Association senior tournament.

title: JESUITS SAY POLAND GIVES THEM FREEDOM
description: ROME, Jan. 27The Jesuit order stated today that its members in Poland were enjoying considerable freedom under the Communist regime and were cautiously optimistic about the future of the Roman Catholic Church there.

title: A Nation of Wretched Wanderers
description: WASHINGTONAbout 1,400 Vietnamese refugees were recently moved from wretched refugee camps in Quangtri Province of I Corps, the northernmost region of South Vietnam, to another camp 450 miles to the south. Vietnamese refugees have never before been resettled so far from their former homes.

title: Point of View
description: TORONTOI view with enthusiasm the slow decline in the supremacy of the nationstate, as it is gradually superseded by the concept of the regional economic and political community. I see immense opportunities for Canada to play initiating roles in these grander designs. And I know that there exists in Canada immense interest in a North American community with closer economic, political and other relations with the United States.

title: AIRLINE LINK PUSHED BY TRANSIT AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (AP) The Department of Transportation strongly reaffirmed today its support of the proposed merger of American Airlines and Western Air Lines. The department took the unusual step of issuing an 800word news release about the brief it filed yesterday with the Civil Aeronautics Board. Government agencies frequently file briefs in routine proceedings to set forth their views publicly, but rarely do they also issue news releases on such filings.

title: Despair at Amtrak
description: Travelers in despair over the steady decline of railroad service greeted Amtrak last May as the last hope for the passenger train. Nine months later, they are no longer sure, and neither apparently are Amtrak officials themselves. A survey by The Wall Street Journal indicates that many operating experts in the corporation organized by the Federal Government suspect it has merely become a fig leaf to cover up systematic neglect of passenger service by railroads which find moving people less lucrative than moving freight.

title: 71 NET OFF SLIGHTLY AT WASHINGTON POST
description: The Washington Post Company announced yesterday that preliminary estimates of its 1971 earnings, if reported on the same basis as in prior years, were $6,045,000, or $1.36 share on a fully diluted basis. Net income in 1970, also before extraordinary items, was $5,772,000, or $1.37 a share.

title: NIXON AIDES DEFEND PLANS FOR DEFICIT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI)  Administration officials, under sharp attack for record deficit spending, said today that a deficit was just what the economy needed. But they cautioned that taxes would have to be raised if Congress added to the outlays.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In the Millrose Games of 1956, Lee Calhoun, Jack Davis and Joel Shankle finished 123 in the high hurdles. Ten months later in Melbourne, the first three home in the Olympic hurdles were Calhoun, Davis and Shankle. The Millrose 60 was the only sprint of consequence that Lindy Remigino won in 1952 until in stunned disbelief he heard the friendly Finns of Helsinki hail him as the world's fastest human pro tern. Herb McKenley of Jamaica, England's MacDonald Bailey and Dean Smith of America shared Lindy's incredulity, for all four had been clocked in 10.4 seconds in the Olympic 100 meters. Not many Americans had heard of Ralph Doubell when that Australian's closing burst won the Millrose halfmile in January of 1968 but Doubell was a household word in October when he tied Peter Snell's world record for 800 meters in the Mexico City Olympics.

title: Revenue Rises as Traffic Falls On Triborough Agency Facilities
description: Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority facilities carried almost a million fewer vehicles in the two weeks after higher tolls were imposed at 11:59 P.M. on Jan. 5. At the same time, revenues jumped 70 per cent, compared with the like period a year earlier.

title: Couture Alive, Pulse Fading
description: PARIS, Jan. 27It may be in its death throes, but the couture still stands, supported mainly by the twin pillars of Valentino in Rome and Christian Dior in Paris. It's been shaken to its roots by (1) the thinning ranks of private customers, (2) the lack of interest of American store buyers and manufacturers and (3) internecine warfare.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: To lee how an enemy spy can influence a U. S. presidential election, read Farago's The Game of the FoxesAdvt.

title: Case of Harlem 4 Ends in Hung Jury
description: A jury that was later described by eight of its members as hopelessly deadlocked 7 to 5 in favor of acquittal was dismissed yesterday, and the third trial of four young defendants charged with the 1964 murder of a Harlem shopkeeper was declared a mistrial.

title: China, Without Comment, Reports the Nixon Plan
description: HONG KONG, Friday, Jan. 28 (Reuters)China's official press agency reported without comment today President Nixon's eightpoint plan for peace in Southeast Asia.

title: DR. FREDERICK IGLER, A RETIRED CHAPLAIN
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Jan. 27The Rev. Dr. Frederick B. Igler, who served as chaplain at the University of Pennsylvania from 1917 to 1961, died here today while on a vacation visit. He was 82 years old and lived in Philadelphia.

title: News of Skiing
description: Taking full advantage of the third straight day of subfreezing weather, operators of ski areas equipped with snowmaking machines continued to give their surfaces much needed assistance yesterday.

title: All Quiet in New Jersey
description: Needlessly harmful noise in New Jersey has been upgraded, if that is the word, from a local misdemeanor to a state offense punishable by a fine as high as $3,000. Governor Cahill has signed into law the duty of his Department of Environmental Protection to regulate all those noises that make life in the metropolitan areas so hard to bear, whether or not their source is known.

title: PRICES ADVANCE IN AMEX TRADING
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthe counter market scored their first advances in seven sessions yesterday as both markets made sharp gains in accelerated trading.

title: Hurok and Others More Than Just 10 Percenters
description: The key to putting concert artists before the public is often turned by the organizations that develop and book them, a multimilliondollar business done by such organizations as Columbia Artists Management, Inc., and Sol Hurok Enterprises, whose midtown offices were bombed Wednesday morning.

title: 86 LBS. OF HEROIN SEIZED IN JERSEY
description: Federal narcotics agents early yesterday morning seized 86 pounds of heroin worth $15million on the open market and arrested four men who they said were in the higher echelon of heroin importers.

title: Mobil Profits Higher
description: The oil industry poured out a mixed barrel of earning reports yesterday showing a generally improved figure for all of 1971 but with the profit picture turning poorer in the final three months of the year.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: SAPPORO, Jan. 27 (AP)Dianne Holum of Northbrook, Ill., a speed skater, was selected today to carry the American flag in the parade of teams at the opening ceremony of the Winter Olympics. It was the first time a woman had been chosen.

title: U.S. Aids Polish Seaman
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Jan. 27 (AP)A Coast Guard helicopter carried a stricken crewmen from a Polish fishing vessel to Atlantic City today for medical treatment. The crewman, who apparently suffered a heart attack, was identified as Eugeniusz Borodziej, 61 years old, from the fishing vessel Kaszuby, which was 15 miles off New Jersey. The crewman was taken to Atlantic City Hospital.

title: AIR FORCE NAMES A BLACK GENERAL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI) The Air Force named today a black, a woman, an astronaut and the son of its second Chief of Staff for elevation to the rank of general.

title: J. & L. Earnings Up
description: Alcan Aluminium, Ltd.'s preliminary annual report released yesterday showed that the company moved ahead of the Aluminum Company of America (Alcoa) in sales and revenues, volume sales and net income in 1971.

title: U.S. Investments in Canada Seen as Key Election Issue
description: OTTAWAThe American investor, who collectively holds a $34billion interest in Canada may well become the country's major political issue in the federal election, expected this year.

title: Rapist Gets 25 Years
description: John D. Hill, 20 years old, of St. Albans, Queens, who had been accused of raping eight young girls in the Rochdale section of Queens between February and May, 1970, was sentenced in Queens Supreme Court yesterday to 25 years in prison. He lived at 120141 Farmers Boulevard.

title: RESERVE WIDENS CREDIT POLICIES
description: Federal Reserve credit policy continued to exhibit brisk expansion in the two latest weekly periods, particularly as measured by the monetary aggregates, according to central bank data made available yesterday.

title: Pope Sets 1975 Holy Year
description: ROME, Jan. 27Pope Paul VI confirmed today that the Roman Catholic Church would celebrate a holy year in 1975 and exhorted Romans to prepare for that event by adopting stern moral standards. The church usually proclaims holy years, or jubilees, every 25 years.

title: View of the City Served Up With Dinner
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: Zurich Police Said to Ask F.B.I. To Talk to Irvings in Bank Case
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Jan. 27Police sources said today that Lieut. Willi Ulrich has asked the United States Federal Bureau of Investigation to interview Mr. and Mrs. Clifford Irving in connection with the Hughes affair investigation into the deposit and withdrawal, by persons unknown, of $650,000 from McGrawHill, Inc.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Contrary to the views expressed by Derryn Hinch in his Jan. 21 OpEd article Let's Buy Australia, American finance, business ventures and settlers are welcomed in the country's bid to develop its vast resources.

title: 118 Boxcars Where Railroad Should Run Angers Staggers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI) A man once under Federal grand jury investigation for the unauthorized possession of railroad boxcars was accused at a congressional hearing today of turning a small Florida railroad into a boxcar repair service. He was identified as Joseph C. Bonanno, who was not charged following the grand jury inquiry but was ordered to pay rent on the boxcars in his possession when Federal agents raided his facility last spring.

title: KNICKS CONTINUE CELTICS PURSUIT
description: Although Willis Reed's return has been postponed indefinitely, the New York Knickerbockers are still fighting for first place in the National Basketball Association's Atlantic Division. They meet the divisionleading Celtics in Boston tonight. The game will be televised over Channel 9 beginning at 7:30 o'clock.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: JERUSALEMThe practice of diplomacy has changed enormously since Sir Henry Wotton, a seventeenthcentury poetenvoy, observed: An ambassador is an honest man sent to lie abroad for his country.

title: N.B.C. Offers Roosevelt Films of 1930's
description: Home movies of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt, his family and friendsfilms never before seen publiclywill be televised tonight as a segment of Chronolog, the National Broadcasting Company's monthly twohour news magazine, at 8:30. The movies run a little under a halfhour.

title: Brent Beats Finn, 64, 61, Gains State Net Semifinal
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Jan. 27Rod Brent of Australia, the top favorite, moved ahead of the field into the semifinals of the New York State men's indoor tennis championship today with a 64, 61 victory over Andy Finn. Brent, a teaching pro at the host Port Washington Tennis Academy, has not lost a set in the tournament.

title: An Appraisal
description: WASHINGTONVictorian taste is still as exotic and unfathomable to most Americans as the puberty rites of faroff tribes, but it has been officially endorsed in the Smithsonian Institution's new Renwick Gallery, which opens to the public today. This restored 19thcentury structure, after a classic struggle for survival, is a noble preservation success. It is nice to report structure, after a classic struggle for survival, is a noble preservation success. It is nice to report that the good guys have won.

title: Few Whirrs, Clicks and Presto! Sail Ratings Come Out Faster
description: If sailboats all go faster this year yet retain their original I.O.R. ratings, it may be because people like Yale Grayson got tired of multiplying 0.13L by the square root of the sail area, dividing by the square of the beam times the depth, adding 0.25 times the length plus 0.20 times the square root of the sail area plus depth correction and freeboard correction.

title: Portrait of an Alberta Wildcatter
description: CALGARY, Alberta  A wildcatter is a man who spends his moneyor somebody else'sdrilling for oil in unexplored territory.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Governor's plan to charge tuition at the City University is outrageous. It is unfortunate that he is so insensitive to the plight of the poor and middleincome families in New York. [Editorial Jan. 19.]

title: Quebec Optimistic Despite Its Setbacks
description: MONTREALRiot, insurrection, separatism. Forget it. We're back on the beam. Quebec is part of Canada.

title: STOCKS REBOUND IN BROAD ADVANCE
description: Stock prices bounced back in a strongand exceptionally boardrecovery yesterday, fed by favorable economic news, improved earnings reports and increased public participation.

title: Point of View
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  The fact that the United States is inadequately utilizing its enormous economic potential not only leads to unemployment and social tensions within its own boundaries, but also is having a serious impact in Latin America and indeed throughout the third world generally.

title: Ottawa Cheers As Dollar Floats
description: OTTAWA  The United States could have forced Canada to repeg her dollar at the Washington monetary conference last month if Treasury Secretary John B. Connally had not overplayed his hand, according to a wellinformed Canadian.

title: Principal Negotiators at Conference in Paris on Peace in Vietnam
description: PARIS, Jan. 27The Vietnamese Communists insisted at the peace talks here today that there can be no Vietnam settlement until the United States first sets a specific date for total military withdrawal and ousts the present South Vietnamese Government.

title: Advertising:
description: Naturally, after 20 years without a corporate advertising campaign, Dow Chemical is approaching the whole thing with a bit of caution. Only part of the country will see the advertising that begins next month, and we're not in it.

title: Fishing Outpost Awaits Refinery
description: COME BY CHANCE, Newfoundland  Until recently, this was just a quiet, little outpost like a thousand other fishing settlements with picturesque names on Newfoundland's jagged coaatline.

title: Workshop's Perils Buffet Cornwall
description: CORNWALL, Ont.This is a factory town. Its 48 plants and mills turn out assorted consumer and industrial products, front handbags to lacrosse sticks, from plastics to iron castings.

title: Power Play in Quebec
description: MONTREALIn a bold move fraught with political, environmental and financial perils, the Province of Quebec has undertaken a project to harness the gigantic hydroelectric potential of the rivers on the eastern flank of James Bay, 500 miles north of Montreal.

title: Harvard to Provide LongTerm Loans
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 27 In the latest of a series of new college payment plans, Harvard University announced today it was establishing a longterm student loan program in which payments are keyed to a graduate's income for about 10 years after graduation.

title: Quarter Results Up
description: The McDonnell Douglas Corporation last year showed lower earnings than in 1970, but fourthquarter results rose from a year earlier, the concern reported yesterday from St. Louis.

title: Manhattan G.I. Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (AP) The Pentagon today announced that Army Sgt. Jimmy L. Dunagan of Manhattan, had been had been killd in action in Southeast Asia.

title: Store Sales Advance
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales for the week ended Jan. 22 were an estimated $643,000,000, an increase of 12 per cent from $575,000,000 for the corresponding week last year. Total retail sales for the week were an estimated $7,185,000,000, an increase of 6 per cent from $6,765,000,000 a year earlier.

title: INCREASE DELAYED IN DAYCARE FEES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27Governor Rockefeller announced today that he was postponing implementation of the new statewide daycare fee schedule until March 1, in effect giving lowincome families additional time to get into the program lat the current lower fee schedule.

title: Pan Am Cuts Losses
description: UAL, Inc., the hcilding company of United Air Lines, the world's largest air carrier, operated in the black for the third successive quarter in the final three months last year. As a result, the company reduced its consolidated net loss to $5,071,000 from the 1970 deficit of $40,877,000, Edward E. Carlson, president, reported yesterday.

title: Miss Wade Recovers to Beat Miss Gilchrist, 67, 62, 61
description: HINGHAM, Mass, Jan. 27 (AP)Virginia Wade of Britain lost a tiebreaker in the first set but recovered to defeat Australia's Wendy Gilchrist, 67, 62, 61, in the second round of the women's professional tennis tournament tonight.

title: Merrill Lynch in Rise
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the world's largest investment house, and Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, Inc., a leading institutional investment concern, announced sharp 1971 earnings increases yesterday.

title: Rubinstein at 85: Still a Fresh Outlook
description: Artur Rubinstein massaged his right cheek with five legendarily sensitive fingers and squinted painfully. I don't feel well, the pianist explained glumly. I have kind of subflu. I took the shots but I got it anyway. I'm not used to being sick.

title: Scalers of Eiffel Tower Held
description: PARIS, Jan. 27 (Reuters)Five young French mountain climbers complete with boots and ropes, were detained by the police today as they scaled the girders of the 984foot high Eiffel Tower. Three were stopped when they reached the first floor of the Paris landmark but the other two were only seized at the second floor about 345 feet from the ground.

title: T.V. A. Appeals Injunction Curbing Tellico Dam Work
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Jan. 27 The Tennessee Valley Authority said today that it had filed an appeal with the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit, in Cincinnati, from Federal District Judge Robert L, Taylor's limited teni porary injunction against construction of Tellico Dam.

title: Point of View
description: LAST spring, when I was appearing on a Vancouver openline radio show as a Canadian nationalist, I was moved to make the passionate declaration that I love Canada. Five seconds later, the station switchboard lit up like a birthday cake and the first caller, breathing aggressively, demanded that I explain myself.

title: $10 and $20 Bills Rain on Detectives In Robbery Arrest
description: Detectives on the trail of a man alleged to have robbed a Queens bank twice in less than a month were showered with $10 and $20 bills yesterday as they pried open a trapdoor in the ceiling to arrest the man they charged with the crime.

title: Report of Kissinger Talk
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The United States mentioned a possible figure of $2.5billion in aid for North Vietnam out of a possible total of $7.5billion for Indochina over five years during Henry A. Kissinger's secret talks with Hanoi officials in Paris, a White House official said tonight.

title: Two British Giants Vying To Acquire Drug Maker
description: LONDON, Jan. 27Two corporate giants are locked in a struggle here over control of the largest Britishowned pharmaceutical company, which regards one of the contestants as a welcome partner and the other as a menace.

title: Eximbank Loan Set For Brazil APlant
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI) Brazil and the United States Export  Import Bank today signed two credit agreements for almost onehalf billion dollars for the construction of Brazil's first nuclear power station and the expansion of its growing steel industry.

title: Dr. Otto Frey, ExU.N. Aide. Dies at 64 in Addis Ababa
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 27Dr. Otto Frey, a disarmament expert here for 23 years until his retirement, died Tuseday, on a holiday visit to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. He was 64 years old.

title: Guatemala Protests
description: GUATEMALA CITY, Jan. 27 (Reuters)Guatemala protested to Britain today over the sending of troops to neighboring British Honduras, adding that she had no plans to invade the colony.

title: Deaths
description: ATKINSONGuy, on January 26, 1972 at home. Beloved husitano of Arnalla I Atkinson. Reposing at The Universe! Chapel, 52 St. arid Lexington Ave. Services Friday January 28, 2 P.M. Interment private. Kindly omit flowers.ATKINSONGuy. The Huguenot Society America records with deep sorrow the death of its dear member and former historian, Guy Atkinson, on January 26th, 1972.KLEIMANSol. Shakespeare Lodge #750 F & AM sorrowfully announces the death of Its highly esteemed life member. Sincere condolences are extended to the bereaved family.

title: Books of The Times
description: As an avid reader of contemporary books, I am subject to periodic doldrums when nothing seems fresh any more and a drone of merely serviceable words blocks all but the most elemental circuits to comprehension. Suddenly all novels seem to have but one subject (need one name it?), all autobiographies one tone (loud and coarse) and all books on world events one mastermind  a behindthescenes editor who carefully trims all personality from the writing. When the hangover is on, my antidote is to reach for my nearest literary reference book. I have only toscan the pages that bear the names of illustrious minds and imaginations to be reassured that writing, after all, is an individual achievement, a personal vision.

title: Economic Advisers Cool To Pacts on Import Limits
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers said today that voluntary agreements to limit imports, such as those negotiated by the United States for steel and textiles, have serious disadvantages and can foster cartels.

title: NETS SURGE BEATS SQUIRES BY 114112
description: NORFOLK, Va., Jan. 27Rick Barry's 18foot jump shot with four seconds remaining brought the New York Nets a 114112 victory over the Virginia Squires in an American Basketball Association game before 8,035 fans tonight.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.4 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 111.5 from 111.1 last week

title: Metropolitan. Briefs
description: Steep rises in living costs since the price freeze ended on Nov. 14 amount to a massive assault on the pocketbooks of the people in New York City, Victor Gotbaum, the union leader, charged yesterday.

title: Consumerists, Meeting in Capital, Question Efficacy of Controls
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The average consumer considers the Phase Two price controls a sham and a fraud, representatives of several consumer organizations said today.

title: $50Million Mortgage Sale Scheduled by Ginny May
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (Reuters)The Government National Mortgage Association announced today it would auction $50million in mortgages bearing 7 per cent interest on Feb. 10.

title: Persico to Begin Sentence.
description: Carmine Persico, reputed lieutenant in an organizedcrime group, surrendered to United States marshals in Brooklyn yesterday to begin serving a 14year sentence for a truck hijacking. His application for a new mat will be heard Feb. 7 before Federal Brooklyn.

title: BROADWAY TO GET STICKS AND BONES
description: For the second time this season, the New York Shakespeare Festival is moving one of its, attractions from Off Broadway to Broadway.

title: Amtrak Charges Cited
description: Two of the nation's biggest railroad holding companies reported yesterday higher net income, before extraordinary charges, for, the fourth quarter and full year of 1971.

title: 1,000 Face Morocco Trial
description: RABAT, Morocco, Jan. 27 (UPI)Nearly 1,000 persons will go on trial Monday on charges of trying to overthrow the regime of King Massan II last July in the assault on the King's summer palace in which two dozen of his guests were killed. The attempted coup was crushed within 24 hours and several officers involved were shot

title: Laboratory Producing Heroin Reported Raided in Marseilles
description: PARIS, Jan. 27  A clandestine laboratory equipped for the production of heroin was reported discovered today in Marseilles by French customs agents. At the same time what was described as an important stock of equipment and chemicals used to turn morphine base into heroin was seized there.

title: Court Clears Rent Rises For 800,000 City Tenants
description: A decision permitting rent increases for 800,000 controlled apartments in the city was issued here yesterday by a Federal judge who had temporarily blocked the scheduled rise in rents. The city promptly announced that the first notices would be mailed next Monday to inform tenants of the rent increases, ranging up to 7.5 per cent, retroactive to Jan. 1.

title: MUNARI IS LEADING MONTE CARLO RALLY
description: MONTE CARLO, Friday, Jan. 28 (UPI)The Lancia Fulvia of Italy's Sandro Munari took the lead in the Monte Carlo Rally early this morning, only hours from the finish of the sevenday event, when the two leading French Alpine Renaults retired with gearbox failures.

title: S. CAROLINA TOPS FORDHAM, 40077
description: The Fordham press was not the answer to South Carolina's overwhelming height advantage last night.

title: Nationalism Spreads In Canada
