title: Japanese Gymnast Is Flawless
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Jan. 30A 28yearold Japanese gymnast put on an exhibition here last night that had 7,300 fans cheering wildly and one official calling it incredible.

title: DANIEL L. BROWNING
description: Daniel L. Browning, who retired five years ago as chairman of George W. Millar & Co., paper merchants, died Wednesday in the Veterans Hospital, San Juan, P.R. He was 65 years old and lived at St. Thomas, Virgin Islands.

title: 50 Are Hurt as Cambodians Fire at Eclipse of the Moon
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Monday, Jan. 31 (Reuters)At least 50 people were wounded by spent bullets in the Cambodian capital last night when hundreds of troops across the city let off a fusillade of bullets at an eclipse of the moon.

title: Publisher Is Now Chairman Of Field Enterprises, Inc.
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 30 (UPI)Marshall Field, publisher of The Chicago SunTimes and The Chicago Daily News, has been elected chairman of Field Enterprises, Inc., and chairman of the Field Enterprises Educational Corporation, a subsidiary, it was announced over the weekend.

title: ITALIANS FEARFUL OF A DIVORCE VOTE
description: ROME Jan, 30The sharpest legal brains in Italy are trying to devise a way of staving off referendum on repeal of the Divorce Act.

title: Personal Finance
description: High interest rates are being buffeted by changing economic winds to the increasing dismay of savings account depositors. Just last week came another round of interest rate cuts which weaken the public's hold on 6 per cent, 6 per cent and even 7 per cent rates to which many thrifty savers and investors have become accustomed.

title: Snug Harbor Site Is Sold To Builder for $6Million
description: Sailors Snug Harbor on Staten Island has arranged to sell most of the grounds around its home for retired seamen to a private developer for more than $6million. However, the landmark buildings of the home would be reserved for sale to the city for use as a cultural park.

title: MONTOYA EXPLORES GYPSY LORE IN SOLOS
description: Carlos Montoya, who claims to have presented the world's first solo flamenco recital, in 1948 (as opposed to flamenco accompaniments of singers and dancers), gave another one at Carnegie Hall Saturday night. At 69, the master has lost none of his incredible dexterity, none of the creative ingenuity that makes his flamenco improvisations so endlessly fascinating for the aficionado. His program was shortunder 90 minutes, including two intermissions but Mr. Montoya explored nearly 20 gypsy song or dance forms, and left his rapt audience thoroughly satisfied.

title: Mexico Fearful for Her Border Industry
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 30The Mexican Government is expressing growing concern that protectionist pressures in the United States may lead to legislation that will damage Mexico's flourishing border industrialization program.

title: PUBLIC IS BACKED ON STOCK BLOCKS
description: The eagerly awaited policy statement that the Securities and Exchange Commission plans to issue this week on a broad spectrum of Wall Street issues will include a recommendation that the public be allowed to participate in price concessions when large blocks of stock are offered for sale.

title: A OnceBusy Town That Is Up for Sale
description: GERLACH, Nev., Jan. 26The old train station sits off by itself. It's over there on the other side of the highway all but hidden down an embankment behind the Post Office and a water tower that is worn and rotting. It's a faded yellowing building that appears abandoned but the truck outside and the light that comes through a dusty window means that Mylo Kacer is there. He is the agent at this remote station and he is there in his office with Ralph Johnson, his clerk.

title: Breaking Up City Hall: I
description: Two weeks before Christmas, the President vetoed the Child Development Act of 1971. In doing so, he stated: Neither the immediate need nor the desirability of a national child development program of this character has been demonstrated. The needs of the nation's children, the President proclaimed, would be adequately met by his own proposed legislation H.R. 1.

title: Suit Attacks a Merger
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 30 (UPI) Mrs. Paul's Kitchens, Inc., filed a $30million damage suit against General Mills, Inc., it was announced this weekend. The suit charges that General Mills merger with the Gorton Corporation in 1968 gave it a monopoly of the frozen packaged seafood industry.

title: Unrest Vexes Youth In a Torn Chinatown
description: Back from the cemetery only two hours, three friends of the late David Chin were brooding. They reflected on his murder, on the old apartments in which they lived with as many as 10 relatives in four rooms. on their long, fruitless searches for work outside Chinatown, and on their grappling in school with only skimpy English.

title: Nastase Wins Midlands Final, Defeating Tiriac, 26, 60, 61
description: OMAHA, Jan. 30 (UPI)Ilie Nastase of Rumania defeated a fellow countryman, Ion Tiriac, 26, 60, 61 to win the singles competition in the Midlands international tennis tournament today.

title: NIXON PEACE PLAN CRITICIZED BYCH0U
description: PEKING, Monday, Jan. 31 (Reuters)Premier Chou Enlai said today that he thought it would not be possible to end the war in Indochina, especially in Vietnam, if the United States went ahead with its eightpoint peace plan.

title: Steel Mills Report A Surge of Orders; Shipping Rise Seen
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 30Steel producers had good news and bad last week.

title: Celtics Down 76ers, 130114
description: BOSTON, Jan. 30 (UPI)John Havlicek scored 33 points today to lead the Boston Celtics to a 130114 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers despite 41point performance by Billy Cunningham.

title: Play Ball Becomes It's Show Time
description: New York's baseball writers staged their 49th annual eating and oratorical contest last night and, amid waves of nostalgia for the good old days, honored Joe Torre and Roberto Clemente as the best in the business today.

title: Sparkle Back in Sierra Leone
description: FREETOWN, Sierra Leone With a pickup late last year in the diamond trade, the first signs of an upturn are appearing In the depressed economy of this small West African country.

title: Housing Agency Plans Orchestra as Food for Soul
description: The City Housing Authority, which up to. now has concentrated on providing 160,000 dwellings for some 600,000 New York residents, is about to create its own symphony orchestra.

title: New York Women Victors
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 30The New York Metropolitan A team won the Howe Cup women's squash racquets tournament today for the fourth straight year by defeating Boston, 41, and Philadelphia, 32.

title: L.I.Opponents of Bridge Assail Report
description: BAYVILLE, L. I., Jan. 30An Oyster BayRye Bridge, recommended in a special consultants report presented to Governor Rockefeller yesterday, may be outmoded within 10 years of its construction, will have little salutary effect on the area it will serve, and will hasten the destruction of Long Island's famed Gold Coast, planning experts and the bridge's many opponents said today.

title: Charlotte P. Paikin Is Bride of Lawyer
description: Miss Charlotte Penny Pekin, daughter of David Paikin of Monsey, N. Y., and the late Mrs. Laura Paikin, was married here last evening to Joel Eliot Abramson, son of Dr. and Mrs. David A. Abramson of Far Rockaway, Queens. Rabbi Walter S. Wurzburger performed the ceremony in the Roosevelt.

title: U. S. Aides Now Foresee Peril In Mutual Troop Cut for Europe
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30 After months of study, Nixon Administration officials have concluded that any agreement on mutual reduction of forces in Europe that would be likely to be accepted by the Soviet bloc would probably jeopardize Western security.

title: Hartford Seminary, in New Role, Offers to Train Ordained Clergy
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 30At a time of financial stress for theological schools and scarce jobs for graduates, the Hartford Seminary Foundation has decided to transform itself into a new kind of educational institution.

title: BROKERS'
description: The New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange announced yesterday that they had started a shared communication network linking the branch offices of six memher firms of the two exchanges in Chicago, Los Angeles and Miami with New York.

title: Malawi Fears Tobacco Decline
description: BLANTYRE, MalawiLike her neighbor, Rhodesia, the landlocked state of Malawi is heavily dependent for export earnings on tobacco and has gained much from the economic sanctions imposed again the breakaway state.

title: Orr Gets Goal, Three Assists As Bruins Set Back Blues, 52
description: BOSTON, Jan. 30 (AP)The Boston Bruins scored four goals in the second period tonight, including two within 35 seconds, and went on to defeat the St. Louis Blues, 52, in a National Hockey League game.

title: 15 Years Ago He Owned 8 Bottles of Wine, Now He Has 2,000
description: Dr. Martin Katz lives on the 10th floor, but he never takes the elevator to get to his cellar. That's because it's right in his apartment on East 81st Street. Dr. Katz is a wine lover and his cellar his wine cellar, that isreally is not a cellar at all. It's an ordinary closet in what was once a maid's room just off the Katz's kitchen.

title: D'
description: Unabashed verve is the dancer's most reliable asset when performing Jacques d'Amboise's playful ballet, Irish Fantasy. Displaying great quantities of it, Gelsey Kirkland and John Clifford danced the principal roles Saturday evening, for the first time together, in the City Ballet's performance in the State Theater.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Monday, Jan. 31 (Agence FrancePresse)President Bhutto left Rawalpindi today for a twoday official visit to Peking He was accompanied by his wife and a 60member party.

title: NONE FACE DRAFT IN NEXT 2 MONTHS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird announced today that there would be no draft calls until April at the earliest thus assuring tens of thousands of men with low lottery numbers that they will not be drafted.

title: Waste in Harrisburg
description: Federal parole authorities acted wisely in releasing the Rev. Daniel J. Berrigan from prison. Once the ailing priest pledged himself to abstain from antiwar activities of an illegal nature, no purpose would have been served by keeping him in jail.

title: McGovern Expects to Capture 200 of State's 278 Delegates
description: Senator George McGovern expressed confidence yesterday that more than twothirds of the New York State delegation to the Democratic National Convention would be committed to his bid for the Presidential nomination next July.

title: San Juan Phone Strike Ends
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Jan. 30 (AP) Members of the Independent Telephone Workers Union voted today to accept a settlement reached by their leaders and representatives of the Puerto Rico Telephone Company. The 2,200 striking workers have agreed to report back to work gradually, ending a walkout that began Jan. 18.

title: Gas Leak Near Times Sq. Causes Temporary Hazard
description: A leak from a broken gas main in a telephone manhole at 41st Street and Broadway early today caused inflammable gas to spread along 41st Street and into the Times Square subway station.

title: New Economic Adviser Marina von Neumann Whitman
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30When Marina von Neumann Whitman, President Nixon's new appointee to the Council of Economic Advisers, was a high school student in Princeton, N. J., many of the world's intellectual elite at the Institute for Advanced Study passed through her living room. I was 15 before I realized this was not the normal American way of life, she says. The first woman named to the threemember Presidential advisory group, Mrs. Whitman is the daughter of the noted mathematician, Dr. John von Neumann, the creator of game theory and one of the pioneers of the computer age. His Princeton home, said Mrs. Whitman, was always filled with terribly interesting people and terribly interesting conversations.

title: Clouds Here Obscure An Eclipse of the Moon
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 30 (UPI)An eclipse of the moon was visible early today in portions of North and South America.

title: Art: Comeback for Landscapes
description: BOSTON  The American landscape may be in danger of every sort of commercial, industrial and ecological disaster, but so far as the art of painting is concerned, it is making a distinct comeback. Artists of several generations, including the young est, are rediscovering landscape as a vital artistic subject, and the results of their diverse investigations are beginning to be widely recognized.

title: Advertising of Sales by Stores Goes Under City Curb March 1
description: A March 1 starting date was announced yesterday for the city's new Consumer Protection Law Regulation 13, setting rules for advertising of sales, bargains and discounts.

title: 25 Senators Urge Treaties On the Azores and Bahrain
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30 (AP)  Twentyfive Senators have cosponsored a resolution calling on President Nixon to submit as treaties recent agreements setting up American bases in the Azores and in Bahrain in the Indian Ocean.

title: Moroccan Goal: Export Iron Ore
description: RABAT, Morocco  With an investment of $20million Morocco is making an effort to recapture her old position in the ironore export market. To do so, she is revamping her mines at Nador, on the Mediterranean coast 255 miles northeast of here.

title: Woman Killed in L.I. Crash
description: PORT JEFFERSON STATION, L. I., Jan. 30A 31yearold woman was killed here early today when the car in which she was riding veered off Route 112 and struck a tree. The victim, identified by the police as Mrs. Judith Sage, of 40 Linden Lane, Farmingvile, died shortly after the accident, which had occurred at 3:45 A.M.

title: INDUSTRY ASSAILS GYPSYCAB BILL
description: The Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade charged yesterday that a proposed city bill that would permit licensing and regulating of gypsy cabs spells doom for the whole industry.

title: Bacallao Takes 4th U.S. Squash Tennis Title in Row
description: For the fourth year in a row. Pedro Bacallao of the Princeton Club captured the United States open squash tennis championship yesterday at the Lone Star Boat Club. The 34yearold doctor defeated Frank Iannicelli, the pro at the Harvard Club and the second seeded player, 1814, 1512, 157, in the final.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: For Councilman Robert I. Postel to scream out on television in protest against the Mayor over something as petty as a theater ticket is an obvious political stunt and, I might add, to be expected of him. But for The Times to do so on its [Jan. 25] editorial page is beneath its dignity. It is insulting and stupid.

title: Miss Wade Wins Final
description: HINGHAM, Mass., Jan. 30 (AP)Virginia Wade of Britain defeated FrancoIse Durr of France, 63, 75, today in the final of the $18,000 Virginia Slims women's Indoor tennis tournament.

title: FOLK CONCERT GIVEN BY LOS VALLDEMOSA
description: While Bobby Short is taking his annual vacation from the Cafe Carlyle, a group of singers and instrumentalists from Majorca, Los Valldemosa, are filling the little room with music that bubbles with gaiety and high spirits.

title: Shoe Industry Here Faces Rising Costs as Export of Argentine Hides Drops
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30 Relations between the United States and Argentina illustrate, at the moment, the aphorism of the late Carl Jung: The shoe that fits one person pinches another.

title: Hungarian Premier Headed For Talks With Hanoi Chie
description: BUDAPEST, Jan. 30 (UPI)Premier Jeno Fock will leave for Hanoi tomorrow for talks with North Vietnamese leaders official sources said today.

title: Tidalium Plo Wins French Trot
description: PARIS, Jan. 30Roger Lemarie's 9yearold stallion, Tidalium Pelo, won the 48th Prix d'Amerique today for the second consecutive year and again in record time.

title: Coop City Stages a Consumer Fair
description: A swarm of consumerminded residents of Coop City in the Bronx this weekend nibbled, listened, questioned and complained their way through the huge apartment project's first consumer fair.

title: Investment for Peace
description: In submitting his $83.4billion request for new military spending last week, President Nixon argued that a strong defense offers the best means to secure peace for the coming age. But arms at best are only a negative factor for peace. If the world is to realize the generation of peace that Mr. Nixon has repeatedly promised, the United States will also have to continue to lead in positive efforts to promote international stability, as it has with vision and generosity since the inception of the Marshall Plan for recovery in Europe.

title: Murphy to Testify in State Study of City
description: Police Commissioner PatrIcki V. Murphy and three other,toplevel officials were named yesterday by Mayor Lindsay's administration as its witnesses in, state hearings starting this week on the city's functions and structure.

title: SCHRANZ BARRED FROM OLYMPICS
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Monday, Jan. 31 (UPI)The International Olympic Committee today declared the Austrian skiing star, Karl Schranz, ineligible to compete in the Winter Olympics because of his professional activities. The Games open here Thursday.

title: Advertising:
description: The Florida Citrus Commission story, the most dramatic account shift in recent years, came to a surprise ending Friday when the commissioners unanimously named DancerFitzgeraldSample to the $7million orange products assignment.

title: Controls Widespread in Africa
description: Economic controls are widespread in Africa, although they vary across the continent in both form and effectiveness. Some countries have concentrated on import controls, while in others wage and price controls have been applied broadly.

title: The American Dream
description: BONNI am prejudiced when writing about America.

title: French Explosion Injures 8
description: BETHUNE, France, Jan. 30 (Reuters)An explosion today in a heavy water plant at nearlby Mazingarbe injured eight people and blew out nearby shop and apartment windows.

title: OCAM Goal: Regional Development
description: YAOUNDE, CameroonAs a. main vehicle for cooperation in developing Africa, OCAM  French acronym for the AfroMalagasyMauritian Common Organizationis moving into new areas with a program for regional industrialization.

title: Bridge: Two New York Pairs Excel In Tournament in London
description: Two New York pairs were well in contention in the world's strongest pair tournament during the weekend. In The Sunday Times tournament that began Friday in London and to which most of Europe's best players are invited, Sam Stayman and Jim Cayne were in second position in the field of 16 pairs after three of the five sessions had been completed. Their total of 48 victory points put them half a point behind the surprise pair of the tournament, Adrian Schwartz and Maury Stampf of Israel, who led throughout by playing aggressive bridge.

title: 2 Youths in J.D.L. Seized As WouldBe Bail Jumpers
description: Two teenagers who said they were members of the militant Jewish Defense League were being held here yesterday after allegedly attempting to flee the country following their conviction in a sitin demonstration.

title: How to Furnish Home Without Buying a Thing: You Rent It All
description: When John and Victoria Church arrived here from London recently for oneyear stay, they brought no furniture with them. The young couple, both in their early 20's, had planned on doing one of two things while Mr. Church completed a training program at the Chase Manhattan Bank:

title: LINDSAY PLEASED BY ARIZONA VOTE
description: BEAVER DAM, Wis., Jan. 30  Mayor Lindsay was enormously gratified today at running second to Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine in yesterday's Democratic precinct elections in Arizona.

title: 4 More to Make Debuts With City Opera in Spring
description: Four singers have been added to the list of those scheduled to make debuts with the New York City Opera during its spring season at the New York State Theater, which is to begin on Fb. 23.

title: Terrell Turns Back Page In Squash Racquets Final
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Jan. 30Larry Terrell, last year's Harvard captain, captured the Atlantic Coast squash racquets championship today with a 157, 1510, 159 victory over Palmer Page, the United States intercollegiate titleholder from the University of Pennsylvania, at ChalfonteHaddon Hall Racquet Club.

title: Vientiane Facing a Curfew From Midnight to 5 A.M.
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 30 (UPI)  The Laotian Government radio announced today that beginning tomorrow and for an indefinite period, there would be a curfew in Vientiane from midnight to 5 A.M.

title: Seals Beat Canucks
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Jan. 30 (AP)Stan Gilbertson, a rookie, gave Gilles Meloche the only goal he needed as the California Golden Seals defeated the Vancouver Canucks today, 20, in the National Hockey League. It was Meloche's second straight shutout as the Seals goalie.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A series of major issues have arisen between the Administration and the Democratic leadership of the 92d Congress over pending consumerprotection legislation.

title: NINDL CAPTURES $20,000 SLALOM
description: HUNTER, N. Y., Jan. 30Crossed ski tips as he came hurtling over the second of two jumps prevented Spider Sabich of Kyburz, Calif., from scoring his second sweep of the season today as the $20,000 professional Benson & Hedges 100's slalom was staged at Hunter Mountain.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your news story entitled Swaziland to Ban Immoral Sex Between Races (Jan. 18) seems to lay too much emphasis on sexual relations between blacks and whites rather than on the nuisance that visiting sexual perverts create for the immigration regulations of that country. Multiracialism in Swaziland is a way of life. The proposed legislation to curb immoral sex between races has no parallel whatsoever with the laws of racially segregated societies of Swaziland's neighbors.

title: Black Political Convention Will Meet in Gary in March
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30 (AP) Plans to hold the first national black political convention March 1012 in Gary, Ind., were announced today by the Congressional Black Caucus and other elected Negro officials and civil rights leaders.

title: British Agency Aids Swaziland
description: MBABANE, Swaziland The kingdom of Swaziland is beginning to reap the benefits of the Commonwealth Development Corporation's commitment of $85million in southern Africa, most of which is invested in this country.

title: Little Damage to Pakistan By Withdrawal Is Seen
description: LONDON, Jan. 30  For Pakistan leaving the Commonwealth will bring few immediate disadvantages apart from the loosening of close educational and cultural ties. With Britain's entry into the Common Market the economic advantages of Commonwealth membership are becoming less important. In education, Pakistan will lose the benefit of British teachers and technical experts who go out to schools and colleges in Commonwealth countries.
